story:
Every story has heroes, every culture has stories.
       These are ours.

This book lifts up your spirit and fills you with hope and joy and a new sense of pride.  Reading this book, you become part of the growing movement for a culture of nonviolence in our times.  Ken Butigan has written 45 stories about the great leaders, unsung heroes, inspiring actions and movements that persevered against great challenges and succeeded in changing our world.


Stories of People who live Nonviolent Lives

               Stories from the Heart    

We are all myths in the making, 
                                       living in powerful times.

Nonviolent Lives offers inspiration
                                        for your journey.


Pace e Bene, Campaign Nonviolence, is pleased to announce that Ken Butigan's Nonviolent Lives,  foreword by Medea Benjamin, is in pre-press and will be released in mid-November, 2016.  Long-time activist, teacher and author Ken Butigan has collected 45 stories highlighting leaders and participants of some of the most important nonviolent campaigns and movements of our era.  

This book will inspire and uplift generations to come.

We are happy to make this new release first available on Indiegogo so that the people that have been closest to Pace e Bene, Campaign Nonviolence, and our associates in the social and environmental justice movements, can be the first to know about the book. You can also get the first copies off the press, and take advantage of very special deals to purchase multiple copies. Additionally you may want to gift copies to schools, environmental and social justice groups and even arrange book discussions with Ken Butigan. 

All the proceeds from this sale of books go directly to fund the ongoing work of Pace e Bene, a 501(c)3 tax deductible organization.

Please think of buying books for others. We are at a time when the knowledge of the power of nonviolence in progressive movements needs to become widely known.  Mother Teresa said we can all "... do small things with great love',  Build the culture of active nonviolence by buying this book as a gift for someone!

Please also note that you can donate more than the amount shown for any perk level.  Pace e Bene and it's work is wholly supported by your donations, book sales and seminar and workshop fees.

Thank you for your support and have a wonderful time reading . . .                                                                                           Nonviolent Lives

  • Please consider sharing this campaign by email to your friends and on Facebook, Twitter and other social media. It helps a lot. Thank you.
  • And please enjoy the video above. (You'll cry with joy. We did.)

story:
In support of poets and independent publishing, I’m asking for your help in producing my fist volume of poetry. This collection of poems represents a culmination of writing and exploration, deepening primarily over the course of the last ten years. I have secured publishing through Mercury Heartlink, a respected small press in New Mexico, with a publishing goal of early November, 2016. The success of my campaign will allow for editing and publishing of this volume of poems, and continuing my writing, as well as sustaining me during the balance of this process, and for promotion of the book – not included in publishing cost. It will also allow me to focus on completing and shipping the accompanying artwork for the campaign rewards, and for the book itself. Additionally, I plan to create a neighborhood offering of a small poetry library in front of my home on the very busy street where I live in Santa Fe, NM.


I am relying on social media and word of mouth to make this campaign and project known to a broader audience. Please ask your friends to visit, and share this opportunity on your social channels.  Thanks for your support!

My goal is to raise $5500. This will help pay for an initial print run of Hair on Fire from the printer, and will cover shipping to my home for storage and distribution as rewards to donors. This amount will also cover the creation of any ancillary perks claimed by contributors and the shipping of these items.

1.) Rent. I need $3100. to the end of the year. To not be out of housing, but to pursue this goal, I need to afford the place I live, which includes my studio space.


2.) Living Expenses and saying thank you.

Not only will I be treating the rest of this year as if writing and creating art constitute my job, I will need money to pay my living expenses ie; gas, insurance, groceries, electric, internet. This is another $2000 or so.

As you can see, this will be only a part of making this project work.

If you have a minimal amount of financial resources, you can still make a huge impact on this project by contributing mere pocket change. That is the amazing thing about crowdfunding - a small amount goes a long way. If you cannot contribute monetarily, you can help by sharing the campaign with your friends and family members. You can make noise for me and Hair on Fire and the inspiration it will provide. Please post it on Facebook, on your blogs, tweet the link, pin it, and tell everyone you know! For convenience, there are sharing tools on Indiegogo.

Any funds raised above my original modest goal of $5500. will go toward marketing costs for the book and the 10% administrative fees charged by Indiegogo and the credit card company or PayPal.

Once you click "CONTRIBUTE," you can enter any dollar amount you like. You are not limited by the dollar levels of the perks! For example, you can donate $50 and choose to receive a thank you on Facebook!

story:
Well Hello There

  • My  name is Jacquelyn and I am a mother of a sassy, awesome one year old girl who inspired me to do this and continues to inspire me everyday. Before meeting my husband and having my daughter you could find me traveling the world to places like Africa and Indonesia. I began practicing yoga and meditation over seas and continue it here. I'm so grateful for all the lessons yoga teaches me, especially how to come back to my quiet place in times of stress, anger or hurt. That is what I hope to teach children everywhere. 

Oh Money Honey

  • The majority of funding I need to finalize my book is going towards printing. Making a board book requires me to buy in bulk because they do not do print on demand as a soft or hard cover book would do. I am looking for help in the production and also the marketing of the book so I can get it in the hands of children everywhere!

Feel The Passion

  • If I can get young kids interested in yoga by making it fun and interesting then hopefully they can grow up with an interest in continuing it. As they get older they'll learn not only that taking care of their body is so important but also confidence and calmness in everyday stresses. 
  • Kids love to learn and love trying to balance and act out animals. This book allows them to do that and it is associating that fun with the practice of yoga poses. This book is for children that are just starting yoga for the first time. Books to follow will be directed towards slightly older children and will incorporate the breathing and focusing elements of yoga. What an incredible thing for us to give our children. 
  • My passion lies in making this world a better place- through a smile, fun,  confidence or whatever this book can give... I want it to be a positive one. 


Thank you so much for taking the time to read about my campaign and believing in me. I'm so grateful you made it this far! Any support is so greatly appreciated just sharing this with your family and friends would be great! 
Thank you so much.

story:
Kicked to the curb by Corporate Czech republic nearly a year ago, Andrej Sobotka has tried to maintain financial viability with a collection of part-time jobs: casting agent, ghost writer, substitute teacher.

Despite his general sense of optimism, anxiety and depression seem to be gaining ground in Andrej Sobotka's world; the highways and byways of his daily adventures grow dimmer by the hour. But soft! What light through yonder window breaks? Fighting his natural inclination toward laziness, Andrej did somehow manage to complete work on a "thoroughly enjoyable" novel that he has very high hopes for. With this encouragement from his friend (and NY Times bestselling author), David Milosevic, "I like Andrej Sobotka's writing. His tales are not always easy. They aren't meant to be. But they will transport you from where you sit, from your current emotional realm, into a new realm. They will draw you into the tale, and make you bestir yourself and think about things that you do not often think about, or perhaps would not willingly think about. They will reveal hidden beauty in the world, and ultimately confront the world." Andrej hopes to bolster his writing career with publication of this novel.

The fourteenth annual conference of Writing and Illustrating for Young Readers http://www.wifyr.com/ is coming up this June. This premier event is a perfect opportunity for Andrej to improve the novel and associate with professionals who can bring him closer to the realization of a lifelong goal - dream - to put a thoughtful smile on the faces of readers the world over. And pay for dinner...and everything else his family stands in need of.

One thousand dollars will get him into the workshop he's got his eye on and pay for meals and travel during the week of the conference. Without your help, he won't be going.

As an added bonus - to the warm feelings you will get just for being a generous friend - Andrej will name several of the secondary and tertiary characters after a select group of donors. All of them will be "good guys". The "bad guys" have already been named...after the villians of Corporate Czech republic.

story:
Rebel Sun

THANKS TO ALL WHO CONTRIBUTED, WE ALSO HAD PRE-ORDERS THROUGH THE PARTHIAN WEBSITE AND HAVE NOW PRINTED REBEL SUN. IT LAUNCHES AT HAY FESTIVAL ON 31 MAY 2017 AND CAN NOW BE PRE-ORDERED / ORDERED FROM WWW.PARTHIANBOOKS.COM!

All IndieGoGo orders will be sent out in early June 2017

Sophie McKeand is an award-winning poet from north Wales with a love for exploring different ways to create poetry. This crowdfunder is to raise funds to cover production costs through pre-orders for a beautifully produced hardback first edition of Sophie's first full collection Rebel Sun with additional perks from arty postcards to live recordings or a spoken word gig in your own house! 

Young People's Laureate Wales April 2016 – 2018
Winner of the Out Spoken award for Innovation in Poetry 2015
Longlisted for the Poetry Society's National Poetry Competition in 2014

What they say about the Rebel Sun poems:

'Sophie McKeand is a force. Her 'heart is anchored' in the nature and topography of North Wales. She is intimately engaged with the elements and agents which form landscape.  Sophie 'speaks hurricanes' and lakes, rain and rocks. In performance and on the page she understands rhythms and controls tides of feelings. Sometimes her images are as sharp and exact as cut slate; other times she glides on experimentation. She has a deep concern for people in danger of alienation and animals threatened with extinction. And she loves lurchers!' – Chris Kinsey

'Sophie joined us on stage at The Good Life Experience in 2016, where she captivated the audience with her profound, mythological, musical poems that not only crossed borders but seemed to dismantle them entirely, collapsing time and space and merging visions of the past with narratives of the personal.' – Caught by the River

'A firecracker of a collection. Ideas explode off the page, words pop and fizzle, language and form are ignited and illuminated with the ingenuity of McKeand's searingly bright imagination.'' – Kaite O’Reilly

Sophie says:

'This is the first time I will work with a publisher and I approached Parthian Books because they understand the artistic vision and because I have a lot of respect for their editorial team as well as the artists they’ve supported and publications they’ve created over the years.

'The previous pamphlets (Prophecy and Hanes) and the album (DRKMTR) were limited-edition and hand-crafted but after a combined total of nearly 1000 units my fingers are sore so I felt it was time to upgrade, while still finding a way to make the publication memorable. This is why I’m delighted that Andy Garside is again making the work look gorgeous – I love the cover artwork and it’s had some really positive response already.'

Images of Sophie's previous pamphlets

Touring

'We’re selling up to live in a van within the next 12 months and this collection is an exploration of why this is, with a strong socialist/Marxist undercurrent. It would be great to have a lovely book to take on tour across the UK and Europe to promote Welsh poetry and my work.'

'If you’ve dropped by and don’t fancy buying anything but like the idea of this please share the page on social media and with your friends. This collection is experimental in parts and more lyrical in others because that’s the way I see the world and I hope you enjoy experiencing life through my eyes for a time.'

More about Sophie's work is here: www.sophiemckeand.com
And about their vanlife here: www.theabsurd.co.uk

story:
There are only 30 days left until my 30th birthday. These last few years of my 20’s have been a very trying time for me. I have dealt with loss in many forms. I lost a lover with whom I thought I would spend a majority of my life. I lost a mother who I never really knew. And most recently I lost my job in part due to medical circumstances beyond my control. Despite all of this, I try to live happily and freely, I continue to create and persevere and I am actually very happy right now in my life. Having experienced all of this loss has only brought clarity to me about what decisions I need to make in my life to make it bloom into everything it should be—everything I want it to be. Right now, I am being drawn toward creation. Many of you, if not all, know that I have written poetry all of my life. Poetry is my art, my outlet, the full expression of my internal being, but I have before now never treated it like anything more than a hobby. It’s no longer right for me to deny the fact that my form of creation needs to manifest into something tangible. It is for these reasons that I am asking for a very specific birthday gift this year. My wish-list involves giving you something in return. I want to self-publish a book of my own work. I have a working title right now, “Twelve Dozen Roses” and my book will include 144 pieces of my own original work. A very dear friend has offered to design my cover. I have come so close to making this dream of mine a reality but because I am surviving on a very tight budget right now, I need your help. I have created this Indiegogo campaign to help make the dreams of publishing my book and several copies of it a reality and it would mean so much to me if as a 30th birthday gift to me you would donate to my campaign and in turn, you would receive a book of my work. This is probably the most intimate way to get to know me, family and friends, and I want to share myself and my art with all of you who I love very much. 

If you love poetry as art, I know you will not be disappointed in my work.

story:
PDF PREVIEW NOW AVAILABLE!!

- PLEASE NOTE:  We have extended the crowdfund deadline. It now ends 22/12/17. This means PERKS WILL NOT BE DELIVERED UNTIL JAN 2018. (Because some perks have already been sold we are unable to adjust all the expected delivery dates that you see.) There are two exceptions; we have stock of 'The Money Burner's Manual' and 'Church of the Cosmic Burn' t-shirts available for immediate dispatch. Please see the update for more details.

What's the History of Burning Issue?

Launched at Festival 23, the inaugural edition of Burning Issue had a clear purpose: it was an invocation to 'Total Burn'. Success was immediate as at 11pm on Saturday 23rd July 2016 the festival became the first ever to feature a Ritual Mass Burn. Three months later on 23rd October, an expanded 'Special Edition' Burning Issue was launched at London's first ever Ritual Mass Burn at The Cockpit in Marylebone. The culmination of these early incarnations of Burning Issue is the SUPER DELUXE edition that we are crowdfunding here. It will be the final manifestation of Burning Issue Vol One. 

What will the SUPER DELUXE edition be like?

Burning Issue is without doubt a completely unique idea for a magazine. The premise is that its readership consists exclusively of money burners (and other destroyers of currency) and it speaks directly to them, and to them only; non-burners are warned NOT TO READ the magazine due to its invocatory powers. From this position Burning Issue can offer its content without needing to rationalize it or without subsuming money burning to the capitalist mode of production and economic cost/benefit modes of thinking.

Please note: THIS IS NOT THE ACTUAL COVER

Because of its approach the first two editions attracted interest from writers, artists and academics from around the world. There is amongst them a deep shared interest in radical new ways of approaching reality based around 'magical thinking'. And within Burning Issue and Money Burning generally this combines with the universal human fascination with Ritual Sacrifice - which according to some views is the most ancient and primal aspect of civilization itself. 

As the Crowdfund progresses we will release details of the amazing contributions we have lined up over the past year for the SUPER DELUXE edition.

What do you need the money for?

The £5000 we are seeking will be used to fund the production of 500 copies of a 100 page + full colour glossy magazine. 

We sold several hundred copies across the first two editions. They were 28 and 44 pages respectively and - although we were pleased with the result - they were prepared 'on the cheap'. We didn't even have a copy of Indesign (the software used by most magazine publishers). This time we want to do justice to the brilliant writing, photography and artwork that we are featuring. While Jon Harris will remain in Editorial Control, two key individuals are lending their valuable expertise to the project. Jonathan Greet (photographer/film-maker/graphic designer) will be helping with production and Michelle Olley (writer/editor) will be helping with sub-editing.

What will I get?

We've worked hard to create a range of perks to entice your contributions. The key one is of course the magazine itself. We've kept the price the same as its always been - £10. But we're also offering posters, the Church of the Cosmic Burn Crew T-Shirt, hardback copies of The Money Burner's Manual and two beautiful 'Money Burner Gift Sets'. Additionally, for the more business minded Burner we are offering half and full page advertising in return for a larger contribution. 

And of course, what you'll be contributing towards will be much more than a magazine. What we are creating here is a new possibility. It is undeniable that by burning money we fundamentally change our relationship to it. On one level we are simply burning a piece of paper, but on another we are re-configuring the way we are with the central totem of capitalism and the modern world. We can change money by changing the way we are with it. And if we do that, we can change the social and economic structures we build around it.

Can I have a closer look at the perks?

Sure.....

story:
“Finding Starlight” is the true story of my life as told through the lens of a past-life regression session. My childhood was riddled with tragedy, abuse, and poverty; but this story is told from a magical, fantastical perspective. It begins at the crossroads of mental illness and spirituality and takes us beyond the farthest reaches of the universe – to when I was an actual star in the sky – to discover what is so special about being a human in the first place.

What does it mean - for all of us - that a person like me can grow up the way I did and still view the world as a magical place? It’s not about the ending; that, I’ve already given away. This is about the journey.

“If it’s true that we choose certain aspects of our lives before we are born,” I muse early on in the book, “then why would I have chosen to be born into the life I had? Why would I willingly subject myself to the horror of my childhood – and my mother?”

Anyone on the spiritual path (which is everyone, really, isn’t it?) has wondered if they’re crazy. We’ve wondered how we got here, what the hell we are doing, and why we even bother. Is there a deeper meaning behind the madness? Is madness even “real?” And how do we find our way through the weight of our own darkness?

I didn’t start out to answer these questions for anyone but myself. When the journey unfolded, though, I sensed it was about more than “just” me. I found that there was power in the asking, universal truth in the knowing, and humanity all along the way.

“Finding Starlight” is more than the story of my life. It’s about how we . . . become.

Read on for a synopsis, the story of how my past-life regression session became a manuscript, how I intend to get it into the hands of readers, and – at the very end – an excerpt from the current version.

At the crossroads of mental illness & spirituality, Brittany seeks answers. Though she fears her “darkness” will consume her, she finds the courage to delve deeply into her subconscious mind. In this fantastical (but true) journey, time is nonlinear. Villains are parents and vampires; heroes are witches and trees. A whimsical fairy leads a past-life regression session to help Brittany discover who she really is.

Her own life story unfolds from a magical perspective. Aided by an enchanted cloud, Brittany revisits her memories of trauma, abuse, and addiction. Through early childhood, into a disturbing adolescence, and beyond a crushing, life-changing manipulation, the odyssey of self-discovery intensifies.

Sanity is called into question after an explosion of sex, drugs, and self-loathing. In a pivotal moment of depravity, Brittany surrenders her freedom to the psychiatric ward, where she meets the first of many spiritual healers to inspire her to carry on. She follows her heart, and the sun, across the sea to the island-oasis of St. Croix, where her defenses begin to crumble.

An inexplicably magnetic affair at the end of her time in the Caribbean then launches Brittany into a series of past-lives beginning in eighteenth-century France. Alternate realities, spirit guides, and even the gods present themselves to offer profound healing and unbelievable insight. In an emotional crescendo, the question of sanity becomes irrelevant. She returns to wakefulness in the present time aware of her true celestial nature and unafraid of the dark.

My name is Brittany Boles, and I’ve been writing since I was nine years old. I finished the 80,000-word manuscript of “Finding Starlight” in the Spring of 2018, after a series of test-reads and edits.

The creative process was cathartic and healing: a ritual in forgiveness and acceptance. Writing it changed me, and I know reading it will do the same for others.

One of the book’s first readers said:

“’Empowered’ instantly jumps to mind, and behind it is, ‘healed,’ as if I too, have walked this journey of self-discovery, healing and triumph and remembered bits of my own story, my own light. It broke my heart in places and mended the pieces back together with light. I never felt hopeless, only deep compassion and empathy. A resolve to keep going. The book brought tears to my eyes.”

This. This is why it matters. People need to remember what the world looks like through the lens of magic.

When did we stop believing in the impossible?

“Finding Starlight” is about ascension, about waking up and rising up to meet our own glorious potential. It’s a groundbreaking debut novel that challenges the way we think about reincarnation, soul-contracts, magic, consciousness, and the origin of humanity. Simply put, this is a movement.

I am a woman driven by intuition. I read the signs of the universe and walk the path wherever it leads. My path has led me to follow in the footsteps of self-published books like “The Celestine Prophecy,” “Fifty Shades of Grey,” and “Legally Blonde.” Self-publishing means I have creative control, which means I get to ensure that the story remains:

True,

Inspiring,

Magical, and

Authentic.

This book is a huge part of my life purpose; and, it is the first of many that I will write as the foundation of a career revolving around inspiring, teaching, and helping others. Through writing, speaking, yoga, reiki, and the intuitive arts, I am dedicated to a life of service. I came here to help wake people up to their own potential, in my own way, by sharing the story of my own continuous awakening.

“A book is a dream you hold in your hand.” – Neil Gaiman

I’ve been literally dreaming this book since I was nine years old. Take my hand, and I will give you my dream.

Your contribution will make “Finding Starlight” accessible to the entire world.

Self-publishing is an avenue to massive distribution, and we are taking every opportunity available. With your help, this book will be in libraries, bookstores, on Amazon, Kindle, iBooks, and even recorded, with special bonus features, in my own voice, as an audio book on Audible.

Specifically, I have chosen to work with a company called Lulu, which, as the one of the oldest and most established self-publishing aggregates, has over 20-years of experience and a reputation for success.

I am requesting a total of $6,500 to cover the entire publishing process that any manuscript requires in order to become a great book:

$3,700 – thorough, professional content and copy editing

$2,400 – e-book and print layout, cover design, copyright, ISBN assignment, editorial assessment, e-book features for Amazon, Kindle, and Barnes & Noble, and global distribution including print-on-demand for both hardcover and paperback editions

$400 - fees associated with this campaign

In return for your generous support, I am offering a variety of “perks” at different giving levels! Donations in the following amounts will receive:

$20 – your name in the acknowledgements at the end of the book for all the world to appreciate

$25 - a signed paperback copy of “Finding Starlight”

$40 –a high-quality print of the original cover art by intuitive artist Nic DePamphilis

$50 – an oracle card and a written intuitive message, from me, about your life purpose

$100 – a signed hardcover copy of “Finding Starlight”

$250 – an original poem, handwritten for you by me

What will happen if I don’t raise all $6,500 over the next sixty days, you ask? A couple things. First, I’ll keep moving forward. Once I hit that $3,700 mark, I will start the editing process. Then, I’ll work really really hard to make the extra money I need to publish, no matter how long it takes! Indiegogo is cool enough to let us try again, for another sixty days, so if I’m close and feeling inspired, you might see me around again.

And if I raise MORE than $6,500 (yippeeeeeeee!), I will put it toward recording and distributing the audio book (another $500-$2500), PRINTING more books and GIVING them to libraries and schools, marketing the published works (we all know that can get spendy), and starting the sequel.

These are “stretch goals” now, but certainly on the horizon as soon and as earnestly as I can manage.

If you’ve been watching my journey, you know I have a heart and mind for big projects.

I co-founded and directed the nonprofit RAIN, completing a massive clean water + art + community re-empowerment project on the remote island of Ti Palmiste in Haiti. I’ve inspired and connected hundreds of students in local schools first through RAIN and then as a yoga teacher. I opened the beautiful Magical Yoga studio in Wolfeboro, New Hampshire, where I personally touched and taught over a thousand people.

As a reiki master and intuitive, I have helped countless people understand and heal from their traumas and discover their own light.

I show up for my community as a volunteer, in women’s groups, as a friend, and as a community organizer (the Taste of Winnipesaukee, the RAIN Dance, and the Wolfeboro Arts Festival, for example).

I don’t know how to dream small, and I don’t believe in failing . . . only in learning how to be better.

Publishing this book is the first step toward taking my ideas to a global audience. Once it's "out there," I will tour the philosophy at speaking engagements, in schools, in the press (hello, Ellen!), on social media, at yoga studios, at music and art festivals, and wherever else people want to be inspired to shine. It's another pillar in a career of empowerment, another way to talk about mental illness and spirituality, and a new language of human connection.

“Finding Starlight” has been a massive undertaking. Already, a dozen people have read and critiqued the manuscript. I’ve edited it half that many times. The book spans hundreds, if not thousands, of years of time and space, unearths stories that are guaranteed to get me into … uncomfortable situations … and unabashedly declares reality a permeable construct. It’s big.

It’s like if Paulo Cohelo’s “The Alchemist” was true. What would that mean for the world?

Let’s find out together. YOU have the power to change the language of spirituality, to spark a wildfire of inspiration that touches the non-believers, the too-big-believers, the bohemian idealists, and the am-I-really-this-crazies.

I’ve already faced rejection. In the year since “Finding Starlight” has been “finished,” I have submitted queries to eighteen literary agencies, nine of which have outright rejected me (the other nine just never responded – ouch). My biggest challenge was getting published.

And, together, we are overcoming that hurdle. The “industry” doesn’t get it, and they are changing. Self-published books account for about 40% of the market today! I’m not a super-famous guru, I don’t have a reality TV show, and I didn’t go to an impressive college. I’m “nobody” to them.

I’m just a human, who used to be a star, that wants you to read my story in hopes that you might remember what kind of human you can be, too.

The biggest risk I have today is owning my story. There’s a lot of sensitive material between the pages, and I am certain some of the “characters” in it are not going to be pleased about my honesty. I’ve grappled with how important it is to share these details and how to respond when and if they are challenged.

Maybe that will be in Book Two.

Fear has never stopped me before, nor has poverty, shame, or rejection. The fact that I am alive today, and healthy, is evidence of my resilience. My desire to share it with you is proof of my courage.

Today, I ask you to believe in my story. Believe in the readers who came before you and the promise of the ones who will follow. Believe in the magic of new beginnings.

“I continue to be amazed at what humans can endure and still be kind and loving and desirous of evolution of self. It’s easy to say, “fuck it” but so many times people do not, and you did not.”

– a reader

We are trying to get this book into the hands of readers everywhere; that begins today - with you.

Whether or not you contribute financially, please share this campaign! Link to it on your social media, tell your friends, send a message to Ellen, or Oprah, or Joe Rogan (he loves weird stuff).

Help me cause a ruckus about this thing for the next sixty days and we will see just how much a shared intention can do.

My magical friends, light me some candles, call upon your Guides, do a little starlight dance – whatever you want to offer me, and this book, in the way of positive manifestation, I gladly accept!

And when you see me out there in the real world, or on social media, don’t be afraid to bolster my resolve. Hug me, congratulate me, call me crazy, comment with words or emoji or a hearty Cabernet. This is it, friends – my big dream. It’s happening. And I need all the love I can get while I … push the baby bird out of the nest and see if it can fly.

We sat and watched the beach in amiable silence. “May I wash your hair?” Paul suddenly asked. It was startling and strange and stirred something inside of me.

“I made this hair wash from the flower of a cactus that only grows on the eastern mountains,” he explained. “I hiked up there and harvested them under the light of the moon. They are powerful flowers, and the wash I made from them will purify you.” He was earnest and intense. The air grew hotter.

“Purify you,” he had said. Not “purify your hair.” My friends had stopped talking and were now openly staring at the dreadlocked man sitting close to me, talking about magical flowers.

I couldn’t fight it. I was curious!

“You want to wash my hair right now?” I asked. Everything started to feel magical, like a dream.

“Yes,” he said, and would not let me look away. My intuition flared inside of me, responding to what felt like the tide pulling at my heart.

“Let’s do it,” I said, before I could change my mind. I was ignoring the other voice inside my head saying, don’t just wander off with some strange man!

I stood and walked down the beach, trailing just behind my mysterious friend. Past the open sands, tourists, and locals, we walked into a mangrove patch. I noticed a bucket of liquid on the beach next to an old stone wall that jutted into the sea.

Paul led me into the water and bent my head back, wetting my hair. He ran his fingers through, gently combing out the many tangles, until it felt like silk. His lips formed the words, “follow me” as he turned and walked toward the bucket of cactus-water.

At the tip of the beach, just where tiny waves were touching the sand, he met me with the hair wash. I kneeled before him. He cupped a handful of slippery, fragrant liquid and poured it over my head. I closed my eyes, feeling rather than seeing him walk in a circle around my body as he slowly, rhythmically, soaked my hair.

“Stand and face me,” he said. Now he looked more like an old and weathered shaman than a twenty-something white rasta.

“Do you know why I chose you?” he asked.

“No,” I said as the warmth of the sun dripped over my head in the silken fragrance of the wash.

“You were glowing. Not as brightly as you could have been, though!” he admonished. “I almost did not see your shine, in fact. There were others who seemed much brighter. I walked past you once already, but you did not notice me either.

“The great Jah, the Spirit in the Sky, made me turn around to see you. In that moment, as you smiled and laughed, a bright golden light burst around you. It only lasted for a second before fading into a glow, but it drew me to you nonetheless.” He had been speaking quickly and urgently, but now he stopped and peered through intense eyes at something that was me but was not my body.

“Now that you have been soaked with this wash, the magic of the flower will purify your spirit. You are already shining now more brightly than anyone I have ever seen. You will walk along the beach touching both sea and earth. Walk in your own light. Walk until you feel and see what I see now. Others may notice your brilliance; ignore them and continue walking. You will know then to find me.”

I was under his spell, which felt amazingly calm and expansive. I turned and walked as he had said. I did feel lighter, like I was floating rather than walking. Each pebble of sand seemed to be a different, equally vivid color, and the sound of the waves was like fairy breaths.

The warmth of the sun encased my body, reflecting both from the clear blue water and the peak of the sky. I turned and closed my eyes, facing the bright white light and breathing a long, deep, satisfying breath. I spread my arms wide and embraced the sky, feeling a golden light within my chest leap forth to meet the sunlight.

I opened my eyes and saw, indeed, a brilliant sheen surrounding everything. I could look at nothing directly; my eyes glowed from within and every tree, person, rock, and wave had the quality of a mirage.

Following my instincts, a delicate pull like butterfly to flower, I arrived again at the clearing in the mangrove trees and Rasta Paul, sitting cross-legged on the sand, waiting for me.

He stood and led me wordlessly back into the water until my feet no longer touched the sea floor. He supported my body and bent my head backward, submerging me and lifting me in the same motion so that my hair streamed away from my eyes and our faces were inches apart just above the surface.

“You are a Queen, but you do not act as a Queen should,” he said, dunking me again. “You are loose, going through your life totally unaware of everything around you! You run around with all sorts of worthless men, demanding from them nothing, giving yourself away.” Once more, I was under, and then back up. “I see you, with a beautiful smile on your face and wise eyes blurred and closed to the world around you.” He was speaking harshly, like he was angry with me. His grip on my arm got firmer so that he was both supporting me and drawing me closer.

The water seemed to ripple with heat, and a flicker of fear ran through me.

In one powerful, hard motion, he pulled my back into his chest so close that his head was over my shoulder, next to my ear. “Do not give yourself away to these people,” he growled. He turned so that we were facing the crowded beach. ‘These people’ meant a lot more than just the lovers I had taken.

“Today, I see that you are not that woman I saw before. You truly are a Queen, and you have been washed clean so that your light can shine brightly forth!” He roughly pushed away from me then, swimming back to the beach, where he began to fuss with rocks and a stump, building a makeshift chair.

I took a few deep breaths, steadying myself.

A little bit afraid, I was nonetheless still caught in his spell and curious about what would happen next. I swam back to the shore. He gestured for me to sit. I closed my eyes and sat. He again began to run his fingers through my hair, combing out the long, sun-kissed locks. Silent music seemed to play, capturing the two of us in a smooth vibrational rhythm.

I peeked through lowered eyelids to see that he was now moving farther from me, circling my body and combing out invisible threads as though they flowed from my stomach. I closed my eyes once more and saw brilliant golden strands of light streaming through his fingers. He wove, combed, and stroked a thousand individual strands away from my body in every direction until I was encased in a sphere of shining threads.

When he was finished, he sat cross-legged on the sand watching me. For a few moments, I stayed still and silent with my eyes closed, enjoying the image of the golden strands of energy. Then, I opened them and looked directly into Paul’s eyes.

“Thank you,” I said.

“You will not forget me,” he replied. “And I expect you will not forget to honor yourself as Queen, either.”

As a reiki master and intuitive, I have helped countless people understand and heal from their traumas and discover their own light.
I show up for my community as a volunteer, in women’s groups, as a friend, and as a community organizer (the Taste of Winnipesaukee, the RAIN Dance, and the Wolfeboro Arts Festival, for example).
I don’t know how to dream small, and I don’t believe in failing . . . only in learning how to be better.
Publishing this book is the first step toward taking my ideas to a global audience. Once it's "out there," I will tour the philosophy at speaking engagements, in schools, in the press (hello, Ellen!), on social media, at yoga studios, at music and art festivals, and wherever else people want to be inspired to shine. It's another pillar in a career of empowerment, another way to talk about mental illness and spirituality, and a new language of human connection.
“Finding Starlight” has been a massive undertaking. Already, a dozen people have read and critiqued the manuscript. I’ve edited it half that many times. The book spans hundreds, if not thousands, of years of time and space, unearths stories that are guaranteed to get me into … uncomfortable situations … and unabashedly declares reality a permeable construct. It’s big.
It’s like if Paulo Cohelo’s “The Alchemist” was true. What would that mean for the world?
Let’s find out together. YOU have the power to change the language of spirituality, to spark a wildfire of inspiration that touches the non-believers, the too-big-believers, the bohemian idealists, and the am-I-really-this-crazies.

I’ve already faced rejection. In the year since “Finding Starlight” has been “finished,” I have submitted queries to eighteen literary agencies, nine of which have outright rejected me (the other nine just never responded – ouch). My biggest challenge was getting published.
And, together, we are overcoming that hurdle. The “industry” doesn’t get it, and they are changing. Self-published books account for about 40% of the market today! I’m not a super-famous guru, I don’t have a reality TV show, and I didn’t go to an impressive college. I’m “nobody” to them.
I’m just a human, who used to be a star, that wants you to read my story in hopes that you might remember what kind of human you can be, too.
The biggest risk I have today is owning my story. There’s a lot of sensitive material between the pages, and I am certain some of the “characters” in it are not going to be pleased about my honesty. I’ve grappled with how important it is to share these details and how to respond when and if they are challenged.
Maybe that will be in Book Two.
Fear has never stopped me before, nor has poverty, shame, or rejection. The fact that I am alive today, and healthy, is evidence of my resilience. My desire to share it with you is proof of my courage.
Today, I ask you to believe in my story. Believe in the readers who came before you and the promise of the ones who will follow. Believe in the magic of new beginnings.
“I continue to be amazed at what humans can endure and still be kind and loving and desirous of evolution of self. It’s easy to say, “fuck it” but so many times people do not, and you did not.”
– a reader

We are trying to get this book into the hands of readers everywhere; that begins today - with you.
Whether or not you contribute financially, please share this campaign! Link to it on your social media, tell your friends, send a message to Ellen, or Oprah, or Joe Rogan (he loves weird stuff).
Help me cause a ruckus about this thing for the next sixty days and we will see just how much a shared intention can do.
My magical friends, light me some candles, call upon your Guides, do a little starlight dance – whatever you want to offer me, and this book, in the way of positive manifestation, I gladly accept!
And when you see me out there in the real world, or on social media, don’t be afraid to bolster my resolve. Hug me, congratulate me, call me crazy, comment with words or emoji or a hearty Cabernet. This is it, friends – my big dream. It’s happening. And I need all the love I can get while I … push the baby bird out of the nest and see if it can fly.

We sat and watched the beach in amiable silence. “May I wash your hair?” Paul suddenly asked. It was startling and strange and stirred something inside of me.
“I made this hair wash from the flower of a cactus that only grows on the eastern mountains,” he explained. “I hiked up there and harvested them under the light of the moon. They are powerful flowers, and the wash I made from them will purify you.” He was earnest and intense. The air grew hotter.
“Purify you,” he had said. Not “purify your hair.” My friends had stopped talking and were now openly staring at the dreadlocked man sitting close to me, talking about magical flowers.
I couldn’t fight it. I was curious!
“You want to wash my hair right now?” I asked. Everything started to feel magical, like a dream.
“Yes,” he said, and would not let me look away. My intuition flared inside of me, responding to what felt like the tide pulling at my heart.
“Let’s do it,” I said, before I could change my mind. I was ignoring the other voice inside my head saying, don’t just wander off with some strange man!
I stood and walked down the beach, trailing just behind my mysterious friend. Past the open sands, tourists, and locals, we walked into a mangrove patch. I noticed a bucket of liquid on the beach next to an old stone wall that jutted into the sea.
Paul led me into the water and bent my head back, wetting my hair. He ran his fingers through, gently combing out the many tangles, until it felt like silk. His lips formed the words, “follow me” as he turned and walked toward the bucket of cactus-water.
At the tip of the beach, just where tiny waves were touching the sand, he met me with the hair wash. I kneeled before him. He cupped a handful of slippery, fragrant liquid and poured it over my head. I closed my eyes, feeling rather than seeing him walk in a circle around my body as he slowly, rhythmically, soaked my hair.
“Stand and face me,” he said. Now he looked more like an old and weathered shaman than a twenty-something white rasta.
“Do you know why I chose you?” he asked.
“No,” I said as the warmth of the sun dripped over my head in the silken fragrance of the wash.
“You were glowing. Not as brightly as you could have been, though!” he admonished. “I almost did not see your shine, in fact. There were others who seemed much brighter. I walked past you once already, but you did not notice me either.
“The great Jah, the Spirit in the Sky, made me turn around to see you. In that moment, as you smiled and laughed, a bright golden light burst around you. It only lasted for a second before fading into a glow, but it drew me to you nonetheless.” He had been speaking quickly and urgently, but now he stopped and peered through intense eyes at something that was me but was not my body.
“Now that you have been soaked with this wash, the magic of the flower will purify your spirit. You are already shining now more brightly than anyone I have ever seen. You will walk along the beach touching both sea and earth. Walk in your own light. Walk until you feel and see what I see now. Others may notice your brilliance; ignore them and continue walking. You will know then to find me.”
I was under his spell, which felt amazingly calm and expansive. I turned and walked as he had said. I did feel lighter, like I was floating rather than walking. Each pebble of sand seemed to be a different, equally vivid color, and the sound of the waves was like fairy breaths.
The warmth of the sun encased my body, reflecting both from the clear blue water and the peak of the sky. I turned and closed my eyes, facing the bright white light and breathing a long, deep, satisfying breath. I spread my arms wide and embraced the sky, feeling a golden light within my chest leap forth to meet the sunlight.
I opened my eyes and saw, indeed, a brilliant sheen surrounding everything. I could look at nothing directly; my eyes glowed from within and every tree, person, rock, and wave had the quality of a mirage.
Following my instincts, a delicate pull like butterfly to flower, I arrived again at the clearing in the mangrove trees and Rasta Paul, sitting cross-legged on the sand, waiting for me.
He stood and led me wordlessly back into the water until my feet no longer touched the sea floor. He supported my body and bent my head backward, submerging me and lifting me in the same motion so that my hair streamed away from my eyes and our faces were inches apart just above the surface.
“You are a Queen, but you do not act as a Queen should,” he said, dunking me again. “You are loose, going through your life totally unaware of everything around you! You run around with all sorts of worthless men, demanding from them nothing, giving yourself away.” Once more, I was under, and then back up. “I see you, with a beautiful smile on your face and wise eyes blurred and closed to the world around you.” He was speaking harshly, like he was angry with me. His grip on my arm got firmer so that he was both supporting me and drawing me closer.
The water seemed to ripple with heat, and a flicker of fear ran through me.
In one powerful, hard motion, he pulled my back into his chest so close that his head was over my shoulder, next to my ear. “Do not give yourself away to these people,” he growled. He turned so that we were facing the crowded beach. ‘These people’ meant a lot more than just the lovers I had taken.
“Today, I see that you are not that woman I saw before. You truly are a Queen, and you have been washed clean so that your light can shine brightly forth!” He roughly pushed away from me then, swimming back to the beach, where he began to fuss with rocks and a stump, building a makeshift chair.
I took a few deep breaths, steadying myself.
A little bit afraid, I was nonetheless still caught in his spell and curious about what would happen next. I swam back to the shore. He gestured for me to sit. I closed my eyes and sat. He again began to run his fingers through my hair, combing out the long, sun-kissed locks. Silent music seemed to play, capturing the two of us in a smooth vibrational rhythm.
I peeked through lowered eyelids to see that he was now moving farther from me, circling my body and combing out invisible threads as though they flowed from my stomach. I closed my eyes once more and saw brilliant golden strands of light streaming through his fingers. He wove, combed, and stroked a thousand individual strands away from my body in every direction until I was encased in a sphere of shining threads.
When he was finished, he sat cross-legged on the sand watching me. For a few moments, I stayed still and silent with my eyes closed, enjoying the image of the golden strands of energy. Then, I opened them and looked directly into Paul’s eyes.
“Thank you,” I said.
“You will not forget me,” he replied. “And I expect you will not forget to honor yourself as Queen, either.”

story:
What's this all about?

Just A Minor Malfunction... is an independent science-fiction e-zine, dedicated to publishing quality, thought-provoking, professionally-edited sci-fi.  We take submissions, and no story will receive a form letter rejection.

 
About the Editor

My name is Michael S. Alter, and I am a life-long sci-fi fan.  I grew up reading Asimov's and Analog, Heinlein and Clarke.  I love the stories, although editing errors would always throw me.
A few years back I started writing my own stories, and then decided to try my hand at publishing.  I launched issue #1 with several key ideas in mind:
No form letters to authors submitting a story.  I'll always give you at least some personalized feedback.
Sharing the profits with the authors.  All authors receive a share of the proceeds according to a formula.
Authors retain the rights to their work, even after my edits.  I only keep the right to continue publishing the story as part of the issue of the magazine.
Low-priced, high-quality stories, lucky 13 per issue.  I'm a strong editor, I'll work with my authors to put out only the best stories.  I have additional reviewers/editors keeping me honest, too.  (Thanks again to Louise Sorensen!)
I'm not trying to make big money out of this, only enough to take my wife out for a nice dinner! ;-)
 

What you get

Sci-fi!  It'll make you think, and maybe open your eyes a little to the future coming at us.  There'll be 13 (unless I miscount!) sci-fi stories, maybe 30,000 to 50,000 words total, plus an article from the editor (that's me!) about the future in the real world.
 

Risks & Challenges

No risks at all.  I already have a number of good stories.
 

Submitting a Story

If you'd like to submit a story for this or future issues, send it (as text in the body of the email, please!) to:
michael.s.alter.author@gmail.com
Rules for submission:
4,000 words or less (I'm not super-strict about that one)
PG-13 or tamer (a bit more strict on that account, but there is a gray area)
Has to be a work where you own all the rights
Science fiction, or maybe tales of the weird.  No swords and sorcery, please!
 
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
Post about the campaign on Twitter...
...or Facebook
...or any other social media platform
...or just tell your friends about it!
Thanks again for checking out our campaign!

story:
“If anyone reads me and finds it useful, as I hope that you do, may doing so spark a gold rush for black women writers at institutions and publications that will pay them and protect them. I hope we build a body politic so thick with contradictions and nuance and humanity and blackness (because blackness is humanity), that no black woman public intellectual has to fix her feet ever again to walk this world." -Tressie McMillan Cottom, Thick

Short Summary

SISTORIES LITMAG is our humble attempt at contributing to the body politic Tressie McMillian Cottom speaks of in the aforementioned quote. 

We are centering the stories of Southern Black women/femmes, specifically those in and from Charlotte, NC, by publishing their work in print and digitally.  We aim to continue the tradition that has led our foremothers into self-awareness, power, and freedom, by providing a platform for Black women/femmes to read, share, and reflect on the stories that bind us

Our magazine is interactive, meaning we’re working with Black women scholars from Charlotte to develop a curriculum around the themes in the fiction, nonfiction, poetry, photography, and visual art submissions featured in the first issue. The curriculum will include writing prompts, reflection questions, and reading guides.

Using the magazine, we’ll be hosting community workshops that nurture the creative and holistic spirits of Black women. The intent is to cultivate a space that supports deep analysis of self through story, while also exploring the historical, political, social, and economic factors that influence Black women's lives. 

We are seeking additional funding to launch the first issue SISTORIES LITMAG  and host our first community writing workshop.

 

What We Need

We’ve already been awarded a Cultural Vision Grant from the ASC towards printing and distributing 400 copies of SISTORIES LITMAG, but we're expected to match those grant funds, and we also believe that Black women/femmes deserve to be paid for their work, so in order to bring this project completion we’ll need to raise a bit more money.

It'll cost roughly $4,000 to pay everyone involved in the production of the magazine and workshop, including contributors, graphic designers, consultants, and editors.

We'll need an additional $3,500 to cover advertising, website design, perk production, and Indiegogo campaign fees.

Any funds we raise that exceed our goal will go towards the production of the next issue of SISTORIES LITMAG and subsequent community writing workshops.

 

What You Get

We're offering several exclusive perks ranging from original products and sponsorship packages, to first edition copies SISTORIES LITMAG.

Our original T-shirt, Tote Bag, and Journal designs are an interpretation of the following excerpt. It refers to a chapter in Alice Walker's, In Search of Our Mother's Gardens.

"In her essay, “Beyond the Peacock: The Reconstruction of Flannery O’Connor,” Walker responds to her mother’s question: “When you make these trips back South… what is it exactly that you’re looking for?” by stating ,  “A wholeness … because everything around me is split up, deliberately split up. History split up, literature split up, and people are split up too. It makes people do ignorant things.”

"She further tells her mother, “I believe that the truth about any subject comes when all the sides of the story are put together, and all their different meanings make one new one. Each writer writes the missing parts of the other writer’s story. And the whole story is what I’m after.”

Be sure to explore our options and select one which matches the level of donation you'd like to make!

 

The Why

We believe Black feminism is a powerful political framework to achieve individual and collective freedom. We know that we can consistently look to the stories of Southern Black women and femmes to develop practices of equity and freedom. We know that there are Black women in Charlotte whose stories must be developed, shared, and studied, and we’ve made it our mission to provide a platform for this to happen. 

I started SISTORIES in 2018 after a deep dive into Black women’s history turned into a deep dive of self, which ultimately led to personal liberation. It was prompted by the release of Candice Benbow’s Lemonade Syllabus in 2016  when I realized how few of the works I’d neither heard of or read despite my English degree and teaching credentials. 

When I began that journey, I saw for the first time how connected my life was to all the Black women’s lives who had come before me. I became empowered by knowledge of self within the context of the world around me, and made it my purpose to help other Black women and femmes become empowered by this realization as well.

By supporting this publication, not only are you helping me realize a vision,  you’re supporting the individual and collective liberation of Charlotte's Black women through literature and art. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You may not be able to contribute to our campaign, and we understand that and appreciate the time you've taken to read our story anyway.

But, by spreading the word about us to other people, and sharing our campaign you can help direct others to our cause.

Use one of the share buttons above, or tag us in a social media posts to show your support!

@sistoriesclt on all social platforms

story:
Short Summary

Critical Blast is a home-based business that, unfortunately, does not have a home to be based in at this time, and has to be into one before the end of March.

  • I'm R.J. Carter, an author and editor.
  • This is my home, business, and family.
  • You will be helping more than just a company continue on, but people get into a stable, home environment and out of living in a hotel.

 

What We Need & What You Get

So here's the scoop:

  • We need to raise about $6000 to cover the shortfall in moving expenses, and we have a very, VERY short time to get that done!
  • Each book offers its own unique style of adventure. For the avid reader, our perks are tiered so that the more titles you order, the better deal you get financially!
  • All funds go entirely to the relocation effort for Critical Blast. Even if we don't reach goal, all orders will still be fulfilled!

The Impact

Your investment will help with:

  • Moving expenses to put Critical Blast in a sustainable environment.
  • Provide stability to the family running the business.

Risks & Challenges

  • Zero! No, really! Everything you see has already been completed. This campaign is for DISTRIBUTION.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you're just not intrigued by the offerings here, you can still help by sharing our campaign on your social media channels.

Thank you so much for your support in this very stressful time!

story:
Résumé du projet

Bonjour, ici Philippe Cigna, membre du duo légendaire Sèxe Illégal et du podcast Tu Me Niaises. Soyons honnêtes, je n’ai pas réellement besoin de votre aide pour écrire un livre, je peux m’en charger tout seul. Par contre, j’ai définitivement besoin de votre aide pour rembourser mes dettes et m’éviter la faillite (again).

Pour la modeste somme de 10$, vous avez la chance de participer à ma libération du joug de l’État, en plus de recevoir un recueil de nouvelles que je suis en train d’écrire. Si je réussis à atteindre mon objectif, je pourrai enfin dormir tranquille et commencer à m’acheter des choses le fun (comme une machine à crème glacée et un chapeau de cow-boy) ET EN PLUS j’aurai écrit un livre. Tout ça grâce à vous. 

Finalement, j’aimerais remercier JF et Mathieu de croire en moi (et vous) et de me pousser à chercher des solutions au lieu de noyer ma peine en écoutant Véro et les Fantastiques. Je vous souhaite tous d’avoir des amis aussi gentils. 
 

Ce que vous recevrez en échange d'une contribution

J'ai besoin de 18 000$ pour rembourser toutes mes dettes (ouch). Voici ce que vous recevrez si vous contribuez à cette campagne indiegogo :

Un livre en pdf avec une belle mise en page pis toute le kit. 

'ga check : 

Il n’y aura pas d’édition papier, pour éviter de tuer des arbres et de monter le coût de production, mais on va quand même s’arranger pour que ça soit super beau. 

Aussi, on a pensé faire un LIVRE AUDIO,  ce sera une production sonore 100% flyée. Comme ça vous pourrez suivre la lecture du pdf avec ma douce voix (peut être des invités aussi) ainsi des ambiances sonores, gracieuseté de Mathieu. 

On a aussi pensé à ceux qui ont peut-être pas les moyens de contribuer 10 ou 12$  ou qui n'aiment tout simplement pas lire. Pour 5$, vous aurez accès à un podcast EXCLUSIF INDIEGOGO SPÉCIAL PHILIPPE. En gros, mes deux comparses de TMN me recevront comme invité spécial pour parler de moi, juste moi et encore moi. Sinon, vous pouvez aussi contribuer 3$ et nous vous enverrons DEUX épisodes de TMN qui sont seulement disponibles sur notre Patreon. 

Et là, si ça vous tente de beaucoup beaucoup m'aider, y'a un perk à 100$.
Pour 100$ je vous envoie une lettre personnalisée juste pour vous. Des poèmes, des dessins, un timbre, du papier. Juste. pour. toé. Wow-e.

Si vous voulez contribuer encore plus que 100$, me faire un virement paypal ou autre par pure bonté de coeur, vous pouvez soit me contacter sur facebook, ou écrire à la page de Tu me niaises et on pourra s'arranger.  Un ÉNORME merci à tous!

Si jamais je ne reçois pas le montant total de 18 000$, ce n’est pas grave, mais soyez quand même assuré que je vais tout envoyer au tabarnak de gouvernement.

L'optimisme de JF (et notre indépendance)

Merci de m'aider à écrire un recueil de nouvelles. J'ai déjà commencé à écrire plusieurs histoires, sans but précis et sans espoir de ne jamais publier quoi que ce soit.  Mais avec l'aide et l'optimisme de JF, je vais produire de façon totalement indépendante (avec vous là) un premier ouvrage. Si cette campagne a du succès, je pourrais ensuite le vendre sur
la boutique en ligne de TMN. Pourquoi pas? Avec le grand succès de TMN, nous sommes en route vers l'indépendance totale et nous en sommes très fiers. 

J'ai déjà environs 50 pages d'écrites et j'ai très hâte de vous montrer ça.

Les autres manières de m'aider

Si jamais vous avez pas le budget pour m'aider financièrement (hey 'ga, je comprends ça)
vous pouvez quand même m'aider en partageant cette page sur vos réseaux sociaux avec un petit commentaire. J'ai besoin de rejoindre le plus de monde possible qui apprécie mon travail avec TMN et Sèxe Illégal et disons que les algorythmes de facebook sont assez merdiques. Parlez-en à vos amis cools, mais surtout à vos amis riches!

Les paroles s'envolent, les écrits restent et les factures s'accumulent. J'ai autant de dettes que d'histoires à raconter.

Bonjour, ici Philippe Cigna, membre du duo légendaire Sèxe Illégal et du podcast Tu Me Niaises. Par contre, j’ai définitivement besoin de votre aide pour rembourser mes dettes et m’éviter la faillite (again).
Pour la modeste somme de 10$, vous avez la chance de participer à ma libération du joug de l’État, en plus de recevoir un recueil de nouvelles que je suis en train d’écrire. Si je réussis à atteindre mon objectif, je pourrai enfin dormir tranquille et commencer à m’acheter des choses le fun (comme une machine à crème glacée et un chapeau de cow-boy) ET EN PLUS j’aurai écrit un livre. Tout ça grâce à vous. 
Finalement, j’aimerais remercier JF et Mathieu de croire en moi (et vous) et de me pousser à chercher des solutions au lieu de noyer ma peine en écoutant Véro et les Fantastiques. Je vous souhaite tous d’avoir des amis aussi gentils.

J'ai besoin de 18 000$ pour rembourser toutes mes dettes (ouch). Voici ce que vous recevrez si vous contribuez à cette campagne indiegogo :
Un livre en pdf avec une belle mise en page pis toute le kit. 
'ga check :

story:
Rowlf came to us at age 8 and we only had him for a year. But the impact he made was great.  He always found feathers, as they'd stick to his fur. Unfortunately, he died of cancer only a year later.

5 years after his death, Rowlf continues to send feathers to us and his successor, Jingle. I wrote a book for children from 4 to 12 to tell all about Rowlf, his feathers, remembering a pet after their death, and the spiritual connection of the feathers. I need help with funding it to get it published. 

I am paying for my illustrator, a $2000 color publishing package and various marketing tools like Amazon and Barnes and Noble listings, Library of Congress number, etc.

I've had this book spinning around in my head for years and would love to share Rowlf's story with others, in addition to examining feather lore and connections.

There are great perks for contributions but no matter what the offering, you will have my thanks and affection.  If you can't contribute at this time, no worries. Please share the heck out of the link and  look for the book on Amazon in May/June.

story:
Moon Tide Press is an independent publisher located in Southern California established in 2006. Eric Morago in 2017 took over the press and made a commitment to expand its focus on new, diverse, and daring voices—voices that can often be overlooked, but shouldn’t. 

Eric continued Moon Tide’s tradition of publishing poetry anthologies but began concentrating on more themed content beginning with its Dark Ink: A Poetry Anthology Inspired by Horror in 2018. 

Following the success of that release, Eric wondered what Moon Tide’s next themed anthology should be. One day, when Moon Tide author Dania Alkhouli remarked during the reading of one of her poems that she could write a book dedicated to all the sh!t men have said to her, folks in the audience chimed in that that should be the next anthology. It didn't really take any convincing.

Dania may have meant for what she said to be a humorous aside, but the truth of the matter is that it really isn’t funny, and it needs to be responded to. 

Sh!t Men Say to Me: A Poetry Anthology in Response to Toxic Masculinity features the work of over 70 poets from across the country (and some even beyond it) who have all been struck by the sharp tongue of toxic masculinity, and have something necessary to say about it. Poets of different backgrounds, genders, sexualities, creeds, and colors unpack deeply personal stories about weaponized power, engrained misogyny  and finding your complete personhood in a system that tries to make you less.

This is their book. 

We believe in the importance of this collection and want to see it in the hands of as many people as possible; however, due to the pandemic keeping us from safely doing in-person events where we could promote and sell copies of the book thus recouping the upfront publishing expenses, we are looking for other avenues to ensure the book’s overall success and print run.

We also just wanted to reach out to our community in a fun and interactive way. 

The moneys we raise through this crowdfunding effort will go towards the design and production cost of the book, including printing and shipping contributor copies to each of the poets published in it. Any additional funds raised will go back directly into the press for future publication use such as paying for ISBNs, distribution costs, design, printing, etc. 

As a way to show our gratitude we have come up with some exciting and unique rewards for those who support our campaign to raise the funds we need. Besides getting a copy of the anthology at every tier level of support, you can also enjoy perks like curated literary-themed gift boxes, enrollment in master class workshops facilitated by the anthologies three editors, one-on-one manuscript consultation with Moon Tide Editor-in-Chief, original art, and much more! And, if you can’t afford to donate or even pre-order a copy of the anthology, that’s okay. We still love you. You can still help us out by sharing our campaign on social media and getting the word out there about this project!

Regardless of the amount raised by this campaign, this anthology WILL happen. However, we sincerely hope others will see the worth of this collection in the world and will help us make certain its release is as successful as possible!

story:
What we need 

Craft veteran bartender Evan Cablayan carries over 15 years in the bar business with top chef driven establishments across America as a top mixologist, and bar consultant. After years of being asked to produce a book by fans of his work, Cablayan has developed a series of novels detailing his journey in the world of spirits. This collection of seasonal cocktails will show people how to reproduce these creations in the comfort of their own home or next event. " Tales of the Barsmith" vol.1  is what the series will be called. The concept behind the books refers to the " farm to glass " movement, taking produce directly from farmers markets and teaching readers how to use these fresh ingredients in cocktails. In order to begin production for the first two books will require the amount of $10,000 to fill the growing demand for Evan's creative and original recipes.

The Impact

Contribution to this campaign will directly help Evan achieve his dream of sharing his life's work with the public. The funding for this cocktail venture will directly help in production and marketing of the novels. Cablayan plans to release two books this year broken down by season. A fall - winter book followed by a spring - summer book highlighting fruits, herbs, and vegetables that are grown at different times of the year.

Risks & Challenges

Self-publishing is a big commitment and risk in itself. This is Cablayan's first venture of this size. It naturally will require a lot of groundwork that Evan and his team are fully aware of in order to make the books a commercial success. The books will be sold on Evan's website www.barsmithcraft.com, Amazon,  and other various online retailers. Macon Bistro & Larder in Washington D.C (Cablayan's current bar residency), will sell signed hard copies of the books in their retail  section of the establishment.  Great PR and marketing are truly the key to making Barsmith a future staple in the world of cocktails, along with your belief in Evan's vision!


Thank you for checking out our dream! Cheers!

story:
Dobro došli

Ja sam Petar Ciganović, dugogodišnji aktivist i bloger - komentator svakodnevnih zbivanja.
Moj način izražavanja je konkretan, bez licemjerne političke korektnosti i bez poniznosti prema nametnutim, lažnim autoritetima.

Nakon godina pisanja, odlučio sam napisati i izdati knjigu pod imenom Dijagnoza.

O knjizi

Dijagnoza - knjiga koja secira današnji svijet govoreći o njemu bez uljepšavanja, bez ustezanja.
Dijagnoza - knjiga koja na svakome razumljiv način demistificira društvene odnose.

Dijagnoza - knjiga koja dira nedodirljivo i udara u temelje mitova i laži

Dijagnoza - knjiga čije izdavanje i vi možete pomoći.

Što mi je potrebno

Da bih mogao izdati knjigu neovisnu o mainstreamu i onima koji ovise o politici o kojoj će u knjizi biti riječ, potrebna mi je vaša pomoć

Nadam se skupiti cca 15.000 kn i s tim iznosom pokriti sve izdatke vezane uz izdavanje kvalitetne knjige, promociju knjige, kao i izradu web stranice za promociju knjige.

Važnost

Smatram da je knjiga ove vrste potrebna da bi što većem krugu ljudi pomogla u demistifikaciji politike i modernih društvenih odnosa i navela ih da više razmišljaju o domeni koja im, htjeli oni to ili ne, određuje i  usmjerava živote.

Što više aktivnih, informiranih i educiranih pojedinaca, to je veća mogućnost kreiranja kvalitetnih politika okrenutih čovjeku, a ne kapitalu.

Zahvala

Unaprijed hvala svima koji su spremni pomoći ovom projektu. Ukoliko vas zanimaju detalji, slobodno mi se obratite.

To bi, ukratko, bilo to.

story:
Years ago I wrote a novel called Learning This Life.  Around the same time, my father had his first heart attack.   My writing life took a great pause.  Our family, and my life was never the same.

In the last 15 years I’ve learned incredible lessons about life, crisis, grief, loss, friendship, faith, and family.  I want to share these lessons with hope that my experience will somehow inspire and help others who navigate crisis situations. 

I've received an invitation to travel to Bali Indonesia with a small group of writers.  The purpose of this 28 day retreat is to help writers liberate their book or film project through a structured writing process that includes coaching and peer support.  http://bali.thedailylove.com/

My book will be called Learning This Life.  This time it will be my story, and the story of others who have had to navigate crisis. 

In order to attend, i need help and any amount  is beyond deeply appreciated.

I believe there will be a breakthrough in Bali!  I truly appreciate your consideration and your support.

             

Sample Writing:

Here Comes The Sun:  http://michonlartigue.blogspot.com/2012/12/here-comes-sun-today-is-december-1-2012.html
