story:
Love and Life of Female Entrepreneurs: A Book About Relationships and Success in the Time of Millennials


In the midst of pursuing the most difficult journey I’ve ever embarked on, I had my heart ripped out and trampled on. I picked it up, put it back where it belonged, and then continued on with the feeling of a thousand knives stabbing into it. I thought that breaking up with him would heal the pain I felt, but all it did was worsen it.

I lost the man I loved, my best friend, and my favorite advisor.

Despite the agony, I still had to suit up and show up to continue building my very first startup. For the first time in my life, I had more than just my own wellbeing at stake. My decisions impacted the livelihood of an entire company, and more than just my own future.

How did other women do it? Is it even possible to be successful in a romantic relationship while running a business? I wondered if Sarah Blakely went through heartbreak while she started SPANX. I wondered if Melinda Gates ever had problems with Bill, and how she handled them. Building a company required me to be leader-like, single-focused, and decisive, whereas, building a romantic relationship required me to be receptive, adaptable, and multi-focused. I wondered how many other women dealt with these opposing demands? So, I started asking around my own network of high-powered women, and found that many of them are facing similar challenges…


In an article titled Female Entrepreneurs Are Happier Than Male Entrepreneurs, Forbes wrote:

“Maria Seidman, CEO of simple app-maker, Yapp, says she’s definitely more fulfilled as an entrepreneur. Of course, there are trade-offs. “There is a lot of uncertainty and failures in the day to day, in addition to the successes and wins, and the emotional roller-coaster can take a toll on you and your relationships if not managed,” she says. “Entrepreneurship can also be lonely – even if you have a great partner, team, and mentors – because ultimately the buck stops with you and some days you really feel the weight of that responsibility to make it all work.”

---

An article on Inc.com said:

“Wendi Goldsmith, the CEO of Bioengineering Group, in Salem, Massachusetts, didn't get a single bite when she tried online dating after her divorce in 2003. Then she made one change to her profile, and the responses streamed in.

The one change? She stopped referring to herself as an entrepreneur.”

---

In the article called 6 Challenges Women Entrepreneurs Face, Businessnewsdaily.com wrote:

“Entrepreneurship was once considered a man's territory, but each year, more and more women set out on the journey to launch and lead their own companies. “

---


With more and more women entering the entrepreneurial world, we’re seeing a shift from women competing with each other, to supporting one another. Networking events have shifted from a “what can you do for me?” to a “what can I do for you?” mentality, but with our personal lives and relationships still taboo, there’s a major elephant in the room.


This is why I will be spending the next 6-12 months interviewing entrepreneurial women from all walks of life, to reveal their stories, their challenges, their successes, and their opinions about love and relationships in the world of a female entrepreneur in the 21st century. Then, I will compile them into a book: The Love and Life of Female Entrepreneurs*


The idea came to me when I attended an event where there was a panel of two entrepreneurs talking about their businesses and lives as female entrepreneurs. I noticed that neither of them talked about their romantic relationships, so, when the Q&A was opened up to the audience, I asked “How did starting your businesses impact your personal relationships?” Clearly, this made them feel uncomfortable, and the tone of the entire room shifted. I couldn’t believe how taboo the subject was. After the panel, I had a series of women thank me for asking them that question. It became clear that there’s a need for these topics to be talked about more freely.


In this book, we’ll be tackling some questions like…

What kind of challenges do women face in their relationships and dating lives, while starting a business?

With more women starting companies, how are we dealing with this shift of gender roles in our relationships?

How do relationship disasters, such as divorce and adultery, affect our businesses?

How do successful business owners cope with emotional pain?

What do female entrepreneurs think about alternative relationship styles, like polyamory?

What, if anything, can we do to ensure success in both our relationships AND our businesses?


As a Certified Relationship Coach and Sexuality Educator, romantic relationships are always on my mind. As I meet more and more successful entrepreneurs, I’m learning how taboo it is to talk about personal relationships. Being a millennial female entrepreneur is hard enough, but tack on some trouble with a husband, boyfriend or dating life, and it’s a whirlwind of impact. 

As women, we have an obligation to band together and provide concrete stories and information for other female entrepreneurs who may be going through similar struggles, in order to set up future female entrepreneurs for success in all of their relationships. This information could also be useful to men that are dating female entrepreneurs (or want to), as well as the people that work around them.


---Who's Being Interviewed---

Here's a list of Entrepreneurial Women who I have already interviewed, or has already agreed to be interviewed:

Chantelle Baxter, Co-founder of One Girl, Speaker, & Blogger (author of this incredibly inspiring blog post: "7 Surprising Lessons I Learnt From My Recent Breakup" )  

Pocket Sun, Founder of SoGal: a platform, and community, for millennial female entrepreneurs, on a mission to close the gender gap in entrepreneurship 



---Stretch Goals---

Once $15K is reached…

This book will be published through Amazon, and print copies will be available!

It will also be available as an ebook!

Once $20K is reached…

I will include interviews from the people (men and women) who are dating female entrepreneurs, to give you the perspective of those on the other side.

I will also offer the book in audio format. (yay, audiobooks!)

Once $30K is reached…

I will include advice around how to…

·  better your romantic relationships,

·  build intimacy,

·  create safe environments

·  cater to the masculine and the feminine,

·  get what you need,

·  set boundaries,

·  and be more attractive.


Once $50K is reached…

story_txt:
Love
and Life of Female Entrepreneurs: A Book About Relationships and Success in the
Time of Millennials 
In the
midst of pursuing the most difficult journey I’ve ever embarked on, I had my
heart ripped out and trampled on. I picked it up, put it back where it
belonged, and then continued on with the feeling of a thousand knives stabbing
into it. I thought that breaking up with him would heal the pain I
felt, but all it did was worsen it. 
I lost the man I loved, my best
friend, and my favorite advisor. 
Despite
the agony, I still had to suit up and show up to continue building my very
first startup. For the first time in my life, I had more than just my own
wellbeing at stake. My decisions impacted the livelihood of an entire company,
and more than just my own future. 
How did
other women do it? Is it even possible to be successful in a romantic
relationship while running a business? I wondered if Sarah Blakely went through
heartbreak while she started SPANX. I wondered if Melinda Gates ever had
problems with Bill, and how she handled them. Building a company required me to
be leader-like, single-focused, and decisive, whereas, building a romantic
relationship required me to be receptive, adaptable, and multi-focused. I
wondered how many other women dealt with these opposing demands? So, I started
asking around my own network of high-powered women, and found that many of them
are facing similar challenges…
In an article titled Female Entrepreneurs Are Happier Than Male Entrepreneurs, Forbes
wrote:
“Maria Seidman, CEO of simple app-maker, Yapp, says
she’s definitely more fulfilled as an entrepreneur. Of course, there are
trade-offs. “There is a lot of uncertainty and failures in the day to day,
in addition to the successes and wins, and the emotional roller-coaster can
take a toll on you and your relationships if not managed,” she says.
“Entrepreneurship can also be lonely – even if you have a great partner, team,
and mentors – because ultimately the buck stops with you and some days you
really feel the weight of that responsibility to make it all work.”
---An article on Inc.com said:
“Wendi Goldsmith, the CEO of Bioengineering Group, in
Salem, Massachusetts, didn't get a single bite when she tried online dating
after her divorce in 2003. Then she made one change to her profile, and the
responses streamed in.
The one change? She stopped referring to herself as an
entrepreneur.”---
In the article called 6 Challenges Women Entrepreneurs Face, Businessnewsdaily.com wrote:
“Entrepreneurship was once considered a man's
territory, but each year, more and more women set out on the journey to launch
and lead their own companies. “---

With more and more
women entering the entrepreneurial world, we’re seeing a shift from women
competing with each other, to supporting one another. Networking events have
shifted from a “what can you do for me?” to a “what can I do for you?” mentality, but with our personal lives and relationships still taboo, there’s a major
elephant in the room.

This is why I will
be spending the next 6-12 months interviewing entrepreneurial women from all
walks of life, to reveal their stories, their challenges, their successes, and
their opinions about love and relationships in the world of a female entrepreneur
in the 21st century. Then, I will compile them into a book: The
Love and Life of Female Entrepreneurs*

The idea came to me
when I attended an event where there was a panel of two entrepreneurs talking
about their businesses and lives as female entrepreneurs. I noticed that
neither of them talked about their romantic relationships, so, when the Q&A
was opened up to the audience, I asked “How did starting your businesses impact
your personal relationships?” Clearly, this made them feel uncomfortable, and the
tone of the entire room shifted. I couldn’t believe how taboo the subject was.
After the panel, I had a series of women thank me for asking them that
question. It became clear that there’s a need for these topics to be talked
about more freely.

In this book, we’ll be tackling some questions like…

What kind of
challenges do women face in their relationships and dating lives, while
starting a business?
With more women starting companies, how
are we dealing with this shift of gender roles in our relationships?
How do relationship
disasters, such as divorce and adultery, affect our businesses?
How do successful
business owners cope with emotional pain?
What do female
entrepreneurs think about alternative relationship styles, like polyamory?
What, if anything,
can we do to ensure success in both our relationships AND our businesses?
As a Certified Relationship Coach and Sexuality Educator, romantic
relationships are always on my mind. As I meet more and more successful
entrepreneurs, I’m learning how taboo it is to talk about personal
relationships. Being a millennial female entrepreneur is hard enough, but tack
on some trouble with a husband, boyfriend or dating life, and it’s a whirlwind
of impact. As women, we have an obligation to band together and provide
concrete stories and information for other female entrepreneurs who may be going
through similar struggles, in order to set up future female entrepreneurs for
success in all of their relationships. This information could also be useful to
men that are dating female entrepreneurs (or want to), as well as the people
that work around them.
---Who's Being Interviewed---Here's a list of Entrepreneurial Women who I have already interviewed, or has already agreed to be interviewed:Chantelle Baxter, Co-founder of One Girl, Speaker, & Blogger (author of this incredibly inspiring blog post: "7 Surprising Lessons I Learnt From My Recent Breakup" )  Pocket Sun, Founder of SoGal: a platform, and community, for millennial female entrepreneurs, on a mission to close the gender gap in entrepreneurship 

---Stretch Goals---Once $15K is
reached…
This book will be
published through Amazon, and print copies will be available! It will also be available as an ebook!
Once $20K is
reached…
I will include
interviews from the people (men and women) who are dating female entrepreneurs,
to give you the perspective of those on the other side.I will also offer the book in audio format. (yay, audiobooks!)
Once $30K is
reached…
I will include
advice around how to…
·  better your romantic
relationships, 
·  build intimacy, 
·  create safe
environments
·  cater to the
masculine and the feminine, 
·  get what you need, 
·  set boundaries,
·  and be more
attractive.

story:
Starcherone Books is closing its doors. To use the term coined by one of our favorite writers, Raymond Federman, we’re “changing tense.” Going from present to past.

It’s been a good run. But it’s time. This is the end. Cue The Doors.

After 15 years of being one of the country’s leading alternative literary presses, Starcherone is now fulfilling the last of our publishing commitments. Recently we released our final title, Bryan Hurt’s award-winning Everyone Wants to Be Ambassador to France. It’s a great book—and has testimonials from T.C. Boyle, Aimee Bender, and guest judge Alissa Nutting, who chose it last year as winner of the 10th Starcherone Prize for Innovative Fiction.

Now we’re finishing final obligations and setting up support for our backlist titles.

But, as we near the finish line, we’re looking at a big budget shortfall.

To this end, we're undertaking one last fundraising campaign.

Please help us. Your financial contribution will help us create a stable support mechanism for marketing, distribution and warehousing of Starcherone’s over 30 titles. These include books by Alissa Nutting, Michael Joyce, Stacey Levine, Raymond Federman, Steve Katz, Kent Johnson, Thaddeus Rutkowski, Leslie Scalapino, Aimee Parkison, Gretchen E. Henderson, Joshua Cohen, Michael James Rizza, and more.

Those of us who work in nonprofit literary publishing send books out into the world and often don’t know whether or how they connect with readers. So the support and praise that’s arrived in these last days has surprised us a little. It’s been a reminder of how many people the books have touched, and in how many ways—more than we thought possible.

Please take a couple of minutes to make a contribution. Any amount is welcome. All gifts are tax deductible to the fullest extent of the law. 

And please excuse us for disappearing. But the books will live on—and your support will help make that happen.

story:
Kimly's Trade

(A short excerpt from the prologue)

“What do you call her?” the purple-marked man asked Uncle.  Before Uncle could answer, the strange man turned to me, “Child, what is your name?”

“Noi,” I whispered, immediately hating myself for giving him my name. I wanted it back. I didn’t want the purple-marked man to have my name.

Uncle bent down and pulled me to my feet. He nudged me toward the strangers, and a skinny man with baggy pants grabbed my arm. I tried to pull away. “Uncle!” my voice was high, as panic overtook me. I used my free arm to try to peal his fingers off me, but his dirty hand would not budge. I leaned back and away, allowing my legs to buckle beneath me. The skinny man with baggy pants grabbed the hair on the top of my head and pulled me across the dirt and gravel. With both of my hands I tried to pull his fingers away from my hair and my head. My short pants slid down to my knees. I used one hand to try and pull my shorts back up while my other hand flailed about. My hip and my backside were on fire as the rocks tore into my skin.

When he reached the block building, the man in the baggy pants grabbed me at the waist and lifted me in the air. He tossed me across the floor of a small room, and my head banged against the ground. He slammed the door behind me.

I don’t remember when the night sky came, but I stayed in the room alone while the darkness moved outside. I dreamed of Momma and cold red ice.
The next morning the purple-marked man came back to the room. He set a bowl on the floor. I ate thick cold noodles so quickly that my stomach hurt. The pain felt good, because it was the first pain I had felt in many days that I had done to myself. I wondered if that pain was the last pleasant memory I would ever have.

Almost four years ago I wrote a 95,000-word fictional manuscript about a woman at a crossroads in her life. I named her Kimly because I saw her as a fierce lioness with a limited view of the strength she possessed.

Within the manuscript I also unearthed the parallel story of Noi, a young girl sold into the sex trade.  While you will never read it in the book, Noi's name means, "Child of God".

When readers are drawn into Noi's story of slavery and abandonment they will discover a story that is stimulating and triumphant. Reading the story allows readers to travel through the streets of Thailand on a life changing adventure filled with hope.

Kimly's Next Trade

It's time to move forward and give Kimly's Trade a life of its own!

  • We have hired an editor!
  • We are contracted with THL Final Copy  to begin editing on September 8th

Let's Be Real...it's The Story of God

  • Kimly's Trade is the story of God's redemption and restoration.
  • Time and again, God has been faithful to use stories as a means to spread the message of hope to people who might not hear about His love.
  • It's time for that to happen again!

Risks & Challenges

  • I am asking for donations to help with the expenses of getting Kimly's Trade to the right literary agent and publisher
  • Look through the PERKS and pick the one that works for you!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share my blog! (jackiesill.com) In less than 18 months we've had just under 56,000 visitors!
  • Share the campaign for Kimly's Trade!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools and share about this campaign!
  • Pray for our marriage. Pray that we would be diligent in doing the things we have learned to remain steadfast and faithful.
  • Pray for the writing. As we are revisiting Kimly, Noi, and Dak--pray that God will be glorified through their stories.

story:
IMMORTAL


The year is 1204 - the 4th Crusade. Two brothers, Marcus and Alexander, uncover a myth in the depths of Constantinople. What seems like a mere coincidence develops into an all out war of good versus evil.

When Marcus is bitten by a monstrous creature and transforms into the beast itself, he is forced to flee. Since the bond between the brothers is so overpowering, Alexander will stop at nothing and risk everything in order to bring his brother back into the light.

A dark truth waits to be discovered regarding their father's death, and Marcus and Alexander become entangled in a battle of life or death. Once discovered, the secret will change their lives forever. 


  Why The Campaign 

I believe in family. I wanted to do something unique and make my family proud, so I wrote a book focusing on a brother's bond. 

A family's bond is strong - stronger than anything. A father protecting his daughter, a mother caring for her young, a brother standing up for his sibling, and a sister advising her's. Protection, care, wisdom, and love. That's what makes up a family and that's what makes the bond so powerful. Family is the most important aspect in life. 

There are so many broken families nowadays, children who never got the opportunity to meet their father or mother. They feel alone in this great big world, they feel abandoned, forgotten. Which often pushes them away from the family they have and end up traveling down a dark, wicked path. 

We all face challenges in life, but when we do face these challenges; it's our decision on what path we choose. Will we press on through the fog and reach our goal or turn back and give up? 

Life is never simple enough to just choose a yes or no option, we often choose to take a leap of faith, but why not turn to family? They want what's best for you and they love you. They are the greatest guidance you can receive. 

The world needs to know how strong a family's bond can be for one another and that no one is alone in this world. 


Meet the Author

Hi, I'm Tim Routledge. I'm an author from Chicago, Illinois and I've spent a lot of my life traveling to new places. I've been all around the country - I love learning the history of each new place I visit, as well as enjoying the scenery. 

I'm 22 years old and I love writing stories. Stories full of exciting action between heroes and villains. The classic good versus evil. Immortal is a new and engaging story that focuses on relationships between likable characters having to endure trials which will either make or break them. 

I am very knowledgeable in history - world, U.S., mythology, etc.. With all my traveling and interest in history, I've created an imaginative new story where two brothers find that they have been living in a world where the supernatural exists.  

This story is more than just another story. This story is about family. Two brothers, who had lost both parents, out on their own. These brothers are extremely close and will risk their lives for each other without hesitation. 

I based the main character's personality off my own: Alexander, the younger brother. There are also a few similarities between my brother and Alexander's brother, Marcus. But the brother's bond throughout the book is exactly like the bond I share with my brother. 

This isn't just another book. It's my life. At least it's my life if it took place in the 13th century and there were mythological creatures roaming about, but that's where my imagination kicks in.  


The Goal

The goal is to raise enough money to have this book edited and published on kindle/ebook and softcover for the world to read. It would be a dream come true for me to see this book on the shelves.


What Your Money Will Pay For

$2,900 - Proofreading and line editing through CreateSpace (An Amazon.com Company)

$300 - Published through CreateSpace as a softcover print and an ebook. 

I know my goal is set at $2,000, but after contacting CreateSpace - I've decided to go through them to have the book edited instead of the independent author through Fiverr.com. 

Total to have IMMORTAL published - $3,200. 

Excerpt From Immortal

"I hesitate to aid any man in becoming immortal, because it is rare that it ends well." Jal said this with an unmistakable bitterness in his tone.

"Risk, pain, and daunting tasks I must go through to achieve immortality pale in comparison to what my brother would have to face alone the remainder of his days, Jal." Alexander replied, confidently. 

Don't Forget to Share!

I know times are tough and it's hard to donate, but donating isn't the only way you can help me. You can help my campaign by sharing in around social media and with your friends and family! The more who see it - the stronger impact it will be. 


Thank You So Much For Your Support!

story:
Overview

Millennials are educated, have diverse skill sets, large and well-connected networks, and a mix of values that do not fit neatly into any one political party. All parties are struggling to connect with the next generation of voters.

MIP is a non-partisan political literacy and engagement organization for every Millennial, young professional, and student under 40 years of age. The goal of MIP is to successfully support Millennials to enter the political sphere as educated citizens and voters, qualified elected officials, and positive governmental and non-governmental influencers, thereby strengthening democracy and public policy for the next generation. MIP will provide information to members with various comfort levels, for those who simply want to make an informed vote or keep up-to-date on the important issues, to those who want to run as candidates themselves, so it is available for absolutely anyone to join.

What We Need & What You Get

Your donation helps us to cover our start-up costs, including website development, hosting services, and graphic design, which have totalled about $5000.

Among the benefits for members are:

  • Access to a network of talented, educated and ambitious peers;
  • Can be recognized as MIP Ambassadors;
  • Start local hubs (by city);
  • Be recognized as an Up-Stander, with nominations for our 40 Leaders under 40 and the opportunity to join our Advisory Panels; and
  • Build a portfolio by submitting articles and opinion blogs on policy and political topics.
  • All of these can be highlighted by our members on their resumes and LinkedIn profiles to demonstrate their personal influence and leadership potential and ability to their peers and prospective employers.

MIP’s strength lies in our membership and is funded through donations, which help us achieve strategic goals for organizational growth.

The Impact

Imagine collaboration over polarization. Creative destruction over entrenched ideology. Intelligent and inspirational young leaders bringing fresh ideas to politics and government.

One person is capable of more influence than it may seem; imagine what dozens, hundreds and thousands of us can accomplish if we support political and democratic engagement together. We are the future of politics, government and public policy. We need to learn how to play the game so we can change the rules.

Millennials are quickly becoming the largest generation in history, with under 40 as the median age of citizens in almost every country across the globe. We have the opportunity to turn disaffection and apathy on its head and make a positive impact, we just need a platform to launch from.

This is about a generation whose values deserve recognition, and young, dynamic leaders who need to represent us where the decisions are happening. It is so important that we ensure democracy remains healthy and strong for our generation and for future generations.

MIP are the thought leaders of the Millennial generation and politics. Millennials need a political voice, the opportunity to improve political discourse and public policy, and ultimately strengthen democracy for our and future generations.

MIP is an opportunity for the next generation to get hands-on, to get informed, to get engaged, to make a difference. A donation to MIP is a vote for our future. Become a catalyst for change with us.

Risks & Challenges

The common line is Millennials are apathetic about politics, don’t vote, and don’t care. This simply isn’t true. We know we’re on the right track to engaging Millennials in the right way to see results, defying stereotypes, and we need your help to prove it. Your memberships and donations are crucial to our success.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Visit www.millennialsinpolitics.com and become a member. Email us at connect@millennialsinpolitics.com to let us know you’re interested in founding a hub in your city and country and we’ll keep you in the loop to get that process going!

  • Share this fundraising campaign and the MIP website with everyone you know, and encourage every person under 40 to join MIP (membership is free!). Some of our greatest supporters are the generations ahead of us, waiting for Millennials to grasp the future that is ours, and may want to donate as well.

  • Retweet, like, and repost us on your social media accounts to help us raise our profile, engage more Millennials, and change politics, government and public policy around the globe for the better!

story:
What and why

I retired a year ago to write. This is my second novel and this time I want to to it right. I have learned the hard way that the success of any book requires the feedback and guidance of a professional editor. But editors are expensive and more than I can afford without your help.

To see other books and stories I have done, please visit my personal web page under publications. Many of my short stories can be read for free (such as on kindle unlimited or with a scribd subscription). As I hope you can see, I am serious about my writing.

As for my novel, I have just finished my 4th draft so the novel is totally written. Here is a brief description:

Imagine Frankenstein's monster but created by an alien machine where each piece of his flesh acted as a DNA key. Imagine a man who died in 1986 and was resurrected 300 years later into just such a patchwork body. This is the story of Puppet, the only man who could die in a world of involuntary immortality. A world where death was forbidden and rules where made up by a select few. This is a story about mortality, art, love, unusual relationships, and a place where people can choose to reincarnate into augmented bodies or bizarre creatures. Puppet's misguided quest to save an immortal woman led him to discover the truth about himself, the truth about immortality and eventually the reason he was created in the first place.

What I need

I have gotten three different estimates from three different editors: $1850, was the lowest;  $2,100 was in the middle; and $2,500 was the highest and most highly respected editor. I am asking for middle amount but hoping for the best editor.

  • $2,100 to $2,500 will go to a professional editor.
  • Anything above $2,500 will help me market the novel.
  • If I don't reach my minimum goal, I will use what I do get to sadly hire a really cheap fiverr editor.

You get

 I am also a photographer and can provide framed photos of some famous people as rewards for your help.

  • Janis Joplin and others at the Monterey Pop Festival in 1967.
  • The Jefferson Airplane and others at the KFRC Fantasy Fair 1967
  • Trebes on Canal du Midi, France and other lovely places around the world.
And, of course, copies of the novel (ebook, or paperback) when it publishes.

Some risk

In general one should reserve an editor two months in advance. Since I cannot reserve without first having the funds, there may be a long delay between funding and the actual editing.

Can't afford to help?

Even if you cannot afford to contribute, you can still help by spreading the word about this campaign. Share with your friends on Facebook. Mention to your connections on Linkedin, or just tweet to all your followers.

Thanks!

story:
Short Summary

Hello everybody!

My name is Stutisheel Lebedev, and I am a 9-time finisher of the world’s longest race - the  3100-Mile Self-Transcendence Race, that takes place annually in Queens, New York. For my best performance, it took me 48 days to complete the distance, averaging 64.3 miles per day. 

I take it as a natural quality to share the best you have. My participation in the 3100-Mile Race changed my life dramatically - I saw and became aware of many things that block or delay the movement towards my goals. For me, this extraordinary race is the best school of life (and also - concentrated life - when everything happens with great intensity and speed), where I can test and verify many approaches and discoveries in nutrition, equipment, but first of all - in the natural unfoldment of your hidden unlimited potential. 

I would like to summarise my experiences and findings in a beautiful book for you to use in your daily striving for not giving up, going forward, and for your life’s eternal pursuit for happiness. I believe that we are truly happy only when we exercise our maximum capacities in sport, creativity, career, and family - in all aspects of life.

Inside the Book

These are the chapters I would like to include in my book as of today:
 

Discipline
Your own style
Enjoying each moment
Determination
Inner cry
Following your heart
Humor
Fullness of life
Beyond the boundaries
Best friends
Searching for the solutions
An Effective Relaxation 
Best personal example
Gratitude
One Power
Revealing secrets
Global picture of life
Mystery of the Big Race

With your sincere help of funding the publishing of my book, I will be able to spread the spirit of the 3100-Mile Self-Transcendence Race and inspire people to have faith in themselves and to believe that nothing is impossible. I see it as a BIG positive creative impact in everybody’s daily life. 

I request you not only to contribute the money-power, but to BE a part of this impact, spreading the message by personal example.

What Is Needed & What You Get

My goal is to have  two books of the same content -  one in English and the other - in Russian simultaneously. I will self-publish the books through Create Space. But my desire is to make it as professional and beautiful as possible. Therefore I will need to cover the following expenses:

•Editing, proof reading, and cover design work
•Translation
•Printing layout and e-book formatting
•Printing of the paper book itself
•Sales description, marketing campaigns and promotions

I strongly believe that the book will be usefull not only to runners, but to many people who are seek  achieving their goals in life harmoniously. In case the main fundraising goal is not met, I will still try my best in accomplishing my goals in order given above. I promise to deliver the books for you under all circumstances.

The Impact

There are only 38 runners in the world who successfully finished the 3100-Mile Race since its inception in 1997. Together with Grahak, my friend from Australia, we try to convey our first-hand experiences of this unimaginably tough race outwardly, but extremely joyful and even delightful inwardly. We are the two runners-writers, who try to rise the curtain about what happens during the Big Race. The secrets of never giving up and doing the best you can under all conditions are universal secrets that work in achieving every challenging goal in life.


YOUR HELP IS NEEDED!

If you would like to help me complete my book “Run. Journey. Become” and share my story with the world, please donate to this campaign.


Help Spread The Word!

After you complete your transaction, Indiegogo will give you the option to send a message to your friends and followers on Facebook and Twitter.

This message will inform your friends that you just backed “Run. Journey. Become.” and will include a link to our campaign page (you'll be able to edit the text). Please send these messages out! It only takes a second and it will be of huge help!


Outstretched Goals

$5000 - Audiobook creation

Project Timeframe

beginning of March 2016 - e-book available
end of March 2016 - print book is ready
April 2016 - Audiobook available


Risks & Challenges

I have published 3 books and issued one CD through Create Space. You can find them here http://bit.ly/StutisheelBooks

From the technical point of view, all process are quite familiar and clear to me.

The risk that I can foresee is the lack of people who are aware of my Crowdfunding project. I have a plan to minimise it:

•Reaching out to my friends and e-mail newsletter subscribers  
•Placing a campaign banner at my own site Stutisheel.org and using services to attract traffic using SEO
•organizing promotional events
•spreading press releases and articles 

But most importantly, I will be really grateful if you shared my project if you like it. Teamwork is the main idea of crowdfunding and I hope our teamwork will bring beautiful things! Please utilise Indiegogo share tools.

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

story:
Help Us Investigate Outrageous Government Conduct

Outrageous Government Conduct is a legal claim made by defendants who argue that law enforcement acted in a way so outrageous that their right to due process was violated.

The claim is part of an entrapment defense and usually involves undercover agents or confidential informants participating in a crime to some extent. Basically, it’s an argument that law enforcement acted in a way so outrageous — creating fake bombs or using informants offering incentives — that a case should be thrown out.

The Crime Report is digging through court cases that involve the entrapment defense and claims of outrageous government conduct, and we're producing a series of stories that will allow readers to get a broad view of how the government has pushed up against the walls of legality in order to make arrests. 

We'll also be highlighting certain cases that haven't been widely covered, but deserve more attention.

This project will be reported by Adam Wisnieski, an investigative journalist from the Bronx, who has spent years digging into issues ranging from corrupt senior care facilities to dishonest government reporting and police malpractice.

The project will be run on The Crime Report, the nation’s most comprehensive news service covering the diverse challenges and issues of 21st century criminal justice.

What We Need & What You Get

The Crime Report is a non-profit news site operating on a thin budget, and this is a major project, so we need your help! 

Adam is devoting months to this project, he's traveling and conducting dozens of interviews, and we need to make sure his stories aren't compromised because of budget restrictions.

But we want you to be a part of the process! Supporters will get:

  • Exclusive access to Q&A audio
  • Opportunities to chat with Adam and the editorial team about the project
  • The Crime Report swag
  • And, of course, much more!

Why Are We Right for this Project?

The Crime Report has a history of groundbreaking investigations that examine the murkiest corners of the U.S. criminal justice system. Our stories have shed light on tens of thousands of wrongful convictions, financially shady prisoner re-entry and substance abuse programs and failures to prosecute environmental crimes.

These are risky, long-term projects, that require hard-nosed reporting, but our reporters have a history of taking on big challenges and returning fearless journalism that challenges authorities.

Risks & Challenges

We're hoping to complete this project this spring, but deadlines are finicky in journalism, especially when you're seeking access to information the government would often not prefer see the light of day.
That said, we won't stop working on this until we can present a clear picture of what exactly is the line between acceptable and outrageous government conduct.

story:
UPDATE: 
Thank you very much for everyone who donated. For all those still interested in supporting us, we are setting up a paypal account and Patreon. Donations can be sent to burningbridgesblogs@gmail.com. 


In the words of Flavia Dzodan "My feminism will be intersectional or it would be bullshit". As awareness of different spheres of oppression grows, and previously silenced minorities begin to speak out, it is important to look at the various ways that different spheres intersect. 

Burning Bridges is about giving representation to those voices that aren't always heard. To provide a network that explores different areas of social justice without ignoring the different frameworks they exist in, and promoting discussion on the different ways that different factors come into play in any given situation. We want to promote the stories of trans people, people of colour, people living in poverty, those with mental illness, queer folk, disabled people, and more. 

We have no interest in silencing anger, but rather seek to help it catch fire in people's hearts and start the process towards making this world a just one. In the long term, we would like to move on towards publishing social justice motivated works of both fiction and non fiction; such as stories that feature protagonists in less represented populations. 

Who Are We? 


We are a group of multimedia artists, bloggers, podcasters, and more, all of whom have an abiding passion for issues of social justice. Since none of us live single issue lives, we know what it means not be single issue in our activism. 
Here are just a few of the blogs joining our network: 

Angie Jackson.

Dirty Nerdy 

Alex Gonzalez and Ania Onion Bula

Sunflower Punk

Radical Neurodivergence Speaking

We also hope to help set up some talented artists in creating web comics, artistic pieces, podcasts, video casts, all in addition to the high quality blogging content we already produce. 

What We Need? 

We are looking for help with managing the start up costs until the network can start earning on its own. Since some of our writers are struggling financially because of their spheres of oppression, we don't have the same level of investment ability. We do however, have plans to over time, turn this into a business capable of sustaining several of us. 

  • $2500 will go to covering the cost of the server itself, the server set up, graphic design, and other site specific expenses. The full amount will make it possible to start off with a lot fewer bugs. We need a minimum of $300 to get started, but every additional dollar will help us make sure everything works cohesively. 

  • $500 to cover incidental costs, including offsetting the costs of long distance phone calls, work put into creating the related social media, and other systems. 
What if We Raise More? 

The more we raise the faster we can move forward into some of our long-term plans. 
If we raise: 

  • Between 3500-4000 - We can fund the formation of podcast featuring some of our bloggers and create more accessible content. The higher end would allow us to also facilitate the creation of other forms of content, including art, and video casts to become a multimedia network.

  • Between 4000- 5000 - We can register Burning Bridges as a business name, and start the process to offer publishing services, beginning with e-books and moving on to include printed editions. 

  • Between 5000 - 6000 - We can begin putting out printed editions of various works like collected essays on certain subjects, or collections of short stories. 
We also hope to facilitate the ability of more people to become content creators on the network. 

How We Plan to Make Money

The intent of our fundraiser is to bring in the capital that we need in order to cover the start-up costs of the blog network and additional network projects if we exceed our goals.  

While we are asking for help to accelerate the process of bringing our dream to life, we are also aware that in order for Burning Bridges to thrive and expand, we will need a sustainable cash flow. For this reason, we have a multi-faceted income generation strategy that will include: Ads, merchandise, publishing, Patron and member investments. 

Below you will find a more detailed breakdown of the ways in which we plan to use these vehicles to ensure that Burning Bridges will sustain itself long after this fundraiser ends.    

Ads:  

As with most bog networks, a percentage of our money will be generated through ad revenue. We are currently investigating the options that would best suit the content of our member blogs, our readership and our ethics. 

As many of our members have their own businesses, they will also have the option to purchase ads for their own businesses, to the benefit of themselves and the network as a whole. 

Patreon: 

Burning Bridges will have a network specific Patreon that will be used to raise funds on a monthly basis. In order to encourage donations, there will be perks for those who choose to offer support in the form of a set monthly donation. Over time, other perks might present themselves.

 These perks will come in the form of exclusive/early release content. This may include poems, short stories or essays made available before they are released to the general public and/or additional supporting materials such as illustrations. 

Though set monthly donations will earn those who choose to donate access to this special content, the content on the network’s blogs will remain frequent and accessible to all visitors. 

Merchandise: 

Several of our contributors are talented artists and crafters and they already have a variety of plans for Burning Bridges specific merchandise in the works. This merchandise may be sold through a Burning Bridges Store, flash sales or promotional auctions, with proceeds going towards the network. 

Publishing: 

Once the blog Network is up and running, we intend on releasing and selling short story e-books and online anthologies, all written by members. The blog network itself can be used to help promote these publishing initiatives. 

Investment: 

As mentioned above, the network will be able to promote the stores and businesses that our members maintain. The business owners within the network have expressed a desire to use some of their profits to further invest in Burning Bridges as a company. 

These investments, in conjunction with our other sources of income will allow us to further expand Burning Business into additional income generating ventures such as: editing services, copy writing, digital promotions and other areas that make use of our members’ rich skill sets. 


What We Offer: 

Among our campaign perks are the ability to suggest topics that you would like to see covered, and access to exclusive/early content. 
What we offer as a group is a variety of diverse voices in one location.  Among our content creators are both women and non-binary people who in many cases are also queer, parents, disabled, transgender, people of colour, living in poverty, and/or homeless. Our content creators come from various religious backgrounds, and maintain differing beliefs and non-beliefs. They are united in their devotion to  intersectional social justice. 

If you cannot donate, please share widely!
story_txt:
UPDATE: Thank you very much for everyone who donated. For all those still interested in supporting us, we are setting up a paypal account and Patreon. Donations can be sent to burningbridgesblogs@gmail.com. In the words of Flavia Dzodan "My feminism will be intersectional or it would be bullshit". As awareness of different spheres of oppression grows, and previously silenced minorities begin to speak out, it is important to look at the various ways that different spheres intersect. 
Burning Bridges is about giving representation to those voices that aren't always heard. To provide a network that explores different areas of social justice without ignoring the different frameworks they exist in, and promoting discussion on the different ways that different factors come into play in any given situation. We want to promote the stories of trans people, people of colour, people living in poverty, those with mental illness, queer folk, disabled people, and more. 
We have no interest in silencing anger, but rather seek to help it catch fire in people's hearts and start the process towards making this world a just one. In the long term, we would like to move on towards publishing social justice motivated works of both fiction and non fiction; such as stories that feature protagonists in less represented populations. 
   Who Are We? 

We are a group of multimedia artists, bloggers, podcasters, and more, all of whom have an abiding passion for issues of social justice. Since none of us live single issue lives, we know what it means not be single issue in our activism. 
Here are just a few of the blogs joining our network: Angie Jackson.


Dirty Nerdy 

Alex Gonzalez and Ania Onion Bula


Sunflower Punk


Radical Neurodivergence Speaking

We also hope to help set up some talented artists in creating web comics, artistic pieces, podcasts, video casts, all in addition to the high quality blogging content we already produce. 

What We Need? 

We are looking for help with managing the start up costs until the network can start earning on its own. Since some of our writers are struggling financially because of their spheres of oppression, we don't have the same level of investment ability. We do however, have plans to over time, turn this into a business capable of sustaining several of us. 

$2500 will go to covering the cost of the server itself, the server set up, graphic design, and other site specific expenses. The full amount will make it possible to start off with a lot fewer bugs. We need a minimum of $300 to get started, but every additional dollar will help us make sure everything works cohesively. 


$500 to cover incidental costs, including offsetting the costs of long distance phone calls, work put into creating the related social media, and other systems. 




What if We Raise More? The more we raise the faster we can move forward into some of our long-term plans. If we raise: 
Between 3500-4000 - We can fund the formation of podcast featuring some of our bloggers and create more accessible content. The higher end would allow us to also facilitate the creation of other forms of content, including art, and video casts to become a multimedia network.
Between 4000- 5000 - We can register Burning Bridges as a business name, and start the process to offer publishing services, beginning with e-books and moving on to include printed editions. 
Between 5000 - 6000 - We can begin putting out printed editions of various works like collected essays on certain subjects, or collections of short stories. 

We also hope to facilitate the ability of more people to become content creators on the network. 
How We Plan to Make Money

The intent of our fundraiser is to bring in the capital that we need in order to cover the start-up costs of the blog network and additional network projects if we exceed our goals.  
While we are asking for help to accelerate the process of bringing our dream to life, we are also aware that in order for Burning Bridges to thrive and expand, we will need a sustainable cash flow. For this reason, we have a multi-faceted income generation strategy that will include: Ads, merchandise, publishing, Patron and member investments. 
Below you will find a more detailed breakdown of the ways in which we plan to use these vehicles to ensure that Burning Bridges will sustain itself long after this fundraiser ends.    
Ads:  
As with most bog networks, a percentage of our money will be generated through ad revenue. We are currently investigating the options that would best suit the content of our member blogs, our readership and our ethics.

story:
La Casa de Panamá (establecido en 1989), también conocida como House of Panama, es una organización sin fines de lucro 501(c)(3) manejado por voluntarios que presentan las tradiciones, la música y la cultura de la República de Panamá al público. Se ha estado trabajando sin descanso durante 25 años - para llevar el legado de la cultura panameña a más de 10 millones de visitantes anualmente del Parque Balboa. Estamos unidos por el amor a Panamá y el deseo de compartir ese amor con el mundo.

       

Desde su creación hace 25 años, la Casa de Panamá tiene una larga historia en la colaboración con el Parque Balboa por su programa de verano, Feria de Comidas Étnicas, Programa de Reinas & Princesas, y Festival Internacional de Navidad, entre otras ofertas del Parque; así como dar becas anuales a estudiantes panameños.  

Con motivo de su 25 aniversario, una Resolución fue presentado a la Casa de Panamá que conmemora el aniversario del Concejal de San Diego Todd Gloria y Presidente de la Asamblea Toni G. Atkins California.

En 2014, la Casa de Panamá amplió su programación pública. Fue sede de la Banda de música Panama Brass en el Club Parque Balboa. En 2015, se planea organizar eventos o co-anfitrión con invitados especiales, entre ellos:

• Miss Universo 2002, Justine Pasek

• Miss Panamá 2014 Yomatsy Hazlewood de la Rosa

• Orquesta Sinfónica Banda Heberto López JDC de Panamá

• Serie Internacional de Cine de Panamá

• El alcalde de la ciudad de Panamá, José Blandón, para la firma del Acuerdo de Ciudades Hermanas con el alcalde Kevin L. Faulconer de San Diego; en colaboración con el Comité Directivo San Diego-Panamá Ciudades Hermanas. La Casa de Panamá, como un participante activo en este Comité, se prepara para convertirse en la columna vertebral de la conexión de San Diego-Panamá Ciudades Hermanas para asegurar su sostenibilidad a largo plazo.

La Casa de Panamá ha sido un miembro oficial desde 1989 de la Casas Internacionales del Pacífico del Parque Balboa - un consorcio de museos artesanales que representan 33 naciones que se encuentran en el corazón del Parque Balboa (http://www.balboapark.org/in-the-park/house-pacific-relations-international-cottages). Diecinueve de los grupos nacionales de 33 miembros disponen la cultura, la música, alimentos, y las artes de sus países. La Casa de Panamá tiene un gabinete de 3 pies cúbicos en el que alojar sus artefactos en el edificio del Salón de Naciones.

              

La Casa de Panamá participa activamente en el Comité de Nueva Casas Internacionales compuesto por nueve naciones miembros que buscan construir sus museos junto a las casas museos existentes. El alcalde de San Diego, Kevin L. Faulconer ha expresado su apoyo a la construcción de estos nueve casa museos de Panamá, Colombia, India, México, Líbano, Palestina, Perú, Filipinas y Turquía. En sus palabras:

              


La Junta Directiva de la Casa de Panamá está dirigida exclusivamente por voluntarios dedicados.  Deseamos su apoyo para cumplir nuestra meta.

                          


Para más información sobre la Casa de Panamá y sus esfuerzos para construir su museo, aquí hay unos artículos:

• El 14 de marzo de 2014, el periódico nacional en Panamá, La Prensa, publicó un artículo destacando el proyecto (http://bit.ly/1cGAfiX)

• El 19 de enero de 2015, en VidaLatina San Diego publicó un artículo que destaca las nueve casas que se construirán (http://bit.ly/15rcTKd)

• El 26 de enero de 2015, KPBS publicó un artículo destacando uno de los esfuerzos de las casas para construir sus museos (http://bit.ly/1G5qDuI)

• El 28 de enero de 2015, el diario San Diego Transcript publicó un artículo destacando la expansión de las nuevas casas (http://bit.ly/1b76erp)

La Casa de Panamá le pide su apoyo para llegar a nuestra meta Legado 2015!

Ayúdenos a alcanzar los 220,000 dólares necesarios para construir un museo dedicado a Panamá en los EE.UU.; una institución que va a durar para siempre en los corazones y las mentes de los visitantes.

El museo de Casa de Panamá será construida en el corazón de los 1,200 acres en el Parque Balboa de San Diego; un tesoro cultural que debutó para la Exposición Panamá-California en 1915 para celebrar la apertura de nuestra maravilla de la ingeniería, el Canal de Panamá.

Es tiempo, 100 años después, para construir la Casa de Panamá para mostrar la rica y larga historia entre Panamá y San Diego ... y más ... a los 10 millones de visitantes cada año al Parque Balboa.

Considere hacer una donación deducible de impuestos hoy...y visitar nuestro museo de mañana! Tiene previsto iniciar construcción a finales de 2015/principios de 2016, gracias a su contribución! Estamos muy contentos de que te unas a nosotros para hacer posible la construcción!

La Casa de Panamá será un museo panameño sin fines de lucro que se construirá fuera del Istmo de Panamá. La nueva construcción será 590 pies cuadrados.  La construcción cumplirá con las restricciones arquitectónicas históricas del Parque Balboa de acuerdo a la época del renacimiento español. La planta baja será el museo y la cocina, y el sótano se utilizará como depósito. La Casa de Panamá va a compartir un baño y la escalera con la Casa de Colombia como se ve en el plan a continuación:

Los visitantes de la Casa de Panamá podrán disfrutar del sabor del espíritu vibrante y el sabor de Panamá, desde lo histórico a lo moderno de hoy en día. Más información sobre los profundos vínculos históricos entre San Diego y Panamá; particularmente el debut simultánea del Canal de Panamá y el Parque Balboa para la Exposición Panamá-California de 1915. Descubre la maravilla de la ingeniería del Canal de Panamá, una de las Siete Maravillas del Mundo Moderno, en el proceso de su expansión actual; cinco sitios del Patrimonio Mundial de la UNESCO (Casco Viejo/Panamá Viejo, Portobelo/San Lorenzo, Parque Nacional Coiba, el Parque Nacional del Darién y el Parque Nacional La Amistad), el patrimonio cultural de siete grupos indígenas; el semillero de la biodiversidad; el Biomuseo moderno diseñado por Frank Gehry; y las artesanías intrincadas creados por talentosos artesanos. La Casa de Panamá contará con más de 590 pies cuadrados de artefactos.

DENTRO DE LAS PAREDES DE LA CASA DE PANAMÁ SERÁ:

• Un modelo interactivo del Canal de Panamá

• Manualidades para niños

• Múltiples pantallas y video de la cultura panameña, arte, historia, biodiversidad, destino de jubilación / turistica / negocios y gastronomía

• Rotación de exposiciones con artistas talentosos, músicos, autores y atletas de Panamá, entre otros

• Talleres y conciertos musicales de talentosos músicos locales y de Panamá

• Degustaciones culinarias

• Libros de autores panameños

• Presentaciones folclóricas de la Casa de Panamá Sonares de mi Tierra y el Grupo Juvenil

• Biblioteca de libros que muestran Panamá

• Programación Pública, incluyendo alojamiento de profesores invitados, excursiones privadas, viajes de estudio / clases, y web-casting de eventos

Desarrollar una apreciación de un país que, en palabras del libertador Simón Bolívar, es “Panamá ... Puente del Mundo, Corazón del Universo”.  Sólo se tarda una hora en llegar desde el Océano Atlántico hasta el Océano Pacífico en carro. Así acariciado es Panamá, que en 2014, International Living clasificó Panamá el mejor destino en el mundo para jubilarse, siete veces seguidas (http://internationalliving.com/2014/01/panama-worlds-best-retirement-haven-2014/).

Te llevaremos al corazón de este istmo de Panamá ...

Quién sabe, puede que desee visitar pronto! No podemos esperar traer Panamá a San Diego!

                  

La Casa de Panamá necesita $220,000 para diseñar y construir el museo. Hasta la fecha, la Casa de Panamá ha recaudado $45,000 y ha recibido compromisos por un total de $40,000. La Casa de Panamá ha pagado $10,000 para los planos arquitectónicos y el proceso de permisos. Ahora necesitamos el suelo restantes $135,000 para iniciar la construcción, el objetivo de esta campaña IndieGoGo.

Hay un gran impulso en este momento, ya que 2015 también marca el año en que los alcaldes de las ciudades de Panamá y San Diego firmarán un acuerdo para convertirse Ciudades Hermanas; el 25 aniversario de la Casa de Panamá y las continuas celebraciones del Centenario del Parque Balboa.

                           

Beneficios

Todas las donaciones para financiar el costo de diseño y construcción serán reconocidas prominente dentro la nueva Casa de Panamá. Los patrocinadores serán reconocidos en un libro “Legado Patrocinio” con su nombre inscrito o en las paredes de la Casa de Panamá.

Realmente será un legado duradero. Su respaldo de este museo ayudará a asegurar a largo plazo viabilidad de una institución cultural importante.  Usted puede ayudar donando ahora a la Casa de Panamá a través de esta página Indiegogo; en línea a través de PayPal en www.houseofpanama.org; o mediante el envío de un cheque a: Casa de Panamá, PO Box 16146, San Diego, CA 92176.

Como una organización 501(c)(3) sin fines de lucro, las donaciones a la Casa de Panamá son deducibles de impuestos, con Tax ID # 71-0954067.

                      


La historia del Parque Balboa en San Diego está directamente relacionada con Panamá desde hace 100 años en 1914; cuando el Parque Balboa abrió sus puertas a celebrar la apertura del Canal de Panamá durante su Exposición Panamá-California de 1915.  La construcción de una Casa de Panamá en el Parque Balboa cimentará la importancia histórica de la construcción del Canal de Panamá para la Ciudad de San Diego.  La transmisión de la herencia de la rica cultura de Panamá será duradera.  El Parque Balboa ha existido por alrededor de 100 años y estará aquí para muchas generaciones por venir.

Los 10 millones de visitantes que visitan el Parque Balboa anualmente tendrán acceso a la Casa de Panamá y sus numerosas actividades en el Parque Balboa.  Durante 25 años, la Casa de Panamá no ha tenido un espacio suficiente grande en el que exponer el Parque Balboa los visitantes de su rica cultura e historia. Se ha limitado a asistir a eventos organizados celebrado al aire libre, espacios de las Casas Internacionales del Pacífico, y otros museos que nos han prestado su espacio.  Tenemos una pequeña vitrina 3 pies cúbicos junto a otros 33 naciones en el Salón de las Naciones. El Salón de las Naciones esta pasando por una renovación a largo plazo y se encuentra actualmente cerrado al público, y la vitrina de la Casa de Panamá esta inaccesible al público.

                                       

                     

Con un museo propio, la Casa de Panamá tiene como objetivo informar a los visitantes de la riqueza de la historia y el enlace a San Diego, así como inspirar a millones de visitantes para viajar a Panamá. Hay un gran impulso en este momento, ya que 2015 también marca el año en que los alcaldes de la ciudades de Panamá y San Diego firmarán un acuerdo para convertirse en Ciudades Hermanas; el 25 aniversario de la Casa de Panamá y las continuas celebraciones del Centenario por todas partes del Parque Balboa.

La Casa de Panamá es un participante activo en el Comité Directivo de San Diego-Panamá Hermana Ciudades. La construcción de una Casa de Panamá puede ayudar a facilitar el intercambio de actividades culturales, el desarrollo de un programa de intercambio de estudiantes, y ayudar a consolidar las asociaciones económicas entre las ciudades hermanas.

MÁS HISTORIA:

Balboa Park fue nombrado por Vasco Núñez de Balboa, el primer explorador europeo en cruzar el Istmo de Panamá hasta el Océano Pacífico en 1513.  En 1915-1916, el Parque Balboa en San Diego sirvió como sede de la Exposición Panamá-California, una monumental feria mundial que conmemora la terminación del Canal de Panamá. La Exposición estableció el escenario para que el Parque Balboa se convertirá en el centro cultural de San Diego para los visitantes de todo el mundo para las generaciones por venir. En 1935-1936, el Parque Balboa fue sede de la Exposición Internacional Califomia-Pacífico, la segunda feria mundial que incluyó la construcción significativa en el parque, incluyendo las Casas Internacionales del Pacífico. Las Casas internacionales situado en el interior del Parque Balboa, eran los dormitorios originales para acoger el Capitán y Almirante de los primeros barcos que venían por el Canal de Panamá en 1914.

                  

MUCHAS GRACIAS

Gracias por tomarse el tiempo de leer esto y ver nuestro video; y teniendo en cuenta lo que su donación podrá hacer. Todo esto es un trabajo de amor, que seguimos dando mientras buscamos maneras de compartir nuestro amor por Panamá. Usted no tiene que ser de Panamá para apreciar el entusiasmo y dedicación de nuestros voluntarios.  Este museo es posible.  Pero para hacerlo - y para que sea un espacio fantástico - necesitamos tu ayuda!

Riesgos y Desafíos

La Casa de Panamá será construida. Es una de las nueve casas que ha ido a través de un proceso formal de obtener la aprobación de varios comités históricos y de la ciudad; y tiene el apoyo de su alcalde Kevin L. Faulconer; que quiere inaugurar la construcción a finales de 2015. Con sus 25 años de historia como organización, los profundos vínculos históricos entre San Diego y Panamá, la colaboración como un equipo con otros ocho museos artesanales que se construirá, y la unidad de sus voluntarios, la Casa de Panamá avanzara con éxito.

Al igual que con cualquier tipo de construcción puede haber retrasos debido a los acontecimientos que ocurren en el Parque Balboa, sin embargo los arquitectos tienen un plan para minimizar el impacto en el flujo de tráfico y peatones en el Parque Balboa, y ha sido aprobado por el Ayuntamiento de la Comisión de Planificación de San Diego. Ver webcast del 22 de enero aquí: http://granicus.sandiego.gov/ViewPublisher.php?view_id=8 

Otras maneras que usted puede ayudar

Aceptamos contribuciones monetarias y también aceptamos la ayuda de voluntarios como tú también!

Por favor, pidale a sus amigos que nos sigan en las redes sociales.

Estamos muy contentos de que te unas a nosotros para hacer posible la construcción!La Casa de Panamá será un museo panameño sin fines de lucro que se construirá fuera del Istmo de Panamá. La nueva construcción será 590 pies cuadrados.  La construcción cumplirá con las restricciones arquitectónicas históricas del Parque Balboa de acuerdo a la época del renacimiento español. La planta baja será el museo y la cocina, y el sótano se utilizará como depósito. La Casa de Panamá va a compartir un baño y la escalera con la Casa de Colombia como se ve en el plan a continuación:Los visitantes de la Casa de Panamá podrán disfrutar del sabor del espíritu vibrante y el sabor de Panamá, desde lo histórico a lo moderno de hoy en día. Más información sobre los profundos vínculos históricos entre San Diego y Panamá; particularmente el debut simultánea del Canal de Panamá y el Parque Balboa para la Exposición Panamá-California de 1915. Descubre la maravilla de la ingeniería del Canal de Panamá, una de las Siete Maravillas del Mundo Moderno, en el proceso de su expansión actual; cinco sitios del Patrimonio Mundial de la UNESCO (Casco Viejo/Panamá Viejo, Portobelo/San Lorenzo, Parque Nacional Coiba, el Parque Nacional del Darién y el Parque Nacional La Amistad), el patrimonio cultural de siete grupos indígenas; el semillero de la biodiversidad; el Biomuseo moderno diseñado por Frank Gehry; y las artesanías intrincadas creados por talentosos artesanos. La Casa de Panamá contará con más de 590 pies cuadrados de artefactos.
DENTRO DE LAS PAREDES DE LA CASA DE PANAMÁ SERÁ:
• Un modelo interactivo del Canal de Panamá
• Manualidades para niños
• Múltiples pantallas y video de la cultura panameña, arte, historia, biodiversidad, destino de jubilación / turistica / negocios y gastronomía
• Rotación de exposiciones con artistas talentosos, músicos, autores y atletas de Panamá, entre otros
• Talleres y conciertos musicales de talentosos músicos locales y de Panamá
• Degustaciones culinarias
• Libros de autores panameños
• Presentaciones folclóricas de la Casa de Panamá Sonares de mi Tierra y el Grupo Juvenil
• Biblioteca de libros que muestran Panamá
• Programación Pública, incluyendo alojamiento de profesores invitados, excursiones privadas, viajes de estudio / clases, y web-casting de eventos
Desarrollar una apreciación de un país que, en palabras del libertador Simón Bolívar, es “Panamá ... Puente del Mundo, Corazón del Universo”.  Sólo se tarda una hora en llegar desde el Océano Atlántico hasta el Océano Pacífico en carro. Así acariciado es Panamá, que en 2014, International Living clasificó Panamá el mejor destino en el mundo para jubilarse, siete veces seguidas (http://internationalliving.com/2014/01/panama-worlds-best-retirement-haven-2014/).
Te llevaremos al corazón de este istmo de Panamá ...
Quién sabe, puede que desee visitar pronto! No podemos esperar traer Panamá a San Diego!                  La Casa de Panamá necesita $220,000 para diseñar y construir el museo. Hasta la fecha, la Casa de Panamá ha recaudado $45,000 y ha recibido compromisos por un total de $40,000. La Casa de Panamá ha pagado $10,000 para los planos arquitectónicos y el proceso de permisos. Ahora necesitamos el suelo restantes $135,000 para iniciar la construcción, el objetivo de esta campaña IndieGoGo.
Hay un gran impulso en este momento, ya que 2015 también marca el año en que los alcaldes de las ciudades de Panamá y San Diego firmarán un acuerdo para convertirse Ciudades Hermanas; el 25 aniversario de la Casa de Panamá y las continuas celebraciones del Centenario del Parque Balboa.                           Beneficios
Todas las donaciones para financiar el costo de diseño y construcción serán reconocidas prominente dentro la nueva Casa de Panamá. Los patrocinadores serán reconocidos en un libro “Legado Patrocinio” con su nombre inscrito o en las paredes de la Casa de Panamá.Realmente será un legado duradero. Su respaldo de este museo ayudará a asegurar a largo plazo viabilidad de una institución cultural importante.  Usted puede ayudar donando ahora a la Casa de Panamá a través de esta página Indiegogo; en línea a través de PayPal en www.houseofpanama.org; o mediante el envío de un cheque a: Casa de Panamá, PO Box 16146, San Diego, CA 92176.
Como una organización 501(c)(3) sin fines de lucro, las donaciones a la Casa de Panamá son deducibles de impuestos, con Tax ID # 71-0954067.                      La historia del Parque Balboa en San Diego está directamente relacionada con Panamá desde hace 100 años en 1914; cuando el Parque Balboa abrió sus puertas a celebrar la apertura del Canal de Panamá durante su Exposición Panamá-California de 1915.  La construcción de una Casa de Panamá en el Parque Balboa cimentará la importancia histórica de la construcción del Canal de Panamá para la Ciudad de San Diego.  La transmisión de la herencia de la rica cultura de Panamá será duradera.  El Parque Balboa ha existido por alrededor de 100 años y estará aquí para muchas generaciones por venir.Los 10 millones de visitantes que visitan el Parque Balboa anualmente tendrán acceso a la Casa de Panamá y sus numerosas actividades en el Parque Balboa.  Durante 25 años, la Casa de Panamá no ha tenido un espacio suficiente grande en el que exponer el Parque Balboa los visitantes de su rica cultura e historia. Se ha limitado a asistir a eventos organizados celebrado al aire libre, espacios de las Casas Internacionales del Pacífico, y otros museos que nos han prestado su espacio.  Tenemos una pequeña vitrina 3 pies cúbicos junto a otros 33 naciones en el Salón de las Naciones. El Salón de las Naciones esta pasando por una renovación a largo plazo y se encuentra actualmente cerrado al público, y la vitrina de la Casa de Panamá esta inaccesible al público.                                                            Con un museo propio, la Casa de Panamá tiene como objetivo informar a los visitantes de la riqueza de la historia y el enlace a San Diego, así como inspirar a millones de visitantes para viajar a Panamá. Hay un gran impulso en este momento, ya que 2015 también marca el año en que los alcaldes de la ciudades de Panamá y San Diego firmarán un acuerdo para convertirse en Ciudades Hermanas; el 25 aniversario de la Casa de Panamá y las continuas celebraciones del Centenario por todas partes del Parque Balboa.
La Casa de Panamá es un participante activo en el Comité Directivo de San Diego-Panamá Hermana Ciudades. La construcción de una Casa de Panamá puede ayudar a facilitar el intercambio de actividades culturales, el desarrollo de un programa de intercambio de estudiantes, y ayudar a consolidar las asociaciones económicas entre las ciudades hermanas.MÁS HISTORIA:
Balboa Park fue nombrado por Vasco Núñez de Balboa, el primer explorador europeo en cruzar el Istmo de Panamá hasta el Océano Pacífico en 1513.  En 1915-1916, el Parque Balboa en San Diego sirvió como sede de la Exposición Panamá-California, una monumental feria mundial que conmemora la terminación del Canal de Panamá. La Exposición estableció el escenario para que el Parque Balboa se convertirá en el centro cultural de San Diego para los visitantes de todo el mundo para las generaciones por venir. En 1935-1936, el Parque Balboa fue sede de la Exposición Internacional Califomia-Pacífico, la segunda feria mundial que incluyó la construcción significativa en el parque, incluyendo las Casas Internacionales del Pacífico. Las Casas internacionales situado en el interior del Parque Balboa, eran los dormitorios originales para acoger el Capitán y Almirante de los primeros barcos que venían por el Canal de Panamá en 1914.                  MUCHAS GRACIAS
Gracias por tomarse el tiempo de leer esto y ver nuestro video; y teniendo en cuenta lo que su donación podrá hacer. Todo esto es un trabajo de amor, que seguimos dando mientras buscamos maneras de compartir nuestro amor por Panamá. Usted no tiene que ser de Panamá para apreciar el entusiasmo y dedicación de nuestros voluntarios.  Este museo es posible.  Pero para hacerlo - y para que sea un espacio fantástico - necesitamos tu ayuda!Riesgos y Desafíos
La Casa de Panamá será construida. Es una de las nueve casas que ha ido a través de un proceso formal de obtener la aprobación de varios comités históricos y de la ciudad; y tiene el apoyo de su alcalde Kevin L. Faulconer; que quiere inaugurar la construcción a finales de 2015. Con sus 25 años de historia como organización, los profundos vínculos históricos entre San Diego y Panamá, la colaboración como un equipo con otros ocho museos artesanales que se construirá, y la unidad de sus voluntarios, la Casa de Panamá avanzara con éxito.
Al igual que con cualquier tipo de construcción puede haber retrasos debido a los acontecimientos que ocurren en el Parque Balboa, sin embargo los arquitectos tienen un plan para minimizar el impacto en el flujo de tráfico y peatones en el Parque Balboa, y ha sido aprobado por el Ayuntamiento de la Comisión de Planificación de San Diego. Ver webcast del 22 de enero aquí: http://granicus.sandiego.gov/ViewPublisher.php?view_id=8 Otras maneras que usted puede ayudar
Aceptamos contribuciones monetarias y también aceptamos la ayuda de voluntarios como tú también!
Por favor, pidale a sus amigos que nos sigan en las redes sociales.

story:
Why Do I Need Your Help?

We all know the stories about best-selling authors who were rejected hundreds of times before their stars aligned, their hard work paid off, and they got that publishing deal. But how many stories are there that never got told, that we never got to read, because a writer couldn't take advantage of the little bit of luck needed to make her dreams come true? 

I am a 43 year-old mother of three beautiful daughters, and ever since I can remember, I've needed to write. I have a completed, unpublished manuscript that has won awards, received great feedback from editors and agents, but hasn't managed to snag a book deal. But finally, I feel like maybe that little bit of luck, that spark from fickle fate, has landed in my hands--and I need to take advantage of it! I'm usually terrible at asking for help, but this time I have to--the opportunity is just too great to pass up.

I, along with only two other authors, have the opportunity to attend a 5-day writing retreat with an iconic Australian (internationally best-selling) author of more than thirty books, and I need to raise the funds to attend. My stories are demanding to be told, and this is an incredible opportunity to work with the inestimable Fiona McIntosh to make my book the best it can be.

I'm asking for your help to raise the minimum amount I need to be able to attend:

  • The balance of the retreat registration costs (includes meals and accommodation) $5499
  • Travel expenses (airfares, bus and taxi costs) estimated at approx $450
What I'm offering:
  • My undying gratitude;
  • Constant warts-and-all [blood-sweat-and-tears included] updates on my writing progress that won't be available to the general public;
  • Plus a number of really cool perks to say thank you for your help.
  • AND I frequently post random naked cat pictures... who could want more?

We Just Might Change the World

Readers know that a work of fiction can profoundly affect them, make them think, make them feel--even change the world a little for the better. I've been told this is one of those stories, and together, we can get it ready to send out to the world. 

What Do I Write?

Edgy, Contemporary Young Adult (YA) novels.

This novel, "A Little Bird Told Me", has been described as Daisy Whitney's The Mockingbirds set in Melina Marchetta's Australia.

Sixteen year old Gympie school-girl and popular-girl-in-training Emma Clancy finds out it’s possible to ruin your life in 140 characters when she accidentally tweets the news of her best friend’s rape at a party neither of them were supposed to attend.

Dealing with the fallout of Annaliese’s rape is bad enough, but when everyone is pretending it didn’t happen—and worse, accusing Emma of making it up for attention—Emma finds her world starting to crumble. When Annaliese’s parents won’t let Emma see her friend, and seem to be working with Annaliese’s attacker to discredit Emma, she knows something is seriously wrong. Emma’s life dissolves into a tidal wave of bullies, police, lawyers and psychiatrists, and when she discovers the shocking truth about Annaliese, everything she thought she knew and could count on is swept away from her. Getting her life back means saving both Annaliese and herself.

The Challenges

What if we don't fund the whole amount? I'm going regardless--I'd just prefer not to have to sell my children or my soul to get there. Please help me!

What if the book doesn't get published? If it doesn't get picked up by a major publisher within six months of the retreat, I will publish it independently, and all the perks will still apply.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help! Please use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word about my campaign to all your friends.

Let's put a really powerful story out into the world together.
