story:
Excerpts From Beautifully Shaken 

Here are a few excerpts from the book!    Please click here

About Beautifully Shaken 

The Beginning of an Inner Journey. There are moments when our inner voice encourages us to go deep within to gain a better understanding of our life experiences. If we follow this encouragement, many of us soon learn that we’ve been conditioned to believe that we are somehow less than the true wonder of our authentic self. Through examining the choices we’ve made in the past, we can see that this deeply ingrained belief triggers our self-doubts and alters our life’s path in significant ways.

Change. This stark and sudden awareness will likely astound us. We now know that we’re much more deserving and worthy than we’ve believed ourselves to be.  We also now know that we and we alone are responsible for what we do with our gift of life. This awakening is our second chance. It’s what we’ve been longing for: the arrival of the inner clarity, support, and motivation to help make the difficult choices necessary for true and lasting change.  

Change is rarely easy. It involves facing the inner challenges of accepting truth, acknowledging our hurt and pain, asking ourselves big questions, altering old beliefs, forgiving ourselves and others, letting go, and so much more.

My Story of Change. I’ve just described the pivotal point in my life when I decided to find my way back to my true self. Five years ago, I came to understand that my life had been significantly influenced by unresolved issues resulting from the difficult relationship I had with my mother. Deeply disappointed in myself for having allowed my past to influence my choices and self-image, I decided to believe in myself and my capacity to grow, to not fear the journey, and to take a leap of faith into the unknown.

Applying Neuroscience. Once I had done the necessary inner work, it was from this newly transformed self that I would begin to evolve into my greater potential. I soon came across the world of neuroscience and its relationship to what makes us who we are.

Neuroscience is currently in the midst of an exciting and unprecedented era of research breakthroughs.

Through neuroscience, I now understand that the desire to change our lives is achievable and supported by the way our brains function. Change occurs from within – our thoughts, beliefs, and our inner narratives create our reality. Through paying attention and feeling the wonder of thinking deliberately, we can begin to create new neuropatterns and ultimately change our beliefs, our state of being, and our very reality. We can change even lifelong thoughts and beliefs.

Just imagine: What would your life be like if you could begin to remove your self doubts? 

I’ve learned how to use the basics of neuroscience as a tool for mastering my thoughts and for more clearly understanding my past, present, and the greater potential of my future. This has been an awesome journey, and I would now like to share it with you in Beautifully Shaken. 

The Need 

When I began writing Beautifully Shaken, I didn’t realize just how expensive this endeavor would be! I had no idea how much writing and research time would be required. I was also surprised to learn about the many facets of industry expertise needed not only to create a quality product, but also to help with marketing and promotions.   

In order to make the dream of Beautifully Shaken a reality, $13,600 is needed.  This will pay for the following expenses:

1 - Pre-publishing: includes content and line editing, revisions, proofreading, and the book's back cover copy.

2 - Publishing: includes cover design, digital formatting, print interior layout, and book registrations. 

3 - Marketing: includes a book website, social media and technical support, and print media marketing.

4 - Other expenses include campaign support, Indiegogo and PayPal fees, and shipping costs. 

Your generous financial support will be used to publish e-book and print editions of Beautifully Shaken.

What You Will Receive

Perks include a personal Thank You email from the author, e-book and print copies of the book, shipment of books to individuals as gifts in your name, 90-minute phone calls with the author, a personal tribute, a list of five to eight of your inner strengths and guidance on how you can begin to master them, an Authentic Life Path plan, and your name included in the Acknowledgements section of the book.

Risks & Challenges

After months of writing, I've written my first draft. I now have a product! While I’m ecstatic about the manuscript and the early positive feedback that I've received, it’s now time to work with my editors and a self-publishing house to create a polished, quality book. Your donation will contribute towards meeting my funding goal, which in turn will help get this book into readers' hands.

Other Ways You Can Help

1 - By recognizing that every contribution is important! Together, we can reach the goal of $13,600 in 30 days!

2 - By spreading the word about the book. Getting the word out and sharing your enthusiasm for Beautifully Shaken  helps to significantly multiply the value of your support!

·  Get the word out by phone, email, and talking it up in person to friends, coworkers, and family members.

·  Post a message about this campaign on your Facebook page.

·  Post a link from your Facebook page to the first campaign video above.

· Please share this campaign on any other social media sites on which you are active, as well, including Twitter, Instagram, and Pinterest.

3 - To the Connectors: Are you the connector in your network? Be the first in your circle to talk about the applicability of neuroscience in living as one’s highest self! Get the word out!

4 - Please feel free to contact me with questions or comments. 

Thank you!

story:
Me presento

Soy Juan Dual, un valenciano de 30 años y con una historia que contar. En los últimos diez años me han extirpado varios órganos para evitar cánceres genéticos. A pesar de ello, lejos de deprimirme o tratar de vivir la vida más apacible posible, he sentido que la Vida me ha dado una enorme oportunidad para tratar de empujar a la gente a un movimiento de felicidad. Sin estómago, colon, recto ni vesícula biliar me siento lleno de energía para contagiar a todo aquella persona que se sienta tocada por mi historia. 

El fin de recorrer estos 7.000 km en bicicleta  es el de demostrar que no existe límite que no seas tú. Actuar como un golpe de realidad. Crear suficiente impacto. Porque quiero mostrar al mundo que existen personas que piensan de manera diferente, (incluso desafiando consejos médicos). Con espíritu luchador y dispuestas a cambiar el mundo. Los que asumen riesgos. Desafían al fracaso y apuestan todo por hacer las cosas de manera diferente. 


¿Por qué esta hazaña?

Cuando se nos diagnostica una enfermedad como pueda ser un cáncer, lo primero que te viene a la cabeza es una lista de cosas pendientes por hacer. Te crees que tu vida se ha terminado y es que la palabra cáncer está demonizada. Nada más lejos de la realidad.

Evidentemente es una situación peliaguda, pero no es el final. Puede que llegues a tener 80 años y en vez de disfrutar, hayas vivido un cáncer. Habrás vivido tu enfermedad, no con una enfermedad. Y eso es serio amigos, porque no tenemos una segunda oportunidad.

Por supuesto, podría haber establecido una meta más accesible, pero considero que un mensaje tan importante como es el de vivir la vida plenamente, requiere de una hazaña inaccesible. Tanto es así que he atraído a Chema Solís, el filmmaker que pedaleará conmigo y producirá el documental de toda esta maravillosa locura.

Personalmente, me encuentro con fortaleza mental y física como para llevarlo a cabo. Habría sido sencillo quedarme en casa pero considero que sería irresponsable. 


¿Por qué donar?

Todos tenemos un familiar que ha sido tocado por el cáncer.  ¿Cuánta gente conoces que sufriéndolo piensa que no hay mucho más allá? ¿No crees que merecen la oportunidad de vivir su propia aventura? Esto es lo que estoy haciendo. Sé partícipe de este proyecto y hagámoslo más real.

Mensualmente publicaré los avances de las donaciones en runnife.com y en qué será invertido. Al final del trayecto donaré lo restante. 


Esto es lo que busco de ti.

 Mi meta es recaudar 6.000€ para disponer de material suficiente y poder mantenerme durante el camino hasta Ushuaia. Como la tienda de campaña en la que dormiré, el casco que hará que mi cabeza llegue entera al destino o algo tan básico como la comida.

Por esto, en la lista de recompensas quiero mostrar mi lado más cercano y darle valor personal a tu donación. 
Gracias por hacer que suceda.

extirpado varios órganos para evitar cánceres genéticos. A pesar de ello, lejos de deprimirme o tratar de vivir la

story:
United State Government Out of Touch on Industrial Hemp

Most of the world—including now a majority of these united states—understands industrial hemp to be a valuable plant that can be grown sustainably for oil, seed and fiber and is useful in the manufacture of food, body care, textiles, paper and construction and other products. (See Hemp Industries Association and North American Industrial Hemp Council websites for more information.)

From the seeds and the stalks of industrial hemp can be made many useful products. Source: Congressional Research Service, adapted from d. G. Kraenzel et al. “Industrial Hemp as an Alternative Crop in North Dakota. North Dakota State University. 1998.

Unfortunately, the U.S. Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA) irrationally conflates industrial hemp with marijuana. The scientific literatures of biology, chemistry and medicine all agree: industrial hemp is not marijuana. The evidence is compelling and it’s time to compel DEA to heed such evidence.

Interior panel of a car door made with a biocomposite of hemp fibers and polyethylene. Source: Christian Gahle, nova-Institut GmbH from Wikipedia under a Creative Commons Attribution-Share Alike 3.0 license.

Industrial Hemp is Not Marijuana

Industrial hemp and marijuana are different varieties of Cannabis sativa L. The former has a long history as a raw material for a variety of useful products (rope, canvass, etc.), while the latter is favored for its intoxicating properties. Industrial hemp is not intoxicating, so it cannot be “abused” as a drug—because industrial hemp is not a drug.

It all comes down to the cannabinoid ratio of the intoxicating THC (∆-9 tetrahydrocannabinol) and the non-intoxicating CBD (cannabidiol) in a C. sativa plant. If the THC:CBD ratio is <1, it is industrial hemp; if >1, it is marijuana.

The Drug Enforcement Administration is the only entity that conflates industrial hemp and marijuana. Source: Andy Kerr, The Larch Company, Ashland, OR and Washington, DC. 2015 (Source for each entity will be cited in the formal administrative rulemaking petition).
There are many lines of evidence that industrial hemp is not marijuana. Here’s one of them. 

Industrial Industrial hemp and marijuana are distinguished by widely different THC:CBD ratios. Source: Hillig, Karl W. and Paul G. Mahlberg. 2004 A Chemotaxonomic Analysis of Cannabinoid Variation in Cannabis (Cannabaceae). American Journal of Botany 91(6): 966-975.

The THC and CBD levels in 157 accessions of cannabis are plotted above. It’s clear that selective breeding for marijuana has produced strains high in THC (x symbols on chart) and low in CBD (the antidote to THC). Selective breeding for industrial hemp has produced just the opposite (black box symbols on chart). In between are intermediates (the remaining symbol on chart) that approach THC:CBD ratios of 1.

When ingested, CBD acts as an antidote to THC, so it’s obvious why marijuana growers select for not only high THC, but low CBD. It’s also obvious that industrial hemp isn’t marijuana.

A Very Brief Legal History

In 1937, Congress enacted the Marihuana Tax Act. It placed a prohibitively high tax on marihuana that was a crime not to pay. At the time, Congress didn’t know as much about industrial hemp not being marijuana, but it knew that what we now call industrial hemp was useful and the tax was reduced to a very low amount for licensed “marihuana” (pronounced “industrial hemp”) growers. Over the decades, it became increasingly difficult for farmers to get licenses, save for World War II when the Japanese cut off our supplies of Manila hemp (not a true hemp). Until 2014, the last legal industrial hemp crop was grown in Wisconsin in 1957.

As there was a war on, the federal government actively promoted industrial hemp cultivation during World War II. Source: Internal Revenue Service, US Department of the Treasury available from Wikipedia.

In 1970, Congress enacted the Controlled Substances Act and any distinction federal law made in regard to what was increasingly called industrial hemp was lost to the statute books.

While Much Policy and Political Progress Has Occurred, It’s Still Generally Illegal to Cultivate Industrial Hemp in the United States

While there has been much political progress to relegalize industrial hemp, it is not enough to sustain the ecologically, economically and socially viable domestic cultivation of industrial hemp. In the United States, while it is generally legal to possess industrial hemp and products made from it, it is generally not legal to grow industrial hemp.

The good news is that 27 of these united states have reformed their drug laws so as to no longer treat industrial hemp as marijuana (some other states may soon follow). Some states have even enacted laws to promote industrial hemp cultivation. In the 2014 farm bill, Congress allowed for the limited cultivation of industrial hemp for research purposes. However, U.S. industrial hemp cultivation is limited solely:

•  (a) to states that have legalized industrial hemp;

•  (b) by state or academic institutions; and

•  (c) for research purposes.

That means that industrial hemp cultivation is still illegal in 23 states and cannot be freely grown in any state.

In the U.S. House of Representatives, 66 Members (including 23 Republicans) have signed on to the Industrial Hemp Farming Act (H.R. 525), sponsored by Rep. Thomas Massie (R-KY) that would fully legalize industrial hemp cultivation. In the U.S. Senate, 11 senators have cosponsored companion legislation (S.134) sponsored by Sen. Ron Wyden (D-OR), including Majority Leader Mitch McConnell (R-KY) and presidential candidates Rand Paul (R-KY) and Bernie Sanders (I-VT). Alas, neither bill has been given a hearing. You can find the latest information on political actions to relegalize industrial hemp on the Vote Hemp website.  

The combine and the tractor may be American-made, but the trailer and the industrial hemp are French. Source: Aleks on Wikipedia under a Creative Commons Attribution-Share Alike License.

Petitioning the Government for Redress of Grievances

The First Amendment of the United States Constitution guarantees the right of citizens to “petition the government for a redress of grievances.” One way this right has been operationalized is through the Administrative Procedure Act of 1946 (APA), which provides for citizens to file formal administrative rulemaking petitions, in this case to change the rules that say industrial hemp is marijuana.

Under the law, a government rule must be based on “substantial evidence.” Industrial hemp is, as a matter of fact, not marijuana. Most other industrial democracies distinguish the two varieties of C. sativa as now do the majority of U.S. states. It’s not rational for DEA to continue to conflate industrial hemp and marijuana. If accepted, the formal petition will end the near eight decades of inappropriate illegality for a very useful plant.

The Relegalizing Industrial Hemp Formal Administrative Rulemaking Petition

First, we file the petition. It will be fully documented and fully cited and be at least 100 pages.

Then, it is likely that DEA will sit on the petition and not do what is required by its own regulations and by the APA. After a reasonable amount of time (around a year), if DEA hasn’t told the petitioners that it is actually considering the petition, petitioners will file a procedural lawsuit in federal court to compel DEA to act. The judge would likely put DEA on a timeline such that if DEA failed to adhere, the agency or its officials could be held in contempt of court.

Eventually, DEA will decide on the petition. But before that, under its own regulations to carry out the Controlled Substances Act (CSA), DEA must refer our petition to the Secretary of the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) for an expert scientific opinion on whether industrial hemp is marijuana.

If HHS agrees that industrial hemp is not marijuana, then DEA must accept that finding and change its rules meaning industrial hemp would be removed from the Controlled Substances Schedule! While the scientific and medical evidence is overwhelming that industrial hemp is not marijuana, it is likely that HHS and DEA will not change their contention.

Petitioners will seek an evidentiary hearing and an opportunity to cross-examine the HHS official who prepares the recommendation report to DEA. We will build the administrative record to prepare for substantive litigation to ask a federal judge to find DEA’s decision on the petition, if contrary to the requested result, arbitrary and capricious and without substantial evidence.

If DEA Says Yes

If DEA accepts our formal administrative rulemaking petition, then the Relgalizing Industrial Hemp Project was a stunning success. It’s farming time!

If DEA Says No

If DEA rejects our formal administrative rulemaking petition, then the Relegalizing Industrial Hemp Project was a qualified success. It’s litigation time!

A Relegalizing Industrial Hemp Project—Phase II will be launched to fund the substantive litigation over the denial of the official petition submitted under this Relegalizing Industrial Hemp Project—Phase I.

How About Those Perks?!

We’re not making a great new device or creating a work of art. We’re seeking to change public policy for the benefit of this and future generations. This all makes offering rewards more challenging. We cannot provide you a new and useful device or a book or a DVD or a streaming opportunity and other tangible items. We cannot offer you the opportunity to see a play or a film or any other sensory experience. Fundamentally, your reward will be knowing that you helped fund the relegalization of industrial hemp in the United States after nearly eight decades of irrational illegality.

What we are offering as rewards is an opportunity to let the Drug Enforcement Administration know directly that you believe they are wrong about industrial hemp and are putting some money where your mouth is. In an appendix to the formal administrative rulemaking petition we’ll be submitting to DEA, we’ll include a list of the Relegalizing Industrial Hemp Project supporters (if you don’t want on that list, but still want to contribute, just let us know after you donate).

The larger the donation, the more prominent the listing. Here’s what we mean:

Progressively larger contributions result in progressively more prominent visibility of your name. If you make a $10,000 contribution (yay!!), alas we can’t add any visual prominence to your name in the petition, as it will be on the cover page along with other official petitioners!

While the legend that the 18th Century Massachusetts merchant, smuggler, statesman, and prominent patriot of the American Revolution John Hancock signed his name so large on the Declaration of Independence was that so King George III could see it without his spectacles is apocryphal, here’s your chance to not require the DEA Administrator to reach for their glasses.

Conclusion

To fully relegalize industrial hemp in the United States, either the:

• Congress must amend the Controlled Substances Act (CSA) to redefine “marihuana” to not include industrial hemp; or 

• the Drug Enforcement Administration must do the same thing by amending its regulations, using authority to do so granted by Congress in the CSA.

While we believe the votes would be there in both houses of Congress to enact the Industrial Hemp Farming Act into law—if the bills were allowed to receive a floor vote—the general dysfunction of Congress these days mean that such events are highly unlikely. When Congress enacted the CSA, it provided for the DEA to add to, delete from, or move within the official drug schedules, based on new information. In regard to industrial hemp, DEA has failed to do its job. Congress doesn’t have to act on legislation, but DEA has to act upon a formal administrative rulemaking petition. There is no doubt as to whether industrial hemp will be fully relegalized in the United States; the only question is when. The formal administrative rulemaking petition is to ensure timely relegalization. Industrial hemp advocates must continue to exert political pressure on Congress. The formal administrative rulemaking petition will exert political pressure on the Administration and if it doesn’t work, legal pressure will also be applied. 

What If We Exceed the Indiegogo Project Goal?

The $40,000 goal was chosen to meet the minimum bare-bones project budget. $40,000 is enough to get the project done (and we will!), but it doesn’t actually cover all the legitimate costs that should be covered.

A proper and fair budget for the project is $207,000 and we are also trying to raise funds from sources outside of Indiegogo. As $167,000 is quite a difference, just what would we do with the “extra” money?

First and foremost, the chief petitioners would be compensated equitably. Under the $40,000 budget, we’ll be working for far less than minimum wage. If we raise more than $40,000—either in Indiegogo and/or outside of Indiegogo—we’ll pay ourselves closer to what we make per hour working for other clients. We wouldn’t have to sleep on people’s floors, we could avoid red-eye plane flights and we wouldn’t have to reach into our own pockets to cover legitimate project expenses. We could compensate the outside experts the project needs at a level they deserve and are worth.

If we were merely soulless economic actors, we’d simply do an Indiegogo campaign for $207,000 and if not enough of you stepped up, we’d step out and go back to making our livings doing other work. However, we are in a very poor bargaining position, because our passion is relegalizing industrial hemp for the benefit of this and future generations. This twin curses of caring and commitment means that to do this project for $40,000 (and we will!), we’re sacrificing money that we could be making elsewhere, at the cost of having less money today and for retirement.

If we exceed our total fundraising goals, any funds will be reserved for the Relegalizing Industrial Hemp Project—Phase II—litigation in federal court to overturn a negative decision by the Drug Enforcement Administration (see “Risks and Challenges” below). 

This Indiegogo campaign will fund the creation and filing and pursuit of a formal administrative rulemaking petition, including a final decision by DEA.

If again true to form, DEA will continue to stonewall by incorrectly conflating industrial hemp and marijuana and the agency will deny the administrative rulemaking petition. This will be the end this Relegalizing Industrial Hemp Project: Phase I and we would launch another Indiegogo Campaign entitled Regalizing Industrial Hemp Protect: Phase II to raise funds for the litigation (perhaps we’ll subtitle it “Suing the Bastards”).

Conclusion

The evidence is overwhelming and there is no substantial evidence for DEA to continue to conflate industrial hemp and marijuana in the federal drug schedules. Therefore, DEA would be acting in an arbitrary and capricious manner and that is illegal under federal law. The continued legal entwining of industrial hemp and marijuana is not based on substantial evidence and pretending that there is, DEA is acting in an arbitrary and capricious manner.

A federal court judge is unlikely to tell DEA what to do, but only that what it did is illegal. The case will be remanded by the court to DEA for further consideration. While we would have won the litigation, industrial hemp will still not be relegalized.

DEA may try to concoct new “substantial evidence” in support of a new negative decision. If they do, we’ll take them to court again (a Releglizing Industrial Hemp Project—Phase III, if need be). DEA will run out of excuses before we run out of Indiegogo projects.

The wheels of justice may grind slowly, but they grind exceedingly fine. We’ll all have a fine time grinding away.

In any case, we are in it for the long term. It usually takes about a generation (defined by demographers as ~30 years) to change the world. The good news is that clock on industrial hemp relegalization isn’t starting now, but started over two decades ago. Historically, we’re right on track for historic change. The policy, political, social, economic and environmental stars are aligning. This alignment is a convergence of outside forces unrelated (but beneficial to this effort) and the great past and continuing work of thousands of Americans who advocate for industrial hemp. This formal rulemaking petition can be what bumps that most important star into alignment and brings down DEA’s house of cards, once and for all.

amending its regulations, using authority to do so granted by Congress in the
CSA.
While we believe the votes would be there in both houses of
Congress to enact the Industrial Hemp Farming Act into law—if the bills were
allowed to receive a floor vote—the general dysfunction of Congress these days
mean that such events are highly unlikely. When Congress enacted the CSA, it
provided for the DEA to add to, delete from, or move within the official drug
schedules, based on new information. In regard to industrial hemp, DEA has
failed to do its job. Congress doesn’t have to act on legislation, but DEA has
to act upon a formal administrative rulemaking petition. There is no doubt as
to whether industrial hemp will be fully relegalized in the United States; the
only question is when. The formal administrative rulemaking petition is to
ensure timely relegalization. Industrial hemp advocates must continue to exert
political pressure on Congress. The formal administrative rulemaking petition
will exert political pressure on the Administration and if it doesn’t work, legal
pressure will also be applied. 
What If We Exceed the Indiegogo Project Goal?
The $40,000 goal was chosen to meet the minimum
bare-bones project budget. $40,000 is enough to get the project done (and we
will!), but it doesn’t actually cover all the legitimate costs that should be
covered.
A proper and fair budget for the project is $207,000 and we
are also trying to raise funds from sources outside of Indiegogo. As
$167,000 is quite a difference, just what would we do with the “extra” money?
First and foremost, the chief petitioners would be
compensated equitably. Under the $40,000 budget, we’ll be working for far less than
minimum wage. If we raise more than $40,000—either in Indiegogo and/or
outside of Indiegogo—we’ll pay ourselves closer to what we make per hour
working for other clients. We wouldn’t have to sleep on people’s floors, we
could avoid red-eye plane flights and we wouldn’t have to reach into our own
pockets to cover legitimate project expenses. We could compensate the outside
experts the project needs at a level they deserve and are worth.
If we were merely soulless economic actors, we’d simply do an Indiegogo campaign for $207,000 and if not enough of you stepped up, we’d step out
and go back to making our livings doing other work. However, we are in a very
poor bargaining position, because our passion is relegalizing industrial hemp
for the benefit of this and future generations. This twin curses of caring and commitment means
that to do this project for $40,000 (and we will!), we’re sacrificing money
that we could be making elsewhere, at the cost of having less money today and
for retirement.
If we exceed our total fundraising goals, any funds will be
reserved for the Relegalizing Industrial Hemp Project—Phase II—litigation in
federal court to overturn a negative decision by the Drug Enforcement
Administration (see “Risks and Challenges” below). 
This Indiegogo campaign will fund the creation and filing
and pursuit of a formal administrative rulemaking petition, including a final
decision by DEA.
If again true to form, DEA will continue to stonewall by
incorrectly conflating industrial hemp and marijuana and the agency will deny
the administrative rulemaking petition. This will be the end this Relegalizing
Industrial Hemp Project: Phase I and we would launch another Indiegogo Campaign
entitled Regalizing Industrial Hemp Protect: Phase II to raise funds for the
litigation (perhaps we’ll subtitle it “Suing the Bastards”).
Conclusion
The evidence is overwhelming and there is no substantial
evidence for DEA to continue to conflate industrial hemp and marijuana in the
federal drug schedules. Therefore, DEA would be acting in an arbitrary and
capricious manner and that is illegal under federal law. The continued legal
entwining of industrial hemp and marijuana is not based on substantial evidence
and pretending that there is, DEA is acting in an arbitrary and capricious manner.

A federal court judge is unlikely to tell DEA what to do,
but only that what it did is illegal. The case will be remanded by the court to
DEA for further consideration. While we would have won the litigation,
industrial hemp will still not be relegalized.
DEA may try to concoct new “substantial evidence” in support
of a new negative decision. If they do, we’ll take them to court again (a
Releglizing Industrial Hemp Project—Phase III, if need be). DEA will run out of
excuses before we run out of Indiegogo projects.
The wheels of justice may grind slowly, but they grind
exceedingly fine. We’ll all have a fine time grinding away.
In any case, we are in it for the long term. It usually
takes about a generation (defined by demographers as ~30 years) to change the
world. The good news is that clock on industrial hemp relegalization isn’t
starting now, but started over two decades ago. Historically, we’re right on
track for historic change. The policy, political, social, economic and
environmental stars are aligning. This alignment is a convergence of outside
forces unrelated (but beneficial to this effort) and the great past and
continuing work of thousands of Americans who advocate for industrial hemp.
This formal rulemaking petition can be what bumps that most important star into
alignment and brings down DEA’s house of cards, once and for all.

** Thank you so much to all our supporters! Just hours after this campaign ended, an article in The Stage provoked a flurry of support for theatre bloggers and pointed out the need for new models to make criticism sustainable. So we thought we'd give people who missed this campaign the opportunity to get behind our scheme at http://bit.ly/1VTKYuk. See you there! ************************************************

Arts criticism is changing.

As print media cut their arts coverage or fold completely due to rising internet use, the world turns more and more to a vibrant community of online arts critics. These critics host their own websites, blogs, vlogs or podcasts where they evaluate performances with a specialist eye. These are often productions that rarely get coverage in mainstream media, but are as deserving as any other of critical attention. 

These critics may differ in style, output and interest, but one thing that unites them is their passion for their work as advocates for quality live performance.

These critics often work for free, and have no umbrella organisation to support them. Until now.


About the Network of Independent Critics

The Network of Independent Critics launches this year at Edinburgh Festival Fringe with three primary aims:

- to provide established, independent performing arts critics with support and networking opportunities

- to provide free housing at Edinburgh Festival Fringe to enable unsalaried critics to focus intensely on their specialism for a week.

- to provide coverage for festival productions normally neglected by the mainstream press.

NIC has been formed by Laura Kressly, a fringe theatre advocate with a Shakespeare specialism, and Katharine Kavanagh, who founded the only UK publication dedicated to circus critique. Three mentorship places are reserved for participants wishing to develop skills as circus critics, in partnership with The Circus Diaries. 


What We Need For Our Edinburgh Fringe Launch

This summer, 24 successful applicants will each have a 6-night stay in one of the NIC flats in central Edinburgh. These flats come at a high cost due to the unique economy that arises in Edinburgh each August.

Our fundraising target covers our accommodation costs and associated fees. It does not cover food, travel or event tickets. If we don't reach our goal, what we have raised will be split between all participants (including the founders) who will have to pay the balance.


What Your Support Means

By supporting the Network of Independent Critics, you will provide the means for under-represented work to receive coverage from specialist critics and fuel the critical and creative economy. 
You will enable unpaid critics to immerse themselves in a global arts festival and see a large number of shows in their specialist genre. (We require our participants to see a minimum of 3 performances a day and generate content they feel is appropriate to these events). 
In a festival with over 3000 shows, this is a unique opportunity for critics to discover emerging talent from around the world and create new connections within the critical community. Financial limitations of staying in peak season Edinburgh will not limit the work they see or the other writers and publications they can network with.
If we exceed our funding target, all additional costs will be split equally amongst participants to help towards their travel costs to and from Edinburgh.


Risks & Challenges

All participants have agreed to pay the balance of any remaining costs if we do not reach our target, but there is always a risk that unforeseen circumstances could crop up and make this problematic. In the event that sudden expenses, work or family issues arise and a participant is no longer be able to take their place, we will rent their room(s) at cost to someone still in need of accommodation during the festival, so there will be no adverse impact on other participants or the programme.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute financially, we would love it if you would spread the word about this campaign and/or the Network of Independent Critics.

story:
Short Summary

Do you feel slightly guilty when eating a meat product when you actually think about where it has come from?

There is a healthier, alternative and better way to eat – veganism.

I am here to teach people how to make the transition so that you can feel better about what you eat. Not only that you will be healthier and live longer.


What We Need and What You Get

We need to raise £22,000 to pay for a coffee-table quality book and fund a YouTube series.


The Impact

What price? The planet.

We will change the world by enabling people to change their diets to a plant based one.

Did you know that the biggest government lobbyists are the meat industry? We have been brainwashed into thinking that a plant based diet is impossible. It is not, in fact some of the most successful body builders are vegan!

Donald Watson, founder of The Vegan Society in the very first Vegan News (November 1944) said some wise words:

“We can see quite plainly that our present civilisation is built on the exploitation of animals, just as past civilisations were built on the exploitation of slaves, and we believe the spiritual destiny of men is such that in time he will view with abhorrence the idea that men once fed on the products of animals’ bodies."


Risks and Challenges

I have the determination, dedication and insight but need your help to make an impact.  I realise I can't do this on my own.  This is why I need your help. 

Having sat on the board of trustees at The Vegan Society and having ran my own businesses - I have grown and taken knocks yet overcoming these obstacles I have been able to venture forth to achieve my goals.  Where I lack skills I turn to others who can aid me on my journey.  I recognise that I need to rely on others and on you.

I need your help to kickstart this venture to set me on the road - to pioneer, set and bring about change in the world - we can do this.


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are unable to contribute, this does not mean you cannot help in other ways.  It would be particularly helpful if you could:

  • Spread the word amongst friends and work colleagues, and make some noise about my campaign
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Vision Statement: The LifeStory Lighthouse recognizes the power of writing and the sharing of life stories for archival and empowering purposes, yet also recognizes the struggle many corporations and individuals face in knowing how to share that writing with a larger audience. We provide support in all stages of writing, from idea-gathering to publishing, in sharing your life stories, biographies, and histories.

Mission Statement: Through mentoring, editing, and writing services, as well as workshops, conferences, and publishing opportunities, The LifeStory Lighthouse empowers corporations and individuals of all ages to publish their writing with a larger audience. We value the stories, biographies, and histories that are important to you and your community, and it is our goal to provide the guidance and support in assisting you in every stage of writing to publish and archive your life story.

Why The LifeStory Lighthouse?

My name is Rus VanWestervelt, and I have been helping people share their stories for over 30 years for two distinct reasons; first, to provide them the courage and the navigation to transform their experiences into publishable letters, memorials, essays, and even book-length works; second, to provide them the opportunity to write about tragedy, violence, depression, and injustice so that their stories might provide a light of hope to others in need.

My projects have been diverse, from giving a voice to Marylanders after the attacks on America in 2001, to providing teens throughout Maryland to share their life stories in a professional publication that ran for 8 years, to offering lines of love and hope to those struggling with depression, anxiety, and suicidal thoughts. With the greatest care, I have shared the power of writing therapy with victims of domestic violence, rape, racism, and gender discrimination. Every single time, my goal has been to empower, provide courage and support, and -- for some -- navigate them and their work to publication and share with a larger audience. I have accomplished this through workshops, conferences, and one-to-one sessions.

The time has come to strengthen this light and reach more individuals, through more opportunities, so that their life stories can be heard and even provide hope to others across the country.

This has always been my calling to serve others in helping them find their voice and share it with a larger audience. Besides providing love and support for my family, it is the single most important role in my life to fulfill. I’m asking you to help me help others find – and share – their voices.

With your help, we can celebrate the lives of the elderly and the terminally ill, capture the blessings in our present experiences, and bring to life the struggles some face with mental illness, victimization, abuse, and discrimination.

There has never been a greater need for our voices to be heard. Help me build this LifeStory Lighthouse that will serve as the bright navigation beacon of courage, hope, and guidance toward publication.

Getting Behind The Light To Help Others

The LifeStory Lighthouse is not a single project, or a call to action; it’s a full-service organization that offers workshops, conferences, one-to-one mentoring, writing strategies, editing services, and publishing opportunities. I’m opening this business with the call for an initial $5,000 to cover marketing and technology costs, initial conference and workshop set-up fees, and publication costs to share the words of others.

Every contribution made has an immediate 100% return on your investment. In fact, for those who donate between $5 and $250, your return on your investment is 200%; all contributions have benefits and perks that can be used for yourself or for others. It’s your choice.

Here’s how it works. For contributions between $5 and $250, I will double the value of your contribution toward consulting, workshop or conference registration fees, or publication products. For example, if you contribute $100, I issue you a $200 credit toward any of the services provided. It’s that simple.

And, there are other special and unique perks for those who contribute $250 or higher! I value your support, and I am grateful for your contributions in helping others share their life stories. Even if we don’t reach our full goal, you still get your double credit for your contribution between $5 and $250, and your full perks for higher contributions. This is not an all-or-nothing organization. The LifeStory Lighthouse is here to stay.

Our Stories Must Be Shared

In every single project that I have initiated, I hear the same from my contributors and our readers: Thank you for finally giving us the chance to share our story.

I have had the experience of working with reluctant writers and storytellers all my life, and I know how to empower them to find the courage within to share their stories – first with themselves and then eventually with a larger audience.

I have had the experience of working with victims and individuals struggling with mental illness or facing discrimination who have not been able to articulate their challenges, or who have been suppressed by others to share their authentic stories. 

I have had the experience of working with the elderly and the terminally ill to help them share their stories, their message to the world.

As well, I have had the experience of composing many memorials, eulogies, and tributes to and for loved ones who have passed on.

We need to reach more people, empower more individuals, provide more opportunities to share the stories that have defined who we are. In this age of instant and miraculous communication, it is terribly ironic that our true and authentic voices still cannot be heard.

Help me change that. Help me build a lighthouse for our parents, our brothers, our friends, and even ourselves to let the world know that we were here, and we have made a difference.

Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to your financial support, I need help in spreading the word to the world about The LifeStory Lighthouse. We all know individuals who have said to us (or we have said it ourselves): I have a story to tell; I just don’t know how to tell it.

Help me reach others to tell their stories. Indigogo has incredible tools that can push this campaign through social media. Share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and your own websites.

I am available to guest blog, be interviewed, and meet with those who believe in this drive to help others. Get in touch with me at rus.vanwestervelt@gmail.com and let’s get started.

story:
Dear Friends,

It's been a wonderful journey so far, and I'm excited to embark on the last stage of my book tour! This campaign is crucial in covering the costs of my spring book tour where I will be traveling throughout the country to  share my work with gracious readers, students, and all-around terrific people.  

I’ll be coming to city near you to present and sign copies of my debut literary novel, JUVENTUD,  now available from Curbside Splendor (Oct 2015). The above video features my exciting new book trailer: a delightful peek at my earliest beginnings, writing stories at age ten in my parents' diner office, along with highlights from the fall tour, including the official launch party hosted by Bookmark It in Orlando. I hope you find it inspiring!

Here’s a brief summary of the novel, the “story behind the story,” and why I need your support:

Story Summary

Juventud explores the idealism of youth, the complexities of a ravaged country, and the stories we tell ourselves in order to survive. Growing up as the only daughter of a wealthy landowner in Santiago de Cali, Colombia, teenaged Mercedes Martinez knows a world of maids, armed guards, and private drivers. When she falls in love with Manuel, a fiery young activist with a passion for his faith and his country, she begins to understand the suffering of the desplazados who share her land. 

A startling discovery about her father forces Mercedes to doubt everything she thought she knew about her life, and she and Manuel make plans to run away together. But before they can, tragedy strikes in a single violent night. Mercedes flees Colombia for the United States and a life she never could have imagined. Fifteen years later, she returns to Colombia seeking the truth, but discovers that only more questions await.

My Journey  

This riveting story, part sociopolitical thriller and part love story, lyrically told, marks the culmination of the copious research and drafting which I began in 2009, and relied on the support of several writers’ colonies to complete, including Yaddo, Ragdale, the Virginia Center for the Creative Arts, and others. 

After so many years of working on the project, I am ecstatic that Juventud has found a home with the Chicago-based independent press, Curbside Splendor Publishing, and I am committed to bringing the novel to the widest audience possible upon its release last fall.  This spring I am scheduled to present at the Tucson Festival of Books, the Virginia Festival of the Book, then will head to launch events in LA at the annual AWP conference, with more events pending for late spring/summer.  

                   


Why I Need Your Support

I need your help and support to cover travel expenses, lodging, and meals from when the spring launch kicks off in March through June. I will be on leave from my part-time job at Bookmark It in Orlando, FL to promote the book. While the publisher is arranging the tour, they are not funding it. My only source of income during the spring will be the online writing workshop I’m teaching for UCF, which will allow me to maintain flexibility but will amount to a small paycheck that will just cover monthly essentials. 

                        

I have a variety of donation levels and incentives to offer – but of course you may donate any amount you wish! I sincerely thank you for being a part of bringing this stunning and important novel—the first of many, I hope—into the world. Further information can be found on the press release and in my biography, provided here, as well as on my website, www.vanessablakeslee.com. 

                                          


The Impact

Your support will make all the difference. Juventud  is a story I truly believe in, and audiences have been overwhelmingly captivated and moved by it so far. I can't wait to continue on the journey ahead, and bring the book to even more readers. I've been fortunate enough to have this novel, my first major literary work, published to a much critical acclaim from Publisher's Weekly, Rain Taxi Review of Books, Washington Independent Review of Books, the Jewish Book Council, the Rumpus, among many others. Just this week came the exciting news that it is on the long-list for the SIBA Pat Conroy Southern Book Prize and the Montaigne Medal for "the year's most thought-provoking books." Dear Friends,
It's been a wonderful journey so far, and I'm excited to embark on the last stage of my book tour! This campaign is crucial in covering the costs of my spring book tour where I will be traveling throughout the country to  share my work with gracious readers, students, and all-around terrific people.  
I’ll be coming to city near you to present and sign copies of my debut literary novel, JUVENTUD,  now available from Curbside Splendor (Oct 2015). The above video features my exciting new book trailer: a delightful peek at my earliest beginnings, writing stories at age ten in my parents' diner office, along with highlights from the fall tour, including the official launch party hosted by Bookmark It in Orlando. I hope you find it inspiring!
Here’s a brief summary of the novel, the “story behind the story,” and why I need your support:




Story Summary
Juventud explores the idealism of youth, the complexities of a ravaged country, and the stories we tell ourselves in order to survive. Growing up as the only daughter of a wealthy landowner in Santiago de Cali, Colombia, teenaged Mercedes Martinez knows a world of maids, armed guards, and private drivers. When she falls in love with Manuel, a fiery young activist with a passion for his faith and his country, she begins to understand the suffering of the desplazados who share her land. 
A startling discovery about her father forces Mercedes to doubt everything she thought she knew about her life, and she and Manuel make plans to run away together. But before they can, tragedy strikes in a single violent night. Mercedes flees Colombia for the United States and a life she never could have imagined. Fifteen years later, she returns to Colombia seeking the truth, but discovers that only more questions await.


My Journey  
This riveting story, part sociopolitical thriller and part love story, lyrically told, marks the culmination of the copious research and drafting which I began in 2009, and relied on the support of several writers’ colonies to complete, including Yaddo, Ragdale, the Virginia Center for the Creative Arts, and others. 
After so many years of working on the project, I am ecstatic that Juventud has found a home with the Chicago-based independent press, Curbside Splendor Publishing, and I am committed to bringing the novel to the widest audience possible upon its release last fall.  This spring I am scheduled to present at the Tucson Festival of Books, the Virginia Festival of the Book, then will head to launch events in LA at the annual AWP conference, with more events pending for late spring/summer.  


                   

Why I Need Your Support
I need your help and support to cover travel expenses, lodging, and meals from when the spring launch kicks off in March through June. I will be on leave from my part-time job at Bookmark It in Orlando, FL to promote the book. While the publisher is arranging the tour, they are not funding it. My only source of income during the spring will be the online writing workshop I’m teaching for UCF, which will allow me to maintain flexibility but will amount to a small paycheck that will just cover monthly essentials. 

                        
I have a variety of donation levels and incentives to offer – but of course you may donate any amount you wish! I sincerely thank you for being a part of bringing this stunning and important novel—the first of many, I hope—into the world. story:
A MAN.  A CHAPLAIN.  A VOCALIST.  A FLUTIST.  AN ENCOURAGER.  A LEADER.  A BIBLE SCHOLAR.  A LOYAL FRIEND…AND NOW A BEST SELLING AUTHOR!

This campaign is in support of John K Fleming and his new book.  

FINALLY DOING JOHN!

All those who know him, know what he is made to do.  We have all been touched by his encouraging spirit and light. FINALLY he is following what God and The Universe has been telling him.  Now the words he shares with us individually, will bless the world in an inspirational book.  Please MATCH OUR 50 or more as a tax deductible gift!

A little about John K. Fleming...

John K. Fleming has lived in Austin, Texas since 1971 and is a product of the Austin Independent School District having gone to Andrews Elementary, Pearce Jr. High School and Reagan High School. He attended The University of Texas at Austin where he was a member of The University of Texas Wind Ensemble and Symphonic Band while studying flute under Prof. Karl F. Kraber in the School of Music.

Since 1992, John has worked extensively as a flute instructor, performer and clinician to students in music programs throughout the greater Austin and surrounding areas.

He has facilitated leadership enrichment workshops relevant to band programs in the Austin, Pflugerville and Victoria Independent School Districts drawing from experiences as the first African American Drum Major of The University of Texas Longhorn Band. John has actively served in the community as a board member for Reading is FUNdamental, the KLRU Community Advisory Board and The University of Texas Longhorn Alumni Band and the Longhorn Band Advisory Council. John is a past Board Chair for the Leadership Enrichment Arts Program helping to mentor and inspire minority and under served youth in Central Texas through the arts.

John partnered with Dr. Maimy Fong in 2006 to establish Fleming & Fong – Music for All Occasions and continues to collaborate with other musicians and artists throughout the greater Austin community. John currently sings with the Celebration Singers as a member of Unity Church of Hills with recent appearances with Chorus Austin Vocal Consort and orchestra, The Austin Children’s Choir, St. Edward’s Masterwork’s Project and St. Theresa’s Catholic Church production of Amahl and the Night Visitors. John is extremely blessed, grateful and thankful for the opportunity to share in the wonderful music and life journeys of Hedda Layne and Troy Warden and Courtney Santana.

Are you excited yet?  Let's push you over the top!  

Here's a brief synopsis of the book from John:

"I intend to write a book about how we process our feelings and/or emotions.  I want to take a look at what they mean, how do we value or devalue them, what we do in allowing ourselves to be with them and to really feel them as a way to leverage them to manifest what we really want or desire in life. Above all how our feelings/emotions are the way to a form of deeper listening and discernment of our most vulnerable and authentic Self.  In coming home to who I really I am, I began with a conversation with my inner child.  This engaging conversation helped me discover my voice as an individual, healing through forgiveness of others and myself and a deeper form of listening that is helping me to leverage my power in speaking my truth."

NOW IS THE TIME! MAKE YOUR TAX DEDUCTIBLE CONTRIBUTION TODAY!

John left UT in February of this year and sees this time as the perfect opportunity to create this book as a way to encourage humanity to deal in authentic truth.

We are raising funds to:

1) Give John the space and opportunity to write unencumbered by his finances for two months.  

2) Collect funds for the marketing, publishing, and production of the book once it is completed in Fall of 2016.

We hope to raise $8,000 in a match program with gifts starting at $50 each.  We of course want to raise more funding to cover any miscellaneous costs.  Give what your heart says is right.  You will receive a tax deduction through the Survive2Thrive Foundation for your financial support of John's book.

John is ready to tackle this book with all he has and knows it is part of what he can do to heal the world and help their emotional health.  This is only the beginning for him...he is stepping into his truer form.

Match our $50 gift and let's raise this funding in 30 days or less!  I'll start! Please share this campaign with those that you know love John as well and give them an opportunity to contribute as well.

There will be a book reception and signing coming later this year and you be the first to know! THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

story:
A LONG READ ABOUT THE SOUND OF SPEED.


The Indianapolis 500 is the world’s largest single-day sporting event, and when the 100th running takes place on May 29, some 300,000 people will be in one place to see one of America’s most cherished and thrilling spectacles. They will also need to HEAR the multi-faceted event, and that turns out to be an extremely difficult, high-stakes job that falls on the shoulders of Nashville audio engineer Steve Durr. 


(Steve Durr on the right with the amazing Dave Dusick.)

In 2015, I got to follow Steve, one of the country's top acoustics and sound designers, as he and his team of specialists made final preparations for the 99th Indianapolis 500. The result is a chapter-length, non-fiction essay (7,000 words / 30 minutes) that profiles Steve, his colleagues and a massive media production. Read the story on the web or mobile HERE. 
Sound from dozens of different places on and near the track has to reach not just a 380-speaker sound system around the 2.5 mile circuit but millions of spectators watching on television. Durr, a Louisiana-reared veteran sound guy of the 1970s era of arena rock, is a technician who has little use for technology if it doesn’t convey emotion.

An Excerpt: 

"(Steve Durr) is in racing black — slacks and a golf shirt emblazoned with the "wing and wheel" Indianapolis Motor Speedway patch and the logo of his back stage technical team, RaceTrack Engineering. A walkie-talkie is at his side, through which come and go instructions, questions, Southern wisecracks and some circuit-melting cussing. Durr’s face is simultaneously friendly and bullshit free. As a boy in Louisiana in the 1950s, he’d lay on his stomach listening to the Indy 500 on the radio every May. Now he’s here, enmeshed in technology and jargon and everybody else’s problems, running on stress, manic euphoria and an implacable deadline less than 30 hours away. Durr’s a specialist in a particular confluence of art and technology: public address systems. It’s safe to say nobody will notice him or his vast speaker network unless something goes awry. He’s invisible and anonymous, but without him and his team, the largest sports event in America and its pageantry has no soundtrack, no reach and no presence."


Self-Publishing

This is a story for readers who love literary non-fiction and who want to meet some remarkable people behind the scenes of an iconic American event. If you enjoy reading about surprising jobs and the hidden moving parts of the world around you, this essay was written with you in mind. And if you already love the history and immensity of the Indianapolis Motor Speedway and the Indy 500, or if you work in music, sound or professional audio, you'll relate even more.

I'm a journalist and media producer in Nashville who specializes in music and sound. Since the late 1990s, I've written for a variety of national publications, written a book about radio station WSM and produced features for NPR, generally with the focus on music makers and the music business. But my other passion/fascination is motor sports, and all my life I'd wanted to attend the Indianapolis 500. Being able to shadow Steve and his team was more than I'd ever dreamed possible. 

Not many magazines in the world would publish a 7,000 word essay about audio technicians at a motor race (at least I didn't find one). So I'm taking it straight to you, hoping that you'll help me cover the costs of covering the story. A tip jar thank you is $3. A five dollar contribution nets you a download PDF or e-book. For $2 more, I'll send you an audio/podcast version of the story as an .mp3 file. (You'll get an email from us soon after ordering, no more than 48 hours, with links to the downloads.) And if you want to join me virtually for this year's historic Indy 500, I'll send you a radio quality audio diary of my experience after the race in May. 

Here I am with more about what this is:



Support Journalism Directly

As I figured out what I wanted to do with my life as a writer, I kept coming back to the impact and art of narrative journalists like Tom Wolfe, Timothy Ferris and John McPhee. Sometimes called literary non-fiction, it's a format that tries to take the reader inside a world they'd otherwise never know and make it interesting even if it seems initially strange. That's what I've attempted to do with "The Sound of Speed," a piece that transcends its subject matter to tell a larger story about the world we live in. I've poured my heart and everything I've ever learned about my craft into this article. I'm as proud of the writing as anything I've ever had published. But since it hasn't found a "traditional" home, I'm following the model I've seen so many of my friends and colleagues pursue with recording projects. This story, combining all my passion and curiosity, is my stab at a little bit of art and understanding in this world. I hope you'll support my endeavor.

story:
Welcome to Makanaka's World™, a children's book series designed to teach your child about the globe, other cultures and languages in a fun and engaging way.

The  book series that follows a 7 year old girl named Makanaka and her best friend Fari, a very charming and bubbly parrot. Makanaka is a world travel guide who is gifted in languages and has penpals all over of the world. Fari also has a special gift allowing him to transform into a jet. Together they travel to different cities and countries giving their audience a chance to learn about the globe, new cultures and languages in a fun and engaging way.

Makanaka (Maa-kah-naa-kah) is a name in the Shona language spoken in Zimbabwe meaning…..beautiful also means amazing, great, awesome!

Fari (Faa-ree), short for Farai, is a name in the Shona language spoken in Zimbabwe meaning….be happy.

Where Will The Money Go?

Makanaka's World™, has big plans for the future and books are just the beginning. We have 8 books that are ready to be illustrated and printed. Funds will also be used for marketing and advertising.  

As a token of appreciation for your monetary support we offer some cool perks, take a look!

The Impact

We need your help in order for Makanaka to complete her mission of educating smarter kids, worldly kids and inspiring the next Columbus or Magellan. 

Creators 

The series was conceived out of Christine’s desire to teach her daughter her native tongue, Shona, spoken in Zimbabwe. She spent countless hours looking for literature that was both engaging and educational for an early reader. It was then that she realized there was a void that needed to be filled, not just for her daughter but for other families across the world.

Illustrator Jasmine Mills has been drawing ever since she knew how to hold a pencil. She teamed up with Christine to create and bring Makanaka's World™ to life.

Risks & Challenges

After countless hours of preparation we are all ready to go. All that remains is to submit the manuscript for actual physical printing. Of course, unavoidable personal mishaps, acts of God, or global disruption could throw us off schedule, and we will keep Kickstarter backers updated if we do encounter any delays.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute any money? No worries, help us spread the word! Simply share Makanaka's World with your family and friends. 

And that's all there is to it.

story:
It's been a rough week.  

One of the things that’s kept me going however, was the outpouring of emotion and solidarity on Facebook this week from my friends and loved ones. I was so impressed and comforted that I had to capture it before the algorithms sucked it back into the void, buried underneath the cat videos and advertisements.  

So, on Wednesday afternoon, still reeling from the election, I conceived of this booklet: a collection of the most heart wrenching, life affirming and future looking posts from my Facebook news feed and beyond. 

After tragedy, life can too quickly turn back to normal. 

Daily routines take over - but, remember, as long as that racist pervert is in the Oval Office, there will be no safe normal for too many people in this country. As long as he spews ignorant climate-denying bullshit, the entire planet is in danger. 

But, as long as we remember this great well of empathy and tap deep within out hearts, love will show us the way to resist. 

 

Today: I mourn and cry freely. 
Tomorrow: I get back up and figure out how to fight for all.
Today and tomorrow and every single f*cking day: I love.

 

Ways to support:

  • Over on the right you’ll find the most obvious way to support the project: buy a booklet.
  •  know that I’m not alone in being profoundly affected by my news feed. And so, please send me the posts that really spoke to you. You can copy and paste in the comment / message section.
  • And finally, Facebook isn’t enough. Call 3 people, right now, and tell them that you’ve been thinking of them. Check in on those you love. We all need that support. 

 

Thank you for your attention and support,

ƒ.

Today: I mourn and cry freely. Tomorrow: I get back up and figure out how to fight for all.Today and tomorrow and every single f*cking day: I love.
 

Ways to support:

Over on the right you’ll find the most obvious way to support the project: buy a booklet.
 know that I’m not alone in being profoundly affected by my news feed. And so, please send me the posts that really spoke to you. You can copy and paste in the comment / message section.
And finally, Facebook isn’t enough. Call 3 people, right now, and tell them that you’ve been thinking of them. Check in on those you love. We all need that support. 

 
Thank you for your attention and support,
ƒ.

story:
Our passion is to positively develop the Caribbean & Latin America region. 

 

The Story

I lived in London, England for a few years. While London has pockets of Caribbean culture I was still missing being updated on things from my home country Trinidad and Tobago. Even with Social Media and the efficiency of the internet, there are several things pertaining to the Caribbean and Latin American daily lifestyle that is not easily available online. Much positive news gets lost in the clutter and the people within the region do not get many opportunities to tell their own stories.  These concerns are similar for migrants to the US, Asia, Europe and Africa. 

I decided to create a solution, which is Country Vibes Magazine. At 1st, it was designed for persons from Trinidad and Tobago; both local and within the global diaspora. When we launched in Miami, at the Chamber of Commerce, people from the other English speaking countries wanted to be part of the magazine. With a small team, we redesign and connected to writers from various countries to ensure a uniquely authentic experience for the readers. At our 2nd launch in New York, Latinos and Haitians were requesting to be included, their culture is also Caribbean and the challenge for their migrants to be connected with back home is the same. So for the 3rd and final time, we have redesigned the publication and are connecting with writers and photographers from Cuba, Costa Rica, Panama and Haiti, as we also seek to expand outside of the region.  


These experiences have greatly educated us about the needs and have inspired us to create a quality lifestyle magazine that really appeals to all customers globally. 

 

 

What's inside Country Vibes Magazine?

The Caribbean and Latin America is so much more than just sun, sea and sand - though we have some of the most beautiful beaches and coral reefs in the world. While we are classified as developing countries, our rich history has caused us to really showcase diversity in harmony. Our rich cultures experienced through our food, music and vibes is reflected within our dynamic people, usually with warm smiles.  Country Vibes Magazine captures this and more within the following topic areas:

  • Business
  • Culture & Food
  • Love & Relationship
  • People
  • Health 
  • Country Vibes Hero
  • Where is the party?
  • Learning languages
  • Ah sure yuh did not know!
  • Opportunities
  • Inspiration
  • Look who made it!
  • Gone but not Forgotten
  • Simple Pleasures 
  • Sports
  • Community Matters
  • Hidden Treasures

 

Demographics 

 

 

 

 

 

Why is Country Vibes Magazine important?

With a history which almost caused the extinction of the Carib people - from whom the region gain its name, followed by African slavery and then indentured labour, we progressed to hospitality and tourism. Now with the global transformation of tourism and growing poverty among various island states, in addition to weakening customer service and instability with many governments, we need to create avenues to inspire ourselves and to evolve as a region.

While Country Vibes is an amazing magazine, it is the start of a new revolution within the Caribbean & Latin America. A movement where we the people are taking charge of our own and learning to harness our dynamic cultures and rhythms to lead our positive development and chart our future success. We will tell our stories from our eyes and we want to share this sacred sight and sounds with you as well as with the rest of the world.

We invite you to come with us on this exciting and adventurous journey. We have only just begun!!!

 

 

 

The Journey & Challenges

This has been a challenging journey, but creating a stable regional system is worth it. We have custom designed structures within a region with 33 different countries and hundreds of islands, with almost 630 million people separated by the sea and jungles. Over 10 different financial currencies. Over 6 formal languages. With poor and extremely costly transportation between the countries. As a multicultural, diverse people, we share a common beauty and rhythm, though in many ways we are strangers to each other with plantation remnants: still not heeding the call for emancipation sung by Bob Marley.

With your support we can achieve several things that require high costs outputs:

  • Have Country Vibes Magazine translated into several languages. This will allow the almost 630 million people within this region to experience this magazine in their own language.
  • Complete a fulfilment & logistics system whereby we can ship printed copies of Country Vibes Magazine throughout the region and any part of the world. The people have requested print more than e-magazines.
  • Provide inspiration to the 630 million throughout the region, so they can use their creativity to solve the issues within the region and to design new paths for success.
  • Introduce you, your friends, family and millions globally to Country Vibes - Be part of the beautiful and harmonising vibrations of the Caribbean & Latin America.

 

 

Our Team

We have writers and photographers from various countries around the Caribbean Sea and we will continue to grow by attracting team members from all countries globally. One of the unique things in our design is to have people who live in difference countries write about their country and visitors write about their experiences. This is some of our team members:

 

 

Meet Rhonda M. Thomas - Editor-in-Chief of Country Vibes Magazine. She is a Project Manager, Business and Human Development Consultant, from the twin island republic of Trinidad and Tobago. 

 

Curtis Morton is  an experienced journalist and the Coordinator for St Kitts & Nevis

 

 

 

 

Anouska Blanca is a writer, Sales Representative  & Coordinator for Suriname

 

 

Michael R Faulkner is the Executive Producer for Film & Photography. He is an award-winning film producer from Baltimore, MD, USA

 

 

Be part of our Community 

Spread the word and show your support:

  • Help us to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.

  • There is a range of Indiegogo share tools that you can use to tell your friends and family about Country Vibes Magazine campaign. Send it through facebook, twitter, or email

  • Do you have an excellent attitude with amazing skills? This is an opportunity to be part of our global team of people who believe in the mission. We are seeking Coordinators from different countries, Sales Representatives, Writers, Photographers, Videographers, Communication and Social Media technicians. If you are interested contact us at editor@countryvibesmagazine.com.  

  • We are seeking advertisers & advertising agencies who want to share their product or service to gain Caribbean & Latin America customers. Benefit from our local positioning within various parts of the world, as readers receive Country Vibes Magazine online or at their addresses. If you want to target Caribbean & Latin America people then this is the place to be seen. Contact us at sales@countryvibesmagazine.com.

 

 

 

Interested in being featured with us? Email us directly at sales@countryvibesmagazine.com.

story:
Following Ithaki is a book written by Chris Christopoulos and Alex Michelidakis. A modern story full of romance, drama, action, mind games and plot twists.

The story

Odysseus is a lonely, young guy that most people think is weird. His parents mistreat him as everybody else does, so the only company he has is his brother Sam. One day he meets a girl called Ithaki and he instantly falls in love with her. He is too shy to express his feelings though. All he does is going everyday to the kiosk she works just to be able to see her. Things move on from there, he saves her life a couple of times without Ithaki knowing who her saviour is and then he loses her for some years. 

When he accidentally finds her again, always together with his brother, she gets kidnapped by a ruthless tycoon and a corrupted politician after she threatens to expose their illegal operations. Odysseus is following the traces of Ithaki trying to save her once again while being hunted by gangsters. With the help of Antigoni, a lawyer and old friend of Ithaki, he finds where she is being kept, but then things take a twist. 


About us

We are Alex Michelidakis and Chris Christopoulos, from Athens, Greece. We work together in a supermarket while at the same time we write at various online magazines and blogs. We came up with the story for the book while at work. We created two fictional characters, Odysseus and Ithaki, one thing led to another and before we know it we had the whole plot ready in a few days! So then we started writing. Chris has already seen some of his stories published in various literature magazines, another one, "Our Own" was accompanying the cd release of George Alkaios under the same name, while he has won a short film script contest with "A Fine Day For The End Of The World" and very recently won the award for best novelette in the Larry Niven Fantasy awards with his story "The Fairytale". For Alex it was the first attempt, but writing the book together worked out really well. 


What we need and what you get


Every little help from you counts and will bring us closer to our goal. Together we can make it happen as you can see at the end of the trailer we shot, showing one characteristic scene of the book.


A small sample

Prologue

He ran until his injured body sent his brain a clear mesage that it was pointless to go on. He only had moved a few blocks away from the appartment he was shot, standing now in a small square fortunately alone. That was good. He didn't want to be seen like this, covered in blood, what would he say? He sat on a bench to regain his power and to put his messy thoughts in some kind of order. He took a deep breath, filling his nostrils with the aroma of the trees and flowers surrounding him, and that made him feel a little better. It was that time again, the magic hour before day gave place to night that always fascinated him. The sky was covered with a purple, dreamy color that filled Odysseus with hope. Hope that anything could happen. And so much had happened lately, especially in the last few hours, that it was hard for him to handle. Everything that so far was defining his reality proved an illusion, forcing him to review his whole life as he knew it.

His head was still aching like hell, both internally (even if the fading was gone) and externally. The first bullet found him on the surface, right besides his right ear, but still was causing him an intolerant, unpleasant dizziness. The second one had hit him on his left side where the bleeding may had eased, but was draining the remaining energy left on his body. He tried to stand on his feet but felt so weak.

There wasn't a place he could go, a shelter to hide until he could recover. His appartment was being watched and in a hospital he should give some good answers about his situation, something that would cause him further troubles. He knew he should keep running but that seemed a huge task to achieve, so he just leaned on the bench. Maybe that was it he thought. Besides, he had fulfilled his mission, getting a reward that all these years he could only dream of. So if this was supposed to be the end, let it be, he wouldn't mind.

..and in greek..

Έτρεξε μέχρι το ταλαιπωρημένο κορμί του να δώσει εντολή στον εγκέφαλό του πως δεν αντέχει άλλο. Δεν είχε απομακρυνθεί παρά μόλις μερικά τετράγωνα, όμως ένοιωθε ότι ήταν μάταιο να συνεχίσει. Είχε φτάσει σε μια μικρή πλατεία, άδεια από κόσμο. Ευτυχώς. Δεν ήθελε να τον δουν σε αυτή την κατάσταση, γεμάτο αίματα, τι θα έλεγε; Έκατσε σε ένα παγκάκι να ανακτήσει λίγο τις δυνάμεις του και να βάλει σε μια σειρά τις μπερδεμένες σκέψεις του.

Πήρε μια βαθιά ανάσα, γεμίζοντας τα ρουθούνια του με τις ευωδίες των δέντρων που τον περιτριγύριζαν, κάτι που τον έκανε να αισθανθεί λίγο καλύτερα. Ήταν εκείνη η μαγική ώρα λίγο πριν η μέρα δώσει τη θέση της στη νύχτα που ανέκαθεν τον γοήτευε. Ο ουρανός είχε πάρει μία παραμυθένια, μενεξεδιά απόχρωση που τον γέμιζε ελπίδες πως όλα μπορούν να συμβούν. Κι είχαν γίνει τόσα πολλά τον τελευταίο καιρό, ειδικά τις τελευταίες ώρες, που του ήταν δύσκολο να τα διαχειριστεί. Είχαν ανατραπεί όλα όσα μέχρι τότε προσδιόριζαν την πραγματικότητά του, κάνοντάς τον να αναθεωρήσει τη ζωή του όπως τη γνώριζε ως τώρα.

Το κεφάλι του εξακολουθούσε να τον πονάει, τόσο εσωτερικά (αν και οι διαλείψεις είχαν σταματήσει) όσο και εξωτερικά. Η σφαίρα τον είχε τραυματίσει επιφανειακά, ακριβώς δίπλα στο αυτί, δεν έπαυε όμως να του προκαλεί μία ανυπόφορα δυσάρεστη ζαλάδα, ενώ και η αιμορραγία στο πλευρό του από τη δεύτερη σφαίρα είχε κοπάσει κάπως, του αφαιρούσε όμως και τις τελευταίες ικμάδες ενέργειας που του είχαν απομείνει. Έκανε μία προσπάθεια να σηκωθεί, όμως ένοιωθε τόσο αδύναμος. Δεν είχε άλλωστε κάπου να πάει, ένα καταφύγιο για να προστατευτεί μέχρι να αναρρώσει. Το σπίτι του το παρακολουθούσαν, ενώ στο νοσοκομείο θα έπρεπε να δώσει εξηγήσεις για την κατάστασή του, κάτι που θα του προξενούσε περισσότερους μπελάδες.  Έτσι θα έπρεπε να συνεχίσει να τρέχει, όμως αυτό ήταν απλά αδύνατον. Έγειρε πίσω στο παγκάκι. Ίσως μέχρι εδώ ήταν σκέφτηκε, άλλωστε είχε εκπληρώσει την αποστολή του, έχοντας πάρει μία ανταμοιβή που για χρόνια μόνο να ονειρευτεί τολμούσε. Οπότε αν ήταν να τελειώσουν όλα εδώ, ας γινόταν έτσι, δε θα τον πείραζε.
