story:
It is a book about two older teenagers who are living thousands kilometers away from each other in underdeveloped countries in the future 30-50 years from now. High speed communications have created new opportunities for them. They are falling in love with each other while performing remote drone missions on distant planets. They have to challenge death itself to save their love. A collection of outstanding people, both friends and enemies gather around our lovers. Together they may even change the future of human race. Are they opening to humanity new horizons or are they  bringing it to the brinkmanship of extinction?

All scientific concepts and technologies used in this book already exist today. The main idea of the book is inspired by Russian philosopher Genrikh Fyodorovich Khrustov.

story:
Myanmar moves to democracy and the West is watching, but not enough

I intend to visit the Canadian Embassy to speak with our ambassador about Canada's commitment to Myanmar and the ongoing partnership between our two nations and what it means for its people as well as Canadians.

Foreign money is pouring into Myanmar on the heels of major democratic ripples in a country that has been run by the military for a generation.

Governments around the world are observing Myanmar after its most recent de-facto leader Aung San Suu Kyi assumed office at the end of March.

Within a week, Canada's foreign affairs Minister Stephane Dion flew to Myanmar to visit and announce a $44 million multi-faceted development project in Myanmar, though the details presently are somewhat foggy, and I want to fill that void and learn about the partnership between our two countries during an exciting time in that part of SE Asia.

Will this money help the Burmese people? Will it help democratization? Do the people want democracy? These are questions I seek to explore and write about for Canada's news agencies as a free-lancer in that country.

Canada needs a reporter on the ground to observe its impact abroad, and I need help paying to stay in Yangon

Any journalist will tell you the best stories are found on the ground. So that's why I'm going to Myanmar instead of waiting for a press release or a call back.

Significant costs have been racked up since I left the country to start writing. Below is a brief, conservative breakdown on the money I've spent to be able to arrive in Yangon as a journalist.

-Vaccinations to enter Thailand as a Canadian : (more than) $100
-Travel insurance: (more than) $200
-Flight to Thailand (with return booked) $930
-Flight to Yangon from Bangkok ($220)
-Myanmar Journalist accreditation (including two-day hostel bed during wait period) : ($92+$40=$142)

That's $1656 CAD to merely set foot in Yangon, a place that has strict requirements for guesthouses, hotels and hostels that rent out to foreigners. As a result, prices tend to be high to get a room. I'm bound to rack up quite a tab after 25 days, even in a shared dorm in the blistering heat.

Food prices may be low but the cost of permits to enter certain parts of the country have yet to be tabulated by this reporter but I can give updates to potential sponsors who seek to know how I'm spending their money.

I also may be required to leave Yangon and travel to other parts of the country, either by land or air.

What you'll get out of this

People who have an interest in Myanmar, international relations and foreign affairs may be able to glean more information about a part of the world rarely covered thoroughly by the foreign press.

Also:
-You'll potentially be able to read about the struggles of regular people in Myanmar and how foreign aid may help upward mobility in a developing part of the globe.

-You can learn more about where $44 million Canadian tax dollars will be going, to whom, and when.

-You'll be able to help pay the expenses of a young journalist getting started as a freelance foreign correspondent in a difficult media climate with few resources to send people literally across the globe for nearly a month.

About me

I'm a Carleton University journalism graduate and former nighttime reporter at the Ottawa Sun.
I have permission to enter Myanmar and I've gone through all the proper steps to obtain accreditation.
I've been in Thailand since March to fast-track my adjustment to this part of the world.

Contact

Add me on twitter @samcooley for updates.

Or send me an email at Sam (dot) m (dot) cooley (at) gmail (dot) com

Portfolio: http://sammcooley.wix.com/portfolio

story:
Cieľ kampane 

Cieľom kampane je podporiť vydanie knihy Odvážne srdce. 
Prinášam mladým ľuďom napínavé dobrodružstvo v duchu Tolkienovho Pána prsteňov a C.S.Lewisových Kroník Narnie!

Svet Odvážneho srdca je jedinečný tým, že prepája rozhodnutia hrdinov s ich fyzickým výzorom. A tak v príbehu po povrchu zeme kráčajú nádherní ľudia, ale aj draci, harpie, baziliškovia, medvedí a vlčí muži.

Príbeh zároveň zobrazuje rôzne typy otcov, od hrdinských a obetavých, až po zákerných a zbabelých.

Na Odvážnom srdci som pracoval päť rokov a teraz chýba posledný krok k zavŕšeniu tejto cesty.

Vaša podpora umožní vydanie tejto knihy pre tisícky ľudí!

Máte šancu obohatiť životy mladých a nestarnúcich dospelých :)

Čo potrebujem a čo dostanete

  • Potrebujem 6000 € na vytlačenie 2400 kusov kníh , licenciu na obrázok na obálke knihy, grafické spracovanie vnútra knihy, korektúru textu, zalomenie textu do tlače. 
  • Ako odmenu získate knihu Odvážne srdce v mäkkej väzbe, s plnofarebnou obálkou, lesklými časťami hrdinu a draka, so zlatou ražbou názvu knihy a autora. Na začiatku každej kapitoly je umelecky stvárnené srdce obrastajúce konármi košatého stromu, ktoré stráži vo svojom vnútri vzácnu perlu. 
  • Venujem Vám moje poďakovanie, podpis, osobné venovanie, video poďakovanie zdieľateľné na sociálnych sieťach, Vaše meno sa objaví v každom výtlačku knihy v časti poďakovanie autora, venujem knihy do knižníc a nemocníc podľa vášho výberu, alebo sa osobne stretneme a porozprávame o mojich snoch a inšpiráciach.

Dôležitosť projektu

  • V dnešnej dobe je rodina a identita muža v hlbokej kríze. Váš príspevok pomôže mladým pochopiť dôležitosť odvahy, obety a čestnosti v ich životoch.
  • Budete mať možnosť čítaním knihy vžiť sa do postáv, ktoré sú postavené pred náročné životné dilemy.
  • Prinášam knihu, ktorú môžu rodičia spokojne ponúknuť svojm synom, ale aj dcéram od 12 rokov.

Riziká a výzvy

  • Som pevne odhodlaný knihu vydať.
  • Ak sa nevyzbiera dostatok peňazí, budem vydanie knihy financovať pôžičkou z banky.
  • Nakoľko tvorím popri práci na plný úväzok, som schopný postupne tento dlh splatiť.

Iné spôsoby, ako môžete pomôcť

Okrem finančnej podpory môžete kampaň podporiť takto:

  • Povedzte o kampani svojim priateľom, známym, kolegom
  • Lajkujte a zdieľajte ju na sociálnych sieťach 

Človek za knihou 
Volám sa Juraj Vojtáš, mám 37 rokov. S manželkou a dvoma synmi žijem v Žiline.

story:
The Big Move

Established in 1970, Glad Day Bookshop is the world’s oldest LGBTQ bookstore and Toronto’s oldest surviving bookstore. In 2012, a group of 23 community members pooled their funds and bought Glad Day Bookshop to save it from closing.

Since 2012, Glad Day Bookshop book sales have increased by 30% (bucking the North American trend that saw book sales drop 25% in the same period). However, revenue streams like DVDs, erotic photo books and magazines have still been dropping while the cost of doing business continues to rise. We have been going into debt every year, so our choice is clear:

We need to move it or lose it!

Our best strategy for survival is adding new revenues streams like food and drink – which means a larger space. We’ve picked out a great spot on Church Street that would allow us to be a bookstore & coffee shop during the day and a bar at night. It is wheelchair accessible, with an accessible washroom. It has a cute patio, a small space for performances and walls for art.

We will be a space where everyone feels welcome, sexy and celebrated. We will be a queer-owned, indie place on Church Street. We will amplify the love, creativity, sexuality, diversity & liberation that Glad Day Bookshop is known for.

It’s not going to be easy – but it’s going to be fabulous.
And we can do it together.

In the last 4 years, Glad Day Bookshop has hosted over 700 author & performer appearances at over 160 events. We’ve been able to pay over $27,000 to authors & artists for their participation at events. We have had over 125 volunteers log in over 14,000 hours making us an important cultural and community hub; with more funds and more space we can expand the vital role we play in many people’s lives.

In 2013, we launched an online bookstore, which has over 1800 titles, including eBooks.

In 2015, we launched the Naked Heart Festival, which is already the largest and most diverse LGBTQ literary festival in the world.




How much money do you actually need?
We actually need over $200,000 for this move. It will cost over $120,000 for the equipment, materials, supplies, renos and licensing to set up this coffee shop and bar. It will cost over $30,000 for first and last month's rent. The other $50,000 would be needed for other set-up costs, paying off some bookstore debt and having a prudent fiscal buffer.

Are there other ways to help financially?
Yes! We are also looking for 'Angel Investors'. An Angel Investor is someone who is willing to lend us money at low or no interest rate. You can email erickson@gladdaybookshop.com for more information.

How does the names-on-things work?
You choose what name gets put on something. They need to be the names of people. Some people might want to choose names that are important to them, as a gift for someone or as a way for our community to remember someone.
The reason we can't guarantee the names on tables will be there for more than two years is because we might change our set-up by then but the names will stay on the tables until the tables change.

How does this move fit with what the community has asked for?
Over 350 people filled out our survey on moving. People said they would be more likely to come to the store if it:
Had an outdoor patio: 70%
Had a performance space: 70%
Had space for local art: 70%
Served good coffee & tea: 66%
Was wheelchair accessible: 60%
Was also a board game cafe: 59%
Moved to Church Street: 45% (the most popular location)

story:
My Brother's Keeper . . .

Jack Cartwright and Samantha Griffin have been in love with each other--and denying it--since they were 17, when the Griffins rescued Jack from his abusive father. They grew worlds apart, Samantha as a supermodel and Jack as an NFL star. Through it all, they kept a tight reign on their true feelings. Until a family tragedy brings them back together--and forces them to face what they can no longer deny.


Hey Everybody! I'm Nina. Not only have I been writing since grade school, and reading romance novels since high school, but one day I realized that I could write them too!

And I did! I wrote my first draft of My Brother's Keeper in 2013. After several revisions, I shared it with a group of Beta Readers, and they LOVED it! I also had the honor of publishing my short romance story The Long Road Home in the Shades of Pink Anthology, benefitting breast cancer research, this past October. I also got some great feedback from that story.

But even with all of this great progress, I couldn't get any of the traditional publishers to bite. I'd heard that with A LOT of hard work, publishing one's own book can be rewarding and help lay the groundwork for a traditional publisher to take notice of a new author.

So I did some major research and decided to engage BookFuel to help me launch my first romance novel, My Brother's Keeper this coming June. I have a great personal consultant who has spent the past few months helping me prepare and get all the pieces into place.

Like many independent projects, there is a significant financial commitment. But it's one I'm undaunted by, and I'm determined to see my book launch "on time and under budget" as they say :).

First, I thank you for stopping at my launch page to investigate my story. Follow the links below to read a free excerpt. If you like it, as I know you will, take this chance to pre-order your Kindle or signed print copy today and become part of my global publishing team with your contribution!

I also invite you to share this page and these links with others.

http://afineromancendg.blogspot.com/2014/10/a-little-taste-of-love.html

Thank you, Thank you Thank you!

story:
The background to this campaign...

We all saw the Ice Bucket challenges take the world by storm last year, and now most people can say, at least vaguely, that they have heard of Motor Neurone Disease (MND), ALS or Lou Gehrig's disease.

Yes, being diagnosed with MND is like having a bucket of ice water thrown over your head… not only for the victim but also for everyone close to them.

  • My 53-year-old husband was diagnosed with MND in 2013
  • He had the double cruelty of degeneration of the brain causing deeper challenges (frontotemporal dementia) as it affected his decision making skills and emotional behaviour

Why am I writing this book?

At some point in our lives we will have to face a terminal illness in someone we care about deeply.  We don't know how we will cope until we are there.

This is a book of hope and support. 

Purchase a copy here as a gift to support someone in a caring role.

So what will you read about in this book?

You will read a down-to-earth account of my real life situation with the invaluable insight of what a carer goes through as they care for someone who is declining physically, intellectually and emotionally.

In 470 pages it includes practical support strategies for anyone who is close to someone with a terminal or disabling condition.

You can grab a teaser version, just 50 pages and see for yourself.
Click here to get the teaser from Amazon

An excerpt...

Is there a right way to react to a diagnosis such as MND?

All I can say is it is not like it is in the stories.  I'm no hero; I don't have some magic way of knowing how to do everything right in the worst of situations.  The shock produces so many effects on you and you are not in full control of yourself.  I often had the eerie feeling of watching myself going through it all from a slight distance as though it was happening to someone else or like I was watching it as a movie or as though I had ceased to exist and was a just a shadow amongst a world that no longer made sense.  I knew it was really happening to me, but it is an overwhelming situation, so many emotions all clamouring to have first place in line, including that demon denial that still wants to convince you that it will all go away if you just refuse to accept it and hide your head in the sand.



I have always believed that if there is a problem, there is a solution.  If there is no solution, then you don't have a problem, you have a fact.  I desperately wanted my husband’s health issue to be a problem!  But what I had to face was that his disease was a fact, and the only problems we would be able to find solutions to were how to live the rest of our time together to the fullest and how we could make the most of whatever we have on every day we have it, and try to keep him as comfortable as possible as it progressed.



YOU can allow this book to get through the expensive editing process so that everyone can benefit!

  • After interviewing prospective editors I have secured one that understands and is in tune with my writing goals
  • A trial edit has been conducted and an estimate of costs delivered allowing me to create a budget. (see below for budget challenges)

A little about the monster

MND (Motor Neurone Disease) is known as ALS (Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis) and Lou Gehrig’s disease in the US.

  • In Australia two people are diagnosed with this disease every day and two people die from the disease every day.  
  • In the US a person is diagnosed every 90 minutes.
  • Diagnosis is a family-wide situation as everyone close to the person who has the disease is going to be affected for the rest of their lives. 
  • MND occurs in all countries of the world. It does not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity or demographic.
  • Over 350,000 of the world’s people are living with MND and over 100,000 people die from MND every year.
  • MND is not a disease of ageing and can affect adults at any age, although the peak age of onset is during the fifties and sixties.

In 2015 there is still no known cause for this disease and no cure.


Just what would I get if I choose a perk?

EARLY BIRD eBOOK. 

Receive the very first release of the eBook, hot off the virtual press and be the first person in the world to read this story.  Published in all formats so you can receive the format of your choice to suit your eReader, including PDF.

The
background to this campaign...
We all saw the Ice Bucket challenges take the world by
storm last year, and now most people can say, at least vaguely, that they have
heard of Motor Neurone Disease (MND), ALS or Lou Gehrig's disease.
Yes, being diagnosed with MND is like having a bucket of
ice water thrown over your head… not only for the victim but also for everyone
close to them.


My 53-year-old husband was diagnosed with MND in 2013
He had the double cruelty of degeneration of the
     brain causing deeper challenges (frontotemporal dementia) as it
     affected his decision making skills and emotional behaviour


Why am
I writing this book?
At some point in our lives we will have to face a terminal illness in someone we care about deeply.  We don't know how we will cope until we are there.
This is a book of hope and support. Purchase a copy here as a gift to support someone in a caring role.

So
what will you read about in this book?
You will read a down-to-earth account of my real life situation with the invaluable insight of what a
carer goes through as they care for someone who is declining physically,
intellectually and emotionally.
In 470 pages it includes practical
support strategies for anyone who is close to someone with a
terminal or disabling condition.
You can grab a teaser version, just 50 pages and see for yourself.
Click here to get the teaser from Amazon


An
excerpt...
Is there a right way to react to a diagnosis such as MND?
All I can say is it is not like it is in the stories.
 I'm no hero; I don't have some magic way of knowing how to do everything
right in the worst of situations.  The shock produces so many effects on
you and you are not in full control of yourself.  I often had the eerie
feeling of watching myself going through it all from a slight distance as
though it was happening to someone else or like I was watching it as a movie or
as though I had ceased to exist and was a just a shadow amongst a world that no
longer made sense.  I knew it was really happening to me, but it is an
overwhelming situation, so many emotions all clamouring to have first place in
line, including that demon denial that still wants to convince you that it will
all go away if you just refuse to accept it and hide your head in the sand.





I have always believed that if there is a problem, there
is a solution.  If there is no solution,
then you don't have a problem, you have a fact. 
I desperately wanted my husband’s health issue to be a problem!  But what I had to face was that his disease
was a fact, and the only problems we would be able to find solutions to were how
to live the rest of our time together to the fullest and how we could make the
most of whatever we have on every day we have it, and try to keep him as
comfortable as possible as it progressed.




YOU can allow this book to get through the expensive editing process so that everyone can benefit!

After interviewing prospective editors I have secured
     one that understands and is in tune with my writing goals
A trial edit has been conducted and an estimate of
     costs delivered allowing me to create a budget. (see below for budget
     challenges)


A
little about the monster
MND (Motor Neurone Disease) is known
as ALS (Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis) and Lou Gehrig’s disease in the US.


In Australia two people are diagnosed
with this disease every day and two people die from the disease every day.  

In the US a person is diagnosed every 90
minutes.


Diagnosis is a family-wide situation
as everyone close to the person who has the disease is going to be affected for
the rest of their lives. 



MND occurs in all countries of the world. It does not
     discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity or demographic. 
Over 350,000 of the world’s people are living with MND
     and over 100,000 people die from MND every year. 
MND is not a disease of ageing and can affect adults at
     any age, although the peak age of onset is during the fifties and sixties.

In 2015 there is still no known cause
for this disease and no cure.

story:
Peace is Inevitable is an innovative program that supports marginalized youth in recovery and self-discovery. 

Thank you for recognizing and reacting. 

Our Team (l-r)

Paul Murtha - (Ecuador) Director- Calle Paz y Respeto Project (CPR), Director - Vibrant Village Foundation, Ecuador, Administrator - Fundacion Montanas de Esperanza, Design and management of model community development projects including a cultural arts center, family nutrition projects and initiatives for challenged youth. Paul also photo/film documents this exciting evolution.
Ing. Oscar Alvarez - (Quito, Ecuador) - Oscar is the Production Manager for Radio Publico Ecuador. He is a key cheerleader for Calle Paz and has given professional grade workshops in radio production to the CPR team.
Simon Edwards - (UK, Spain) co-Director - "Peace is Inevitable" film documentary. Simon started promoting and managing professional theater over 30 years ago. He began to make films in the 90s and since 2007 has been capturing the magic of real peoples stories through documentary. "We all love stories, but when they are real they can be life changing". 
Rosa Costanza - (US , LA) -  Rosa is a writer of original screenplays, industry related articles and prose. She is a producer who has worked in media and film production for 15 years; films, music videos, Grammy selected music albums, international events and crowd-funding campaigns are all a part  of her repertoire.
Dr. Angel Castillo - (Ecuador) - ex-Director of Education, Imbabura Province, N. Ecuador, Director/consultant Arteduca Yuyay Program, Ibarra,  As Director of Education in 2012-'13, Dr. Castillo played a key role in developing the Calle Paz y Respeto program.
Lic. Fernando Jara - (Ecuador) -  Director of Project Development - Ministry of Culture, Ibarra, Fernando has supported Calle Paz for two years and works as our project liaison with the Ministry. Recently Fernando worked developing cultural projects in Ecuador for the European Union.

Grupo Calle Paz y Respeto - team members (l-r )
Cristian Ubidia - Radio production tech, editing, mastering, also music/song writing, Gives courses in graffiti. Via his radio personality DLT, Cristian presents the weekly "Acciones de Vida' segment that promotes positive choices in life.  Cristian is very artistic and puts that extra effort into everything. He is clear about the reality of peace within and  creatively puts the message into his creative expressions. 
Jefferson Morejon - Radio DJ,  hip hop music production and handles internet communications/social networking for the CPR group. "Cunini" is a leader at heart and has been a bridge to the local gang in the peace transformation process. In his radio persona - DJ Don Q, Cunini puts out a recognized voice on their national public radio show REACCIONA.
Gisela Herrera - CPR Public Relations rep with partner organizations - Ministry of Culture, media interests, NGO's. Gisela writes project proposals and reports. As honorary Queen of Alpachaca, she helps leverage the dream for 2016 to set up a Community Cultural Arts Center in their tough neighborhood, Alpachaca. Gisela is the radio voice of the broadcast segment "Sabias Que?" (Did you know?) And Gisela is the dance instructor for the Alpachaca girls dance troupe, dedicated to empowering young girls.
Cristina Recalde - Cristina is a popular voice on the radio show. She writes/records her weekly radio theme plus helps coordinate  the Alpachaca Children's theater. Cristina is a naturally gifted speaker who has spoken in several prestigious PR venues.
Roxana Recalte - Rox is the CPR office secretary/manager, keeping the books and helping to write proposals, etc. She is adept at organizing public events; obtaining permissions, artist's contracts and arranging logistics.  For the CPR national radio broadcast REACCIONA, Rox records select interviews, dovetailing the interview with the week's chosen theme. 

Words to intro video soundtrack "Tell Me"                                             Written/produced/performed by Grupo Calle Paz y Respeto

CHORUS

 

Tell me why you seek by going to places.                                                                                     

 

Tell me why peace is not painted on your walls.

  Tell me why people die in segregated zones.                                                              Tell me why peace does not fill your homes.

Part 1 - DLT

  Maybe they do not know or have not yet discovered.                                                      The magic is in you and it surrounds you.                                                                                   I invite you to my party if you want to attend.                                                                         Just take off the blindfold and be transported.                                                               Write the script of your life, it is time to film it.                                                                 Because you are the star of your life.                                                                                           And you will not forget it. No, you will not forget it.

Part 2 - Don Q

  Explore, search and find.                                                                                                              

 The peace is within you. Looking costs nothing.                                                       Take off the mask. Race and social class are not admitted here.                               To be happy you don’t need material things.                                                                  It depends on you to be real. Because in the end we are all equal.                          We have joys and sorrows. With effort we overcome the problems.

CHORUS

Part 3 - Mr Raffc

  Take care of your life, there is only one.                                                                               Seek the good path, avoid the drugs.                                                                                     And if you fall, there is no time to give up.                                                                           Everything is in you to help you decide. To lift yourself, love yourself.                               Rebel against the bad, free yourself. A good future, a good life,                                           Seek a way out of problems. Time heals wounds.                                                                 To setbacks, apply good energies. Hey my friend do what you decide.                   Your family is with you and you are not forgotten, in any way.


Calle Paz y Respeto - a story of transformation 

(Peace and Respect Street)
 


October, 2012 - Ibarra, Ecuador - Barrio Alpachaca 

Rival gangs each lose a friend to violence. The gang leaders have learned that exacting revenge traps them in the brutal cycle of fear, pain and tragedy. It is no longer an option. 

I am working in the prison of Ibarra, Ecuador with the successful Peace Education Program (PEP). A special meeting is arranged with gang leaders to introduce these videos about the peace process.  Something clicks and we begin to meet weekly to watch more video and talk things over. 

Inspired gang members march in the local Alpachaca civic parade for the first time. Their self-elected banner reads "Peace is not only possible, it is inevitable". Local authorities stand and clap to see such a vital statement coming from these notorious youth.


2013 -To facilitate their transformation process, five leaders are hired part-time through the foundation I direct. An initial project develops antidrug/bullying/self-esteem programs that are presented in twenty regional high schools. These upbeat, multimedia, interactive presentations come from the personal experience of the gang leaders. It is youth to youth and the students really listen.


  '13 - CPR sponsors a major event for World Peace Day, Sept. 21st. Over 2,200 area students march and enjoy a followup music festival.

   


 

2014 - Now with an office and gaining credibility, the Calle Paz y Respeto (CPR) team wins $10,000 from the Ecuadorian Ministry of Culture in a national contest to design and promote a cultural festival.  CPR stages a successful event - "Hip Hop for Peace" - in their tough neighborhood Alpachaca that features live music, graffiti and dance, all with messages of peace and well-being.

   

   '14 - CPR team members maintain their gang leader status and work from within the organization. A Peace Accord is reached and signed between rival gangs. This courageous and effective pact is honored and holds to this day, serving as a model for other gangs to follow.

    '14 - An international film crew spends two weeks with the CPR team and local gang members gathering material for a film documentary about the personal transformations of these marginalized youth. Entitled "Peace is Inevitable", the one hour film is slated to open in Film Festivals and for 2016 it is planned to be a feature on Discovery Channel Latin America.

                            

    '14 - CPR begin to write and record "consciousness" hip hop songs.

                            


2015 - An audio recording studio is installed in the CPR office.     

    '15  -  Calle Paz y Respeto team writes, edits and produces a 1/2 hour radio program broadcast weekly over National Public Radio, RPE. It is the first national "urban sound" program dedicated to peace and well-being. 

    '15  - This weekly broadcast "REACCIONA" has a growing national audience of est. 160,000. The CPR team receive specialized training in radio production from the audio technicians at Radio Publico Ecuador.


   '15 - CPR coordinates a first-ever Summer Arts Camp for children of their tough neighborhood Alpachaca.


Transformation           

Each Calle Paz y Respeto  team member has embraced a new optimistic perspective. They continue to serve as gang leaders, but now as role models for their peers in choosing a positive path for life. 

The message of peace that these young people promote via their national radio broadcast, their in-school programs, public events, community outreach and children's arts activities has generated a significant impact in Alpachaca, Ibarra and in Ecuador.


The Impact

  • Their active and courageous choice to stop the violence and to practice peace has positively affected members of their local gang and other challenged youth in nearby cities.
  • Their weekly urban-vibe radio show reaches thousands of marginalized youth throughout Ecuador with a positive message of well-being.
  • Their in-school presentations have inspired students, school psychologists, teachers and authorities to learn more about youth challenges and how to support positive change.
  • Their personal success, dedication and ongoing training is a model of transformation for Latin American youth.

 


The PEACE IS INEVITABLE 

Indiegogo campaign 

is about keeping this model project alive and growing thru 2016 and beyond.

It's about sharing with challenged youth a working example of productive choice. 

It's about taking off the mask and embracing one's innate inner resources.

It's about accepting the possibility of peace.

As a co-sponsor you are part of an innovative initiative that will reach thousands of youth in Ecuador, the Americas and the world. 


Plans for 2016 are in motion......

Strategy for 2016

  • CPR's successful national radio program will expand to a one-hour weekly broadcast. 
  • The ground-breaking, hour-long documentary "Peace is Inevitable" about personal transformation to peace will be released in Latin America, the US and internationally. Its impact is expected to generate major interest in the peace process for challenged youth.
  • A digital "how-to" package  about the unique peace process will be prepared and provided to all those wanting to know more; whether  responding to the documentary film, the radio show or any other CPR initiative. 
  • A national tour targeting youth in Ecuador's cities and impoverished zones will feature the "Peace is Inevitable" documentary plus Grupo Calle Paz y Respeto live onstage with their hip-hop songs, messages of peace and inspired interactions with the audience.
  • Job training and the creation of a productive micro-enterprise for other members of the gang (association).
  • The purchase of additional audio gear for CPR's in-office recording studio.
  • The first stages towards developing a Cultural Arts Center in Alpachaca to offer dance, music, theater and creative arts workshops to disregarded children and youth.
  • Basic salaries, office supplies, rent, materials and mobility expenses.
  • Promotion of the REACCIONA radio program in other Latin American radio markets.



What We Need  -  $44,000  -  goes a very long way in Ecuador. 

Grupo Calle Paz y Respeto has a successful three-year track record in managing peace-themed, multi-media and social service initiatives. To date in 2015 they have produced over 25 professional half-hour national radio broadcasts.
Recent meetings with the regional Ministry of Culture, the Board of Education, both the Senator and Governor of Imbabura Province and local NGO's have generated additional support for CPR program logistics, materials and technical assistance. 

The momentum of this exciting model project must continue! 


What You Get

Receive CPR's latest song releases, video clips, artwork from N. Ecuador, cool T-shirts, customized caps, plus the opportunity to be a special guest of CPR in Ecuador for a two day immersion in the world of "Peace is Inevitable".
As a donor, be kept abreast of developments thru 2016 and beyond. Success stories and new updates can be delivered to you regularly.
If we don't reach the campaign goal, we will apply all funds raised to keep Calle Paz y Respeto alive and well for as long as possible. 
And this campaign will continue thru 2016 via Indiegogo's generous "in-demand" option. 

It's time to invest in human dignity, in human potential, in the power to choose clarity and peace.


Risks & Challenges

  • Grupo Calle Paz y Respeto will continue technical training to constantly improve the quality of their national radio broadcasts,  in-school presentations and administrative capabilities.
  • The fact that funds are channeled to a third world country via a private US account may deter investment, even though the credibility of the staff, the program and the donation process are reliable, proven and endorsed.
  •  Indiegogo's "in-demand" status will enable ongoing donations as the project progresses and expands.
  • It is vital to train other young people in radio production and the logistics of developing and delivering social assistance. 

Paul Murtha - Peace is Inevitable Campaign Director

  • 2008-'15 - Director, Fundacion Montanas de Esperanza, Ecuador 
  • 2011- present - Director, Vibrant Village Foundation -Ecuador
  • 2012 - present - Project Coordinator for Grupo Calle Paz y Respeto
As Director of two foundations in northern Ecuador, I have been the legal representative and fiscally accountable for over 6 years, effectively managing and investing over 1.2 million dollars into specific social service projects. I have successfully worked with grants from Rotary International, the Prem Rawat Foundation and the Vibrant Village Foundation. Our model initiatives to improve quality of life for Andean families and youth have garnered accolades from many regional social service organizations and the Ecuadorian government.
 
The Peace is Inevitable project is an innovative and vital program for supporting marginalized youth in self-discovery and recovery. Thank you for recognizing and reacting. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Money ain't everything.

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Feel free to send a note of support or inquiry to callepazyrespeto@yahoo.com

they do not know or have not yet discovered.                                                      The magic is in you and it surrounds you.                                                                                   I invite you to my party if you want to attend.                                                                         Just take off the blindfold and be transported.                                                               Write the script of your life, it is time to film it.                                                                 Because
you are the star of your life.                                                                                           And
you will not forget it. No,
you will not forget it.
Part 2 - Don Q
  Explore,
search and find.                                                                                                              
 The
peace is within you. Looking costs nothing.                                                       Take
off the mask. Race and social class are not admitted here.                               To
be happy you don’t need material things.                                                                  It
depends on you to be real. Because
in the end we are all equal.                          We
have joys and sorrows. With
effort we overcome the problems.
CHORUS
Part 3 - Mr Raffc
  Take
care of your life, there is only one.                                                                               Seek
the good path, avoid the drugs.                                                                                     And
if you fall, there is no time to give up.                                                                           Everything
is in you to help you decide. To
lift yourself, love yourself.                               Rebel against the bad, free yourself. A
good future, a good life,                                           Seek
a way out of problems. Time
heals wounds.                                                                 To
setbacks, apply good energies. Hey
my friend do what you decide.                   Your
family is with you and you are not forgotten, in any way.


Calle Paz y Respeto - a story of transformation 
(Peace and Respect Street)

 






October, 2012 - Ibarra, Ecuador - Barrio Alpachaca 


Rival gangs each lose a friend to violence. The gang leaders have learned that exacting revenge traps them in the brutal cycle of fear, pain and tragedy. It is no longer an option. 
I am working in the prison of Ibarra, Ecuador with the successful Peace Education Program (PEP). A special meeting is arranged with gang leaders to introduce these videos about the peace process.  Something clicks and we begin to meet weekly to watch more video and talk things over. 
Inspired gang members march in the local Alpachaca civic parade for the first time. Their self-elected banner reads "Peace is not only possible, it is inevitable". Local authorities stand and clap to see such a vital statement coming from these notorious youth.






2013 -To facilitate their transformation process, five leaders are hired part-time through the foundation I direct. An initial project develops antidrug/bullying/self-esteem programs that are presented in twenty regional high schools. These upbeat, multimedia, interactive presentations come from the personal experience of the gang leaders. It is youth to youth and the students really listen.








  '13 - CPR sponsors a major event for World Peace Day, Sept. 21st. Over 2,200 area students march and enjoy a followup music festival.



   


 

2014 - Now with an office and gaining credibility, the Calle Paz y Respeto (CPR) team wins $10,000 from the Ecuadorian Ministry of Culture in a national contest to design and promote a cultural festival.  CPR stages a successful event - "Hip Hop for Peace" - in their tough neighborhood Alpachaca that features live music, graffiti and dance, all with messages of peace and well-being.



   


   '14 - CPR team members maintain their gang leader status and work from within the organization. A Peace Accord is reached and signed between rival gangs. This courageous and effective pact is honored and holds to this day, serving as a model for other gangs to follow.




    '14 - An international film crew spends two weeks with the CPR team and local gang members gathering material for a film documentary about the personal transformations of these marginalized youth. Entitled "Peace is Inevitable", the one hour film is slated to open in Film Festivals and for 2016 it is planned to be a feature on Discovery Channel Latin America.

                            
    '14 - CPR begin to write and record "consciousness" hip hop songs.


                            



2015 - An audio recording studio is installed in the CPR office.     


    '15  -  Calle Paz y Respeto team writes, edits and produces a 1/2 hour radio program broadcast weekly over National Public Radio, RPE. It is the first national "urban sound" program dedicated to peace and well-being. 
    '15  - This weekly broadcast "REACCIONA" has a growing national audience of est. 160,000. The CPR team receive specialized training in radio production from the audio technicians at Radio Publico Ecuador.


   '15 - CPR coordinates a first-ever Summer Arts Camp for children of their tough neighborhood Alpachaca.


Transformation           
Each Calle Paz y Respeto  team member has embraced a new optimistic perspective. They continue to serve as gang leaders, but now as role models for their peers in choosing a positive path for life. 
The message of peace that these young people promote via their national radio broadcast, their in-school programs, public events, community outreach and children's arts activities has generated a significant impact in Alpachaca, Ibarra and in Ecuador.


The Impact


Their active and courageous choice to stop the violence and to practice peace has positively affected members of their local gang and other challenged youth in nearby cities.
Their weekly urban-vibe radio show reaches thousands of marginalized youth throughout Ecuador with a positive message of well-being.
Their in-school presentations have inspired students, school psychologists, teachers and authorities to learn more about youth challenges and how to support positive change.
Their personal success, dedication and ongoing training is a model of transformation for Latin American youth.



 







The PEACE IS INEVITABLE 
Indiegogo campaign is about keeping this model project alive and growing thru 2016 and beyond.


It's about sharing with challenged youth a working example of productive choice. 
It's about taking off the mask and embracing one's innate inner resources.
It's about accepting the possibility of peace.


As a co-sponsor you are part of an innovative initiative that will reach thousands of youth in Ecuador, the Americas and the world. 

Plans for 2016 are in motion......

Strategy for 2016



CPR's successful national radio program will expand to a one-hour weekly broadcast. 
The ground-breaking, hour-long documentary "Peace is Inevitable" about personal transformation to peace will be released in Latin America, the US and internationally. Its impact is expected to generate major interest in the peace process for challenged youth.
A digital "how-to" package  about the unique peace process will be prepared and provided to all those wanting to know more; whether  responding to the documentary film, the radio show or any other CPR initiative. 

A national tour targeting youth in Ecuador's cities and impoverished zones will feature the "Peace is Inevitable" documentary plus Grupo Calle Paz y Respeto live onstage with their hip-hop songs, messages of peace and inspired interactions with the audience.

Job training and the creation of a productive micro-enterprise for other members of the gang (association).
The purchase of additional audio gear for CPR's in-office recording studio.
The first stages towards developing a Cultural Arts Center in Alpachaca to offer dance, music, theater and creative arts workshops to disregarded children and youth.

Basic salaries, office supplies, rent, materials and mobility expenses.
Promotion of the REACCIONA radio program in other Latin American radio markets.






What We Need  -  $44,000  -  goes a very long way in Ecuador. 



Grupo Calle Paz y Respeto has a successful three-year track record in managing peace-themed, multi-media and social service initiatives. To date in 2015 they have produced over 25 professional half-hour national radio broadcasts.

Recent meetings with the regional Ministry of Culture, the Board of Education, both the Senator and Governor of Imbabura Province and local NGO's have generated additional support for CPR program logistics, materials and technical assistance. 
The momentum of this exciting model project must continue! 

What You GetReceive CPR's latest song releases, video clips, artwork from N. Ecuador, cool T-shirts, customized caps, plus the opportunity to be a special guest of CPR in Ecuador for a two day immersion in the world of "Peace is Inevitable".
As a donor, be kept abreast of developments thru 2016 and beyond. Success stories and new updates can be delivered to you regularly.
If we don't reach the campaign goal, we will apply all funds raised to keep Calle Paz y Respeto alive and well for as long as possible. 
And this campaign will continue thru 2016 via Indiegogo's generous "in-demand" option. 
It's time to invest in human dignity, in human potential, in the power to choose clarity and peace.


Risks & Challenges

Grupo Calle Paz y Respeto will continue technical training to constantly improve the quality of their national radio broadcasts,  in-school presentations and administrative capabilities.

The fact that funds are channeled to a third world country via a private US account may deter investment, even though the credibility of the staff, the program and the donation process are reliable, proven and endorsed.


 Indiegogo's "in-demand" status will enable ongoing donations as the project progresses and expands.


It is vital to train other young people in radio production and the logistics of developing and delivering social assistance. 



Paul Murtha - Peace is Inevitable Campaign Director


2008-'15 - Director, Fundacion Montanas de Esperanza, Ecuador 
2011- present - Director, Vibrant Village Foundation -Ecuador
2012 - present - Project Coordinator for Grupo Calle Paz y Respeto

As Director of two foundations in northern Ecuador, I have been the legal representative and fiscally accountable for over 6 years, effectively managing and investing over 1.2 million dollars into specific social service projects. I have successfully worked with grants from Rotary International, the Prem Rawat Foundation and the Vibrant Village Foundation. Our model initiatives to improve quality of life for Andean families and youth have garnered accolades from many regional social service organizations and the Ecuadorian government.
 
The Peace is Inevitable project is an innovative and vital program for supporting marginalized youth in self-discovery and recovery. Thank you for recognizing and reacting. 
  

    Other Ways You Can Help Money ain't everything.  Please get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Use the Indiegogo share tools!
Feel free to send a note of support or inquiry to callepazyrespeto@yahoo.com

story:
Origine du projet

Il y a dans ce pays des églises qui se réunissent dans des lieux non conformes à ce que le monde pourrait accepter. Le lieu de culte d'Ampanataovana à Antsirabe en est un de ceux-là.

Le toit en tôle ondulé est rouillé.
Les portes et fenêtre en bois sont souvent vandalisées pour voler le matériel à l'intérieur car il n’y a pas de volets de sécurité.
La sonorisation est inexistante.
Les bancs sont sans dossier en planches de coffrage.
Le sol n'est pas carrelé.
Il n'y a pas de terrasse pour que les membres s'abritent du soleil et de la pluie à la sortie.
Il n'y a pas de toilettes.
Il n'y a pas d'eau courante.
Etc. . .Etc. . ..La liste est longue. . .. 

Ce lieu de culte a un grand besoin de rénovation car, encore le mois dernier, un tremblement de terre est venu agrandir les craquements des murs et du sol.
Le mur du côté gauche est sur le point de tomber, comme vous pouvez le voir sur les photos dans la galerie.

Chaque euro que vous allez donner, sera pour eux d'une grande importance.

Si vous êtes ici, c'est parce que le sort de nos frères et sœur vous intéresse, donc ne ressortez pas de cette page sans faire un geste pour eux.

Nos besoins

Pour la reconstruction, nous avons besoin d'un peu d'argent.

Ne vous y trompez pas, si nous demandons 7500€, c'est le montant total pour la reconstruction et l'aménagement nouveau de ce lieu.

Le coût de la construction n'est pas très élevé.
1€ = 3200MGA (Ariary Malagasy)
Donc les 7500€ = 24 000 000 000MGA 
Le salaire d'un ouvrier du BTP est de 180 000MGA

Un bâtiment comme celui qui est souhaité nous prendra environ 3mois de construction avec 4 ouvriers du BTP et des membres d'église qui vont pouvoir aider à côté. Soit un coût de : 2 160 000MGA
C'est très important que les membres puissent aider dans ce projet. Car ce lieu sera le leur.

Une brique à un coût de 80MGA
L'ensemble du bâtiment c'est environ 20 000 briques soit : 1 600 000MGA
Un moellon à un coüt de 150MGA
Il faut de 750 moellons soit : 112 500MGA.

Les plus importants coûts seront :

-  Le ferraillage

- La charpente

-  Le toit

-  La finition

-  Le ciment

-  Le sable

-  Le carrelage

-  Les portes et fenêtres

-  La sécurité du nouveau bâtiment

-  Les bancs

-  Les chaises

-  Le pupitre

-  La déco de la chaire

-  La sonorisation

-  L'électricité

-  Les wcs.. .Etc. . .
Tout cela en plus du bâtiment lui-même et la construction des toilettes.

C'est donc pour cela que nous avons pris un montant un peu plus important que ce que vous pensez que nous aurons besoin vu le coût.

Nous reconstruirons totalement l'édifice et l'aménagerons de façon moderne et sécurisé. 

Le début des travaux est prévu pour le début du mois de Juin de 2016. A cette période c'est l'hiver Austral et donc la saison sèche. La meilleure saison pour la construction.


Fin de programme

En fin de programme, s'il reste de l'argent sur ce qui a été reçu, nous l'utiliserons pour aider d'autres églises dans le besoin, car il y en a beaucoup dans ce cas.
Il y existe dans la ville, une association d'aide aux enfants et jeunes en difficultés tenu par le pasteur de l'église francophone qui a des besoins financiers permanents.

Utilisation de l’argent

Afin d’améliorer la vie de cette congrégation, nous ne reconstruirons pas à l’identique le lieu de culte, mais nous ferons un vrai bâtiment à deux niveaux.

Au rez-de-chaussée nous disposerons des salles pour l’école du Sabbat des enfants, une grande salle de réunion des JA et les toilettes.

Au niveau 1, accessible à toutes personnes, y compris celle à mobilités réduites, il y aura une salle de préparation du culte et de réunion pour les officiants, un wc pour personnes à mobilités réduites, et la grande salle de réunion des membres d’église capable de recevoir 120 personnes environ.

Dans les salles du bas, nous y placerons des chaises pour les enfants selon leurs âges.

Dans la grande salle de l’étage, nous ferons fabriquer des bancs dignes du lieu où Dieu lui-même vient à la rencontre de son peuple.
Dans la salle de réunion, il y aura aussi des chaises et une table afin de réunir le comité et autre réunion de la direction de l’église.

14 500 000MGA - La construction du bâtiment selon les plans dans la galerie.
 2 000 000MGA - Sonorisation de la salle de culte.
  1 000 000MGA - L’aménagement du bâtiment.
  1 000 000MGA - Achat de peintures (Les membres vont faire reste)
  1 000 000MGA - Portes et fenêtres avec des volets en acier.
  1 000 000MGA - Electrification - éclairage
  1 000 000MGA - Installations plomberies et sanitaires
     500 000MGA - Le carrelage de la grande salle.

2 000 000MGA Ce montant n'a pas encore d'affectation, car au regard de la fluctuation des monnaies, si l'Euro remonte par rapport à l'Ariary, il n'existera pas.
Car à 1€/3000MGA, les 7500€ ne font plus que 22 500 000MGA 

Dans le reste des salles il n’y aura du carrelage que si nous avons plus d’argent que les 7 500€, mais pour le moment, nous y apposerons de la peinture.

La décoration sera effectuée en bénévolat par des membres d’église.

Le temps de la reconstruction les membres iront dans un autre lieu de culte,
Mais, nous sommes en négociation pour avoir une tente pour qu'ils puissent rester sur le terrain à coté, prêter par le frère voisin.

Les prix sont approximatifs car les plans sont en cours de réalisations et les ferrailleurs, les maçons et autres corps de métier nous ont donner des prix et nous avons fais le choix d'afficher les montants max possibles, mais cela va diminuer.


L'impact

Cette reconstruction sera pour les membre de cette église, une sortie sous l'épée de qui leurs est au dessus de la tête, car ce bâtiment qui risque de s’effondrer dans les mois à venir. Ce sera un grand soulagent.
Elle aura un puissant impact sur la population dans les quartiers autour. Ce qui augmentera la puissance de la diffusion du message des 3 anges.
Il est important d'avoir un lieu ou recevoir convenablement ceux qui font le choix d'accepter le Christ dans leurs vies.

 Cette reconstruction redonnera confiance aux membres d'église dans toute cette région.

Le défi

Nous croyons que nous formons une seule et grande famille sur la terre et que Dieu est notre unique créateur.
Nous savons que lorsqu'il y a un problème dans une famille, tous les membres de cette famille sont touchés et qu'ils mettent tout en œuvre pour aider celui qui se trouve dans la difficulté.

Cette église se retrouve souvent avec peu d'argent en caisse : 30 000MGA = 10€, c'est le fond de roulement qu'ils ont eu. 
Comment refaire construire un bâtiment avec ça?

Nous sommes une famille et nous devons nous aider les uns, les autres.

Dans le cas où nous n'atteignons pas notre objectif (ce à quoi je ne pense pas) nous utiliserons l'argent reçu pour aider Ampanataovana et ferons de notre mieux avec ce que nous aurons récupéré.

Le vrai défi, est que nous puissions avoir plus de 10 000€ afin de donner une vrai chance à cette église et pouvoir aider d'autres qui en ont besoin.

D'autres façons d'aider

Même si vous n'avez pas 100€, mais 1€, c'est déjà l'équivalent de 100 briques.
100 personnes à 1€ et cela fera 100€, c'est le prix de 10 000 briques.

Et vous pouvez nous contacter pour passer sur place poser une brique, passer le balais sur le site, ou faire deux coups de pinceaux et les aider si vous êtes de Madagascar et offrir vos services, nous sommes aussi preneur.

Compte-rendu 

Durant tout le programme et la construction, nous vous tiendrons au courant du déroulement des opérations et en fin de construction, vous recevrez un compte-rendu.
Vous recevrez le décompte de l'argent utilisé, les photos, le nombre d'heure passé pour la construction par les ouvriers . . . Etc. . .

D'autres façons d'aider
Même si vous
n'avez pas 100€, mais 1€, c'est déjà l'équivalent de 100 briques.100 personnes à 1€ et cela fera 100€, c'est le prix de 10 000 briques.
Et vous
pouvez nous contacter pour passer sur place poser une brique, passer le balais
sur le site, ou faire deux coups de pinceaux et les aider si vous êtes de
Madagascar et offrir vos services, nous sommes aussi preneur.
Compte-rendu 
Durant tout le programme et la construction, nous vous tiendrons au courant du déroulement des opérations et en fin de construction, vous recevrez un compte-rendu.Vous recevrez le décompte de l'argent utilisé, les photos, le nombre d'heure passé pour la construction par les ouvriers . . . Etc. . .

story:
Short Summary

Lori Leak Travels to Paris is a unique book about an African American girl who does something that less than 10% of African -American females do -- she travels outside the United States of America. We -  the author and international lifestyle entrepreneur Barrett Clemmensen Powell, and the illustrator, Cannes award-winning animator Kristen Palana -  want to take this book to the Los Angeles Times Festival of Book 2016. We also want to donate one copy to each of the 50 states in the USA. To do this, we need your help.

We want to raise the money that it will cost to travel to the Lost Angeles Times Festival of Books in April 2016 and have an exhibit booth filled with

  • copies of "Lori Leak Travels to Paris"
  • writing activities for children
  • marketing materials such as banner, postcards and maybe even a life-sized Lori Leak that children can stand with and have a photo taken
Bringing this book to this internationally known and respected book fair will empower this book to be recognized by booksellers, bookstores, reviewers and media.

This book opens doors to children of color and girls, particularly African-American girls. It tells them that they have the opportunity and possibility in life to be a foreign exchange student in another country during high school, to take a gap year and travel the world, to go to university in another country or take some semesters abroad while earning their degree, to learn other languages, to live in other countries, to be a dual citizen, to pursue work in international companies and positions which will take them to lands far from home. It has the ability to create an impact on the global economy by creating girls who become adult women who impact the global economy.

By contributing, YOU have a crucial role in opening up the world to young girls of color and young girls in general, empowering their social and economic futures.

What We Need & What You Get

The base support we are seeking is the funding to bring this book to the Los Angeles Times Festival of Books in April 2016.

  • Exhibition booth $1250-1600 (smallest booth 10x10)
  • Marketing materials $700
You can read more about the Los Angeles Times Festival of Books 2016 and what you will help fund, here:

Los Angeles Times Festival of Books 2016 - Exhibitor Sales

Beyond reaching our $2500 goal, we would like to use excess funds to
  • Donate 1 copy of the book to the main public library in the capital of each of the 50 states in the USA so that it is available in the library system for any child who wishes to borrow it to read. We will donate alphabetically by state.
  • Give free copies of the book to girls ages 6-12 at book signings and other events
  • Finally, if there are enough funds, we (Barrett and Kristen) could use them to reduce our transportation costs (airfare) to Los Angeles for the fair
The perks we are offering will be many, such as a handwritten note of thanks, a signed PDF, an autographed illustration, coupons for free enrollment in online writing or art courses.

If we do not reach our basic goal, all that we do get will still be put towards renting a booth at the Los Angeles Times Festival of Books 2016.

The Impact

Both Kristen Palana and I have spent many years opening our hearts to people and giving of ourselves. We live out the motto "be the change you want to see in the world". I have been active in children and youth organizations for decades (Campfire Boys and Girls and YMCA) and teaching various subjects like English and culture in countries such as Guatemala, Dominica and Denmark. Kristen has been teaching art to young people for over a decade and leading fundraising campaigns for young people and students in developing nations. "Service" is both our middle names!

Now you can be a part of this collaborative creative project with Kristen and me and make a significant impact in the lives of girls.

Risks & Challenges

The risk we face is that we will not get the money to go to the book fair. In that case we will need to fund it ourselves.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute financially you CAN help in other ways:

  • Spread the word about this Indiegogo campaign on Facebook and Tumbler. Use the Indiegogo share tools
  • Spread the word about this Indiegogo campaign on Twitter and use @barrettcpowell in the tweet. Again, use the Indiegogo share tools
  • Download a free preview and leave a rating and written review for others to see how great this book is! If your native language is other than English, we would love for you to write a review in that language! FREE PREVIEW: Lori Leak Travels to Paris

story:
Hi! My name is Mariah!

Thank you for your interest in my campaign! I am an author who has been diligently working towards the completion of the first two books in my new medieval fantasy series titled "The Blood Stone Saga". I am ready to begin the next stage (editing), yet lack the funds to hire a professional editor as well as a few additional requirements in order to successfully publish and release these books.

If you'd like to be a part of this epic adventure and see it come to life, please continue reading on how you can help!

What I Need & What You Get

Here is a breakdown on what you will be receiving for your generous contribution:

  • Professional Editing. Editors are VITAL and worth their weight in gold . They can make the difference between a good book and a GREAT book! This cost will be around $5,200 per book (x 2 = $10,400).
  • Design/Layout for this project will run $900. This includes all phases of design and layout—from the book covers to the illustrations, as well as ensuring the manuscript is print-ready.
  • I'll also need to purchase ISBN numbers for these first two books, each in three different formats: E-book, paperback and hardcover (each format is required to have its own unique number). There is a discount on a pack of 10 ISBN numbers, so buying this quantity will cost $300.
  • Before the works are published, I need to promote the books so I have included the cost of $300 for basic Facebook and Google ads to get this rolling.
  • Also, the "The Blood Stone Saga" needs a live website for fans (like you!) to read news and updates on all that's happening with the series (as well as my progress on the future books)! I've already secured the domain name; what's needed now is to fund the first year of web hosting on Squarespace for $100!
  • If I don't reach my entire goal, the funds received will first and foremost go to editing the books as that is the next crucial step of the process.
All contributors will be thanked on the official website!
Here are the awesome perks that YOU will receive when you contribute:
  • $5 You have my thanks and I will mention you on my author Facebook page!
  • $10 My special thanks, 6" x 4" signed glossy postcard (of a Blood Stone Saga illustration) sent to you and a very nice mention on my Facebook page! ($2 for mailing is additional.)
  • $20 My ♥ hearty thanks ♥, 7" x 5" signed and personalized glossy postcard (of a Blood Stone Saga illustration) and an even bigger mention on my Facebook page! ($2 for mailing is additional.)
  • $45 An even LARGER thank you, and you will receive a FREE E-book of the first book (once published) and a glowing mention on my Facebook page!
  • $60 A gigantic thank you, 50% off the first book in paperback (once published), as well as an excited post about you on Facebook! (Shipping cost is additional.)
  • $80 An enormous thanks for your generosity! You'll receive a FREE paperback copy of the first book (once published)! I will happily write about you on my Facebook author page and include a HUGE thank you on the official website! (Shipping cost is additional.)
  • $200+ You will have my eternal thanks for your belief in me and my books! Additionally you will receive a FREE hardcover of the first book (once published), PLUS the FREE E-book (first book, once published), a heartfelt post about you on my Facebook author page, and you will be personally thanked in my first book! (Shipping cost is additional.)

The Impact This Will Have On My Life

I have had this story whirling around in my mind for 11 years now, and it would bring incredible tears of joy to know that all those long nights spent fleshing out, writing and rewriting these books wasn't all for naught. It has been my never-ending dream to share my stories with friends, family and the world. If I reach my goal with this campaign, it will MAKE THIS DREAM A REALITY!

Other Ways You Can Help

I completely understand if you are unable to contribute monetarily at this time, but here are some other fantastic and much needed ways that everybody can help me with my project:

  • Get the word out to all your friends and help me SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN on Twitter, Facebook, Google+, you name it! For your convenience, you can share the link right here from Indiegogo!

I thank you so very much and appreciate your support for my campaign. I am looking forward to sharing this adventure with you! Let's make it happen!
