story:
Short Summary

Imagine yourself as a passenger in an airplane.  And, in a split second, all hell breaks loose and the airplane crashes to the ground.  And, through the drama and breathlessness of it, you realized that you are the only survivor.  People say that walking away from an airplane crash is surviving it.  That's just the beginning.  You can be spared physical.  But the emotional paralysis is the psychological trauma of it.  Escaping death is one thing.  Getting your life back is quite another. 

As a survivor of child abuse, I was barely hanging on to life with the effects of post traumatic stress dominating my life.  Then, at the age of 23, a miracle happened.  I was nearly killed in a single engine airplane crash in which the other two on board were killed.  I've  written my story of life and tragedy to show why this airplane crash, that I was in, was a miraculous event for reclaiming my life. 

 

Four weeks after Donna Allen (age 23)
came out of her 9 month coma due to her
survival of a deadly airplane crash accident.
 

Donna Allen having lunch in a spinal cord injury
rehabilitation hospital after her survival of a
deadly airplane crash accident.

 

Donna Allen freshly rehabilitated from
the hospital and back into the world.

 

My Book Project

I have created this book editing campaign to raise funds to pay for comprehensive book line editing for my forthcoming autobiography, Crash And Turn.  It is about the drama and breathlessness of the airplane crash, the trials and tribulations that led me to that tragic point, and it is about how I broke the psychological shackles that had prevented me from going after her dreams.  It is a story of true grit. . . . a romantic and spiritual journey. . . great soul, gut-wrenching stuff to hold onto.  I've learned a lot of valuable life lessons through my traumatic experiences and I am passionate about teaching other trauma survivors how they can survive life too.

I have written a manuscript about my turbulent life of child abuse, my young adult life of turmoil, and my survival of a deadly airplane crash.  With the help of your contribution to my book editing campaign fund, I will be able to pay for the professional comprehensive book line-editing of my manuscript and continue on this awesome journey of telling my story.   With a published book, I will be able to teach the principals of Having A Survivor Instinct to a wider audience.  I want to make a difference in other people's lives at my online business at: Survivor Instinct Unlimited, LLC  http://www.survivorinstinct.com/home.html . 

I have been working long and hard on my autobiography book project as well as my Survivor Instinct eBook series and my Survivor Instinct audio book series.  This has become my life's passion to share my story of surviving my own life's adversities and to give other trauma survivors some tools that they can use to develop a Survivor Instinct.  God has given me life and has given me a powerful story to reach out to other people who are looking for a solution to heal the wounded human spirit. 


My Reach-out For Inspiration

I am so passionate about my airplane crash book project that I have reached out to America's "Hero on the Hudson", Captain Chesley "Sully" Sullenberger, who saved all 155 passengers and crew members aboard a disabled airplane that he crash-landed onto the waters of the Hudson River.  At a San Francisco author luncheon and speaking event, I described to Captain Chesley "Sully" Sullenberger, my own harrowing airplane crash survival.  I told  Captain "Sully" of the miracle that happened when I was nearly killed in a single engine airplane crash in which the other two on board were killed.  And I thanked Captain "Sully" for saving all of those people on board his airplane.  I told Captain "Sully" that just by the fact that I saw him save all of those people, on board his airplane, made me feel that he saved me. 
 

 

Donna Allen meeting Captain "Chesley "Sully" Sullenberger (America's hero on the Hudson).



Donna Allen thanking Captain "Sully" for saving all  of the airplane passengers.

 

 

Donna Allen describing her own airplane crash experience to Captain "Sully".

 

    

Captain Chesley "Sully" Sullenberger,
America's "Hero on the Hudson"

 

Captain Chesley "Sully" Sullenberger saved all 155 passengers and crew members aboard a disabled airplane that "Sully" was forced to crash-landed onto the waters of the Hudson River.


After my own harrowing airplane crash survival, I have become very passionate about my life's purpose and about the gifts that God has given to me.  I would like to raise these book editing funds as soon as possible   I will then be able to get the professional book line-editing completed.  Then I will be able to send my manuscript back to the major literary agent who is interested in my book.  I want to reach out to other survivors of trauma and be able to make a difference in their lives through my autobiography, my eBooks, my audio-books, and through my public speaking.


I hope that, through my writing, I can help other trauma survivors to be able to use new coping tools and personal growth tools to develop a Survivor Instinct.  I want to help trauma survivors to turn their lives around.

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

I need to raise $2,000 to achieve my goal of paying for the professional comprehensive line-editing of my manuscript and sending it back to the major literary agent who is interested in my book.

 

Donation Gift-Level Rewards

With each individual donation gift level, I will provide donation gift rewards to each of my campaign contributors.  Among these gift reward levels are articles and eBooks that I have written and published:

    (What contributors will receive with each donation level)

  $ 10  donation gift reward: 
     (6 page article)       

         > 10 Steps To Your Inborn Ability To Survive And Thrive.
 
 

 

$ 25  donation gift reward: 
     (8 page article / 6 page article)
         > Your Survivor Story From Trauma To Transformation.

PLUS:

        > 10 Steps To Your Inborn Ability To Survive And Thrive.
 


  $ 50  donation gift reward: 
     (9 page article / 8 page article / 6 page article)
          > Do Humans Have A Hard Wired Survivor Instinct?

PLUS:
          > Your Survivor Story From Trauma To Transformation.

PLUS:
          > 10 Steps To Your Inborn Ability To Survive And Thrive 

 


  $ 75  donation gift reward: 
     (28 page eBook / 9 page article / 8 page article / 6 page  article)
         > Having A Survivor Instinct.

PLUS:
         > Do Humans Have A Hard Wired Survivor Instinct? 

PLUS:

         > Your Survivor Story From Trauma To Transformation.

PLUS:

         > 10 Steps To Your Inborn Ability To Survive And Thrive. 

 


   $100  donation gift reward:
      (Book chapter / 28 page eBook / 28 page eBook / 9 page article / 8 page article / 6 page article)             

          > The first chapter of Crash And Turn (my airplane crash autobiography )

PLUS:

          > As A Man Thinketh       

 

PLUS:  

          > Having A Survivor Instinct.

PLUS:          

          > Do Humans Have A Hard Wired Survivor Instinct?

PLUS:

          > Your Survivor Story From Trauma To Transformation

PLUS:

          > 10 Steps To Your Inborn Ability To Survive And Thrive.
 

I would like to raise $2,000 in campaign funding to pay for comprehensive book line-editing.  The raised funds will go directly into my book editing funding bank account of my company: Survivor Instinct Unlimited, LLC.
Please help me to reach my $2,000 campaign goal.

 

 

The Impact

There are millions of people, around the world who are living a life of quiet desperation.  They are looking for an answer to heal the wounded human spirit.  I've started this campaign to help me to continue with my life's purpose of reaching a wide audience with my message of hope.  I want to teach the principles of Having A Survivor Instinct  to other trauma survivors of life's adversities.  I would like to achieve this through my forthcoming autobiography and through my trauma survivor products at:
http://www.survivorinstinct.com/products.html

I feel that we all have worth.  We all have value.  Each one of us has something to offer this world.  And when you know that, you will be a better person for it.
 

These are some of the ways your contribution will help make a difference in other people's lives:

I feel that my airplane crash book project is valuable to many of the contributors of my autobiography book editing fund because they will be helping me to make a positive difference in many trauma survivors' lives.  With the help of my contributors, my ultimate goal of having my autobiography published will help many trauma survivors to live again.  These awesome survivors can learn, through my autobiography, about my break through events that had helped me to achieve success, happiness, and the personal creativity that I wanted.  The many readers, of my Survivor Instinct products , can also learn that they are in control of what goes into their minds.  They can learn to tap into motivational material to help them to clear their minds of negative ideas.  This can help them to start making lasting positive changes in their own lives after their traumatic experiences.  With a published book under my belt, it will give me the credentials that I need.  These credentials will afford me many more speaking opportunities where I can reach out to a wider audience with my message of becoming a "Survivor".

 

 

My Track Record


I've had a successful track record with other projects like this:
 

  • I published an eBook called Having A Survivor Instinct: 10 Secrets to Being Stronger, Smarter, and More Skillful at Handling Life's Adversities at www.SurvivorInstinct.com 


     
  • I published an eBook called Take Back Your Life After You've Survived One of Life's Traumatic Adversities: Build Inner Strength and Gain Control.  at http://www.survivorinstinct.com/products.html


     
  • I've written an article called Having A Survivor Instinct  that was published in:
    Spotlight On Recovery Magazine,
    The Victory News Journal,
    Heal My PTSD Blog,
    Reach Out Magazine Online,
    SelfGrowth     at www.selfgrowth.com/articles/Having_a_Survivor_I...
     WE Magazine For Busy Women On The Move  at
    http://wemagazineforwomen.com/how-to-survive-an...
    Donna Allen's author webpage at http://donnaallenlive.com/Survivor_Instinct.php
     
  • I published an article called Your Survivor Story From Trauma To Transformation in SelfGrowth  at
    http://www.selfgrowth.com/articles/your-survivor-story-from-trauma-to-transformation . 
     
  • I am, presently, writing an audio book called Take Control OF Your Life After Surviving Trauma.
     
  • I appeared, as a guest, on the Messages Of Hope Television Show:
    I shared with television show host, Jill Lublin, my experience of overcoming my child abuse trauma and my devastating airplane crash injuries.

    Donna Allen's television interview Part 1


    Donna Allen's television interview Part 2



     
  • I was interviewed on the Dialogues With Dan Radio Show

    I discussed with radio show host, Dan Windheim (a head injury survivor himself), my harrowing airplane crash experience and how I survived it. http://www.rocklandworldradio.com/player/player.php?media=http://www.mediafire.com/file/n7l0umx2yiumj22/ar_dd_02-08-11.mp3&clr_session=1

       Host, Dan Windheim

 

 

  • I had a second interview promoting my Survivor Instinct business on the Dialogues With Dan Radio Show.
    I talked about my life since surviving an airplane crash. I discussed, with radio show host, Dan Windheim, my work on motivation and more.
    http://www.rocklandworldradio.com/player/player.php?media=http://www.mediafire.com/download/u1fwof52q2gbe1z/ar_dd_01-14-14.mp3&clr_session=1

    Host, Dan Windheim
     


 

  • I was interviewed on the Optimal Health Seekers Radio Show.
    I shared how surviving an airplane crash turned tragedy into a personal triumph.  I discussed, with radio show host, Trish Robichaud, my story of breathlessness during the airplane crash, the life trials that led me to that tragic moment, and the gut-wrenching journey that's finally given purpose to my life.
    http://www.blogtalkradio.com/optimalhealthseekersradio/2011/04/03/donna-allen-how-her-plane-crash-tragedy-turned-into-a-personal-triumph


     Host, Trish Robichaud
     

  • I was interviewed on the Conversations LIVE Radio Show.
    I discussed with radio show personality, Cyrus Webb, how I have been able to survive not only child abuse but how surviving a plane crash has changed my life as well.
    http://www.blogtalkradio  .com/middayconversation...


                  Host, Cyrus Webb


     

  • Because I have strong focus, dedication, and determination, in sharing my message of survival, I want to show you trust in me.  I am showing you trust by demonstrating my purposefulness in my television/radio media work, in my author-speaker projects, and in my published writings.


     

Risks & Challenges

I have come a long way since I've started my book project.  Even though I've had physical and financial challenges along the way toward my ultimate goal of having my autobiography published, I have built, within me, the determination that has gotten me to a position closer to publication. 

Through my classical music training in childhood and as a young adult, I've learned some very important qualities and life virtues that I'm drawing upon to keep me driving forward with my book project (focus, challenge, integrity, responsibility, confidence, dedication, and determination).  My brilliant music professors, at the University of California at Berkeley, and my fellow music classmates, friends, and colleges have greatly supported me along the way toward the publication of my autobiography.  My experience in classical music has formed, fashioned, and shaped my engagement in my writing.  It has strengthened my self-discipline in my writing and in my determination to be a published author.

 

Scenes From the Important Classical Music Training That Shaped My Will to Survive and That Strengthened My Writing and Speaking Skills to Lead

 

Donna Allen (age 14) and her piano
teacher (piano virtuoso, Barbara Shearer)
at The Young Musicians Program on the
campus of the University of California
at Berkeley.

During the emotional pain that I was suffering, as an abused child and as an emotionally wounded young adult, I was able to channel all of my emotions through the music and it saved my life.  My strong classical music background has helped me to build inner strength.  Through my 14 years of music study, my 7 years of playing my violin in the UC Berkeley Symphony Orchestra ( age 17 to age 23), and my four years of music teaching experience has helped me to survive some of life's adversities. I've  learned the importance of focus, challenge, integrity, responsibility, confidence, dedication, and determination.  These qualities of moral excellence, that I've learned through my classical music training, have helped me to survive the many years of child abuse and also the aftermath of my tragic airplane crash accident.   These qualities of moral excellence, that I've learned, will also help me to succeed as a published author of my autobiography.  The undertakings that I have previously had (some temporary physical mobility challenges and some unfortunate financial betrayals by loved ones after my airplane crash accident) has just made me more determined to publish my autobiography, to share my survivor story, and to teach my survivor instinct principals to other trauma survivors.   I want to help guide other trauma survivors who feel that they have no hope.  The determination that I've built within me, as an abused child and as a violinist, has given me inner strength and has helped me to survive the aftermath of my traumatic airplane crash accident.  As they say,"That which does not kill me, makes me stronger."  (Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche). 

My plan for solving these physical challenges is, to not only draw energy from the beneficial qualities of my inner strength and from the encouragement from my family and friends, but to also reach out to the skilled technicians, in the literary profession, who can help me to get over the editing, publishing, and promotion hurtles that stand in the way of many writers' publishing goals.     With your financial support, I can have a wider reach of literary technicians.  These professional  experts can help me to achieve my life's purpose by editing and publishing my autobiography and by helping me to promote my autobiography to the masses.
 
  • What qualifies me to overcome these hurdles is my strong determination to show other trauma survivors that they have it within them to build a survivor instinct.  By showing other people of traumatic mishaps, my own survival story, they can also become stronger, smarter, and more skillful at handling life's adversities.  I will teach these survivor instinct principles through my trauma survivor business (Survivor Instinct Unlimited, LLC).  And with a published book under my belt, I can open more doors to speak about developing a Survivor Instinct.
     
  • My  plan for solving these challenges is to hire skilled literary professionals to help me with the challenging steps that I face toward getting my autobiography edited and  published.  And with your contribution to my book campaign, I can achieve this.  I invite you to go on this awesome journey with me.

 

 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    I know that some people just can't contribute to my book campaign, but they can help my book project in other ways:

    • I'd like to ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
       
    • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

    And that's all there is to it.

    Please help me to achieve my funding goals.  I'm sending a heart warming thanks and appreciation to all of my supporters and contributors of my book project.

Short Summary
Imagine yourself as a passenger in an airplane.  And, in a split second, all hell breaks loose and the airplane crashes to the ground.  And, through the drama and breathlessness of it, you realized that you are the only survivor.  People say that walking away from an airplane crash is surviving it.  That's just the beginning.  You can be spared physical.  But the emotional paralysis is the psychological trauma of it.  Escaping death is one thing.  Getting your life back is quite another. As a survivor of child abuse, I was barely hanging on to life with the effects of post traumatic stress dominating my life.  Then, at the age of 23, a miracle happened.  I was nearly killed in a single engine airplane crash in which the other two on board were killed.  I've  written my story of life and tragedy to show why this airplane crash, that I was in, was a miraculous event for reclaiming my life. 
 

Four weeks after Donna Allen (age 23)came out of her 9 month coma due to hersurvival of a deadly airplane crash accident. 

Donna Allen having lunch in a spinal cord injuryrehabilitation hospital after her survival of adeadly airplane crash accident.  Donna Allen freshly rehabilitated fromthe hospital and back into the world. My Book Project
I have created this book editing campaign to raise funds to pay for comprehensive book line editing for my forthcoming autobiography, Crash And Turn.  It is about the drama and breathlessness of the airplane crash, the trials and tribulations that led me to that tragic point, and it is about how I broke the psychological shackles that had prevented me from going after her dreams.  It is a story of true grit. . . . a romantic and spiritual journey. . . great soul, gut-wrenching stuff to hold onto.  I've learned a lot of valuable life lessons through my traumatic experiences and I am passionate about teaching other trauma survivors how they can survive life too.
I have written a manuscript about my turbulent life of child abuse, my young adult life of turmoil, and my survival of a deadly airplane crash.  With the help of your contribution to my book editing campaign fund, I will be able to pay for the professional comprehensive book line-editing of my manuscript and continue on this awesome journey of telling my story.   With a published book, I will be able to teach the principals of Having A Survivor Instinct to a wider audience.  I want to make a difference in other people's lives at my online business at: Survivor Instinct Unlimited, LLC  http://www.survivorinstinct.com/home.html . 
I have been working long and hard on my autobiography book project as well as my Survivor Instinct eBook series and my Survivor Instinct audio book series.  This has become my life's passion to share my story of surviving my own life's adversities and to give other trauma survivors some tools that they can use to develop a Survivor Instinct.  God has given me life and has given me a powerful story to reach out to other people who are looking for a solution to heal the wounded human spirit. 

My Reach-out For Inspiration

I am so passionate about my airplane crash book project that I have reached out to America's "Hero on the Hudson", Captain Chesley "Sully" Sullenberger, who saved all 155 passengers and crew members aboard a disabled airplane that he crash-landed onto the waters of the Hudson River.  At a San Francisco author luncheon and speaking event, I described to Captain Chesley "Sully" Sullenberger, my own harrowing airplane crash survival.  I told  Captain "Sully" of the miracle that happened when I was nearly killed in a single engine airplane crash in which the other two on board were killed.  And I thanked Captain "Sully" for saving all of those people on board his airplane.  I told Captain "Sully" that just by the fact that I saw him save all of those people, on board his airplane, made me feel that he saved me.  
 
 Donna Allen meeting Captain "Chesley "Sully" Sullenberger (America's hero on the Hudson).Donna Allen thanking Captain "Sully" for saving all  of the airplane passengers.  
 Donna Allen describing her own airplane crash experience to Captain "Sully".     
Captain Chesley "Sully" Sullenberger,America's "Hero on the Hudson"
 
 Captain Chesley "Sully" Sullenberger saved all 155 passengers and crew members aboard a disabled airplane that "Sully" was forced to crash-landed onto the waters of the Hudson River.After my own harrowing airplane crash survival, I have become very passionate about my life's purpose and about the gifts that God has given to me.  I would like to raise these book editing funds as soon as possible   I will then be able to get the professional book line-editing completed.  Then I will be able to send my manuscript back to the major literary agent who is interested in my book.  I want to reach out to other survivors of trauma and be able to make a difference in their lives through my autobiography, my eBooks, my audio-books, and through my public speaking.I hope that, through my writing, I can help other trauma survivors to be able to use new coping tools and personal growth tools to develop a Survivor Instinct.  I want to help trauma survivors to turn their lives around.

I need to raise $2,000 to achieve my goal of paying for the professional comprehensive line-editing of my manuscript and sending it back to the major literary agent who is interested in my book.

The Impact
There are millions of people, around the world who are living a life of quiet desperation.  They are looking for an answer to heal the wounded human spirit.  I've started this campaign to help me to continue with my life's purpose of reaching a wide audience with my message of hope.  I want to teach the principles of Having A Survivor Instinct  to other trauma survivors of life's adversities.  I would like to achieve this through my forthcoming autobiography and through my trauma survivor products at:http://www.survivorinstinct.com/products.htmlI feel that we all have worth.  We all have value.  Each one of us has something to offer this world.  And when you know that, you will be a better person for it. 
These are some of the ways your contribution will help make a difference in other people's lives:I feel that my airplane crash book project is valuable to many of the contributors of my autobiography book editing fund because they will be helping me to make a positive difference in many trauma survivors' lives.  With the help of my contributors, my ultimate goal of having my autobiography published will help many trauma survivors to live again.  These awesome survivors can learn, through my autobiography, about my break through events that had helped me to achieve success, happiness, and the personal creativity that I wanted.  The many readers, of my Survivor Instinct products , can also learn that they are in control of what goes into their minds.  They can learn to tap into motivational material to help them to clear their minds of negative ideas.  This can help them to start making lasting positive changes in their own lives after their traumatic experiences.  With a published book under my belt, it will give me the credentials that I need.  These credentials will afford me many more speaking opportunities where I can reach out to a wider audience with my message of becoming a "Survivor".

    Host, Dan Windheim

I discussed, with radio show host, Dan Windheim, my work on motivation and more.http://www.rocklandworldradio.com/player/player.php?media=http://www.mediafire.com/download/u1fwof52q2gbe1z/ar_dd_01-14-14.mp3&clr_session=1 Host, Dan Windheim 
 
I was interviewed on the Optimal Health Seekers Radio Show.I shared how surviving an airplane crash turned tragedy into a personal triumph.  I discussed, with radio show host, Trish Robichaud, my story of breathlessness during the airplane crash, the life trials that led me to that tragic moment, and the gut-wrenching journey that's finally given purpose to my life.http://www.blogtalkradio.com/optimalhealthseekersradio/2011/04/03/donna-allen-how-her-plane-crash-tragedy-turned-into-a-personal-triumph  Host, Trish Robichaud 


I was interviewed on the Conversations LIVE Radio Show.I discussed with radio show personality, Cyrus Webb, how I have been able to survive not only child abuse but how surviving a plane crash has changed my life as well.http://www.blogtalkradio  .com/middayconversation...              Host, Cyrus Webb 

Because I have strong focus, dedication, and determination, in sharing my message of survival, I want to show you trust in me.  I am showing you trust by demonstrating my purposefulness in my television/radio media work, in my author-speaker projects, and in my published writings.

story:
Kurt W. Bubna is the founding and senior pastor of Eastpoint Church in Spokane Valley, WA. He is a regular and nationally recognized blogger and the author of five published books. (Click here to see his current books on Amazon, including his first children’s book: Pete the Prodigal Pumpkin.)

Every child is afraid of something. Bye-Bye Monsters is book is about facing our fears. Sometimes fear is reasonable and rational, but often it cripples and demoralizes. Too often we are paralyzed by unwarranted anxiety.

This full-color and professionally illustrated children’s book will help kids recognize and overcome irrational fears. The rhyming story chronicles the fears of a boy named Boo who was so afraid he didn’t know what to do. In the end, it dawns on Boo, “What would I do if I remembered it’s true—God’s bigger than me and you?”

As you can imagine, creating and publishing a full-sized (8.5 x 11), full-color children’s book is pricey. However, helping children deal with their fears makes every dollar of your investment worth it.

Here’s a breakdown of the total project cost of $3,800:

$ 2,500 to pay the artist for 20 full-color illustrations

$ 500 for professional editing and publication costs

$ 450 for media support and advertising

$ 350 for an initial run of books for distribution to potential reviewers/endorsers

I know this book will impact the lives of many children!

So here’s how you can help:

  • Give any amount you can as a tax-deductible gift of love for children. No gift is too small to make a difference.
  • Give a tax-deductible gift of as little as $25, and you’ll receive a digital version (in a pdf format) of my book: Perfectly Imperfect ~ A Devotional for Grace-Filled Living!
  • For a gift of at least $50, you will receive a free and signed copy of Bye-Bye, Monsters ~ Facing Your Fears when it releases.
  • For a gift of at least $75, you will receive a signed copy of Bye-Bye, Monsters ~ Facing Your Fears plus a free and signed copy of one of Kurt’s five other books (your choice).
  • Go big and give anything from $100 up and you’ll receive Bye-Bye, Monsters ~ Facing Your Fears, Pete the Prodigal Pumpkin, and your choice of one of any of Kurt’s other five books.

By the way, any funds received in excess of our goal will remain in the Essential Life Press (ELP) accounts for future projects.

Bye-Bye Monsters is a Christian book, published by Eastpoint’s publishing ministry (ELP), and is a project consistent with our mission to advance the Gospel and to disciple people. Therefore, all gifts are fully tax-deductible (less the actual cost of whatever you receive in exchange for your gift).

Please use the Indiegogo share tools on this site to pass the word.

Thank you for investing in the lives of children!

Texassippi Soul Man Danny Brooks & Lil Miss Debi would like to welcome you aboard our new project ‘Miracles For Breakfast: The Journey Continues’ which is the first book in a 7 Book, Miracles For Breakfast Series which is equal parts motivational, inspirational, sharing time tested principles at self-improvement. The book has received a very warm endorsement from legendary motivational writer/speaker Denis Waitley, whose books ‘Seeds of Greatness’ and ‘Timing is Everything’ greatly inspired Danny when he got out of the Donwood Rehabilitation Center, May 8th 1987.

The purpose of this book and series is to help substance abusers, their families, friends, and employers to deal with addictions and finding workable solutions to bring healing and healthy living. Texassippi Soul Man, Danny Brooks and I go into prisons, rehabs and halfway houses on every tour and know we have a winning Music Motivation Presentation.

We are just putting the finishing touches on the book and want to self-publish through Amazon and need funding. We are asking for $10,000 to cover costs of editing services, hard copy book printing, mail-outs to encourage readership, and promotions/advertising for the book on various digital platforms, and some magazines.

Testimonial from Former Prison Inmate

* Where travel is involved, it is dependent on tour schedule and accessibility (possible additional travel expenses may apply should location require air travel).

* Recognized as a Financial Contributor in the book, is based upon contributions received prior to printing of Miracles for Breakfast:  The Journey Continues.

story:
My name is Kyle Miron. I'm a Brain Cancer Samurai, Father of (2) Knuckleheads, and a Humble servant to the Lord.

After being diagnosed with Stage (4) Brain Cancer in 2016, each doctor not-so-politely told me to "plan a funeral" or "the odds are not in your favor." 

When I heard these testaments coming from the experts  my instant response was always "Well, Doc, Cancer never met a guy like me."

WE ARE IN A GENERATION OF CANCER

Not only physical cancers of the body, but of the mind and the soul. I have delivered  my message on the highest stage in a TEDx talk.

After proclaiming my personal cure to the world, I felt magnetized and excited knowing that my truth and experience was going to possibly help the  lives of many who have been afflicted or know someone who has been diagnosed with Cancer.

The highlight of my presentation and which created the most fulfillment for me, was that I was able to connect the philosophy of becoming a "CANCER SAMURAI;" a warrior that is willing to KILL this cancer before it has the opportunity to kill you.

THEN MY SPEECH; MY LIFE'S WORK WAS CENSORED.

They would not post it to the main page or any of their social outlets mostly because they claimed my talk lacked scientific proof.

In that moment I knew that what I had said on the stage was not something that those in power of the main stream narrative wanted to be spread to the masses. I saw many Tedx talks that were mostly conjecture or theory.

If I can't get my message delivered on the world stage, if it doesn't fly with [their agenda]; then I will self-publish, and with your help, get this valuable message out to the masses - FOR FREE.

 

What's in the book?

E-book, Printed, & Audio-book versions  will contain and methods of action which I implemented from diagnosis, to surgery, through chemo, radiation, and remission.

The Printed version will include pictures of the journal entries and brain scans visually showcasing the effects my Samurai Mindset, nourishing diet  & routine, and emotional awareness  had on the shrinking and eradication of the cancerous tumors inside my brain.

 

  • There's (14) Steps that I feel were the major components to how I beat my cancer
  • Much of the Content has already been shared in my TedX talk (but you can't see that)
  • I created this booklet to be re-readable and instantly uplifting for anyone battling Cancer

 

CO-VID Set me Back

But maybe th.at's a good thing. I was planning on funding this through the profits I made with my film company, Blade Creative, but many deals didn't go through, and the dollars simply are not there

  • I need your help to get the necessary funds to launch this book in the most influential way possible. By creating legacy content and delivering the highest quality product available.
  • These funds will be going to the production of the mini-documentary describing my journey, the voice-over talent for the Audio-Version and the printing,  publishing, and promotion of the physical book.
  • I will be giving this book away for Free

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Times are chaotic and truly tough right now. If you can't make a monetary donation, please share this campaign as far and wide as you can on your social media channels. 

I know and understand that God is in control of where and how far this message will go.

You can help me reach millions of humans around the world whose lives have been affected by Cancer, and immediately give them the weapons and a fighting chance to not only survive but DOMINATE!

Thank you for your support and love.

Here is the opening words to Brain Status: Unremarkable.

Good Journey, my friends.

story:
The Dreamscape Series

Today's young dreamers will grow to become the next generation of leaders for change. Together, we can make a difference. Together, we can inspire and nurture a love for diversity that will create a more inclusive world.  Let's raise our kids to rise together.

We dream big! Right now, our goal is to publish 10 books within The Dreamscape Series. We've launched with two: Origami Orchestra and Baked In). Our latest, Unicorn Horn Mountain, is currently in the illustration process and will release in Spring of 2021. The other seven books are in various states of development, but all are outlined and planned.

 

Meet Our Hero

Representation matters.

 

As I began creating the worlds within The Dreamscape Series books, I set a few guiding principles for the collection to ensure they remain inclusive, cohesive, and true to my mission:

  • From book to book, the skin tone of the main character changes in order to depict and celebrate the many shades of humanity.
  • In every dreamscape (the world and landscape within the illustrated dream), the character’s gender remains non-binary in order to allow readers to see themselves—no matter how they identify—within the dream. This helps readers connect visually and feel included.
  • And, much like our dreams, each book is illustrated in a different way to depict diversity within the arts and introduce new concepts and points of view. It encourages thinking outside the box, outside your own bubble.
  1. Origami Orchestra celebrates Asian art and introduces instruments. 
  2. Baked In celebrates pop art.
  3. Unicorn Horn Mountain will celebrate mural art (inspired by street art).

Why do we have these guidelines? We are different colors. We are different genders. We are inspired by different art styles. Our world is wonderfully versatile and our differences should be celebrated and welcomed.

 

 

Author + Illustrator

Ammie Elliott and Travis McCoy are different ages, different genders, different colors, from different backgrounds...but they are both dreamers and believers in change. We can do this together!

 

Ammie

I am the daughter of immigrants. My parents moved here from Wales on a work visa 40+ years ago, and I grew up with a hard-working, self-made dad and a mom who read to me every...single...night. When I was five, my mom introduced me to the worlds of Seuss and Shel Silverstein. I read Where the Sidewalk Ends, and let me tell you, my sidewalk didn't end...my world infinitely expanded. I decided then and there that I would grow up to become a writer to inspire other kids and make an impact on this world.

Ammie Elliott, then to right now, has created thousands of worlds, told just as many tales, and has nurtured countless dreams. All of which have led me to build a collection of picture books called The Dreamscape Series.

The Inspiration

The Dreamscape Series first sparked to life as I watched my daughter sleep when she was an infant. The peace. The symphony of her breaths. I was overcome by wonder reminiscent of when I uncovered my own imagination. I wondered about the worlds unfolding in her mind and reveled in the idea of her dreams being untethered by stereotypes. Young children aren’t sexist or racist; they don’t see differences as bad because EVERYTHING is new and fresh...and exciting. It inspired me to create worlds that aren’t blind to our differences but celebrate them within a limitless dreamscape.

 

Travis

Travis, known in the art world as TRVS, specializes in surrealism to express his creativity. His style comes from his fascination with modern art and its long history. Never seeing an end to what is possible when you set your mind to it, he combines textures, fabrics, and literature into a juxtaposition of works. His focus is anatomy, using body language to spark imagination and invoke emotional interests. When asked what does art mean to you? McCoy responded, 

“I feel like I’m always clearing an obstacle. Patiently searching for what I don’t understand. I seek it, aiming to solve the impossible puzzle.”

Travis McCoy was born and raised in Columbus, Ohio. At a young age, Travis began teaching himself the many facets of illustration, painting, and design. In college, he picked up graphic design as a major and pursued the craft in an effort to enhance his ideas. McCoy later refocused his energy on being an entrepreneur in his field. Throughout the years, McCoy has curated his own galleries and launched a clothing line. 

 

How YOU Can Help Us Make a Difference

The more kids we connect with and the further we extend our hands out, the more opportunity we have to progress toward becoming a more inclusive world. By engaging young dreamers with a collection of books that depicts differences as natural, and shows them a more inclusive world, then the more likely they are to grow up to transform dream worlds into a real world of celebrated inclusivity. 

You can help buy contributing to this campaign and picking a perk. If you can't do that, sharing our campaign and products with anyone you know helps us reach fellow dreamers. Now is the time to engage and inspire new leaders.

 

What We Need & What You Get

All the money within our fund goal, now matter how much, will go toward:

  • Marketing 
  • Website design
  • Product development
  • Print and publishing costs (this one's a doozey!)
  • Creating more books

The Perks?

  • Signed books
  • Digital copies
  • Coloring pages and activities 
  • Limited-edition stickers 
  • A live, virtual reading by the author
  • Art prints
  • Party packs

Together, can can bring about a better, more diverse and inclusive world.

story:
Hello from Athens,

my name is Dimitra Ioannou and I am the editor of the journal A) GLIMPSE) OF) an independent, ad-free magazine which publishes works by contemporary writers & artists in order to generate new narratives for the now. It operates online (aglimpseof.net) with themed issues, Narratives in Progress, and more.

What was originally initiated as an experiment (how to link literary, visual and sound works through a linguistic game), grew up organically to become a platform and, occasionally, a print journal. A) GLIMPSE) OF) has already featured works by 160 prose writers, poets, sound artists and visual artists from 20 countries. That’s why we like to call A) GLIMPSE) OF) a collective work of art, or an international collective of the mind.

Two bilingual print issues have already been published (2013, 2014). The second one was supported by the NEON cultural organization (Athens, Greece).

Although nowadays there are no funds for literary and art magazines in Greece, I felt it was crucial to create another print issue (this time only in English, translations into Greek will be published online).

Now, whether we live in Athens, Boston, Bucharest, or Glasgow, we share similar conditions and needs. Lately, I’ve been hearing the word “zophos” which means “darkness; obscurity; melancholia; the dark side of the horizon.” A very strong Greek word to describe social malaise. 

How are we equipping ourselves for reality? Where do we imagine ourselves less vulnerable? How will we shape new ground upon which we can imagine and thrive? How will we claim space for tenderness, empathy, awareness, humor and beauty?

A) GLIMPSE) OF) invited 27 international poets, artists, and an environmental scientist to reflect on today’s realities. What they offer is a groundbreaking narrative for the now, a narrative that enriches our conception of the present, and broadens our vision of the future.

The Realities and the Rituals of the Upside Down issue features
• poetry by Jay Besemer, Theodoros Chiotis, Maria Damon, Helen Dimos, Universal Jenny, Donna Fleischer, Clive Gresswel, Ray McKenzie, C. Kubasta, Iulia Militaru, John Morgan, Alice Notley, Christina Ntanovasili, Nat Raha, Sandra Simonds, Tom Snarsky, and Alan Sondheim
• original artworks by Antonis Donef, Lito Kattou and Anna Lascari
• a conversation with the poet CAConrad
• critical ideas by the environmental scientist Giorgos Kallis
• Narratives in Progress by Amy McCauley (on consolatory art), by Eva Moreda (on translation) and Rebecca Wilcox (on affective sound)
• columns by Louisa Doloksa (on literature and bowels), Kyriaki Goni (on urban rituals ) and D.I. (Hot Athens).

We rely on your generosity to cover production costs and send A) GLIMPSE) OF) to the printer. All support is critical and appreciated.

Thank you!

Dimitra Ioannou


 

WHO ARE WE?

Dimitra Ioannou (editor) experiments with narrative or anti-narrative forms in various medias (language, photography, publications). Her radio-play How Poems-Cities was specially commissioned by the Onassis Cultural Centre (2018) for the Radio_OCC series. Her work has appeared in ZARF, Tears in the Fence, DATABLEED, Litmus, Blackbox Manifold, and the anthology Futures: Poetry of the Greek Crisis. Some of her poems were exhibited in group shows in Greece. She is the author of the novella Soy Sea (Futura, Athens), and a former journalist.

Marianna Vouza (Designer) is a graphic designer based in Athens. Since 2010 she has been working in different kinds of design projects, such as branding, publications, packaging and exhibition design. Music, illustration and cooking are also few of the things she loves. When not in front of her computer, she will be traveling.

Dora Vasilakou (Assistant editor) is an independent curator and researcher based in Athens. She holds a degree in Archaeology and Art History from the Aristotle University of Thessaloniki. Following the completion of her studies, she interned at DNA Gallery in Berlin. Since 2014, she has organized and assisted in the curation of group and solo exhibitions in Athens and Thessaloniki. Her work focuses on the intersection between art, politics and social issues.

Antonis Katsouris (Editor-at-large) is a writer based in Athens, and the editor of the Closet reading series.

We put together an inspiring issue. Realities and the Rituals of the Upside Down has a front and back cover detail from an original work by the artist Lito Kattou. It is dedicated to the color yellow, a color that reminds and encourages.

Limited edition / 17 x 24 cm / 80 pages / 8 color pages / offset printing .

Video music

- The music for the campaign video is an arrangement of Simeon Ten Holt’s ‘Canto Ostinato’ for toy instruments by Alexandros Drosos (2016). It is published by Fytini, a greek DIY label, interested in the production of queer, performative, experimental and theatrical music alongside sound in hybritic media cultures.

Perks

~ The Yellow Postcard

Sometimes the now is not really new. A) GLIMPSE) OF) would like to generate new narratives for the now, narratives that break new ground upon which we can thrive.

Limited edition of 100.

~ The Yellow Poster

The Yellow Poster features some lines, titles and phrases found in the issue. Designed by Marianna Vouza. (30 X 42 cm // limited edition of 100)

~ The Black Tote bag

The Blag Tote bag features some lines, titles and phrases found in the issue. Designed by Marianna Vouza. 

38 X 42 cm // limited edition of 100// Please note, the tote bag might be different from the one shown in the picture.

~ Pandora’s box is an artwork in the form of a two player board game created by Evangelos Kyriakos, a jewellery designer based in Athens. The myth of Pandora’s box is used as a starting point to think about hope, and the importance of the play element in our culture. As the Dutch historian and cultural theorist Johan Huizinga stated in his book Homo Ludens, “Play is older than culture, for culture, however inadequately defined, always presupposes human society, and animals have not waited for man to teach them their playing.” The loser is the person who is left to get the last piece.

Pandora’s box (35 X 5 X 3.5 cm) consists of a wooden box, a fabric, a bamboo stick, handmade clay pieces, a pouch, and a set of rules. Enjoy!

 

~ Hot Athens tour

Hot Athens is the title of a column for the Realities and the Rituals of the Upside Down issue. Written by Dimitra Ioannou, it's also a way to appropriate the city, reverse its mythologies, and imagine new ones. If you visit Athens in 2019 and you are “A) GLIMPSE) OF) FAIRY,” Dimitra Ioannou will organize a three hour Hot Athens tour. Details to be discussed with each contributor.

What are the funds for?

We need to raise the minimum sum of 4,000 dollars (3500 euros) to secure the forthcoming print issue of A) GLIMPSE) OF). This amount includes the cost of printing, minimum fees (graphic designer, editorial team), translation costs, and costs connected to Indie GoGo.  

Extra funds?

If we go over our goal, we might be able to pay contributors an honorary fee, and work on the summer 2019 issue!

 

A BIG THANK YOU TO YOU!!!

story:
Short Summary

C.L. Young aka Krazybwoy is currently incarcerated in Kentucky. Since writing him through Black & Pink's pen pal program, he's also become a dear friend of mine. He and I quickly realized we had a lot in common, including a passion for activist work (Krazybwoy works tirelessly to learn about legal rights and organize for himself and his fellow prisoners) and a love of all things witchy and occult-related. About a year ago, I started sending him images from the Major Arcana (the first 22 cards of a tarot deck) and he wrote me back with his interpretations and stories about the card. In an effort to get Krazybwoy commissary money to help bring his life inside a bit more comfort and to help support his spiritual and political organizing, we decided to turn this into The Prison Arcana Tarot Zine. 

Krazybwoy has experienced intense violence and discrimination based on his race, sexuality, and spiritual beliefs. He's been locked up in solitary three times since we've been writing (two and a half years) and more before that. He has made numerous attempts to gain more rights for his fellow prisoners using the legal library and attempting to get books and other organizing materials from the outside. It has proven deeply difficult. The money from this zine won't solve all of these obstacles (prisons are designed to make organizing near-impossible), but it will help a little, and for an incarcerated person, a little goes a long way. 

This zine will be completed during an unpaid eight-day residency that I've been selected for at The Future in Minneapolis, where I will have access to to a Risso printer. Part of this campaign is to raise money to support my time at the residency, but the majority of the money - and anything collected in sales after the campaign has ended - will go to Krazybwoy. The breakdown is below. 

What We Need & What You Get

The bulk of the writing for the zine is done. I (Raechel) have also been chosen for an (unpaid) residency at The Future in Minneapolis where I will have access to a Risso printer to make the zines. We're asking for $3,000 for the initial printing and $300 to cover Indiegogo's cut from our fundraising. The money will be used to buy paper and other materials for the zines, cover postage for mailing zines, website fees, and my time at the residency. The rest of the money will go to Krazybwoy.

Here's the estimated breakdown: 

$1,000: directly to Krazybwoy's commissary for his labor writing the bulk of the zine contents; he requests commissary money for basic comforts inside prison (warm socks, clean sheets, snacks, etc) and also ordering legal and spiritual resources for his organizing work (currently he has to order directly from the prison and books cannot be sent to him) 

$1,000: Raechel's 8-day residency at The Future (where she will perform the labor to edit, write the preface, design, print, and assemble the zine). This averages to ~$15/hour during these 8 days only and does not include work prior to the residency, such as finding and recruiting an artist, building a website, etc. 

$1,000: printing and postage supplies, initial mailings, website fees (postage and envelopes cost a ton and good paper isn't cheap either!)

$300: to cover Indiegogo's 5% fees + 3% credit card fees


OTHER THINGS ABOUT MONEY DISTRIBUTION/TRANSPARENCY: 

*We received a grant from the History Design Studio at Harvard to pay an incarcerated or formerly incarcerated artist for images for the zine. That money will go directly to the artist. 

*If we don't reach the $3,300 goal: Krazybwoy will get $1,000 no matter what, and any additional money will go to cover mailing and supply costs. Raechel will get paid last, if any money remains after supplies and postage.

*If we exceed the $3,300 goal: 70% will go directly to Krazybwoy, 20% will be donated to Black & Pink, and 10% will be reserved to continue to pay the artists. Black & Pink is an abolition organization that supports LGBTQIA and HIV+ incarcerated people (and the organization that first linked Raechel to Krazybwoy). 

*After the campaign ends, money from additional sales of the zine ($20 each) will be used in the following way: to cover supplies and postage (estimated $2-3/zine),  B&P donation at $1/zine, and all remaining profits directly to Krazybwoy and the artists. 

 

 

Here's the donation breakdown: 

$5+: a deep amount of gratitude from our hearts!
$20: copy of the zine mailed to you when it's complete (projected Spring 2019)
$30: a copy of the zine and your name in the acknowledgements section of the zine
$40: a copy of the zine for you and sponsoring a copy for an incarcerated person (plus acknowledgment in the zine!)
$60: a copy of the zine for you and TWO sponsored zines for incarcerated folks (plus acknowledgment in the zine!)
$75: a copy of the zine for you, a sponsored zine for an incarcerated person, your name in the acknowledgements, and a three-card tarot reading from me (recording or Skype; in-person may be available in MN, schedules depending)
$100: a copy of the zine for you, a sponsored zine for an incarcerated person, your name in the acknowledgements, and a five-card tarot reading from me (recording or Skype; in-person may be available in MN, schedules depending)

Any amount is greatly appreciated! 

The Impact

This project will not just make a difference to Krazybwoy, but it will also positively impact all of the incarcerated people Krazybwoy aims to help through political organizing and spiritual community-building. In addition, this zine will reach any incarcerated person who is interested in using tarot as a method of healing and coping (which both Krazybwoy and I do in our own life). "Free world" people who read the zine will also get a better sense of the struggles experienced by incarcerated people and ideally will have a heightened sense of empathy for their struggles. Additionally, anyone who practices tarot will be able to expand their understanding of the deck through the interpretation of a marginalized person whose voice is not generally heard in the (overwhelmingly white) public witch world.

If you are invested in a world without prisons, we invite you to consider this project as a small step in that magical direction. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know money is tight for so many of us, so if donating isn't it the cards, we totally get it! That said, there are other (free!) ways to help support this campaign. 

  • Share this on your social media and with your local community groups! 
  • Ask your local witch store or progressive book store to stock the zine! 
  • Write to an incarcerated person! Check out Black & Pink for some resources! 
  • Donate books to your local Books Through Bars organization! 
  • Send us good energy, light a candle for this campaign, cast a spell that helps us reach our goal. Krazybwoy and I actually believe in that kind of thing <3 

Thank you for your support.

story:
Shortly



We will create a community that will be able to experiment an environmental friendly lifestyle  , respecting and using the natural resources available   while trying to exchange opinions and ideas whit our friends and supporters..

My name is Salvatore Rubulotta, I love my Sicily, my homeland, and I have always fought to try to prevent many young people like me to have to move abroad in order to find a job.

Together with my friends Pietro, Laura and my girlfriend Marica we would very much like to build a new and more sustainable way of living .An alternative way to consumerism, a lifestyle that would allow us to respect nature, produce goods as food, energy and so on without having to disrupt nature balance, without destroying or damage the environment .

Our goal will be to live in as much harmony as we can with the planet rhythm and energy.
We will start with buying a suitable piece of  land on Mount Etna.
There we will build an eco- friendly village where, through permaculture and  photovoltaic plants for instance, we can create a  self-sufficient community (which will be able to produce power and food) .
That will allow us to create jobs and opportunities that could be offered worldwide , to all the people willing to try this new way of life. What we ask for is your support,! Give us a hand to build this dream donating as much as you reckon you can, even a drop is very important and valued. We need the money to buy the land and commence working in transforming it in our dreamland!

 

Brevemente

 

Qui in Italia stiamo diventando la generazione "pensione mai".
Il futuro vede molti nostri amici fuori dal paese, lontani dagli affetti, in cerca di altri sogni.
Noi non ci stiamo ma lamentarci non fa per noi.
Siamo Salvo e Piero, due imprenditori e amanti della nostra terra, la Sicilia, e, in un momento di importanti interrogavi , abbiamo scelto di trovare le risposte.
Nasce così il bisogno di metterci in gioco, come si faceva da bambini, attraverso la progettazione di un'isola che non c'è, un nuovo mondo disegnato a misura del tempo e della natura. 
Vogliamo riprendere le nostre vite ed offrire a chiunque ne abbia voglia, la possibilità di vivere in un eco villaggio e sperimentare uno stile di vita alternativo a quello che la società ci offre.
Etna Bio Valley nasce ai piedi dell'Etna , il vulcano attivo più grande d'europa ed oggi patrimonio dell'Unesco. 
Vogliamo rimettere in moto la nostra terra, rivalutando i nostri valori e spendendoci per qualcosa che valga davvero la pena fare : VIVERE.
Il motto della nostra idea è Life in progress e qui potrete trovare qualche informazione in più :
http://catania.meridionews.it/articolo/7430/etn...


 

Cosa ci serve e cosa Vi diamo
 

  • Il nostro fabbisogno è di 232 mila Euro
     
  • 120,000 Euro serviranno per acquistare il terreno di 50 mila mq;                                        (attualmente in comodato d'uso gratuito per 8 anni)
  • 42,000 Euro per i lavori di ristrutturazione del casolare e dei ruderi presenti;
  • 70 000 Euro per l'acquisto di 2 case su ruote per i wwofer, i moduli fotovoltaici con parco batterie e la piantumazione di biodiversità come alberi da frutto e vigneti. 

    Non disponiamo di questa cifra e vorremmo chiedere il tuo aiuto, un contributo in base alle tue possibilità o al tuo coinvolgimento in una missione pulita che vuol essere d'aiuto anche a chi , dalla nostra riuscita, potrà vederci una opportunità per ricominciare ed aggregarsi a noi.

    ​Con Etna Bio Valley, #Lifeinprogress vogliamo ottenere TRE GRANDI RISULTATI

     

  • Autoproduzione Energetica , attraverso moduli offgrid, cucina a legna e energie alternative senza l'allaccio con il gestore energetico nazionale (NO AL PIZZO DEL CANONE RAI)
  • Grazie ai perks, i riconoscimenti, avrai l'opportunità di stare in contatto con noi ed essere aggiornato settimanalmente. Puoi anche venirci a trovare come ospite e immergerti nella natura e riscoprire il valore del tempo ma anche conoscere la nostra terra, la Sicilia.
  • Aiutiamo persone che non riescono a trovare una direzione se non quella di lasciare l'Italia, a riscoprirsi padroni di un' infinità di valori e talenti che ci appartengono
  • Il Proprietario della terreno dove siamo in comodato d'uso, rinnoverà il contratto se ne avremo bisogno, quindi , anche se non dovessimo riuscire ad ottenere l'importo necessario, potremmo comunque andare avanti con la realizzazione del progetto, anche con un tuo piccolo contributo riusciremo ad andare avanti.
 

 

 

 

Altri modi per aiutarci

  • Condividi a più non posso la nostra campagna
  • contattaci per suggerimenti o idee da darci

story:
Change Yourself, Change the World


In its third year, Psychology Tomorrow Magazine (PTM) continues its mission to publish and promote the work of thought-changing psychologists, therapists, scientists, artists, healers, and writers who are forging a new consciousness within our current understanding of psychology and its alternatives. PTM presents groundbreaking ideas that positively influence readers' lives and unsettle the stronghold that conventional approaches still maintain over the practice of therapy.

The future of psychology does not depend on more precise explanations of how the brain performs, or in clarifying diagnostic categories or promoting medications, but in its radicalization based on this new consciousness — a synergistic philosophy that honors individual creativity, respects the alignment of mind/body/spirit, values positive intention and meaningful action, and supports ideals like courage, determination, and love.

To further our mission, we recently launched the Alternative Therapists Directory, which matches those seeking help with the most creative and expertly skilled practitioners of new psychologies and their alternatives, from meditation therapy to shamanistic healing. Visitors to the directory can make the best possible choice for themselves by learning about practitioners, their specializations, and what they can expect.

Psychology Tomorrow Magazine and the Alternative Therapists Directory are also platforms for the development of books, films, conferences, and special events that capture the spirit of our evolving concept of psychology as both a science and an art.

We are seeking to raise $25,000 in order to continue our collaboration with a global community of participants and practitioners interested in re-imagining psychology in all its complex possibilities. Your contribution will help us expand our network of therapeutic providers, cover expenses for our staff, offer compensation to contributors, and give their ideas the greatest exposure possible.

With your support, we can continue to broaden thinking, validate feelings, and celebrate the benefit we can provide to millions of people around the world.

What our minds can conceive, we can achieve. Join our community!


Contributors to Psychology Tomorrow Magazine have included:

*Bill Hayward, photographer and author

*Sheila Heti,  author

*Will Hall,  speaker, radio host and therapist

*Kenji Williams, founder, Bella Gaia

*Leslie Kean, NY Times bestselling author

*Stanley Siegel, author, speaker, and therapist

*Joan Larkin, poet, author and lecturer

*Catherine Obie, artist and photographer

and many, many others ...

story:
Hello lovely people! 

We all know that childhood is a time for exploration and adventure, but no one adheres to this sentiment more than Ellie. She may be small. She may be the younger of the two siblings, but she has an iron will and a persistent nature that inevitably gets her and her older brother Tom into trouble. But what's a little trouble when you're about to do something incredibly awesome?

Ellie and Tom: The Secret Tree House Committee, is the story of a great summer-holiday plan to build the 'Most-Top-Notch-Secret-Tree-House ever built on the surface of this planet’ (Ellie's words not mine!). But how will the kids get the materials? How will they assemble it? How will they hide the plans from those who seek to stop them, and, most importantly, how can Ellie's older and wiser brother Tom ensure he doesn't get the blame for everything that goes wrong, like always? So many obstacles to overcome but as always, I'm sure Ellie has the solution—maybe not the safest or the best solution—but a solution all the same!

Filled with comedy, fun and memorable characters, this children’s story evokes a time of practical learning, innocent fun, and youthful optimism that we all once possessed.

What Do I Need To Make it Happen?

Why do I need help getting additional funds? Well, here is what the items on my spectacular shopping list are:

  • The manuscript still needs to go through the final edit, done by the critical eye of my wonderful and patient, editor Dustin Schwindt . Legend!
  • Beautiful illustrations and internal design must be paid for to fully bring the reader’s experience to heavenly highs—and yes, these are proving to be more expensive than expected—but what wouldn’t I do for you, my lovely future reader.? :)  
  • I will also need to pay for an ISBN number (Oh, these administration necessities are so uncreative!);

and finally…

  • The series’ website and all the distribution and printing channels must be set-up in order for this project to reach you all. 

If you want to support Team Ellie & Tom, check out the exclusive perks I offer as a part of this campaign! (Because I’m just really really nice like that :) )

What Else Am I Aiming To Achieve?

  • Inspire the young ones to resist the 'screen-ageddon' faced by today's youth and venture outside for creative and social fun, whilst being mindful of dangers (and little sisters!).
  • Give children and adults a healthy dose of chuckles.
  • Build an audience for the next book in the series. (Ellie and Tom have plenty of adventures to come)

How else you can help? 

Whether or not you fund the project, you can be a great help by getting the word out. So please share this campaign with your friends and family. Share it with people you know might be interested in reading this book. Hey, share it with people you would never expect to want to read this book (You never know!).  

Hopefully, with your help, we can all enjoy the final print very soon! :)

small. She may be the younger of the two siblings, but she has an iron will and
a persistent nature that inevitably gets her and her older brother Tom into
trouble. But what's a little trouble when you're about to do something
incredibly awesome?
Ellie and Tom:
The Secret Tree House Committee, is the story of a great
summer-holiday plan to build the 'Most-Top-Notch-Secret-Tree-House ever built
on the surface of this planet’ (Ellie's words not mine!). But how will the kids
get the materials? How will they assemble it? How will they hide the plans from
those who seek to stop them, and, most importantly, how can Ellie's older and
wiser brother Tom ensure he doesn't get the blame for everything that goes
wrong, like always? So many obstacles to overcome but as always, I'm sure Ellie
has the solution—maybe not the safest or the best solution—but a solution all
the same!
Filled with comedy, fun and
memorable characters, this children’s story evokes a time of practical
learning, innocent fun, and youthful optimism that we all once possessed.
What
Do I Need To Make it Happen?
Why do I need help getting
additional funds? Well, here is what the items on my spectacular shopping list
are: 

The manuscript still needs to go through the final edit,
     done by the critical eye of my wonderful and patient, editor Dustin Schwindt . Legend!
Beautiful illustrations and internal design must be paid
     for to fully bring the reader’s experience to heavenly highs—and yes,
     these are proving to be more expensive than expected—but what wouldn’t I
     do for you, my lovely future reader.? :)  
I will also need to pay for an ISBN number (Oh, these
     administration necessities are so uncreative!);

and finally… 

The series’ website and all the distribution and printing
     channels must be set-up in order for this project to reach you all. 

If you want to support Team Ellie
& Tom, check out the exclusive perks I offer as a part of this campaign!
(Because I’m just really really nice like that :) )
What
Else Am I Aiming To Achieve?

Inspire the young ones to resist the 'screen-ageddon' faced
     by today's youth and venture outside for creative and social fun, whilst
     being mindful of dangers (and little sisters!).
Give children and adults a healthy dose of chuckles.
Build an audience for the next book in the series. (Ellie
     and Tom have plenty of adventures to come)

How
else you can help? 
Whether or not you fund the project,
you can be a great help by getting the word out. So please share this campaign
with your friends and family. Share it with people you know might be interested
in reading this book. Hey, share it with people you would never expect to want
to read this book (You never know!).  
Hopefully, with your help, we can
all enjoy the final print very soon! :)

EN/LT


Short Summary

My name is Danielius Narauskas. Recently I've completed my dream - running alone across the biggest and wildest USA states - Alaska(900miles/1500km).
During and before this trip I needed to deal with my biggest fears and overcome them. And these experiences led to something beautiful - I've believed in myself and changed my life forever. And I understand that to fully master all the wisdom that the great land of Alaska and people who supported me, gave me - I need to give something back. So that's why I want to write the book and add all the life changing adventures and experiences in it. I just feel that I have something to give you. And I cannot wait, so that's why I act now.

 

What I Need & What You Get

 

This book will be released independently without any publishing company so this campaign is necessary to not only to pre-sale this book, but also to fully fund and cover all the expenses needed to publish the book.
It will also benefit you, because this campaign will last only for 60 days and for this period of time I'm giving -15% discount for every purchase of digital or physical copy of the book.


The estimated release date : 2019/12/01.
By this exact date all the books will be shipped out.

LT

Trumpas aprašymas

Sveiki, esu Danielius Narauskas. Ką tik grįžau iš kol kas asmeniškai sunkiausios ir beprotiškiausios kelionės. Vienas perbėgau didžiausią ir šalčiausią JAV valstiją - Aliaską(1500km).
Ruošiantis šiai kelionei ir jos metu turėjau akis į akį susidurti su didžiausiomis savo baimėmis, žaibiškai reaguoti į kritines situacijas ir susidraugauti su savimi. Tai privedė prie visiško savęs pasitikėjo ir pakeitė mano gyvenimą į gerą. 
Ir tam, kad pilnai įsisąmoninčiau visas patirtis, kurias man suteikė Aliaska bei žmonės, kurie vienaip ar kitaip prisidėjo prie šios beprotiškos kelionės įgyvendinimo, jaučiu, kad atėjo laikas duoti kažką atgal. Todėl ir rašau šią knygą, kurioje detaliai sutalpinsiu visas istorijas, vidinius išgyvenimus, baimes, sunkumus bei kitas patirtis, kurios pasitaikė vingiuotame kelyje.


Ko reikia projekto įgyvendinimui ir ką Jūs gausite? 


Ši knyga yra leidžiama be jokių leidybinių kompanijų, todėl šis projektas skirtas ne tik knygos išankstiniam pardavimui, tačiau ir visų leidimui reikalingų lėšų surinkimui, kurios reikalingos tam, kad knyga išvystų dienos šviesą. 
Todėl pirkdami ar remdami šį projektą Jūs ne tik gausite knygą, tačiau ir prisidėsite prie to, kad ji pasiektų kuo daugiau žmonių.

Taip pat tik šio projekto metu, t.y 60 dienų Jūs turite galimybę įsigyti knygą su 
-15%  nuolaida.

Numatoma knygos išleidimo data :

2019/12/01

2019 m. Gruodžio 1d. visi užsakyti knygos egzemplioriai bus išsiųsti ją pirkusiems žmonėms.
Apie tai būsite informuoti asmeniškai.

story:
Santa's Superhero

Many years back in those tender days when my son was still 3, he came up with this story concept. I have been in amazement ever since. More so was what intrigued this mental creativity. 

I am an entrepreneur and owner of Anything on a Clock. I have passion for helping people. This has zeroed me to this organisation, and to charity. My son Nathan, sees me as his hero and shares my life passion. This made him come up with the idea. This idea has since then captivated me and turned into a goal and ambition. We got started on the book project, but found it it was much more than just writing a book. 

Before the Book - Background Story

Ever since Nathan was born, we would go to the CityTV Breakfast Television FoodBank Friday in Vancouver.  The first time we went, we were interviewed by host Dawn Chubai.  Shortly after Nathan was born I started a company called Anything on a Clock.   After that, whenever we went to FoodBank Friday, we would donate part proceeds of our November sales to the Food Bank.

On December 4th, 2009, we went to the FoodBank Friday broadcast as we always had.  But this time was different.  Shortly after we arrived, a firetruck rolled in. Generally, Nathan is a bit groggy when we go to these events.  They start at 6:00 am and because we like to be there near the beginning, and then hang out for a bit, we usually leave the house around 5:00 am.  But when the fire truck arrived, Nathan got really excited.  Off camera, before our interview, Dawn Chubai asked Nathan why he was so excited.  Nathan being 3 1/2 years old at the time pointed to the firetruck and said “Super Heroes”.

During our interview, Dawn asked Nathan again about the firefighters and he told Dawn that they were Super Heroes.  After our spot, they cut to Riaz Meghji who did an interview about the upcoming Santa Clause Parade.  Then it was the firefighter’s turn.  While Riaz was doling his thing, host Greg Harper asked if Nathan would like to join him at the firetruck for his segment.





...and so it all began

That was the first time that Nathan connected his Super Heroes (firefighters) to Santa.  That evening when I tucked him into bed, I asked him for ideas for his bedtime story.  
He asked me “What would happen if Santa got stuck in a chimney?  Do you think firefighters would help them?”  

As Christmas grew closer, he would give suggestions about how Santa got stuck in a chimney and how a firefighter came to his rescue.  Each night he would begin by giving a different scenario.  After a few nights I saw a pattern in our story telling so after he fell asleep each night, I would go to my computer and write down the story that we just made up.

By Christmas, we had a lot of different adventures that Santa and his Super Hero would go on.  They would all begin the same way; Santa would get caught in a chimney and a firefighter, his Super Hero, would pluck him out of the chimney. Later that year, I found the stories on my computer and thought that I would put it into a story book for Nathan.  I wrote out the story similar to what we have today and the next year I would read it to Nathan as we got closer to Christmas instead of making up the stories.

Jump forward to the winter of 2014.  Christmas was approaching once again and Nathan asked me “When are we going to make this a real book?” I have been talking about it for the last few years but nothing came of it.  So I told him it was time we get it into print.

I went to my favourite online book publishing site, Blurb, and ordered my first book.  This one has no illustrations, just the story.  I did this book because I had arranged for Santa to come to my house to read the book to a bunch of kids and I wanted him to have a real book in his hands.

So, that is how we came up with a story about how a firefighter helped Santa when he got stuck in a Chimney.  


The Book - the story

The malls were crowded with last minute shoppers.  A blanket of snow covered the ground as the echoes of children carolling were heard through the silence of the evening.

Up at the North Pole, the reindeer were harnessed to Santa’s sleigh. The gifts were all loaded and Zippy, Santa’s head elf was waiting to help Santa with his deliveries.  It was a Christmas Eve like every other, so they thought.

When Santa gets stuck in a chimney, a firefighter named Nathan helps to get him out.  Santa is so thankful, he asks Nathan to help them for the rest of the night.  And it’s a good thing they did.

In Santa and His Super Hero, you will read about Santa’s misadventures that Christmas evening and how his Super Hero, a fire fighter named Nathan helped him out.


The Book - not just a Book

When we decided we were going to publish the book, we thought that we would like to help people with the sales of Santa and His Super Hero.  Since a fire fighter was so helpful to Santa that night, we thought that we would help the fire fighters.

Proceeds of the sale of our book will be given to the BC Professional Fire Fighters’ Burn Fund (BCPFFABF).  The Burn Fund not only helps the survivors of fires across British Columbia, they are also big on the education and prevention of fires and injuries due to fire.  Another thing the BCPFFABF does is in the summer they run a camp for children who are burn survivors.

Their new project is the Burn Fund Center.  A brand new building at main Street and East 23rd Avenue in Vancouver will be an affordable place for caregivers to stay as their loved ones are being treated for their injuries at either Children’s Hospital of the Trauma and Plastics Unit at Vancouver General Hospital (VGH).

There are a couple reasons we picked the BC Professional Fire Fighters Burn Fund.

  1. The story is about Santa getting stuck in a chimney and a fire fighter saves him.
  2. Later in the book they come across a chimney fire and the fire fighter puts out the fire so that Santa can safely deliver his presents.
  3. Getting burned in a fire is often a devastating and life changing experience.  The BC Professional Burn fund does great work with burn survivors of all ages.  Please check out their website at burnfund.org for more information about the BC Professional Fire Fighters Burn Fund.

In order to be able to donate as much money as possible, we decided to do this crowd-funding.


Who want to be a Super Hero?

Getting a book illustrated, published and launched is quite a costly endeavour.  We have set up this crowdfunding  to help pay for these expenses. We implore you to help fund this idea. The more money we can get from contributors to pay for these expenses, the more money we will have to give to the BC Professional Fire Fighters’ Burn Fund.
