story:
Help make the Creative Writer's Toolbelt Handbook a reality

Hi, my name is Andy Chamberlain, I'm a writer and creative writing tutor, and the presenter of The Creative Writer's Toolbelt podcast, a mix of teaching and interviews with writers, editors and artists. If you've never listened to the podcast you can check it out at iTunes here.

With over 75 episodes broadcast, the Creative Writer's Toolbelt is a treasure trove of information and insight. There's practical advice with plenty of examples from great literature, together with insights from the award winning, New York Times Bestselling authors I've interviewed, including Nancy Kress, Daniel Jose Older, Nisi Shawl, Becky Chambers, Peter F. Hamilton, and Alastair Reynolds.

I want to take the very best content from the podcast and put it into a handbook; not only for followers of the podcast, but also for every other writer around the world. I've been planning and thinking about this project for months, and now it's time to put it into action. 

But I can't do it without you.

If you have benefited from the Creative Writers Toolbelt, if you've heard something useful, or you just wish there were more great books in book stores, then I hope you will partner with me on this project.

I want the handbook to be the very best it can be, in terms of content, design, and production, and with your help I will achieve that.

The challenges, and the rewards!

It will cost just £1,000 to make the Handbook a reality.

About £400 of this is budgeted for design, illustration, and formatting.

Another £400 will be spent on editing, to bring that aspect of the book to a professional standard

The balance, around £200, will be spent on production costs and marketing. 

Any surplus after all these costs are met will be split, with half going to Book Aid International, a charity that supports global literacy, and the other half going to support the cost of the podcast, and future editions of the book.

I'm starting to work on the project now, with the aim of getting to episode 100 around March or April time next year, and then the book published in August or September.

There will be a range of fantastic perks available to those who support the project, from public and personal thanks for any contribution, through signed special editions of the Handbook, to a very small number of exclusive opportunities to be a guest on the podcast.

This is what we can achieve together

There are millions of titles available to readers out there, and I believe that there are also millions of people out there who have stories to tell that can entertain and inspire others. I want to help as many writers as possible to reach their full potential. Together we can create a resource that will help people to become better writers, and to produce great work. My goal is to make this handbook available to writers all around the world, and together we can make that a reality.

The podcasts will form the basis for the content of the book, but there is still a lot of work to do to make the Handbook as great as it can be.  I'll use all my experience from running and hosting the podcast, as well as publishing work through the traditional and self-publish routes, to make this a success.

But for all that I'll need your help. 

If you have benefited from the Creative Writers Toolbelt, or you just want to be part of the project, please consider how you can help.

Check out the options and perks for supporting the project

Choose one that suits you and make your pledge

Tell others about the project through social media and word of mouth

Thank you so much for the support you have given the Creative Writer's Toolbelt. Together we can take it to an even bigger audience, and help many more people become better writers.

story:
Who am I ?

Hi


My name is John H Gray, I was born in New Zealand and have lived in Canada for many years.I have pursued an active and rewarding career in the  information technology field until my recent retirement.

I have been fortunate to have had the opportunity to travel and live in different countries. In my travels I have been exposed to many different situations and experienced various cultures firsthand.

I previously assisted with, co-authored and edited two books dealing with  events that happened on the Dutch Caribbean island of Aruba during World War II. These books are "The E.S. Antilla", which details the scuttling of E.S. Antilla, a German ship that had sought refuge in the neutral waters of the Dutch West Indies at the start of the war, and "The Torpedo Incident at Eagle Beach" which tells the story of the U Boat attack on Aruba and misadventures that resulted.

This project is a passion of mine. I have spent approximately five years researching the cultures of the characters in the book and the historical events that happened at the various the locations and I have woven a fictional romance and adventure story around these. My purpose in writing this story is for readers to delight in it and become involved in Jakob's journey. I hope you enjoy the read as much as I enjoyed writing it.

Your contribution is important. It will not only assist me, but also keep the prospect of self publishing very much alive for all aspiring new authors.

In summary, this is the story of a boy born at the beginning of the 1900'sto immigrant Mennonite farmers at the end of the 1890's who are forced to relocate due to sickness, adverse winters and crop failures. Their heritage is mistaken at the outset of WWI they are confused with Germans and subjected to horrible acts committed through ignorance. Our lead character, Jakob, is witness to these acts. He starts to question why his faith and culture does not allow them to protect themselves. While growing up on the farm he learns of relatives who remained in Europe his family had avoided all discussion of these European kin. He questions this and finally decides to set off to find these relatives  who reside in Holland and Germany. Against the advice of friends and family he travels to Europe accompanied by his wife. But after the visit with family in Holland, his wife refuses to accompany him to Germany. fearing a possible war. So, he leaves her behind and travels to Germany alone- only to find himself trapped.

Jakob's life changes. He has affairs and abandons the ways of his faith and culture. His wife, trapped in Holland also and has an affair with a Dutch Resistance writer.

The story continues to track their respective lives through and after the horrors of World War II.  Jakob flees Germany and by chance ends up in Aruba in the Caribbean. Jakob befriends many locals and works at several different jobs. He saves and invests into the developing Tourist industry. He remarries and starts a successful series of businesses, Jakob finally establishes himself in the Caribbean.

This story will appeal to readers interested in the adventure of a young man looking for peace within himself, his romances and misadventures. There is a flavor of life in San Nicolaas, Aruba in the 1940's.



What We Need & What You Get

For the book to be published, I need to have it professionally edited and fact-checked. This is the most expensive part in getting to publication. In addition to the editing, formatting for e-books, Kindle and print version must be done.

A mock up cover has been designed and some funds will be spent on finalizing that design.

Some expenses related to initial marketing of the work, plus commission for Indiegogo, must also be incurred.

To meet these expenses I am hoping to raise $5000.

In return for your donation there are perks.

For a $5 donation a free Kindle copy. Estimated time for delivery -- June 2017 (possibly sooner)

For a $15 donation a free Kindle copy and a personal email of thanks from the author. Estimated delivery -- June 2017

For a $30 donation a free printed copy mailed anywhere in the world. Estimated delivery -- June 2017

For a $50 donation your name will be listed in the Acknowledgments as a self publishing supporter and a free printed copy. Estimated time for delivery --  June 2017.

For a $100 donation a free first edition signed copy with a special hand written dedication from the author. Estimated time for delivery  -- June 2017.

For $250 donation -- a free signed first edition with a dedication. You will also get a personal phone call with the author to learn more about  the background to the story, as well as a special mention in the acknowledgements.

In the event the project is not fully funded, work will be done on the manuscript to the extent of the funding available.

The impact your donation will make

By donating you will assist in making this story come to life. Illustrations throughout the story present the cultural differences that exist between us all. I feel it is essential that a work like this be published to show others -  in a gentle way -  that sometimes those differences are important and can alter the path of our lives.

Risks & Challenges

The risks inherent in this project are greatly reduced as the manuscript is already written, a mock up cover design is done, several editors have been interviewed to evaluate the process and estimate the costs to see my book published. In the event of a huge funding shortfall, I intend to investigate other avenues to see this project to completion and publication.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please let your friends know of this exciting opportunity to participate in making this novel happen . Share this with them.

If youd like more information about this project, email me at thestory@myself.com


And that's all there is to it.

story:
The media missed the Rust Belt, the story goes, and the results of the 2016 election show how poorly coastal outlets understand our crucial region. Since November, many newsrooms have been wringing their hands trying to understand how they got it wrong, and wondering what they can do to better cover the Rust Belt.

We have an idea: let's fund the magazine that has been here all along, doing great journalism.

The nation needs more journalism that is written, edited, and published outside the "coastal media bubble.” By funding Belt Magazine, not only will you be able to read stories about this all-important region, but you will be creating much-needed opportunities. According to a recent article in the Columbia Journalism Review, "One out of every five media jobs was located in New York City, Washington DC, or Los Angeles in 2014, up from one in eight ten years prior." We need more opportunities for journalists living in this region as badly as we need better journalism written about it. 

And that’s what we’ve been doing. At Belt, local Rust Belt journalists are the ones asking the questions and writing the stories.

Since our launch in 2013, Belt Magazine has been dedicated to providing quality regional reporting and long-form journalism—and that has never been more important than it is now. The 2016 presidential election proved the importance of the Rust Belt—not just to those who live here, but to all Americans. So we’re relaunching our magazine with a stronger, more focused mission to provide the in-depth and insightful reporting and writing that the Rust Belt—and the rest of the country—deserves. 

Thanks to our dedicated group of readers, we’ve been able to cover refugees in the Rust Belt, what it’s like to be LGBT in the Midwest during a Donald Trump presidency, and the all-important question of who failed the Rust Belt. 

And when one of those major coastal media outlets said the Rust Belt merely “shrugged” during the women’s march, we took that on, too.

Going forward, we’re committed to continuing that kind of coverage. And in this uncertain political era—during a time when we know that the Rust Belt is the canary in all our political, social, and economic coalmines—we're doing even more.

We’re going to publish long-form, in-depth articles with an even stronger focus on electoral politics, “resistance” efforts, and policies affecting the Rust Belt—including the rifts between urban and rural areas, unions, the roles of immigrants and refugees who populate the region, and lead abatement and clean water issues. (Read about that water crisis in Flint lately? Guess what—it’s not over.)

But to do that, we need you on the team.

Belt is supported solely by its readers. We have no corporations or foundations directing our coverage. We have no advertisers we need to please. We are entirely independent. Our first and only commitment is to our readers—and we can cover only as much as your support allows.

So please, help us keep doing what we do: damn good journalism.

If we meet our $15,000 goal, we will be able to publish one in-depth feature per month as well as weekly coverage of Rust Belt stories and issues for the next six months. If we exceed our goal, we can get to work hiring more freelancers and planning expanded coverage.

story:
Diese Kampagne ist zu Ende. Vielen herzlichen Dank an alle Unterstützer. 
Hier kann das Buch weiterhin bestellt werden: LINK

 

Das wichtigste im Überblick

Wofür sammle ich Geld? 
Mein Buch wird in einigen Monaten veröffentlicht. Der Verlagsvertrag ist unterzeichnet. Das bedeutet Ihr bekommt die Perks und Vorbestellungen in jedem Fall. Auch kann ich die gesammelten Mittel behalten. Der Erlös fliesst in das Pre-Marketing welches professionell erstellt wird. In Kombination mit dem Verlagsmarketing möchte ich so ein möglichst breites Publikum ansprechen. Ich möchte mich von der Masse hervorheben.

Erhalte ich die Perks und Vorbestellungen in jedem Fall? 
Ja, dass verspreche ich Dir. 

Wann wird das Buch veröffentlicht?
Das Datum steht noch nicht genau fest, es wird aber zwischen April und Juni 2017

Warum soll ich helfen? 
Weil ich mit Deiner Hilfe das Buch richtig bekannt machen kann und Du teil der Story werden kannst. 

Warum sollte ich ein Buchprojekt unterstützen, es gibt doch bereits tausende davon?
So einzigartig und speziell ich und meine Aktivitäten sind, so ist es auch das Buch. 
Nachdem Du es gelesen hast, wirst Du verstehen was ich meine.

Ich habe leider kein Geld, kann ich Dir anders helfen?
Ja natürlich, teile es in Deinen Sozial-Medien, sprich darüber. 

Leider habe ich kein Pay-Pal und keine Kreditkarte, wie kann ich Dir einen Obolus geben?
Sende mir eine eMail, dann können wir darüber sprechen. 

Gibt es eine Leseprobe?
Es ist noch keine öffentlich verfügbar. Das Lektorat arbeitet daran. 

Und nun alles im Detail

Wer bin ich?

Man sagt mir nach ich sei ein Visionär und Querdenker. 
weiteres findet ihr in meiner Biografie: http://www.steveschild.ch

Ein Buch zu verfassen ist nicht einfach, als Familienvater und Mars100 (Mars-ONE) Bewerber mit einem Vollzeitjob braucht es sehr viel Energie und Zeit alles unter einen Hut zu bringen. 

Dieses Buch entstand im Laufe von mehreren Jahren und das Manuskript ist fast vollständig überarbeitet und fertig. Ein Verlag wurde gefunden und das Buch kommt in den nächsten Monaten auf den Markt. Obschon der Verlag mein Buch verlegen und Werbung und PR machen wird, so bleibt es doch für den Verlag ein Buch unter vielen. Das soll nicht so bleiben. 

Warum?

  • Der Hacken an der Sache ist leider, dass der Verlag einen Druckkostenzuschuss von über 9000.- Euro verlangt welches ich nun auch bezahlen konnte. Manche mögen das kritisieren, aber ein Kollege von mir hat mehrere Bücher erfolgreich über diesen Verlag verkauft. 
    Ich bin überzeugt das er gute Arbeit leisten wird, aber es wird nicht genug sein. Denn man muss aus der Masse herausragen. 

    Wofür brauche ich denn noch eure Hilfe?
  • VISUALISIERUNG des Buches. Ich möchte euch mit Bildern und Videos zeigen, um was es in dem Buch geht. (Das meine ich mit Werbung und Marketing)
  • Leider ist nun mein Konto leergeräumt und als frischgebackener Vater hat meine Familie keine Freude. Damit nun das Buch auch unter die Leute kommt Bedarf es viel Werbung und Marketing das ebenfalls sehr teuer und aufwendig ist, umgerechnet 20.000 Euro fehlen mir dafür. Daher ersuche ich um eure Hilfe, ermöglicht mir mein Buch unter die Leute zu bringen, Werbung zu machen und vielleicht wird aus meinem Buch ein Bestseller?

    Ich habe meinen Teil gemacht, viel Geld und Zeit investiert und das Werk erscheint in ca. 4-5 Monaten überall im Handel. Helft mir, dass mein Buch kein Ladenhüter wird. Werdet Teil der Story und unterstützt mich. Meine kleine Tochter und meine Freundin sind euch dankbar. 


Ich wünsche mir das meine Tochter eines Tages sagen kann, mein Papa hat erfolgreich ein Buch geschrieben und es hat sich gut verkauft. Ich wünsche mir, dass Sie und meine Freundin stolz auf mich sind. Der Erlös der verkauften Bücher kommt zum grössten Teil meiner Familie zu Gute. 

Der Roman, Inhalt:

Wir schreiben das Jahr 2150. Europa und weite Teile der Erde wie wir es kennen gibt es nicht mehr. Die Welt ist in Aufruhr und es herrscht Krieg.
Nach einer globalen Katastrophe wurden grosse Teile der Welt vernichtet und die Menschen flüchteten in die Berge Wälder und andere entlegenen Gebiete der Erde.
Doch die Katastrophe war der Anfang von etwas noch viel schlimmerem mit dem die Menschheit nicht gerechnet hat.
Eine neue Macht hat geduldig in der Kälte und Dunkelheit gewartet. Und Sie haben einen uralten Plan.
Sie wissen alles, Sie sehen alles und sie sind stark. Es hat begonnen…2017

Was gebe ich euch und was bekommt ihr für euer Geld?

  • Ihr werdet Teil eines Sci-Fi Romanes der euch in eine Welt entführt in der Dunkelheit und Schatten die Welt regieren. Eine Welt in der unsere Welt sich verändert hat und nichts so ist, wie ihr es kennt. 
     
  • Ihr bekommt einen Roman, der euch fesselt und den Ihr so schnell nicht vergessen werdet. Ihr bekommt Inspiration und Unterhaltung, Motivation und unvergessliche Momente. Ein Kopf-Kino der besonderen Art. Ich versichere euch, ihr werdet das Buch mögen und die Geschichte wird euch zum Nachdenken bringen. Vielleicht verliert Ihr dabei sogar eine Träne oder habt Albträume danach. 
     
  • Mit dem Betrag den Ihr mir spendet, kann ich Werbung und Marketing finanzieren. Es ermöglicht mir das Buch optimal zu vermarkten und unter die Leute zu bringen.
     
  • Ihr habt die Möglichkeit, eure Ideen und Wünsche im Zweiten Teil mit einzubringen.
    Vielleicht kann das eine oder andere in die Story eingebaut werden. Vielleicht entdeckt ihr aber auch Fehler oder habt Ideen wie es weitergehen kann. 
     
  • Du bekommst ein Buch, dass von einem Mars-One Bewerber geschrieben wurde, wer weiss was die Zukunft bringt, vielleicht gehöre ich zu den auserwählten welche den Mars besiedeln dürfen. Wenn es soweit ist, hat mein Buch unschätzbaren Wert. 
     
  • Du bekommst Motivation und Inspiration, ich bin Weltrekordhalter im Guinnes-Buch der Rekorde. Hast Du auch einen Traum? Worauf warte noch. Träume nicht Dein Leben, lebe Deinen Traum. Mein Motto: "not even the sky is the limit" soll Dich inspirieren. 

Wie geht es weiter?

Mit eurem Beitrag helft ihr mir, dass Buch noch bekannter zu machen. Ihr helft mir dabei das möglichst viele Das Buch lesen können. Ihr werdet Teil der Geschichte und ermöglicht mir eine Fortsetzung. 
  

Risiken & Herausforderungen

Sollte das Buch nicht erfolgreich sein und ich nicht genügend Kapital aufbringen können, dann habe ich unter dem Strich über 20.000 Euros verloren. Das sind die tatsächlichen Kosten für Werbung, Lektorate, Arbeitsstunden usw. die bereits angefallen sind. Zeit welche ich nicht mit meiner Familie verbringen konnte und Geld das eine junge Familie gut gebrauchen kann. 

Als ich vor Jahren mit dem Schreiben des Buches anfing, hatte ich einen Verlag der mein Buch verlegte leider aber kurz darauf konkurs ging. Ich verkaufte lediglich einige hundert Bücher.

Glücklicherweise habe ich alle Rechte behalten und konnte einen neuen Verlag suchen. Nach über 10 Jahren habe ich einen neuen Verlag gefunden, der schon viele Autoren erfolgreich machte. Das Buch wurde in den letzten Jahren komplett überarbeitet und ist nun um ein vieles umfangreicher. 

Ich möchte den Menschen als Inspiration und Motivation ein Beispiel sein und bin überzeugt, dass wenn man seine Ziele verfolgt und nicht aufgibt erfolgreich sein kann.  

Dies ist mein dritter Anlauf und ich bin überzeugt, dass es diesmal mit eurer Hilfe klappen wird. 

Wie könnt Ihr sonst noch helfen?

  • Spricht über meine Kampagne 
  • Teilt die Kampagne in den Sozial-Medien
  • Schreibt mir e Mails mit Vorschlägen oder Wünschen aber auch Anregungen 
    und Feedback sind willkommen.

Mit dem Betrag den Ihr mir spendet, kann ich Werbung und Marketing finanzieren. Es ermöglicht mir das Buch optimal zu vermarkten und unter die Leute zu bringen. 
Ihr habt die Möglichkeit, eure Ideen und Wünsche im Zweiten Teil mit einzubringen.Vielleicht kann das eine oder andere in die Story eingebaut werden. Vielleicht entdeckt ihr aber auch Fehler oder habt Ideen wie es weitergehen kann.  
Du bekommst ein Buch, dass von einem Mars-One Bewerber geschrieben wurde, wer weiss was die Zukunft bringt, vielleicht gehöre ich zu den auserwählten welche den Mars besiedeln dürfen. Wenn es soweit ist, hat mein Buch unschätzbaren Wert.  

Du bekommst Motivation und Inspiration, ich bin Weltrekordhalter im Guinnes-Buch der Rekorde. Hast Du auch einen Traum? Worauf warte noch. Träume nicht Dein Leben, lebe Deinen Traum. Mein Motto: "not even the sky is the limit" soll Dich inspirieren. 

Wie geht es weiter?

Mit eurem Beitrag helft ihr mir, dass Buch noch bekannter zu machen. Ihr helft mir dabei das möglichst viele Das Buch lesen können. Ihr werdet Teil der Geschichte und ermöglicht mir eine Fortsetzung.   Risiken & Herausforderungen
Sollte das Buch nicht erfolgreich sein und ich nicht genügend Kapital aufbringen können, dann habe ich unter dem Strich über 20.000 Euros verloren. Das sind die tatsächlichen Kosten für Werbung, Lektorate, Arbeitsstunden usw. die bereits angefallen sind. Zeit welche ich nicht mit meiner Familie verbringen konnte und Geld das eine junge Familie gut gebrauchen kann. Als ich vor Jahren mit dem Schreiben des Buches anfing, hatte ich einen Verlag der mein Buch verlegte leider aber kurz darauf konkurs ging. Ich verkaufte lediglich einige hundert Bücher.
Glücklicherweise habe ich alle Rechte behalten und konnte einen neuen Verlag suchen. Nach über 10 Jahren habe ich einen neuen Verlag gefunden, der schon viele Autoren erfolgreich machte. Das Buch wurde in den letzten Jahren komplett überarbeitet und ist nun um ein vieles umfangreicher. 
Ich möchte den Menschen als Inspiration und Motivation ein Beispiel sein und bin überzeugt, dass wenn man seine Ziele verfolgt und nicht aufgibt erfolgreich sein kann.  
Dies ist mein dritter Anlauf und ich bin überzeugt, dass es diesmal mit eurer Hilfe klappen wird. 
Wie könnt Ihr sonst noch helfen?

Spricht über meine Kampagne 

Teilt die Kampagne in den Sozial-Medien

Schreibt mir e Mails mit Vorschlägen oder Wünschen aber auch Anregungen und Feedback sind willkommen.

story:
“What They Teach You At London Business School – From Doctor to Entrepreneur; My Career Change Adventure On The World’s Best International MBA Programme”

By Dr Gareth J Thompson

An MBA from LBS is a once in a lifetime experience that can infinitely expand your horizons and profoundly influence your future career. MBA courses from the very top schools are uniquely designed. They blend learning with links into world leading businesses, for high-fliers who want to accelerate their careers in management and leadership in order to change the world.

I’m a medical doctor and I went to LBS to turbocharge my career. I wanted to make a bigger difference to healthcare at the macro level. However, finding my optimal career path was not easy, and I believe all budding MBAs can learn from my journey. I’m now at the beginning of an exciting second career as an entrepreneur in digital health.

I want to share my story with those of you who are considering an MBA at LBS. I want you to use the lessons I learned to enable you to make better decisions to accelerate your own career. My book is aimed at career changers, medics looking for an alternate path, fledgling corporate titans, would-be entrepreneurs and anyone else with an interest in the rarefied world of elite business and management education.

As well as being a serious tool to enhance your career, an MBA is also seriously fun. From international treks to late night parties and epic sporting clashes the social side of business school can be just as explosive!

All contributors will get one of the first copies of my new book, in the exclusive first print run before the book goes on general release. 

  • 275 pages and 90 key takeaways across 9 insight-packed chapters for budding MBAs

What I Need & What You Get

My target fundraise will cover the basic production & distribution costs to ensure my book is of the highest professional standard and available to a wide audience. Costs:

  • Proof-reading
  • Copy-editing
  • Typesetting
  • ebook conversion & formatting
  • Multiple distribution platforms
  • Print-On-Demand paperbacks
  • Nano website creation
  • Initial print run
  • Professional book cover design

Perks for contributors

  • A pre-release signed paperback copy of the book!
    • Every contributor will receive a numbered, signed paperback pre-release copy of my book, before it goes on sale to the general public
  • Meet the author perks!
    • Skype consultations on MBA admissions, business school, consulting, career options, entrepreneurship or digital health innovation
    • Meet the author in person for longer consultations or to share ideas on the future of innovation
  • Royalty share premium perks!
    • Invest more and earn a share of royalties on book sales for the next 5 years
  • Secret perks! Keep watching my campaign for clues...

Information for royalty investors

  • My book is loosely modelled on a similar book called “What They Teach You At Harvard Business School” – this book reached the New York Times Bestseller list in 2010. The author, Philip Delves Broughton, has graciously given his blessing for the title of my book.
  • Book sales are notoriously difficult to predict and data is scarce. Estimated returns for investors:
    • Scenario 1: International Bestseller. Approximate break-even time to recoup royalties investment amount: Less than a week. Enormous upside returns
    • Scenario 2: Amazon top 100 (subcategory) ebook. Approximate break-even time to recoup royalties investment amount: Less than 2 months. Large upside returns
    • Scenario 3: Amazon better than top 5,000 ebook ranking. Estimated break-even time to recoup royalties investment amount: Approximately one year. Multiple upside returns
    • Scenario 4: All other sales outcomes. Estimated break-even time to recoup royalties investment amount: Approximately one to five+ years. Uncertain returns

Excerpts from the book

Istanbul Global Business Experience - "This results in people living financially from day to day, and prevents businesses from investing in the future. Company spreadsheets contained excel models with units of measure that astrophysicists used! A marketing manager for Pepsi told us that during the thirty years of double-digit inflation, companies did not have a marketing budget. When inflation stabilised in 2004, and corporate governance improved in a more stable political climate, foreign direct investment reached $125 billion over a fifteen year period, where before it was $80 billion over the preceding eighty years. Turkey was now a middle-income economy, and closing the gap with European countries rapidly to reach for developed status. The politics of Turkey are a bizarre mix of western left wing liberalism, Islamism, and right wing market orientated military control. This made for a very interesting puzzle for marketers to solve when creating campaigns, which meant an increasing use of digital tools to reach micro-niche audiences."

MBAT Paris - "Every year a group of European business schools have a weekend long sports tournament hosted by HEC Paris known as MBAT. MBAT is one of the biggest events for sporty students on the MBA calendar. The rugby club marks the occasion by hiring a big red London bus (the old Routemaster classic 1950s model), and then driving it from London to Paris. The big red bus becomes LBS base-camp for the weekend complete with a giant speaker stack, a supply of food and copious amounts of booze. I was registered to take part in two sports – basketball and swimming. Yes, I had decided to join the basketball club as well, because I was petrified of FOMO and leaving even the tiniest un-booked space in my calendar free. Everyone was on the Eurostar train and in high spirits for the journey over to HEC. I was sat next to an Italian who was now a firm friend and who also secured a consulting internship at McBain after we practised cases together. It was 9am and the irrepressible party guy and leader of the 51% club passed me a bottle of an unidentified Vietnamese spirit with a picture of a snake on the bottle with a hearty “get this down you mate.”"

Testimonials

  • Niladri Roy, UCL Postgrad & career changer - "Gareth's book is both engaging and insightful. Weaving fun little stories with expansive perspectives. Aside from the Business School facts-of-life - including the naughty ones - it's also quite a raw and vulnerable account. This grounding is what lets the overall optimistic message feel real."
  • Gavin Fox, London Business School MBA2013 - "Gareth took full advantage of his MBA experience as a continual learning opportunity, and I'm sure his book will help others do the same."
  • Andreas Katsiamis, London Business School MBA2013 - "I had the pleasure of being in the same study group as Gareth during my MBA. He was one of the most critical thinkers in the group and we named him our 'devil's advocate'. His fresh perspective and ability to constructively question our inputs led to several awards. I am confident that this perspective will be strongly reflected in his book. A must read!"

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't feel like contributing to my campaign that's ok!

You can still help by sharing my campaign with your colleagues, friends and family members who might benefit from:

  • My inside story of the real MBA experience to help them decide if business school is for them
  • What business school to choose
  • Insights for career changers, including medics who are considering an alternative career pathway
  • An MBA for entrepreneurs, or entrepreneurs who don't want an MBA

FAQs

  • When will I receive my copy of the book?
    • Estimated date is January/February 2017
  • When will meet the author perks be scheduled?
    • From December 2016 onwards
  • How long is your book?
    • Approximately 85,000 words, or 6 hours of reading
  • What does the book cover?
    • The book is a chronological narrative covering a 5 year period: 2 years on the MBA programme and 3 years post-grad
  • Do you have any writing experience?
    • Yes, I'm a regular contributor to Citizen Mag - a magazine for the Citizen M Hotel Chain - http://bit.ly/2f0POo3
  • Why are you crowdfunding?
    • To accelerate release, widen availability across platforms and territories, and help as many people as possible make crucial decisions about their careers
  • What will you do if the campaign raises more funds than the target?
    • Extra funds will mostly be used for additional targeted marketing
    • Translation of the book into multiple languages to increase availability
    • Release of an audiobook version

Risks

My book has been written and the final draft is complete. However, professional copy-editing and production is required to ensure it is polished and of the highest standard prior to release.

If my campaign does not reach the target:

  • The book will still be released
  • Every effort will be made to ensure contributors get a paperback copy of the book, however if funds are insufficient an ebook may be issued as a backup option
  • The funds that are raised will be retained for basic production costs only
  • Release of the book will be delayed to raise alternative funding, and distribution will be limited to fewer platforms and territories

story:
Hi! My name is Sofia Sunden. I have a background in International Politics, however I’m living in Rio de Janeiro since three years, where I teach Swedish, English and capoeira to children for a living and regularly write for the magazine Yeah Brasil.

I am about to embark on a great adventure – putting my faith in and all my efforts into making a dream come true. I have been working on a book since a year and a half now, about me and my life. My dream is to finish and  eventually publish my book. I believe we all have a story to tell, and I want to share mine with you!

This book spans over three continents and eight countries where I lived since I left Sweden as 18-year-old. The book is about my life and my adventures from the favelas in Rio de Janeiro to the rooftops of Dublin, via  the political corridors of the Scottish Government and the EU to becoming a Swedish, English, Capoeira teacher in Rio. 

I began this project in 2015, however, recently  I realized I needed to do Something to get it Off the ground! So earlier this year I applied to Mastin Kipp’s MasterMind Writing retreat in Bali. (Mastin Kipp, known from Oprah Winfrey’s Super Soul Sunday, is a bestselling author, inspirational writer and  the man behind the popular Daily Love website and runs the Power and Purpose podcast). Mastin Kipp takes a number of professional writers and editors to Bali with a group of aspirational writers. With the guidance of the professional writers and inspiration by Mastin, the participants has to complete the first draft of their book within a month! The event takes place in Bali in order for the writers to exclude themselves from their normal social life and without distraction focus on their project and FINISH the draft within a month!

It was a lengthy application and after a long interview, I was selected to participate! I was really excited about the prospect of going to Bali and to have No Excuse but to Sit Down and Do it and FINISH MY BOOK!!

..only that.. I turned the offer down..!

WHAT!?

Why!?

Well.. as much as I felt it was a once in a lifetime opportunity, I was also concerned about my jobs here in Rio, and the financial aspects of the participation fees..  It was with a very heavy heart I turned the offer DOWN!

But, the whole process really lit something in me, and it made me realise how BADLY I want to Do This! Dedicate myself fulltime and whole heartedly to the project, and with help from professionals make this book as good as it possible could be!

And being selected, and hearing that Mastin Kipp and his team believed in me and this project, gave me confidence ..

So, now, I have decided to Do It Anyway!

I’ve heard that you don’t have to quit your job just to write a book, but it might help, right!?

So THAT is what I am doing! I am leaving my work in Rio for an unpaid sabbatical in Ubud,  a traditional artistic village in Bali. There I am giving myself 6 months to dedicate myself to this Project and Finish my book!

I am turning to you all and raising funds in order to be able to contract professional editors to work with me as soon as I have finished the first draft of the book. I am asking for your support in reaching my dream to finish my book, and with professional help make it as good as it possible could be. Even if you are unable to support me financially, feel free to think of me and send me positive vibes over in Bali, that will be very welcomed too! :)

I am taking a huge leap of faith here, to dedicate myself to a dream that I have had for a very long time, but why not? Perhaps we sometimes need to undertake extraordinary measures in order to receive extra ordinary results!?

I wish to see this fundraising as a Wishing Well, do you remember them from the fairy tales!? Where you through in a penny at the top and make a wish! Through a penny at me and my dream, and at the same time, take a moment to think about YOUR dream and what is stopping you from pursuing it..? Perhaps, that way, we can make them Both Come true!

For more about me and my world, check out my Website and Blog Yours Sincerely at http://sofiasunden.wordpress.com

Thank you very much for your attention!

 

Yours Sincerely

Sofia

story:
In Malaysia, we often speak of the importance of racial harmony but that monologue refers mainly to the Malays, Chinese and Indians who populate the Malay peninsula. The plight of the indigenous people officially called Orang Asli hardly figures. Perhaps the fact that they make up less than 200,000 of the country’s population of 32 million means less interest in who they are. And yet, that is the tragedy. The Orang Asli in Malay means ‘The Original People’. Just like indigenous people in many other countries, they have been marginalised.

My project aims to document the story of the Orang Asli in Malaysia. There are many misconceptions about these people and one of the worst is that being indigenous means being primitive, and lazy. We hope to inform, alleviate misunderstanding and describe the issues facing these people.

Subject matter in the book will include their belief system, sustainability of their way of life, heritage loss, problems they face, and most importantly, to capture the present for posterity.

I plan to cover between 12 - 15 locations where the Orang Asli live throughout the Malay peninsula, which is one part of Malaysia.

I will be working with a team, their names I have included at the end of this section.

I want to challenge current stereotypes of the Orang Asli.

When I travelled throughout Malaysia for my first book, Book in Malaysia, in 2013, I did not have a good understanding of the Orang Asli. Like many other Malaysians, what I knew about these people were not necessarily accurate. Since then, I have been involved with a civil society organisation in Malaysia who build dormitories for Orang Asli children to facilitate their education.

Being in close contact with the Orang Asli, I knew then that their story had to be told. Perhaps with greater awareness of their plight, more Malaysians will take up their cause. We need people to be interested in helping and ensuring the survival of the Orang Asli.

Specifically, I want to show the Orang Asli to be individuals and not just numbers.

The book will be divided according to themes as follows:

  1. Diversity of the various tribes including their way of life.
  2. The Orang Asli's belief system or religion.
  3. Sustainability of their way of life. Traditional knowledge as a way of life.
  4. Capturing the present for posterity.
  5. Heritage loss.
  6. How the Orang Asli were sold into slavery in the past.
  7. Changing the stereotypes that exist of the Orang Asli.
  8. Interview with activists, NGOs and the government body assigned to look after their rights.
  9. Their future in Malaysia.
  10. See the people. Not the stereotypes.

The people involved in producing this project

Kenny Loh, author of the book, Born In Malaysia, which is the result of a three-year journey through every state of Malaysia. It highlights a nation in transition and celebrates the individuals from all walks of life who have played their part in building this country. Kenny has a passion for the people of Malaysia and has spent almost ten years traveling throughout Malaysia documenting their stories for his books and website. During his travels, he has repeatedly come across the Orang Asli and in the majority of cases, he has found them marginalised and taken advantage of and is determined to tell their story. He currently volunteers with a civil society group which has built a dormitory for Orang Asli children to stay for free near schools.

Jahabar Sadiq, founder of the online news website, The Malaysian Insight. His previous projects includes The Malaysian Insider; a highly regarded news website. He has been a journalist for nearly 30 years, of which 12 was spent as a TV news producer with Reuters Television. He has reported from a number of countries from Afghanistan in the west to East Timor in the east.

Kamal Solhaimi Fadzil is an anthropologist with the Department of Anthropology and Sociology, University of Malaya. His research interest includes a broad range of issues dealing with minority communities, marginalization, and social inclusion. Over the last eighteen years, he has worked on several topics ranging from adolescent sexuality, stigma and discrimination towards people living HIV/AIDS, situational analysis of children in Sabah, expressions of refugees/undocumented children as residence without formal documentation, as well as with issues related to the Orang Asli living in protected areas.

Allie Hill is a graphic designer and illustrator. Over the past 25 years, she has had opportunities to practice her craft in four beautiful cities: Kuala Lumpur, London, Bangkok and Singapore. Late in 2016, her work experience came full circle when her family moved back home to Kuala Lumpur. Allie’s work includes branding and communications pieces, design for packaging, books, exhibitions, typography and illustration. Allie loves art initiatives that benefit communities and strives to serve with her specific skillset. She also enjoys telling tales, and have just completed her second children’s storybook.

Woon King Chai is a journalist based in Kuala Lumpur. He has covered some of the biggest stories in Southeast Asia for international broadcasters such as the Associated Press (AP), British Broadcasting Corporation (BBC), Sky News and Channel NewsAsia. His passion in telling stories of extraordinary people, cultures and places has driven him to pick up a camera and document them before they’re lost to time and memory. 

King Chai first came across the story of the Orang Asli community when the Temiar people in Gua Musang, the largest district in the eastern state of Kelantan, were forced to build blockades on roads leading to their homes deep within the state’s rainforest reserve to put a temporary stop to logging activities. The blockades fell when state forest authorities tore down the blockades earlier this year.

We may bring in an additional documentary filmmaker to work on the videos.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need funding of USD 80,000. The funding will be used for the following:

  1. At least 10 trips to the Orang Asli villages. Funds will be used to fund transportation and accommodation costs.
  2. A book will be produced and this book will require design, editing and distribution. We expect to print 3,000 copies of the book.
  3. A website as we want to ensure that we reach as many people as possible.
  4. This project has 6 contributors who will be photographing, interviewing, writing, editing and designing the book.
  5. Funding will also be used to produce 4 thematic videos covering various aspects of the lives of the Orang Asli.

If the entire funding goal is not reached, the project will still go ahead. We may then need to revise the extent of our project or explore other sponsorship.

The Impact

In Malaysia, much of what is happening to the Orang Asli remains unreported. Except for the news of the death of 5 Orang Asli children who were so afraid of being punished and bullied that the ran into the forest or the on-going case of logging on their land, there is not a general sense of apathy for their plight.

But just who are the Orang Asli. This book will attempt to answer many of these questions. I cannot stress enough how important it is that we humanise them instead of making them mere statistics. Creating this awareness will make it less easy to ignore their plight. Giving them a voice that is joined by other Malaysians will make it more difficult to silence them.

Risks & Challenges

I am uniquely qualified to deliver this book and the videos as I have a track record of doing so. This is not my first time publishing a book. Moreover, the contributors who will work on this project are also seasoned professionals. Their names and credentials have been listed above.

My track record includes the book, Born In Malaysia, a book about the people of Malaysia, published in 2013. The book was awarded the National Book Award by Malaysia's National Book Foundation. The book and project is now online at http://www.born-in-malaysia.com/

In 2016, I photographed a book titled, Seberang Perai - Stories from Across the Sea.

In August 2017, the Malay edition of Born in Malaysia will be published.

In November 2017, I will be publishing a book titled, Rags to Riches - A Story of Kuala Lumpur.

Reputations are at stake here and that is why such an accomplished team have been selected to work on this project. We do not see any major obstacles in the book being published. We are already immersed in other projects with the Orang Asli and have intimate knowledge of the locations of their villages. We have a publisher who is ready to work with us on the design and distribution of the book.

Other Ways You Can Help

We would appreciate it if you could share this project with your friends.
story_txt:
In Malaysia, we often speak of the importance of racial harmony but that monologue refers mainly to the Malays, Chinese and Indians who populate the Malay peninsula. The plight of the indigenous people officially called Orang Asli hardly figures. Perhaps the fact that they make up less than 200,000 of the country’s population of 32 million means less interest in who they are. And yet, that is the tragedy. The Orang Asli in Malay means ‘The Original People’. Just like indigenous people in many other countries, they have been marginalised.
My project aims to document the story of the Orang Asli in Malaysia. There are many misconceptions about these people and one of the worst is that being indigenous means being primitive, and lazy. We hope to inform, alleviate misunderstanding and describe the issues facing these people.
Subject matter in the book will include their belief system, sustainability of their way of life, heritage loss, problems they face, and most importantly, to capture the present for posterity.
I plan to cover between 12 - 15 locations where the Orang Asli live throughout the Malay peninsula, which is one part of Malaysia.
I will be working with a team, their names I have included at the end of this section.
I want to challenge current stereotypes of the Orang Asli.
When I travelled throughout Malaysia for my first book, Book in Malaysia, in 2013, I did not have a good understanding of the Orang Asli. Like many other Malaysians, what I knew about these people were not necessarily accurate. Since then, I have been involved with a civil society organisation in Malaysia who build dormitories for Orang Asli children to facilitate their education.
Being in close contact with the Orang Asli, I knew then that their story had to be told. Perhaps with greater awareness of their plight, more Malaysians will take up their cause. We need people to be interested in helping and ensuring the survival of the Orang Asli.
Specifically, I want to show the Orang Asli to be individuals and not just numbers.
The book will be divided according to themes as follows:

Diversity of the various tribes including their way of life.
The Orang Asli's belief system or religion.
Sustainability of their way of life. Traditional knowledge as a way of life.
Capturing the present for posterity.
Heritage loss.
How the Orang Asli were sold into slavery in the past.
Changing the stereotypes that exist of the Orang Asli.
Interview with activists, NGOs and the government body assigned to look after their rights.
Their future in Malaysia.
See the people. Not the stereotypes.

Kenny Loh, author of the book, Born In Malaysia, which is the result of a three-year journey through every state of Malaysia. He currently volunteers with a civil society group which has built a dormitory for Orang Asli children to stay for free near schools.
Jahabar Sadiq, founder of the online news website, The Malaysian Insight. His previous projects includes The Malaysian Insider; a highly regarded news website. story:
The 21 day challenge

Historian and elusive authoress Anne O Nomis researched the Dominatrix's history over four years, and wrote the first ever work on the subject  - 'The History & Arts of the Dominatrix' (2013). The book has gone on to be positively reviewed by DDI Magazine, Massad Magazine, Library Journal Review, Leatherati USA, and has become the training curriculum for Mistresses around the world.

Anne O Nomis is well-educated, with a Masters degree in Comparative Art and Archaeology from UCL (University College London). She hosts the "Forbidden Book Club" at Passionfruit, and gives talks on archaeology and history, particularly pertaining to the field of sexuality.

She has wanted for some time to produce a work of erotic fiction. What's stopped her is that in the last 2 years she had a baby girl, a cancer diagnosis and surgery, and lives in a country of which she is not a national and so is not entitled to any government benefits or support. As a result, she is busy working, paying for childcare and earning money for rent and expenses. When she's not busy working, she's busy looking after her daughter and doing domestic chores, leaving her very little free time. 

She wants 21 days to write a work of erotic literature.

21 days of having a babysitter to look after her toddler daughter. 

21 days of charging up on caffeine in her favourite mocha coffee. 

21 days of a morning jog followed by solid hours of writing.

21 days of shutting out distractions, turning her phone on silent, ignoring her email during the period of solid writing hours to solely focus on it. 

She wants to get this work out to her fans and supporters, and to the world. She hopes to then follow the fictional erotica work with the release of her non-fiction work which has been four years in the process, on the ancient sex Goddesses of Mesopotamia, Levant and Cyprus and literature and art spanning 3000 years.

She has calculated that the cost to cover babysitting and coffee for 21 days to write will be AUD $185 a day x 21 days = $3885

 

What her patrons and supporters will get

- Confidential manuscript draft updates of her erotic literary manuscript for all supporters, and get to read her work as it progresses over 21 days. They'll also be acknowledged in her book acknowledgments if the work gets published, and receive a first edition book.

In addition to this...

- Sponsors of 1 day of her work (@ $185) will be able to have a 50 minute meeting with Anne O Nomis after she's finished her 21 days, for coffee and chat, and enable her to express her gratitude for their support. If the supporter is overseas, Anne is happy to arrange a Skype and tea if desired. 

- Sponsors of 2.5 days of her work (@ $462) will be able to have a long lunch with Anne O Nomis after she's finished her 21 days, and enable her to express her gratitude for their support. If the supporter is overseas, Anne is happy to arrange a Skype if desired. 

- Sponsors of 1 week of her work (@ $925) will be able to have a long dinner and chat with Anne O Nomis, or a personalised tour of an art exhibition or museum collection such as the NGV in Melbourne. Anne is happy to alternative solutions to suit people living in other locations overseas to acknowledge their support.

 

Managing expectations & reality-check

Naturally it's going to be a challenge to try and write an erotic work within 21 days.

Anne used to write fictional work as a high school student, and won a poetry writing contest, as well as the Auckland University legal history writing prize. She is also a published non-fiction author, and her skills as a wordsmith are evident.

She has a strong concept of what she wants to write, but is not sure herself how it will go with the plot tracking, character development, erotic content, and so on. Only time will tell...

 

Why she thinks she can do it

1) Marquis de Sade wrote the novella 'Justine' (Les Malheurs de la vertu) reportedly in two weeks in 1787, while imprisoned in the Bastille. It was 187 pages long. (He later produced an extended version in 1791, and a further extended version in 1901 which with the sister-work 'Juliette' amounted to 4000 pages. However the initial work was what kick-started Marquis de Sade's erotic literature.)

2) Anne O Nomis wrote 'The History & Arts of the Dominatrix' in a dedicated 3 month period in Hanoi, Vietnam where she'd gone with the express intention to write it. This was the culmination of approximately 4 years of research. However the experience of writing daily for extended periods of time with a specific deadline and intention was what drove her to get the book finished. She expects she could do a literary fictional work of erotica in the shorter period of 21 days.

 

Feel free to also re-tweet and motivate (whip) others to support Anne.

 

After she's finished the fictional erotic work, she intends to return to completion of her non-fiction Magnum Opus on the ancient sex Goddesses of Mesopotamia, the Levant and Cyprus.

story:
Enigma Front: ONWARD!

We're living in troubling times, and it's hard not to let the headlines get you down. Political figures bickering like schoolchildren on Twitter. Unprecedented natural disasters. Persistent grim economic forecasts. Avocado toast. We could use some stories that turn a hopeful eye to the future right about now.

Enigma Front: ONWARD will bring together optimistic speculative fiction stories from members of IFWA, the Imaginative Fiction Writers Association. Our members range from hobbyists and beginners to internationally-renowned best-selling writers from across Canada and around the globe, with several Hugo, Nebula, and Aurora Award winners among our ranks!

ONWARD will be the fourth volume in the Enigma Front anthology series, and the first published by ExitZero Books. We are planning to release the book in August 2018.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We're setting a Flexible Funding goal of $1500 to get the anthology into print. At least half of whatever we raise through this campaign will be put toward paying the writers for their stories. Put simply, the more we raise here, the more the writers get paid.

We also need to, y'know... print the book. Print on demand publishing has made this easier and more cost effective than ever for small presses, but there are still upfront costs which must be covered. If we don't meet our $1500 goal, we will still be producing the anthology with whatever we do raise.

As for what you get, Enigma Front: ONWARD will be an important collection of optimistic speculative fiction. IFWA is a pretty diverse crowd of writers, so you're looking at a book with science fiction, fantasy, horror, slipstream, all of the _____punk genres, and likely a few stories that defy categorization. The writers are working on their stories right now, and we're hoping to cram around 20 pieces into the finished book when we release in August 2018.

 

The Impact

Since 2015, the Enigma Front anthology series has been a stepping stone for new authors and editors to dip their toes into the murky waters of the publishing business. A number of promising writers have seen their first stories show up in past Enigma Front books alongside seasoned veterans and a few big names.

For a beginning writer, seeing a story you've worked on in print is an incredibly encouraging thing to see for the first time, and having that credit to your name opens doors further down the road. Your support on this campaign ensures the continuance of the Enigma Front anthology series, allowing us to offer this opportunity to more new and upcoming writers for years to come.

 

Risks & Challenges

The risks are minimal. We have a good team of editors at the ready, most of whom have worked on projects like this before. We have a talented pool of writers already working on their stories, and ample time to put the book together before our release date of August 2018.

story:
Who We Are and Why This Matters To Us (And You Too!)

Greetings denizens of the internet!  If you've made it this far, I'm ecstatic we've piqued your interest.  My name is Ken Miller.  I'm a veteran of the automotive industry, spanning three decades plus of my life personally or professionally involved in some fashion to all things on wheels.  I've owned my own aftermarket performance company, sold cars, managed dealership service departments, and broke/fixed/broke again more of my own cars than I or my wife care to admit.  That cute little girl I keep referencing throughout this campaign?  That would be my daughter Mackenzie, who has been my constant companion throughout numerous memorable road trips and assistant on many a late night, busted knuckle, questionable tinkering adventures in the garage.


My eyes and ears are always on the trends and news that pertain to the auto industry.  In the last few years, we hear and read more and more about the decline of interest amongst our youth in the automobile.  I think I speak for many of us when I say I couldn't wait to get my driver's license, much less my own car!  The freedom!  The open road!  The ability to come and go as I please!  With the ability for us to consume entertainment from our smartphones, socialize rapidly through text, post and tweet, the need and subsequently the desire and yearning to physically get out and experience that freedom has considerably waned.  

So everyone is complaining about it - but is anyone doing anything about it?  As spring break approached this year, Mack came to me and asked if we were taking another road trip, and where?  It was from those conversations between her and I that inspiration struck.  What if, I asked her, we went state to state across America and wrote a book about to inspire kids and parents to put down the distractions, pack their bags, hit the road and escape to some unforgettable experiences?

This is the core concept driving our book, Mackenzie Sees America!

Alright, You Ask, So What Do You Need and What's In It For Me?

Mackenzie Sees America is planned to be a full color, hard cover book spanning at least 120 pages of photos, stories and illustrations assembled by Mackenzie and I.  Your contributions will make this ambitious and time consuming project possible.  Our funding goal of $50,000 has been set to encompass the entirety of this project, including;

  • Costs associated with the trip itself - food, fuel, room and board, vehicle maintenance and repairs, etc.
  • Professional layout and editing services to ensure a high quality, entertaining and inspiring book for kids and families alike.
  • Professional printing services for several thousand hardcover and paperback copies.

Where will all these copies go, you may ask?  This is next part of our plan.  Mackenzie and I intend to print enough copies to donate to interested schools, visitors centers, national parks and libraries across the United States.  Not only will your contribution get you a copy of the book and make you a integral part of this trip, you'll be helping share that experience with kids throughout the United States.

Now more than ever, one cannot escape the truth that our national parks and heritage need our support and protection.  Whether it be environmental hazards or looming budget cuts, the truth is there has never been a more paramount time for awareness than right now.  It is our hope that our book will get kids' interest sparked, share the wonders of these places through a kid's perspective and get families excited about experiencing them first hand!

We're so committed to protecting our nation's natural treasures, that if we exceed our funding goal, every dollar beyond that will be donated to the National Park system.  

This All Sounds Pretty Great, But About Those Perks...

Mackenzie and I appreciate whatever support you can provide.  Our planned reward tiers offer you the following incentives;

  • $5.00 - A personalized card from Mackenzie and I, thanking you for your support
  • $7.00 - A personalized thank you card as well as a "swag bag" consisting of goodies like key chains, vinyl decals, etc.
  • $15.00 - A downloadable ebook copy of Mackenzie Sees America.
  • $30.00 - A hardcover copy of Mackenzie Sees America.
  • $40.00 - A hardcover and downloadable copy of Mackenzie Sees America.
  • $50.00 - A hardcover and downloadable copy of Mackenzie Sees America, and YOUR NAME with a thank you on our Contributions Page.
  • $100.00 - Two hardcover and downloadable copies of Mackenzie Sees America for you and your family, YOUR NAME with a thank you on our Contributions Page, and YOUR name or organization's name emblazoned on the side of our vehicle for the trip.
  • $500.00 - Ten hardcover and downloadable copy of Mackenzie Sees America for you and your family, and YOUR NAME with a thank you on our Contributions Page, and YOUR name or organization's name emblazoned on the side of our vehicle for the trip.  Recognition for you or your organization on the book itself and in the book on the Contributions page as a premiere sponsor.

We know $50,000 is an ambitious goal for a kid's book.  What we're offering we feel is more than the sum of paper pages bound together.  We're offering up an epic journey to share and inspire families across the country to get up, get out and take journeys of their own.  Will we convince everyone to make a mad dash around the country in a month?  Likely no.  But if our exciting and unique project can ignite the flame of interest for even a weekend getaway, an outdoor adventure, a historical trip back in time - then we've absolutely accomplished our mission.  You're going to fund and get a book from this whole endeavor, but you're going to be sharing it with many more as well.

*sample page concept*

What If You Can't Reach Your Goal?

As with any crowdfunding campaign, we're asking for your faith and trust.  We know that we have the zeal, the passion and the drive to make this journey and this book a reality that we feel everyone - young and old - will enjoy.  We know you have many choices by which to spend your hard earned dollar, and we appreciate any contribution possible.

That being said, if we fall short, our goal is to still take the trip and offer our book.  Whether that means we offer it solely as a digital download or print fewer copies for donation to schools, libraries and parks.  We aim to be flexible in our end goals if we cannot hit our funding target.  If after the final bell rings it is clearly unfeasible, after consulting with editors and publishers, to fund the trip and the book, we will donate the accumulated funds to the United States National Park Service.

I'm In!  What Else Can I Do To Help?

You've come this far, and we're eternally thankful for that!  Share this page with your friends and family.  Post it on your Facebook page or share it on Twitter.  Tell your bosses and company's managers about the sponsorship opportunities we offer.  Share the link and share through Indiegogo.  Through your contributions and efforts, this amazing project can be made reality!

Who We Are and Why This Matters To Us (And You Too!)Greetings denizens of the internet!  If you've made it this far, I'm ecstatic we've piqued your interest.  My name is Ken Miller.  I'm a veteran of the automotive industry, spanning three decades plus of my life personally or professionally involved in some fashion to all things on wheels.  I've owned my own aftermarket performance company, sold cars, managed dealership service departments, and broke/fixed/broke again more of my own cars than I or my wife care to admit.  That cute little girl I keep referencing throughout this campaign?  That would be my daughter Mackenzie, who has been my constant companion throughout numerous memorable road trips and assistant on many a late night, busted knuckle, questionable tinkering adventures in the garage.My eyes and ears are always on the trends and news that pertain to the auto industry.  In the last few years, we hear and read more and more about the decline of interest amongst our youth in the automobile.  I think I speak for many of us when I say I couldn't wait to get my driver's license, much less my own car!  The freedom!  The open road!  The ability to come and go as I please!  With the ability for us to consume entertainment from our smartphones, socialize rapidly through text, post and tweet, the need and subsequently the desire and yearning to physically get out and experience that freedom has considerably waned.  So everyone is complaining about it - but is anyone doing anything about it?  As spring break approached this year, Mack came to me and asked if we were taking another road trip, and where?  It was from those conversations between her and I that inspiration struck.  What if, I asked her, we went state to state across America and wrote a book about to inspire kids and parents to put down the distractions, pack their bags, hit the road and escape to some unforgettable experiences?This is the core concept driving our book, Mackenzie Sees America!Alright, You Ask, So What Do You Need and What's In It For Me?Mackenzie Sees America is planned to be a full color, hard cover book spanning at least 120 pages of photos, stories and illustrations assembled by Mackenzie and I.  Your contributions will make this ambitious and time consuming project possible.  Our funding goal of $50,000 has been set to encompass the entirety of this project, including;
Costs associated with the trip itself - food, fuel, room and board, vehicle maintenance and repairs, etc.
Professional layout and editing services to ensure a high quality, entertaining and inspiring book for kids and families alike.
Professional printing services for several thousand hardcover and paperback copies.
Where will all these copies go, you may ask?  This is next part of our plan.  Mackenzie and I intend to print enough copies to donate to interested schools, visitors centers, national parks and libraries across the United States.  Not only will your contribution get you a copy of the book and make you a integral part of this trip, you'll be helping share that experience with kids throughout the United States.Now more than ever, one cannot escape the truth that our national parks and heritage need our support and protection.  Whether it be environmental hazards or looming budget cuts, the truth is there has never been a more paramount time for awareness than right now.  It is our hope that our book will get kids' interest sparked, share the wonders of these places through a kid's perspective and get families excited about experiencing them first hand!We're so committed to protecting our nation's natural treasures, that if we exceed our funding goal, every dollar beyond that will be donated to the National Park system.  This All Sounds Pretty Great, But About Those Perks...Mackenzie and I appreciate whatever support you can provide.  Our planned reward tiers offer you the following incentives;

story:
Il Progetto

L'idea di pubblicare questo volume nasce dalla passione per l'oplologia e la guerra medievale-rinascimentale di uno storico, Gabriele Zweilawyer, e di un disegnatore professionista, Francesco Saverio Ferrara.

Il volume sarà stampato interamente a colori e conterrà dieci monografie, diversi focus su armi e battaglie, e oltre venti disegni originali di Francesco Saverio Ferrara. 

Le specifiche tecniche

Le specifiche ufficiose del volume:

- Dimensioni: 17×24
- Pagine: 160
- Copertina: 350gr colori
- Carta: 135gr patinata opaca, stampa a colori

Gli Autori

Dopo due lauree e duecento articoli specialistici, Gabriele Zweilawyer ha pubblicato due volumi storici (Storia della Presa di Salamina e del Comandante Marcantonio Bragadin e Gli Arabi in Israele) e collaborato con diversi professori e ricercatori universitari. Il suo sito, www.zweilawyer.com, ha ricevuto 5 milioni e mezzo di visite negli ultimi quattro anni, mentre la sua pagina FB, Zhistorica, ha oltre 25.000 follower.

Lavorando su diverse fonti, specie ottocentesche, ha riportato alla luce la storia di tre personaggi storici di eccezionale interesse, Pier Gerlofs Donia, Pregeant de Bideoux ed Enrico V di Brunswick.

Francesco Saverio Ferrara è uno degli illustratori italiani di maggior talento. Dopo il liceo artistico, dove frequenta i grandi maestri della pittura e del disegno, ha continuato gli studi al monastero benedettino apprendendo l’arte della miniatura e della calligrafia. I suoi lavori a tema medievale e fantasy riscuotono da anni l'apprezzamento degli esperti del settore e di tutti gli appassionati.          

Come posso contribuire?

Oltre ad acquistare il volume cartaceo, puoi contribuire anche tramite il passaparola, magari linkando il progetto sulla tua pagina social o parlandone con gli amici

story:
The Author

For those who want to know me personally, my name is Nina Angelo OAM. I am an artist, storyteller, volunteer, civil celebrant and much more. I have had an extraordinary, fullfilling life full of adventures. 

In 2009 I was awarded an Order of Australian Medal for services to the Arts and the Central Coast community, which was a most unexpected honour.

A triptych: The fabric of my loving family — the threads that connect

This is a memoir spanning four generations from war, horror and loss, to peace, calm and love. From the extermination camps of Auschwitz and Mauthausen —  my parents were there: my mother a Polish, Ashkenazy, Jewish girl and my father a Greek, Spanish, French, Sephardic Jewish man —  to how love and hearts of kindness came out of the horrors of the concentration camps.

As refugees they came to Australia with me, bringing two cultures and 13 languages to forge a new beginning — these two people who never would have met and fallen in love, if they hadn’t survived the attempted extermination of a race in the death chambers of Europe.  They knew and taught me that we cannot move on without forgiveness.

This is also my story of how I came from that love: how I learnt my philosophies and life lessons from their forgiveness and how healing embraces generations and new life.

My life became an extension, a fulfilment of their past. This is not a story without war because war continued and hardships from another war touched my life at a very personal level.

Please join me and my parents, Yanka and Alberto, on our life's journey through this authentic memoir; celebrating and honouring life and love, family and tolerance of people from all cultures, colours and creeds; in truth, love and forgiveness.  

What I Need & What You Get:

I am looking to raise $12,000 to offset the costs of self-publishing my book. This money will be used to help pay my

  • editor: 
  • map maker:
  • audio book recording:
  • layout and publishing:
  • cover artwork:

Any support that you can offer will be hugely appreciated including sharing it with your friends, family and community networks to help me spread the word.

story:
As creatives, we all enjoy freedom of expression.  

MojoFire is a micro-blogging platform where you can explore and share your creativity. The power to choose the content you see and share is in your hands. We are passionate about providing a place where you can comfortably and easily express your interests and values. We welcome you to become part of our family and have your voice heard. We share your desire for a safe home and we are here to build one with you.

It is no secret that with the present climate of social media, there have been growing concerns with censorship and a lack of freedom to choose what you can or cannot consume.
The number of places for marginalized communities continues to shrink and people from all different backgrounds are losing their digital homes. Large corporations ignoring their users’ concerns and failing to provide a safe and inclusive environment.

MojoFire is open for diverse & inclusive discussion without invasive or arbitrary policing.

We are committed to creating and fostering a digital community where you can find your niche. Discover other like-minded individuals eager to discuss, create, and express themselves freely in the same topics that interest you or simply discover new ones to enjoy.
We encourage an open and inclusive community for all.

Writers, graphic artists, animators, musicians, recording artists, filmmakers - MojoFire is for you. Whoever you are and whatever your interests are, we want to welcome you with open arms.

From fandoms, memes, video games, movies, music, pictures, drawings, comics, recipes, books, pirates, current events, or any one of a million other topics, all have a place on MojoFire and are waiting to be discovered.

Whichever story you want to tell, our community is waiting.

Where is our money going and what's it going to?

  • $25,000 will be used for legal hosting in Switzerland.
    Hosting in Switzerland guarantees you protection under one of the most complete and strictest privacy laws in the world. Your data is your data and we serve you best by protecting it for you.
  • $5,000 will be used for a trustee, a company mailbox, and some minor accounting.
    To ensure that a third party acts in your best interest in the country we incorporate in, a trustee will act on our behalf in your name.
  • Your donations will also pay for:
    • application development
    • hosting and infrastructure costs
    • services to classify and protect content (such as Google's Vision API)
    • design and branding
    • email automation
    • marketing and promotion
    • audio/video recording and editing
    • customer support (through services such as ZenDesk and Mailchimp).
    • digital assets (such as logos and UI elements)

 

 

Mojofire is the brainchild of a group of capable and passionate volunteers  and supporters on our Discord server which we encourage you to join:

https://discord.gg/JBGMYmf
 

Mojofire's leadership team includes seasoned business men, community insiders and enthusiasts donating their time toward creating MojoFire as the digital home we want it to become.
Giving money entitles you to receiving our updates as to what is going to be happening with your funds. We believe in total transparency and have committed ourselves to opening our books for the first two quarters. Every dollar we spend will be accounted for.

story:
Short Summary

Pollyanna is a new comics and graphic works publisher based out of St. Petersburg, FL. Pollyanna was born out of a desire to create and share the thing that makes life worth living--art! We believe art should be accessible to everyone, but for many the art world appears to be completely closed off; even with the growth of social media as a marketing platform, it’s hard for emerging creators to stand out against a sea of competitors. Here at Pollyanna Publishing, we are dedicated to giving independent artists, writers, comics, and creatives from all walks of life the ability to produce and profit off their work.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We here at Pollyanna are passionate about this project and have funded it completely out of pocket so far, but we need your help to keep the dream alive! Your investment will help ensure that we are able to create original and quality products for our audience. With your contribution we will not only support local artists and writers, but also create a gallery that comes to you. 

Our Impact

The United States is a leader in the global art market with a steadily growing industries in; graphic novels, fine art, and comics. Despite this, outside a few major entities there are very limited options for both creatives and customers to get into the art scene, especially in the South. Pollyanna Publishing plans to change this. Our goal is create fair and productive partnerships with independent artists by streamlining the publishing process, providing equitable royalty returns, and establishing networking opportunities for content creators and audiences alike that are both simple and direct. Pollyanna is about giving creative personalities the ability to shine by producing and promoting their art. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate any and all support; if you cannot invest, please consider sharing this campaign widely with friends and family, as well as following us on social media:

Instagram: pollyannapublishing
Facebook: Pollyanna Publishing
Twitter: ThePollyPub
Tumblr: pollyannapublishing
