story:
Introducing the New Surf Blurb Website

I am reaching out  for the opening of a new website and marketplace called www.surf-blurb.com. To fully support this project, $30,000 is required. This takes into account time and effort for creating the website, managing subscriptions, reaching out to partners, doing interviews, feeding the marketplace and fulfilling orders.

Click on the image below to access the website

The Online Magazine

The Online Magazine is the online and premium version of the original Surf Blurb newsletter. As an email, the newsletter is very limited. The newsletter does not always land into your e-mail inbox, because it may be identify as a spam.

The only way to make sure you get the Surf Blurb on time is to subscribe to the online version. With the Surf Blurb Online, you get to have access to more content. You have no advertisement, and you benefit from a responsive layout to your Mac, PC, Tablet, and Phone.

Read Sample #1

 

Read Sample #2

 

 

Premium & Free Subscription 

Click on the image below to access the website

 

The marketplace

Have a look at our fully functional marketplace. Subscribers of the Surf Blurb have already purchased on this marketplace. Items can be sorted by price, name, and collection. The list of items available will grow, as the project gets supported: www.surf-blurb.com/shop

As a buyer, the Surf Blurb will show you unique items at a cheaper price. By purchasing on the Surf Blurb, you will be able to contact book authors and items owners, and ask for special requests, including a signature.

As a business owner, an entrepreneur, or an artist, the Surf Blurb will promote your products and help you to boost your sales. We will give you a strong online visibility, including on Facebook and Twitter.

Click on the image to access the website

 

Sample Product

 

Interviews

Most of us do not have the recognition we deserve. The Surf Blurb will tell everyone who you are and what you do. Have a look at two popular interviews:

  • Interview of Mike Harris: www.surf-blurb.com/mike-harris
  • Interview of Roberto 'Chuy' Madrigal: www.surf-blurb.com/roberto-chuy-madrigal

Click on the image to access the website

     

    Risks & Challenges

    The Surf Blurb connects individuals who live in different countries. International shipping is always expensive. As this project gets fully funded, the Surf Blurb will look for partnership with international shipping companies to reduce shipping costs.

    The Surf Blurb is a high quality website and is a bit slow. I will work on this issue, as full support will help me to get the proper image optimizer software.

     

    Other Ways You Can Help

    • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
    • Make sure you use the Indiegogo share tools at the top-right of this page, next to the video.
    • Contact me at jlemarie@surblurb.com to promote your business, and feed the website now.

     

    History

    In the book business for 20 years, Joe Tabler started to meet demand for surf literature. As a  passionate body surfer from San Diego, he specialized in buying and selling surf books and magazines, and was more successful than expected. Joe simply became one of the most notorious experts on the market. ​​

    Building an impressive network over the years, he came up with a weekly newsletter in 2000 called "The Surf Blurb."​​ Growing through word of mouth, Joe gathered more than 1,600 subscribers.  Joe retired in 2015 and passed the Surf Blurb onto Jeremy Lemarie, a Ph.D. in Sociology of Surf History.

     

    About the Editor

    Ph.D. Jeremy Lemarie is a Teaching and Research Attaché in Sport management & Sociology at the University of Paris-Est Marne-la-Vallée, in France. He is the editor of the Surf Blurb, and author of the book "Surfing: A History of Gliding from the First Wave to the Beach Boys." For over 10 years, Jeremy has done research on the global expansion of surfing, and has spent 3 years in California and Hawaii interviewing entrepreneurs and business owners.

    While living in the U.S., Jeremy served as lecturer in Anthropology of Tourism at the University of Hawai‘i at Manoa, and was a visiting scholar at the University of California, San Diego. As an instructor in France, he taught Sport Management, Sociology, History and Cultural Anthropology in five universities in Paris, including the Sorbonne University. 

     

    Thank you

    The Surf Blurb has been working with or following the websites below. Please support these great online resources:

    • Matt Warshaw and his Encyclopedia of Surfing: eos.surf
    • Timothy De La Vega and his ongoing projects: www.timdelavega.com
    • Geoff Cater and his huge research: www.surfresearch.com.au
    • John Brasen and The Pacific Longboarder in Australia: www.pacificlongboarder.com
    • Robert Wald and his Ocean Mag in California: www.oceanmag.surf

story_txt:
Introducing the New Surf Blurb Website
I am reaching out  for the opening of a new website and marketplace called www.surf-blurb.com. To fully support this project, $30,000 is required. This takes into account time and effort for creating the website, managing subscriptions, reaching out to partners, doing interviews, feeding the marketplace and fulfilling orders.
Click on the image below to access the website


The Online Magazine
The Online Magazine is the online and premium version of the original Surf Blurb newsletter. As an email, the newsletter is very limited. The newsletter does not always land into your e-mail inbox, because it may be identify as a spam.
The only way to make sure you get the Surf Blurb on time is to subscribe to the online version. With the Surf Blurb Online, you get to have access to more content. You have no advertisement, and you benefit from a responsive layout to your Mac, PC, Tablet, and Phone.
Read Sample #1

 
Read Sample #2

 
 
Premium & Free Subscription 
Click on the image below to access the website

 
The marketplace
Have a look at our fully functional marketplace. Subscribers of the Surf Blurb have already purchased on this marketplace. Items can be sorted by price, name, and collection. The list of items available will grow, as the project gets supported: www.surf-blurb.com/shop
As a buyer, the Surf Blurb will show you unique items at a cheaper price. By purchasing on the Surf Blurb, you will be able to contact book authors and items owners, and ask for special requests, including a signature.
As a business owner, an entrepreneur, or an artist, the Surf Blurb will promote your products and help you to boost your sales. We will give you a strong online visibility, including on Facebook and Twitter.
Click on the image to access the website


 
Sample Product

 
Interviews
Most of us do not have the recognition we deserve. The Surf Blurb will tell everyone who you are and what you do. Have a look at two popular interviews:

Interview of Mike Harris: www.surf-blurb.com/mike-harris
Interview of Roberto 'Chuy' Madrigal: www.surf-blurb.com/roberto-chuy-madrigal

Click on the image to access the website



 
Risks & Challenges
The Surf Blurb connects individuals who live in different countries. International shipping is always expensive. As this project gets fully funded, the Surf Blurb will look for partnership with international shipping companies to reduce shipping costs.
The Surf Blurb is a high quality website and is a bit slow. I will work on this issue, as full support will help me to get the proper image optimizer software.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
Make sure you use the Indiegogo share tools at the top-right of this page, next to the video.
Contact me at jlemarie@surblurb.com to promote your business, and feed the website now.

 HistoryIn the book business for 20 years, Joe Tabler started to meet demand for surf literature. As a  passionate body surfer from San Diego, he specialized in buying and selling surf books and magazines, and was more successful than expected. Joe simply became one of the most notorious experts on the market. ​​Building an impressive network over the years, he came up with a weekly newsletter in 2000 called "The Surf Blurb."​​ Growing through word of mouth, Joe gathered more than 1,600 subscribers.  Joe retired in 2015 and passed the Surf Blurb onto Jeremy Lemarie, a Ph.D. in Sociology of Surf History. About the EditorPh.D. Jeremy Lemarie is a Teaching and Research Attaché in Sport management & Sociology at the University of Paris-Est Marne-la-Vallée, in France. He is the editor of the Surf Blurb, and author of the book "Surfing: A History of Gliding from the First Wave to the Beach Boys." For over 10 years, Jeremy has done research on the global expansion of surfing, and has spent 3 years in California and Hawaii interviewing entrepreneurs and business owners.While living in the U.S., Jeremy served as lecturer in Anthropology of Tourism at the University of Hawai‘i at Manoa, and was a visiting scholar at the University of California, San Diego. As an instructor in France, he taught Sport Management, Sociology, History and Cultural Anthropology in five universities in Paris, including the Sorbonne University.  Thank youThe Surf Blurb has been working with or following the websites below. Please support these great online resources:
Matt Warshaw and his Encyclopedia of Surfing: eos.surf

Timothy De La Vega and his ongoing projects: www.timdelavega.com

Geoff Cater and his huge research: www.surfresearch.com.au

John Brasen and The Pacific Longboarder in Australia: www.pacificlongboarder.com

Robert Wald and his Ocean Mag in California: www.oceanmag.surf

Matt Luttrel and his prestigious Trim Hawaii: trimhawaii.com

story:
Short Summary

The unexplained is scary, intriguing, and just darn fascinating! Tales of the Unexplained will take the reader on 4 adventures! Allow your mind to expand and bask in the unknown, securing your copy before publication. However, this is not my first publication.

 In the Fall of 2017, I published book 1 (Joshua: Life After Theos) in a YA Sci Fi Romance Trilogy. In 2018, book 2 (Joshua: Breaking Free) was published. Next Year (2020) book 3 will be published. But before that happens, this anthology needs to emerge. This anthology will be a collection of mysterious tales of the paranormal and other forms of the unexplained. It will consist of 1 mystery novella (approx 30,000 words), and 3 short stories (each under 10,000 words) in the mystery, paranormal and magic realism genres. Basically, tales of the unexplained! These stories will entertain readers from 10/12 on up through adult.

And you can be a part of this journey!!! Read on!!!!

**The above picture (which will be on the front cover) was drawn for me 14 years ago when I was writing the novella which will be the first story in this anthology. The illustrator is Justin Montan. Inside this anthology there will be additional sketches by local art students (Dover and/or New Philadelphia High Schools) specifically chosen to represent scenes from each of the 3 short stories.

What We Need & What You Get

I am in need of readers in these genres. This crowdfunding campaign can help me to reach interested readers in the genres of paranormal, mystery and magic realism. I am also in need of donations to help fund research to complete this project as well as the final edits necessary to bring this challenge to fruition. I am seeking to raise $2000. Every donation comes with a perk. The book is set to be released in Late October-November 2019. The perks are as follows:

Mystery Buff $5 =eBook of this project when completed. (Available for outside of the US)

Clue Finder (Basic Plus) $10=signed print book of this project mailed to the donor.

Local Clue Finder (Local Basic Plus) $10=signed print book without shipping. For Locals only

Singing Specter $20=signed print book of this project mailed to donor plus Book 1 in my trilogy in eBook form.

Creaking Door $30=signed print book of this project mailed to donor plus Books 1 & 2 in my trilogy in eBook form.

Murder & Mayhem $30=eBook of this project as well as eBooks for books 1 & 2 in my Trilogy (Available for Outside the US)

Secret Passageway $50=signed print book of this project plus 1 signed book from my trilogy mailed to the donor.

**International donors can either choose the $5 donation level or donate $30 to receive eBooks of this project as well as eBooks of books 1 & 2 in my trilogy. No print books will be able to be mailed outside of the United States.

**All contributors will be offered to be included in the books' acknowledgments!!

The Impact

Your donation and sharing of this campaign on your social media can have great impact. My readers are used to seeing YA Sci Fi Romance from me and my trilogy does not disappoint. But, reaching readers interested in the genres in this anthology will help to lead mysterious tales of this type to readers who will appreciate them.

Risks & Challenges

I am at risk of not reaching the readers and book lovers who enjoy and would appreciate mysterious tales of this kind. However, I am posting and promoting this campaign on many Facebook sites which will help to reach the readers I need to reach.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute right now, that's absolutely fine! You can still help out a lot. I still need to get the word out about my campaign, my book as well as the books in my YA Sci Fi Romance Trilogy.

Please use the Indiegogo share tools here to pass the word along to others who might be interested, anyone who loves mystery, the paranormal, magic realism, or someone who just  loves books and to read! 

Also please follow me on Facebook@patriciamiller.author or @Patricia Miller - Author. My website can be found at www.pmwritescom@wordpress.com.

Thank You!!!

story:
Innanzitutto un ringraziamento per chi ci sta leggendo (perdonate il gioco di parole)!

 

Chi siamo?

Fontana Editore (vedi sito) è una casa editrice che pubblica saggi, manuali, testi di esoterismo, alchimia, spiritualità, zen, scienza, meditazione, consapevolezza, numerologia, yoga, arte.

Il nostro motto è: “Migliorando noi stessi, influenziamo per risonanza anche il nostro ambiente quotidiano, le persone a noi vicine e di conseguenza MIGLIORIAMO IL MONDO.”

 

Cosa vi proponiano?

Siamo molto orgogliosi di avere la possibilità di curare l’edizione italiana del bel libro “Passagen” di Johannes Odenthal sul danzatore e coreografo Koffi Kôkô, uscito finora SOLO in lingua tedesca.

Koffi Kôkô è ballerino e coreografo, vive tra il Benin e la Francia. Dagli Anni '80 è uno dei protagonisti dello sviluppo della scena contemporanea della danza africana. Il suo lavoro comprende circa 40 coreografie, una sua teoria del movimento e numerose collaborazioni con artisti come Yoshi Oida, Wole Soyinka, Susanne Linke, William Kentridge e Mari Carmen García.

Ha sviluppato un'opera unica che traduce la filosofia del vudù e il potenziale del suo rituale per il palcoscenico della danza occidentale, proponendolo in una lingua teatrale internazionale.

Attraverso interviste, saggi, voci di diario e lezioni, emerge una descrizione della danza di Koffi Kôkô come mezzo di conoscenza e come linguaggio artistico che trasforma l'eredità del colonialismo e della schiavitù in rituali e coreografie potenti e trasformative.

Nel 2015, Koffi Kôkô ha tenuto la Valeska Gert Visiting Professor presso la FU Berlin. 2016 e nel 2017 è stato membro del Research College Interweaving Performance Cultures.
Nel 2019 assume un ruolo di Ricercatore presso IASS Postdam.

 

 

Da più parti siamo stati sollecitati ad intraprendere quest’impresa: la traduzione del libro “Passagen” di Johannes Odenthal, perché tanti sono i fans e gli allievi italiani di questo straordinario maestro di danza.

 

I costi di realizzazione di una traduzione non sono pochi e una piccola casa editrice deve essere un pò matta e coraggiosa per lanciarsi in un’impresa del genere. Per questo chiediamo il vostro aiuto e sostegno, attraverso l’acquisto in prevendita del libro nella nostra prossima edizione in lingua italiana. Tra l’altro la nostra edizione, in lingua italiana, sarà molto curata, con nuove immagini forniteci direttamente da Koffi Kôkô e una nuova bella impaginazione (siamo molto pignoli a riguardo).

 

 

Riepilogo dei costi:

  • I costi sono principalmente per la traduzione dell’intero testo, che si aggira intorno ai €3,000 + iva.
  • A seguire i costi di stampa e spedizione per le prime 300 copie del libro per circa €2,000.

Il costo del libro è quello di vendita e sono comprese anche le spese di spedizione, perciò il libro è molto più conveniente delle copie che successivamente saranno messe in commercio.

A quanti vorranno contribuire all’impresa verranno inviate informazioni periodiche e dettagliate sull’avanzamento dei lavori e sulle date di consegna delle proprie copie del libro.

La consegna del libro è stimata in circa 2 mesi dalla chiusura di questa campagna di crowdfunding. Il tempo necessario per fare l’accurata traduzione, la nuova impaginazione e la messa in stampa.

 

Se non raggiungeremo l’obbiettivo:

Se non raggiungeremo l’obbiettivo dell’importo minimo, valuteremo delle soluzioni alternative per integrare i costi. In caso negativo i vostri contributi verranno rimborsati.

È la vostra occasione per essere editori per un giorno!

 

 

Perché questo progetto è prezioso?

Un’edizione italiana del libro “Passagen” di Johannes Odenthal porta finalmente, anche al pubblico italiano, la possibilità di approfondire la conoscenza di Koffi Kôkô dei suoi metodi e la sua filosofia di danza. Il suo approccio è unico e attinge, come detto precedentemente, ad ancestrali e profonde tradizioni africane, precisamente quelle dalla tradizione vudù. Una conoscenza e un lavoro sul corpo straordinario e quanto mai utile e necessario, di integrazione dell’essere, soprattutto nella nostra società occidentale così arroccata e sbilanciata sull’aspetto “mentale”.

 

Altri modi in cui puoi aiutare

Alcune persone semplicemente non possono contribuire, ma ciò non significa che non possano aiutare:

  • Anche se deciderai di non contribuire alla campagna, il tuo aiuto ci è prezioso per farla conoscere ad altri.
  • Aiutaci condividendo questa pagina sui tuoi social o segnalandola ad amici che possano essere interessati.
  • Aiutaci a fare tanto rumore, tanto quanto il battito dei tamburi africani in festa.
  • Più sopra troverai tutti gli strumenti social per le tue condivisioni.

 

 

Vogliamo ringraziare l’associazione ATOUT AFRICAN ARCH.IT per il sostegno e l’intermediazione diretta con il maestro Koffi Kôkô. Vedi il sito >>

story:
The Gist

I plan to pay local, professional stage actors, currently and indefinitely out of work, to record the sizable collection of short stories, which I’ve written since retiring from playwriting and theatre a few years ago.

  • As many of you know, I was a theatre professional for over 25 years, mostly writing plays but also acting and producing.
  • Seven years ago I retired from theatre in order to pursue other forms of writing and story-telling.
  • In that time I have:
    • Founded a monthly literary series called Loud Mouth Lit.
    • Written a wild, weird quasi-memoir called The Starting Gate (available as an e-book, paperback and audio book here.)
    • Generated countless poems and essays.
    • Written a novel inspired by my time working as the only male executive assistant in the senior executive suite of Washington Mutual Bank during the run up to the Great Recession. (I was planning on self-publishing this book in the spring until this current pandemic crisis changed everything.)

 

So yeah, I’ve been trying to stay busy in my retirement, but I have never lost touch with my fellow theatre practitioners, and I can tell you that right now they are hurting right along with every other person who makes their living by being in close personal contact with other people, especially in large groups.

I feel like this crisis is hitting local theatre artists especially hard. It is difficult for them to ply their trade on-line when their performances are in direct competition with Hollywood offerings on Netflix, Hulu, Amazon Prime and Disney +.

My short stories would provide some original content for them to work their performance muscles on, and this crowd funding campaign would allow me to pay them a viable wage to do it.

The impact of this project, if fully successful, could result in the opening of a whole new channel for local actors to help develop local authors’ material, regardless if that writing was ultimately intended for the stage. 

In other words, this could be the start of something big.

But for now, even just a small contribution from you can go a long way.

How It Will Work

I have set a goal of raising $7,000 dollars. For every thousand dollars I raise, I will record one of my short stories employing a Seattle-area stage actor to do it, and paying them at least $500 for the job. The remaining funds will go to paying for the audio recording studio time, the director and sound technicians, and miscellaneous promotion and administrative fees. (For instance, Indiegogo charges a 5% fee for the use of this platform.)

What You Get in Return

Give $10 and you will receive a professionally recorded audio short story, performed by a Pacific Northwest actor.

Give $25 and you will receive the collection of all seven of the stories we record.

Give $50 and get all seven stories, plus a free copy of the paperback edition of my book The Starting Gate (a 15$ value.)

Give $100 and you will receive all seven stories, plus a free copy of the limited first edition hardback version of my book The Starting Gate (a 25$ value and there are only 20 of them left), plus I will record a sonnet of your choosing by William Shakespeare, written back during a similar epidemic which closed all of the theaters in England.

Give $500 and you’ll get all the perks offered for $100 and also receive the option of nominating the professional Pacific Northwest actor whom you wish to record one of my stories.

Give $1,000 and you’ll get all the perks offered for $100 and also receive the option of commissioning a brand new, original story written by me based on initiating parameters that you provide. And I’ll let you cast the actor, too, if you want.

We will fund this project as we go. The risk of not raising the entire amount is limited because I will only record as many stories as I can afford to pay actors to read.

My Track Record

I have done this sort of thing. Not only did I produce several original productions while I was still working in the theatre, I also crowd funded the publishing of my book The Starting Gate using this platform, Indiegogo.  I raised $7,125 from 163 backers, which allowed me to publish the book in hardcopy, paperback, electronic version for Kindle as well as an audio book, recorded at Cedar House Audio. We can do this because we have already.

Make no mistake, this isn’t so much a charity as it is a brand-new possibility born out of crisis. With your support and a lot of hard work on the part of actors, and other recording professionals, we might be able to crack open an entirely new market, matching local writers to local actors, giving people work now while we are waiting for the theaters to reopen, but also offering new work in the future if we should discover that there is a market for these kinds of stories.

So Many Ways to Help Make this Happen

For as little as $10 you can help make a new audio recording of an original story happen, but I understand money is extremely tight right now, and the future is uncertain. If you cannot spare the cash but are still interested in the outcome of Crowd Mouth Lit, then please let me know. It could well be that your voice spreading the word about this project will go further to bringing it to fruition than any monetary donation.

So give money if you can, but spread the word in any case. I earnestly believe that it will be lots of modest projects like this that will make the difference in people’s lives as we move forward out of these difficult times.

And we will move forward.

Love,

Paul

It is difficult for them to ply their trade on-line when their performances are in direct competition with Hollywood offerings on Netflix, Hulu, Amazon Prime and Disney +.My short stories would provide some original content for them to work their performance muscles on, and this crowd funding campaign would allow me to pay them a viable wage to do it.The impact of this project, if fully successful, could result in the opening of a whole new channel for local actors to help develop local authors’ material, regardless if that writing was ultimately intended for the stage. In other words, this could be the start of something big.But for now, even just a small contribution from you can go a long way.How It Will WorkI have set a goal of raising $7,000 dollars. For every thousand dollars I raise, I will record one of my short stories employing a Seattle-area stage actor to do it, and paying them at least $500 for the job. The remaining funds will go to paying for the audio recording studio time, the director and sound technicians, and miscellaneous promotion and administrative fees. (For instance, Indiegogo charges a 5% fee for the use of this platform.)What You Get in ReturnGive $10 and you will receive a professionally recorded audio short story, performed by a Pacific Northwest actor.Give $25 and you will receive the collection of all seven of the stories we record.Give $50 and get all seven stories, plus a free copy of the paperback edition of my book The Starting Gate (a 15$ value.)Give $100 and you will receive all seven stories, plus a free copy of the limited first edition hardback version of my book The Starting Gate (a 25$ value and there are only 20 of them left), plus I will record a sonnet of your choosing by William Shakespeare, written back during a similar epidemic which closed all of the theaters in England.Give $500 and you’ll get all the perks offered for $100 and also receive the option of nominating the professional Pacific Northwest actor whom you wish to record one of my stories.Give $1,000 and you’ll get all the perks offered for $100 and also receive the option of commissioning a brand new, original story written by me based on initiating parameters that you provide. And I’ll let you cast the actor, too, if you want.We will fund this project as we go. The risk of not raising the entire amount is limited because I will only record as many stories as I can afford to pay actors to read.My Track RecordI have done this sort of thing. Not only did I produce several original productions while I was still working in the theatre, I also crowd funded the publishing of my book The Starting Gate using this platform, Indiegogo.  I raised $7,125 from 163 backers, which allowed me to publish the book in hardcopy, paperback, electronic version for Kindle as well as an audio book, recorded at Cedar House Audio. We can do this because we have already.Make no mistake, this isn’t so much a charity as it is a brand-new possibility born out of crisis. With your support and a lot of hard work on the part of actors, and other recording professionals, we might be able to crack open an entirely new market, matching local writers to local actors, giving people work now while we are waiting for the theaters to reopen, but also offering new work in the future if we should discover that there is a market for these kinds of stories.So Many Ways to Help Make this HappenFor as little as $10 you can help make a new audio recording of an original story happen, but I understand money is extremely tight right now, and the future is uncertain. If you cannot spare the cash but are still interested in the outcome of Crowd Mouth Lit, then please let me know. It could well be that your voice spreading the word about this project will go further to bringing it to fruition than any monetary donation.So give money if you can, but spread the word in any case. I earnestly believe that it will be lots of modest projects like this that will make the difference in people’s lives as we move forward out of these difficult times.And we will move forward.Love,Paul

story:
Spencer Locke’s Market:

My name is Yolanda Rondon and I am the author of Spencer Locke’s Market. I wrote this novel because the origins of cryptocurrency and block chain technology are both a mystery and infamous. Rooted in the ideals of civil liberties and financial freedom, the cryptocurrency GoldCoin is for the people and by the people. The people are the driving mechanism behind GoldCoin, powering the economy without the traditional financial power structure. No banks, no institutions, and no government agencies.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the potential for crypto to transform people's lives across the world: the unbanked population, financially disenfranchised, and developing countries.

In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for the future of crypto. And then, ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you understand how to use the new crypto economy to benefit your professional development, small business, and humanitarian efforts.

In this book, you'll learn about cryptocurrency and block chain technology, the platform that cryptocurrency operates on. Explore the origins and ongoing development of cryptocurrency, and the fight for principle over profit. Current events have placed our privacy rights and financial independence at risk, and thus our core right to freedom and liberty. Crypto and block chain technology signals hope.

The world of crypto is not black and white. There will always be bad actors, but that does not mean we agree to allow banks, institutions, and government agencies to take the reins. We know what they are capable of, and it's not always good, but the impact of crypto is evident:

  • Today, the most efficient way to get money to London is to buy an airplane ticket and physically take it there yourself. You can stream video from the space station but you cannot move your own money quickly and cheaply. You will pay the institutional financial power structure to make transfers, but it is your money, so why should you? Crypto and blockchain is revolutionizing how we control and even think about money. This is the new economy.

 

  • Crypto and blockchain can address corruption in humanitarian aid by allowing donations to be directly funded to the recipients, suppliers of the materials and labor. There is no need for contractors, vendors, third party intermediaries. Thus, eliminating the number of hands in the pot that can skim some money off the top, so all aid goes to those who actually need it.

 

  • The NY stock market has existed for over 200 years but many still do not understand how it works. Our children do not want to invest in stocks. The reality is that they are not interested or excluded because of the need of traditional access to wealth and connections being concentrated in the power of the few, the 1%. But our children know about cryptocurrency and are investing in it. The government purports that they must act to protect our children from fraud in a field self-regulated by unregulated whitepapers. But the future, our children, are beyond regulation.

 

You will love this book if you are curious about the origin of cryptocurrency and its ongoing developments, and the intersection of technology and civil liberties development.

Spencer Locke’s Market is a novel that speaks to the people with no conditions. It rises from the spirit of the youth, the activist, and the working class.

 

The Novel:

The novel explores the underlying ideals of cryptocurrency and block chain technology.

The introduction briefly describes how cryptocurrency and block chain technology works and provides context for the competing interests involved in the crypto economy. The introduction also spurs the reader to reflect on the impact of technology, privacy, and capitalism as they read. Through 13 chapters, the reader rides the ups and downs of the crypto market with the unknown and mysterious creator of GoldCoin, Moto.

Part 1 encompasses chapters 1 through 4. The reader meets the protagonist, Moto, whose personality sheds light on society's conflict with cryptocurrency and how these conflicts contradict democracy itself. We see the purity of a true marketplace for the people not controlled nor dependent upon big business, banks, or governments.

Part 2 contains Chapters 5 through 8. After growing with the characters in development of block chain, GoldCoin is now valued at nearly $20,000 per coin. Almost everyone is reveling in success but everything is not what it seems as the government is watching. Plus, the reader follows Moto as he faces his internal struggles and external pressures as crypto grows and transforms.

Part 3 concludes the story with chapters 9 through 13. The reader will learn about the abrupt collapse of GoldCoin. Everyone is panicking and the government capitalizes in the panic. Scandal dominates the news just as block chain technology is being used to deliver development aid to Ghana.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get:

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2019

The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)

The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this December 2019.

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

 

I am offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish

A personal, handwritten thank you note 

Your name will appear in a Special Acknowledgements section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)

Early access to the Introduction of my book and my entire manuscript

The opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover

I will do an Author Talk where I will share my experience writing my book

And more....

 

About the Author:

Yolanda dedicates her life to protecting civil rights and civil liberties. A privacy and anti-profiling legal advocate, she began her legal career in DC working for the American-Arab Anti-Discrimination Committee. A national civil rights organization, where she defended communities of color, immigrants, & religious minorities. Yolanda earned her National Security LLM at Georgetown University Law Center where she studied cryptocurrency regulation & J.D. at Case Western University School of Law.

Yolanda seeks to explore an exciting, yet to many, foreign technological innovation that created waves throughout the financial sector. The increased government interest to regulate and legislate in the crypto sphere demonstrates a need to balance privacy and civil liberties interests at stake.

Yolanda has always had a distinct voice that her loved ones jokingly teased her about. This followed her into law school where a law professor told Yolanda that she could not be a lawyer because of her voice. Within 2 years of passing the New York bar, Yolanda filed 2 amicus briefs to the U.S. Supreme Court.

Thanks again,
Yolanda Rondon

story:
Short Summary

Here at Denver Horror Collective—our frighteningly talented group of horror writers and artists in and around the Mile High City—we believe in the motto: write locally, scare globally.

Which is why we’re all shivers to announce Terror at 5280’, our horror fiction anthology due out this fall, with stories set around the greater Denver metroplex and Front Range Rocky Mountain communities, all penned by Colorado authors!

What authors, you may ask? Well, how about: 

  • Bram Stoker Award-winning horror master, Stephen Graham Jones
  • USA Today and #1 Denver Post bestselling thriller author Carter Wilson
  • Hex Publishers owner, editor, and author Josh Viola
  • Foreword by John Palisano, author and President of Horror Writers Association
  • Various Denver Horror Collective members
  • Other Colorado-based horror fiction writers

 

The print and e-book anthology will run about 250 pages and include roughly 20 stories (the editorial team has already made its selections and is currently editing). Some tales are based on local folklore and urban legends, while others touch on social and environmental themes relevant to the area, such as gentrification, substance abuse and…zombie deer. 

Our goal is to publish a high-quality and entertaining product that showcases a wide spectrum of Colorado horror writers, from nationally-recognized big names, to seasoned semi-pros, to emerging talents.

As with everything at Denver Horror Collective, Terror at 5280’  is a group effort. So, if you love horror fiction, indie publishing, and/or local arts, we need your help!

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $3,500 to get Terror at 5280’ off the ground.

Here’s where your money will be going:

  • $1,000 for publishing costs
  • $800 for semi-pro rate of 1 cent per word to 20 authors
  • $100 Stephen Graham Jones’ original story, “This Was Always Going to Happen” 
  • $150 for online publication of 10 stories in lead-up to anthology
  • $300 for original cover art
  • $400 for content editing
  • $300 for copy editing
  • $200 for proofreading
  • $250 for Layout

 

In appreciation for your financial contributions, we’d like to offer the following gifts:

$500 - Your name in a Terror at 5280' story
$250 - Framed Terror at 5280’ poster signed by illustrator, The RïpRöck
$100 - Drinks and horror chat with two Denver Horror Collective members at BookBar
$35 - Denver Horror Collective T-shirt 
$35 - Print copy of Terror at 5280’ signed by Collective members 
$20 - E-book of Terror at 5280’
$15 - One of three autographed horror fiction anthologies—Shrieks and Shivers, Turn to Ash, or Demons, Devils, and Denizens of Hell—with stories by Collective members
$5 - Denver Horror Collective sticker

 

The Impact

Denver is home to one of the largest and most active horror writer communities in the country. In fact, Denver has become so synonymous with horror fiction that the Horror Writers Association has chosen the Mile High City to host its 2021 Stoker Con!

As the nation’s leading edge of horror, we have an obligation to showcase the writers haunting our fine city—from award-winners to those appearing in publication for the first time—in one historic anthology as a representation of what Colorado (and the horror genre, itself) has to offer. 

As crucial as the big publishing houses are to horror fiction, independent presses and magazines have always been its foundation, where unique voices from all backgrounds can be heard and honored. And let’s not forget that these small publications are where many a horror master (i.e. H.P. Lovecraft, Stephen King) got their start!

Our incredible authors aside, we’ve also rounded up a formidable editorial and publishing team who will all but ensure the anthology’s raging success. Some of the folks on board include: 

  • a writing instructor, book designer, and retired independent horror editor and publisher
  • an owner of a publishing company focusing on LGBTQ horror and staffer for a nonprofit author resource organization 
  • an associate editor at a popular speculative fiction magazine
  • an award-winning investigative journalist and former publication editor
  • Two MFAs

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you’re not in a place where you can make a financial contribution but love what we’re doing, you can still be a part of bringing Terror at 5280’ to life by sharing this fundraiser far and wide!

Also, be sure to like us on Facebook and subscribe to our free monthly newsletter, The Epitaph!

Darkest Regards,

Denver Horror Collective

story:
Greetings friends and fellow artists. My name is James Lawson Moore, and I hope to have just a moment of your time. It concerns a project I care about very much. By the end of my little spiel I hope that you will care about it too.

            See, I am a writer, and while I write all kinds of things—from essays to film scripts to the occasional novel—it is in poetry that I take my primary form. Between studying various forms of literature in college, hitting up the open mic circuit, and engaging with my fellow artists in roundtable conversations (where much coffee and soda is consumed), I have amassed a sizable collection of words over the years. It is with a sampling of those words that I seek to publish a series of poetry collections, to be billed under the title of Renegade Poetry. The series will comprise of at least three or four books, and they will be issued in ebook and paperback formats.

            I’ve done a fair bit in indie publishing, releasing a few small collections and even a crime novel through Amazon’s KDP. And I’ve enjoyed going the indie poetry route. But for all the love I have for KDP I want to be able to do more with my art. Which is why I plan on moving over to IngramSpark with this next series of books. With IngramSpark I’ll be able to get my work into actual brick and mortar stores. And getting into brick and mortar stores is what every writer dreams of.

            In order to do this I’ll need some help. There are some upfront costs to publishing through IngramSpark, the largest cost being the purchase of ISBN numbers so that I can establish my own publishing imprint. Services like CreateSpace and KDP offer ISBNs for free, but you don’t get to name the imprint with them and it makes for a harder time getting distributed anywhere other than on Amazon.

            Which brings me to what I am now asking of you, which is some help with the cost of ISBN numbers, as well as to offset some of the print costs for the first batch of paperbacks I’ll be ordering of the first book in the series, Word Pictures Etched in My Head. This book comprises some of my best writing, and will soon be followed by a book that is even better.

            For those of you who are wondering what I’m getting at here, it’s this. I am asking for 750 dollars to go towards the bulk purchase of 10 ISN numbers, as well as the initial setup fee through Ingram and printing a run of the first book. I also hope to have some funds to help with various promotional and advertising needs.

            Those of you who would like to contribute to my goal will receive great perks, such as ebook downloads of the book, signed and numbered limited broadsides of single poems, signed copies of paperbacks and even personalized videos where I do an “open mic” style reading of a poem written specifically for the person who chooses that option (and it’s an awesome option if I do say so myself). Every little bit helps, and you’d be giving to a guy who gives his all to create the best possible art.

            That pretty much sums up what I was hoping to say. I want to thank each of you who’ve taken the time to check out my crowdfunding campaign. If you would like to contribute the perks are on the right side of the page. And if you think your Facebook and Twitter friends would be interested please share the page so that they can find out about it. Word of mouth exposure from friends is among the best forms of publicity for an artist, no matter the medium in which they work.

story:
Story of My Book

My name is Ron Cohen and I am the author of Working With Robots.

Most conversations about the future of work focus on how AI will dramatically reshape modern industries. But very few answer the question what we should be doing now to prepare for an unpredictable future.

Working With Robots answers the big questions on everyone’s minds: How AI will redefine the way we Work and Learn? Will we eventually be able to relax while bots handle the most disagreeable chores? Or will AI systems take all the good jobs?

In this book, you'll learn about the following:

  • Whether Robots will eventually replace us
  • What industries are most likely to be taken over by Robots
  • Will college degrees still be relevant in 15, 10, or even 5 years from now?
  • How Higher Ed institutions can meet the rapidly changing requirements of the industry
  • What are the most invaluable skills in the age of robots?

Working With Robots will help you understand how AI is redefining the workforce of the future. Regardless of where you are in your career—this book is relevant, a must-read, and timely.

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2019

  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Winter

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now. You will receive:

  • A personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book

And more...

About the Author

Ron Cohen is a certified AI & Business strategist from MIT Sloan Executive Education and holds an MBA from Georgetown McDonough School of Business. He is passionate about innovative technology and enjoys talking about the impact of disruptive technologies on jobs, skills, and education.

Ron is an Innovation Enthusiast, an Entrepreneur and a Life Long Learner. In his spare time, he loves to play with his beautiful daughter, watch soccer games around the world, and try weird combinations of food.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends and family. 

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Ron Cohen

story:
Kerry Carter is an innocent "old soul" who is venturing away from her home town for the first time in her life.  This fantastic tale of a young maiden in a modern-day world keeps you on the edge of your seat while taking you on a journey you would likely never expect.  Perfect for light reading on a vacation or traveling for business. 

More info at... https://spark.adobe.com/page/D6QSujvRpN7Jw/

When I first read The Calling  I knew I needed to make it my first project.  This was a change since I originally planned to get my periodical, Modern Homemaking, up and going first and then branch into other publications.  But The Calling  is the first novel in many years that has actually grabbed my attention.  I enjoyed every read-through more each time.  That's something.

Stephanie McCoy, chief editor, McCoy's Publishing LLC

 

  • Fundraising and taking pre-orders through IndieGOGO allows McCoy's Publishing LLC to operate debt-free. 
  • By contributing you are helping bring the book to life.  Literally.  Printed on recycled paper, in the USA, in both paperback and hardcover editions.  We hope to raise enough funds to record the audio version.
  • We provide identical books for donation to any accepting entity.  Libraries, military facilities, emergency responders, shelters, hospitals, senior care facilities, prisons,... anyone who accepts donations.
  • Our books feature book club discussion questions and other appendixes. 

Helping bring new, emerging authors to light in their own way.

 

Releasing any piece of work takes time, energy, and a bit of money.  We would like to remain debt-free by by raising money to cover the rest of the release of this novel. 

  • $5000-printing costs to print copies for sale to readers, for review and promotional give-away's, copies to donate, and costs for promotional materials including posters and bookstore displays.
  • Stretch Goal #1: $10,000- the audio format will be made by JDM Audio LLC and available for sale by the release date.  It will also be donated to the Library of the Blind and other similar organizations. 
  • Stretch Goal #2: $25,000- regional release
  • Stretch Goal #3: $50,000- regional plus Seattle or SanFrancisco
  • Stretch Goal #4: $100,000- national release including region plus Seattle, SanFrancisco, NewYork, Dallas, and Chicago

 

  • The Digital Edition is a flow-able format ePub available in any format available.
  • Paperback Edition includes drawings not included in the digital edition.
  • Hardcover Edition includes images not included in other editions, and is a larger size than the paperback. 
  • Picnic Set, Hot drink Set, and other Special Offerings
  • Double-Donations- yes!
  • Souvenir poster by request.  

If we don't reach our goal of $5000, we will be sad but not defeated.  We will reduce our numbers of "review" and "give-away" copies and print what we can afford to print.  Thanks to Print-on-Demand and similar services we can fulfill orders and maintain our promise of One-for-One no matter the minimum!

 

By contributing to the release of The Calling, you...

  • Allow McCoy's Publishing LLC to continue setting an example for debt-free business operation.
  • Contribute to the production of a quality, and giving product.
  • Provide books for donation.
  • In addition to donating books we print, your contribution helps fund our charity initiatives that help solve problems and help improve services to those in need.

 

  • The story is already through the editing process, and we are mostly through the layout process.
  • We are lining up multiple printers so we have options. 
  • Costs for other items including but not limited to editing, cover design, layout, promotional design, and promotional video production have been covered. 

 

Remember, every book sold = a book donated.  (Anywhere a purchaser chooses to donate that receives book donations.)

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. 
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
I need you...

Als schrijver van verhalen en een beetje poëzie heb ik reeds een tijd geleden een kinderboek geschreven over een thema dat nauw aansluit aan mijn dagelijks werk met kinderen en hun ouders. Over het verhaal zelf ga ik niet te veel uitweiden, maar het gaat over een kind dat niet wil gaan slapen uit angst voor wat er misschien wel allemaal zou kunnen gebeuren... De ouders gaan er alvast op een bijzondere manier mee om. 

Het verhaal heeft een stuk de ondersteuning van de tekeningen nodig, en daarvoor heb ik uiteraard een goeie illustrator nodig. Om dit te kunnen bekostigen heb ik jullie steun nodig.

Maar wie steunt, krijgt er uiteraard iets voor terug:

Voor wat, hoort wat:

  • Iedereen die steunt, krijgt sowieso in zijn/haar boek een persoonlijk woordje van de schrijver (boek wel zelf te kopen uiteraard).
  • Wie het bedrag van 25 euro steunt, krijgt een persoonlijk gedicht toegezonden.
  • Wie het bedrag van 50 euro steunt, krijgt 1 euro korting (voor elk gezinslid) op de inkomprijs  van het nieuwe theaterstuk Johannes 2.0 (voorstelling in najaar 2019).
  • Wie het bedrag van 100 euro steunt, krijgt een voorleesbeurt aan huis.
  • Wie het bedrag van 200 euro steunt, krijgt een huiskamervoorstelling of een workshop rond spel en spelen.

Moest je niet kunnen of willen steunen:

Dan kan je nog altijd helpen door mijn oproep mee te verspreiden, en er zo mee voor zorgen om meer mensen te bereiken.

Ik dank jullie alvast van harte!

Niels

story:
Hi there!

Pamela Wasabi here. I'm raising funds to self-publish my third book, Returning to the Wild Woman.

I've been working on this project for the last two years. I've dedicated my time to learning, experiencing, feeling, writing, and delivering the wisdom I have discovered through my studies in the psychology of eating and Eastern philosophies. I have hosted lectures in a dozen different venues around Miami and online since 2018. I've also opened a transformational coaching practice, helping women understand and heal their relationship with food, and I have been using my social channels to share the writings from the book to inspire and empower women to strengthen their self-love.

This book is based on what I call the "Wild Woman Philosophy," which is a way of seeing and living life based on the principle of honoring the ever-creative feminine energy that resides in all of us. Through this book, I invite the reader to awaken their Divine Feminine from the oppression and violence experienced by the ego-mind across centuries, as it has wreaked havoc on our relationships with ourselves, our bodies, and our emotions. Returning to the Wild Woman focuses on one specific theme: helping women heal and transform food issues, body-image issues, and eating disorders. I intend to connect you with your Wild Woman, this innate transformative power that is key to our liberation.

The funds from this campaign will be distributed among the following expenses:

  • 3rd and final edit to the book $1000
  • Book cover design $400
  • Book printing and initial round of copies $1500-$2500

--

Bio

Pamela Wasabi is a thought innovator on women’s social issues, food education and relationship with food. Her background stretches from the whereabouts of the psychology of eating, integrative nutrition, eastern philosophy, to plant-based food artistry. She’s a mother, an Oracle Card reader, and a lover of life. Wasabi is the founder of a local bakery in Miami bringing the message of Self-Love to the table, proposing a new approach to food with her motto #EatMoreBeauty. She’s the author of "Nourished, The Plant-based Path to Health and Happiness,” which explores our relationship with food and self. In January 2020 she published “Woman of the Moon” a poetry book filled with wild feminist prose proposing the liberation of the soul from the oppression imposed by the ego-mind. Pamela Wasabi is currently working on her third title, “Returning to the Wild Woman,” which expands on women’s food challenges and body image issues. She presents the healing solution through the connection, revival and balance of a woman’s Divine Feminine energy.

story:
Background

I've struggled with my mental health for years, but over the course of lockdown, it went seriously downhill. In the past 12 months, I've been forced to quit two jobs because of it. After quitting the second one, I knew I had to change, but I didn't know exactly how. I started on antidepressants in December and it's been a rough ride since.


I've always wanted to help people, but I didn't know how. I always thought my anxiety would get in the way. But then, one day last week, a thought crossed my mind. I don't really know where it came from - I wasn't even reading a book at the time. I thought - I should open a bookstore. So I looked into it. I was up all night, and by the next morning, I knew this was what I had to do.


I don't have many passions, and my depression, along with the pandemic, stopped me from doing any of the few I did have. Last month I bought a bunch of books and since then it's been my main pastime. Books transfer you to a different world - all the struggles disappear from your mind. You're in a new world. Or a different part of the world. Books allow you to escape from reality in a way that film & tv can't do. Video games come close - but your brain is still only comprehending the images that somebody else has made. With a book, you have to think about the words and create your own picture in your mind - no two people interpret what they read in the same way and THAT is what makes books so special. The words are the same, but the images you see are unique to you.

Find more info on my proposal here.

What We Need & What You Get

There are a number of things we need to pay for before we get access to our main funding. These include:

  • Accountants & Solicitors fees
  • Chartered Surveyor fees
  • Industry-specific subscriptions
  • Research for my business plan
  • Buying 'test' stock from suppliers to evaluate quality

Don't worry, you can receive awesome rewards for your support! These include:

  • 5% Founders discount
  • 10% VIP discount
  • Trial subscriptions
  • Premium MVP discount!

If there are any other rewards you would like, please let me know and I'll see what I can do!

How Your Support Helps Others

Outside of selling books, the main aim of our store is to create a community hub and help as many people as possible. This is what I am most passionate about! I want the store to be a centrepiece of the community. I want every single person who enters to feel safe & loved & appreciated. Even if you’re not buying a book, I want you to come by and say hello and browse and talk to other like-minded members of the community. Every independent bookstore I have researched is invested in its local community. That is why I think a bookshop works so well as a hub to help as many people as possible. The two go hand-in-hand.

Here are just a few of the organisations I plan to help or partner with:

  • Schools & Nurseries (including special schools)
  • Hospitals, GP Surgeries & Dentists (so you have something to do while you wait)
  • A host of different local charities (please let me know which charities may benefit from our help)
  • Other local businesses (Again, let me know of any who may benefit from partnering with us)
  • Stafford Borough Council & Staffordshire County Council

If there are any other organisations with who you think we could work well and who share our values, please tell me!

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't worry if you can't contribute any money to this campaign. Here are some other ways you can help:

  • Spread the word! The most valuable way you can help is by telling your friends and family about the project. The more people who know about it, the better.
  • Donate your used books! Used books will be much cheaper for those who cannot afford new books, so every donation helps the people who need it most. If you donate a large amount of books, we may even pay you for them! Note: Used books must be in sellable condition to receive compensation, e.g. no missing or ripped pages. We also want a variety, so please don't donate your whole Stephen King collection of 50 books!
  • Visit! The store may not be open yet, but you can still visit us virtually through our social media channels:
    • Instagram
    • Facebook
    • Twitter
  • Join! Whilst we’re still only in the early stages, I am already on the lookout for help. If you think this sounds like a project you want to jump on board with, please let me know! Check out my proposal document here to find out what kind of help we are looking for!

Thanks for taking the time to read my proposal. I appreciate anyone and everyone who helps me on this venture, small or large. Let’s work together to make our store the best it can be. And let’s work together to make Stafford the best it can be.

You can talk to me here or on any of our social media accounts listed above.

I look forward to hearing from you :),

NOTE: 'Stafford Book Store' is a working title. The store will have a much better name soon, so stay tuned.

Donate your used books! Used books will be much cheaper for those who cannot afford new books, so every donation helps the people who need it most. If you donate a large amount of books, we may even pay you for them! Note: Used books must be in sellable condition to receive compensation, e.g. no missing or ripped pages. We also want a variety, so please don't donate your whole Stephen King collection of 50 books!


Visit! The store may not be open yet, but you can still visit us virtually through our social media channels:
Instagram
Facebook
Twitter



Join! Whilst we’re still only in the early stages, I am already on the lookout for help. If you think this sounds like a project you want to jump on board with, please let me know! Check out my proposal document here to find out what kind of help we are looking for!

Thanks for taking the time to read my proposal. I appreciate anyone and everyone who helps me on this venture, small or large. Let’s work together to make our store the best it can be. And let’s work together to make Stafford the best it can be.
You can talk to me here or on any of our social media accounts listed above.
I look forward to hearing from you :),
NOTE: 'Stafford Book Store' is a working title. The store will have a much better name soon, so stay tuned.

story:
Gulfport, Florida isn't just any town. The Gabber isn't just any newspaper. 

The Gabber’s always been there for you — now, the Gabber needs you to be there for it. 

The COVID-19 pandemic has forced the closure of the newspaper, but your donations can bring it back. On March 26, 2020, the Gabber Newspaper closed its doors.  Your $25 can help keep the Gabber alive.

Please donate what you can. Do your part to save the Gabber Newspaper, a hyperlocal newspaper that raises up the voices of its community.

Telling Gulfport's stories, one Thursday at a time.

The Gabber is a free weekly paper, distributed every Thursday, but it’s more than that — it’s the voice of Gulfport and the surrounding communities in South Pinellas County. The Gabber shows up when no other news can or will. Without the Gabber, no one’s writing about what’s happening in downtown Gulfport, or at the Gulfport History Museum, or at the Community Garden. No one’s writing about what makes Jimmy Oswain so special (you may know him as “Mr. Gulfport” on the green bicycle), or how Gulfportians help one another throughout the pandemic, where city council candidates get their money, or what’s happening with Gulfport’s arts hub. Since 1968, the Gabber has been the voice of our community and the people who love it.

Gabber reporters sit through city council meetings, show up at every event in the city, and highlight all the good things — little, large, and heartwarming — happening in our community. It’s the paper that tells you what’s happening at Bogie, laughs along with Gulfport, reports on Little League, celebrates Gulfport’s first same-sex marriage, and tells you about kidnapped goats.

The Gabber is a vital resource for clubs and organizations throughout the community. The paper’s a digital and print bulletin board — and sounding board — for not only the community, but local government, charitable organizations, and small businesses. 

For more than half-century, the Gabber Newspaper has served Gulfport and South Pinellas County. It is one of the last family-owned papers in Florida, and it needs your help to come back stronger than ever. The Gabber ceased publishing in print and online in March, and Gulfport and the South Pinellas communities it serves weekly are anxious for it to return. 


If we meet our goal...

What will it take to keep the Gabber alive? It’s going to take money to publish the news online, inform the community, and pay the bills. This money will keep the Gabber publishing, and help make the changes needed to adapt during the pandemic.

  • While this money will, among other things, pay salaries for an editor, reporters, and a designer, the owners will not take a salary until the pandemic crisis passes and the paper is on sure footing again. 
  • The Gabber will resume publishing digitally throughout the pandemic, with expanded online content. 
  • Once the pandemic ends and the economy starts to bounce back, we'll resume printing every Thursday. 

Across the country, we’re seeing newspapers die. Standard funding sources are understandably pre-occupied with coronavirus payouts, and projects like this are not even on their radar. Help keep the Gabber serving our community — do not let our voices go silent!

Do your part to save the Gabber — $25 suggested, but any amount helps!

Other Ways You Can Help

If donating isn't for you right now, that doesn't mean you can't help bring back the Gabber Newspaper!

  • Make a low-interest loan to us. You choose the rate — up to 5 % — depending on what you can afford (or by how philanthropic you feel!) Contact us to set up a low- or no-interest loan. 
  • Are you an advertiser, or do you want to be? Pre-pay for your ads. We've relied on your business for 52 years, and you're the reason we can exist at all. To show our appreciation for our advertisers, we're going back to our 2016 rates. You can pre-pay for as many ads as you want. (You can also give this as a gift!) Load up a gift card with pre-paid advertising here. 
  • Share, share, share. The more people who see this, the more people who can help save the Gabber Newspaper! And hey, while you're at it, follow us on Instagram, Facebook, and Twitter. 

 

A word from the owners and publishers Ken and Deb Reichart

We've gotten some questions about our fundraiser here, and we want to be clear: We, along with Cathy Salustri, are looking into all means to bring back the paper to the community, but that requires capital. Your donation will go directly back into the paper in order to make that happen.

—Ken and Deb Reichart, Publishers, the Gabber Newspaper

 

Team Gabber!

  

Ken Reichart and Deb Reichart are the publishers. They bought the Gabber in the early '90s. They're joined by...

 

Cathy Salustri, who worked for the Gabber as a reporter and columnist from 2003-2015. She's also worked as the arts + entertainment editor at Creative Loafing Tampa (2016-2019) and currently works as a freelance writer. She's the author of Backroads of Paradise (2016, University Press of Florida), which appeared in the New York Times. The rest of the team includes...

Laura Mulrooney

Laura Mulrooney was a reporter for the Gabber until its closure in March 2020. She has a master's degree in Journalism and Media Studies Graduate from the University Of South Florida- St. Petersburg. While in graduate school, Laura’s work for several local publications won her the Society for Environmental Journalists Emerging Environmental Journalist Award. Her work focused on childhood hunger and agricultural gag laws. She's also served our country overseas in Operation in Iraqi Freedom (2008-2009) and is a decorated combat war veteran, which did prepare her for covering city hall in a unique way.

Shelly Wilson

Shelly Wilson worked as the editor of the Gabber Newspaper until its closure in March 2020. She currently runs her own editing business, Last Word Editing. She's returning to the paper as the editor. 

Joey Neill

Joey Neill joins the Gabber Newspaper as its Creative Director. Joey has more than 15 years experience with print and digital media, and lost his job as the Creative Director at Creative Loafing Tampa in March. 

Our team believes in the Gabber, so much they've asked to wait to get paid until after the deal closes and we have funding in place for the next six months. For those of us displaced journalists, there's an energy among us that comes from doing something important. We all believe in the future of the Gabber and local news!

 

View the Gabber Newspaper’s print editions and online coverage here. 

Making a donation does not give the donor any ownership or editorial control of the Gabber Newspaper.

story:
I'm Jennifer Gladen, technology teacher and author of Souled.  The idea of Souled came to me when I noticed not only my own son attached to videogames, but many of my students as well. It was the same thing - the desire to keep returning and to keep playing more and more.

 

WHY Support Souled?

Souled is an important book in this technological world. As all of us are inundated by screens and devices, tech appears to consume us all more and more.

See my talk with Dave D'Aoust on You Tube!  

  • In addition to being a teacher and an author, I'm also a mom of a 15-year-old boy. Even with everything I know about tech, I wasn't able to stop the pull video games have on him. 

  • As an author, I'm often inspired by those around me. As a teacher, I see many of my students feel the same pull to a video game.

  • Since I love to teach through stories, a middle-grade story formed about a boy who gets trapped inside a video game. There's one scene that battles the constant distraction our screens have on us. In this scene, Ethan has to force himself to pull away from the distraction in order to complete the mission and be successful. 

 

What is SOULED?

Souled is an upper middle-grade fantasy novel about friendship, family and loyalty. Oh - and gaming!

When Ethan and his friends play the much anticipated new game Seeker, they are thrown into a new world where the lines of reality and gaming are blurred. As people close to Ethan, including his sister, start to disappear, Ethan and his team must free the trapped souls, defeat the dark wizard and stop the destruction before he and his friends are trapped forever.

THE PULL OF THE GAME...

  • Ever play a video game and wonder where the past 6 hours went...

  • Ever feel like it was time to pull away, but you had to play just one more level... 

  • Ever think, "Just one more try..."

Ethan and his friends discover what's behind that pull in Seeker.

 

What would you do if you were playing your favorite video game and became trapped there? That's the question that started it all with SOULED.

 

As a parent and a teacher, I see the pull that technology has on our children. In fact, my own son plays more than he should. That got me thinking that it's almost like someone is inside these games entrapping them and making it hard to leave them. From there the story of SOULED was born.

 

 

 

CAN ETHAN STOP NITH, THE DARK WIZARD, FROM MERGING THE DIGITAL WORLD AND THE REAL WORLD?

 

Ethan, a tech-savvy gamer,  joins the newest gaming rage-Seeker. With his best friends in tow, they try it and fall in love with Bailiwick, the realistic gaming world where the game takes place. Ethan senses something is off as he learns more about the coveted game. When a school friend goes missing, and later his sister, Ethan and his friends discover Nith, a dark wizard, is trapping players inside the game. 

When Ethan and his friends set out to help the trapped players, he discovers there is much more to just being trapped in the game. He learns of Nith's plan to merge the digital world with the real world.  The more souls Nith collects, the more powerful he becomes!  

Will Ethan and his friends be able to stop Nith even as he gains more power with each trapped soul? Or will they join the others who are destined to be trapped forever and becoming part of Nith's NEW WORLD?

A story about friendships, family, gaming, and growth, Souled is an action-packed book filled with one adventure after another.  

 

 

 

 

 

​Risks & Challenges

There is very little risk with this campaign since I will have the flexibility to print as many or as little books needed to fulfil the perks.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, the best thing you can do is

  • SPREAD THE WORD and make some noise about Souled. 
  • Indiegogo has share tools to help with sharing.
