story:
Hi! We are Digital Story Universe, a group of writers, designers, entrepreneurs and crime fiction fans who want to create a new way for readers to experience and enjoy their stories. Following lots of discussion with other fans of crime fiction we recruited graphic designers and software developers to build a digital immersive crime universe based on an incredible story with tons of additional cool features. Access to the content will be through subscription with new material and story lines released every month.

We now have a ready to go initial version of our story accessed through a website, but we’d like your help in turning a great start into a truly awesome product.  We are launching this campaign to raise funds to take the website development to the next level, to provide more amazing art and design content, to introduce an audio version, increase the accessibility options for people with reading difficulties  and to keep the writers producing and enriching the epic story lines. 

We hope to produce stories in many genres but our first venture is in the field of crime fiction and we have created the Digital Crime Universe. Our writer, Jason, has written a crime novel set in California that forms the first part in a series of books. 

A San Francisco banker cut to pieces in Yosemite; a diamond edged slaughter knife; a tech billionaire as suspect and the Stanford University Crime Writing Club with secrets worth dying for. 

Detective Abrahams hoped for a new life in the mountains to escape a death wish. 

Now he wants answers before his wish comes true.

In his way is the person closest to him: Raven. She’s his partner in the case, an ex-army officer and veteran of the wars in Iraq and Afghanistan.  He dreams about the Torah and oblivion; she has nightmares of corpses piled high in village streets. She wants a second chance; he wants her off the case. 

Because she’s a liability.

Because she’s his sister.

As the investigation moves into the underworld of San Francisco and Silicon Valley  they uncover what they really need: clues to the unsolved murder of their own mother. But as the city descends into a bloodbath they realise the price of justice comes at a deadly cost.

It is a revenge story but ultimately its central theme is loss. Just how far would you go to heal the pain of losing someone you loved?

The beauty of the digital medium is not only can you follow the story in a linear fashion but you get the option to explore other dynamic  and immersive elements that a stand alone published or ebook book simply can't provide. By entering the website you can explore the locations, crime scenes, murder weapons, characters backgrounds as well as alternate story lines, short stories, maps, biographies, and loads of stunning art work and design. 

We really focussed on customising the reader experience such as size of text and font, background colours, choice of avatar etc.  We are totally committed to accessibility and again this medium allows us to provide  those with reading difficulties the ability to adapt the text to meet their needs. Add to that our goal of audio options for as many aspects of the story as possible and we hope to provide as an inclusive story world as possible to our readers and listeners.

Not only all this but we are building into the project a networking capability too! You can chat with other readers of the story, post your comments directly next to the text, link in to the rest of the internet and social media, and contact the writers directly. Add in writer interviews and videos with experts such as forensic specialists, historians, etc then we have something truly original and game changing for the world of crime fiction. 

You can see here some of the features we have developed so far and we have so much more waiting in the wings. Indeed,  we want to listen to what readers want and to keep innovating.

Dashboard - Once you enter the story you will have your own personalised dashboard to give you complete control over your experience while in the crime universe. Work your way through an interactive crime board with access to great features.

You can also use the website to find links to further research material and a whole host of additional material such as short stories, diary entries, alternate storylines.

Interactive map - Use an interactive map to find locations in the story and more content on the places, characters, events in the story.

Comment with your friends on the story - As well as interactive and immersive digital content we want you to enjoy experiencing the crime universe with your friends and fellow readers with features such as sharing comments on the story.

SCReeeM - The main suspects in the murder are members of the Stanford University Crime Writing Club. Their magazine SCReeeM (Stanford Crime wRitErs Magazine) provides clues to the case and the various editions are online and the individual stories are ready for you to read in addition to the main story.

Artwork - more clues and important parts of the storyline are conveyed in these illustrations also.

 

The initial release of  our digital crime universe is scheduled for Autumn/Winter 2021. FWe will release chapters and additional content on a monthly basis and keep developing and improving the crime universe we have created. We want to continue working with our talented team of designers and software developers. The funds we are looking to raise will go directly towards salaries for these staff and into software development to enable us to keep innovating.

In return for your support, we can offer a host of perks from signed exclusive artwork, to discounted subscription rates to the digital crime universe to even having a character named after you in the story! The full list of rewards on offer include;

  • Wall paper with specially designed images - not available elsewhere
  • Social media shout out on Facebook and Twitter.
  • Invitation to a webinar with the co-founders of Digital Crime Universe and a guest author
  • 6 months free subscription from the point that we start charging
  • 12 months free subscription from the point that we start charging
  • Digital Crime Universe founders present at your book club (video conference only)
  • Original drawn and painted art
  • SCReeeM magazine (signed) including lifetime subscription
  • Signed Printed Artwork/Merchandise
  • Character named after you in short stories or SCReeeM Magazine
  • A crime short story written for you exclusively 
  • Membership of exclusive crime readers group with special events and unique access to material, authors and designers 
  • Have your own short story published in the story’s own SCReeeM Magazine
  • Significant character named after you in story

Even if we fail to reach our goal of £5000 all funds raised will go towards developing the Digital Story Universe.

Jason – Author and Co-founder of Digital Story Universe

Jason is a writer whose work has won or been highly placed in numerous writing competitions. A short story of his was longlisted for the 2020 Bridport Prize. He has a PhD in modern history from the University of Sheffield and a postgraduate degree in Jewish Studies from the University of Oxford. He was a lecturer in Modern Jewish History at the University of Warwick.

Mark - Co-founder of Digital Crime Universe

Mark is experienced in business and entrepreneurship. Has recently completed an MBA at Henley Business School  and has previously implemented a range of digital applications and business models across financial services and the tourism sector.

Cara - Graphic Designer

Cara is a recent graphic design graduate who is passionate about combining design, illustration and storytelling. Cara enjoys creating digital illustration and concept art and has previously worked at XR games. Working on the digital story universe has been a great opportunity for Cara to push her creativity and think outside the box! 

Riya - Graphic Designer

I’m Riya, a second year student at University of Reading, specialising in graphic communication and Typography, with a passion for art direction and illustration.

Sam - Application Developer

I am Sam Kinloch Large a 3rd year Mechanical Engineering who also specialises in software design and user experiences. I have a business in web and app design. When creating the DigitalCrimeUniverse, I focussed on making a game like user experience where people can be immersed in the story.

Overall we believe that storytelling can be greatly enhanced through using the technology we all use in our day to day lives. Through combining great literature with digital content such as video, animation, gamification and interactive features our mission is to bring a new medium to the way we enjoy storytelling. We believe crime fiction is the perfect genre for this as it allows us to present the reader with a vast range of engaging clues or events that lead up to a crime, readers can then inspect these clues from multiple perspectives.

The ideas we are offering in Digital Crime Universe have not been put to market previously. Although we have carried out significant market research before launching, there is a risk that we will need to spend more time than anticipated evolving the features we initially launch  particularly in response to feedback from our customers. 

From the outset we have built our business on listening to crime readers and our team is committed to delivering a unique and enriching crime fiction reading experience.

By entering the website you can explore the locations, crime scenes, murder weapons, characters backgrounds as well as alternate story lines, short stories, maps, biographies, and loads of stunning art work and design. We really focussed on customising the reader experience such as size of text and font, background colours, choice of avatar etc.  We are totally committed to accessibility and again this medium allows us to provide  those with reading difficulties the ability to adapt the text to meet their needs. Add to that our goal of audio options for as many aspects of the story as possible and we hope to provide as an inclusive story world as possible to our readers and listeners.Not only all this but we are building into the project a networking capability too! You can chat with other readers of the story, post your comments directly next to the text, link in to the rest of the internet and social media, and contact the writers directly. Add in writer interviews and videos with experts such as forensic specialists, historians, etc then we have something truly original and game changing for the world of crime fiction. You can see here some of the features we have developed so far and we have so much more waiting in the wings. Indeed,  we want to listen to what readers want and to keep innovating.Dashboard - Once you enter the story you will have your own personalised dashboard to give you complete control over your experience while in the crime universe. Work your way through an interactive crime board with access to great features.You can also use the website to find links to further research material and a whole host of additional material such as short stories, diary entries, alternate storylines.Interactive map - Use an interactive map to find locations in the story and more content on the places, characters, events in the story.Comment with your friends on the story - As well as interactive and immersive digital content we want you to enjoy experiencing the crime universe with your friends and fellow readers with features such as sharing comments on the story.SCReeeM - The main suspects in the murder are members of the Stanford University Crime Writing Club. Their magazine SCReeeM (Stanford Crime wRitErs Magazine) provides clues to the case and the various editions are online and the individual stories are ready for you to read in addition to the main story.

Artwork - more clues and important parts of the storyline are conveyed in these illustrations also.
 The initial release of  our digital crime universe is scheduled for Autumn/Winter 2021. FWe will release chapters and additional content on a monthly basis and keep developing and improving the crime universe we have created. We want to continue working with our talented team of designers and software developers. The funds we are looking to raise will go directly towards salaries for these staff and into software development to enable us to keep innovating.In return for your support, we can offer a host of perks from signed exclusive artwork, to discounted subscription rates to the digital crime universe to even having a character named after you in the story! The full list of rewards on offer include;
Wall paper with specially designed images - not available elsewhere
Social media shout out on Facebook and Twitter.
Invitation to a webinar with the co-founders of Digital Crime Universe and a guest author
6 months free subscription from the point that we start charging
12 months free subscription from the point that we start charging
Digital Crime Universe founders present at your book club (video conference only)
Original drawn and painted art
SCReeeM magazine (signed) including lifetime subscription
Signed Printed Artwork/Merchandise
Character named after you in short stories or SCReeeM Magazine
A crime short story written for you exclusively 
Membership of exclusive crime readers group with special events and unique access to material, authors and designers 
Have your own short story published in the story’s own SCReeeM Magazine
Significant character named after you in story
Even if we fail to reach our goal of £5000 all funds raised will go towards developing the Digital Story Universe.Jason – Author and Co-founder of Digital Story UniverseJason is a writer whose work has won or been highly placed in numerous writing competitions. A short story of his was longlisted for the 2020 Bridport Prize. He has a PhD in modern history from the University of Sheffield and a postgraduate degree in Jewish Studies from the University of Oxford. He was a lecturer in Modern Jewish History at the University of Warwick.Mark - Co-founder of Digital Crime UniverseMark is experienced in business and entrepreneurship. Has recently completed an MBA at Henley Business School  and has previously implemented a range of digital applications and business models across financial services and the tourism sector.Cara - Graphic DesignerCara is a recent graphic design graduate who is passionate about combining design, illustration and storytelling. Cara enjoys creating digital illustration and concept art and has previously worked at XR games. Working on the digital story universe has been a great opportunity for Cara to push her creativity and think outside the box! Riya - Graphic DesignerI’m Riya, a second year student at University of Reading, specialising in graphic communication and Typography, with a passion for art direction and illustration.Sam - Application DeveloperI am Sam Kinloch Large a 3rd year Mechanical Engineering who also specialises in software design and user experiences. I have a business in web and app design. When creating the DigitalCrimeUniverse, I focussed on making a game like user experience where people can be immersed in the story.Overall we believe that storytelling can be greatly enhanced through using the technology we all use in our day to day lives. Through combining great literature with digital content such as video, animation, gamification and interactive features our mission is to bring a new medium to the way we enjoy storytelling. We believe crime fiction is the perfect genre for this as it allows us to present the reader with a vast range of engaging clues or events that lead up to a crime, readers can then inspect these clues from multiple perspectives.The ideas we are offering in Digital Crime Universe have not been put to market previously. Although we have carried out significant market research before launching, there is a risk that we will need to spend more time than anticipated evolving the features we initially launch  particularly in response to feedback from our customers. From the outset we have built our business on listening to crime readers and our team is committed to delivering a unique and enriching crime fiction reading experience.

story:
Step right up and meet the Werewolf Of Bedburg, the furry-faced star of a great new novel that has 150 pages of monstrous chills, laughs, suspense ... and the occasional “awwww” moment to put that proverbial lump in your throat. It's a fun and fast-paced tale with enough action and whimsy to entice young readers, but with plenty of storytelling savvy to keep adults turning the pages too. And that's not even mentioning the fourteen full-color illustrations that’ll render the exciting goings-on in a way that’s literally drop-dead gorgeous.

The story begins centuries ago in the village of Bedburg, Germany. The year is 1589, and the evil Peter Stumpp, the real-life “Werewolf of Bedburg” (yup, look it up), has been captured. After terrorizing the town for decades, he has been sentenced to death. But before the executioner’s blade can fall, Stumpp vows the evil will manifest itself again. Yikes.

Cut to the present day.

Josh Lupus is a 14-year-old werewolf and one of the shyest kids at Monsters Village Middle School. He has quite the crush on Grayson DeKay, but she’s the most popular girl in school ... and the daughter of the Zombie Supreme himself. What would he even say to her?

Josh would be happy to just keep his head down and never take a risk.  But when his father gets accused of murder, Josh must leave Monsters Village for the first time and set out on the adventure of a lifetime.  He must go to Bedburg, Germany to catch a killer and clear his father’s name.

PLATE #3

 

 

PLATE #4

 

The rich storytelling makes room for a cast of wildly interesting supporting characters, including Dr. Alan Fossil – a University Professor who also just happens to be…a skeleton, Lord Pepperidge, a pompous big-game hunter who gets in way over his head, as well as Scurry and Mister Squirm, the leaders of a “mischief” of talking rats. Everything's in place for one of the most exciting literary debuts in years.

 

 

 

Let's learn more about that team, shall we?

Lenny Schas (Story/characters) is a successful entrepreneur whose passion for storytelling covers the full spectrum of entertainment media. He is the creator of Panopolis, whose 20 digital lands are taking the theme park concept into a new era of interactivity, and Panopolis City, a next-level simulation game built on the same technology. He opened fine art galleries in San Diego and Beijing, and managed Chinese contemporary artists with exhibitions in museums worldwide. 

Steve Purnick (Co-writer) is a writer, actor, improviser and corporate entertainer. For many years, he was on the writers’ bench for Walt Disney World, where he both directed and wrote material for countless special events. Steve penned the screenplay “Lawn and Order” about a crack police squad of lawn ornaments. He was a writer on Nickelodeon’s The Mystery Files of Shelby Woo, where he also portrayed Detective Hineline. He was a contributing writer to Fellowship!, the Musical (an award-winning musical parody of The Fellowship of the Ring). As an improviser, Steve performed for years at The Comedy Warehouse at Walt Disney World, and has toured with Wayne Brady and Rita Rudner. 

Seyyar Tedorov (Illustrations) is a Russian-born artist whose work has been seen across the full spectrum of media and merchandise. Everything from video games to apparel has benefited from his artistic touch, including illustrations he's provided for the wristband manufacturer ZOX and concept art for the Chairbound Comics publishing house. He’s now based in Phoenix, Arizona, where he’s producing the breathtaking images that make The Werewolf of Bedburg really come to life.

 

 

Book is written, Paintings are halfway there. Release date is scheduled for October 10, 2021, just in time for Halloween and the holidays!

 

This books world of Monsters Village and its colorful denizens have their roots in Panopolis, an upcoming state-of-the-art digital theme park that’s spawning thrilling new characters and storytelling by the score. Panopolis will be a stunning, massive world full of original rides, attractions, experiences and environments --familiar yet fresh, assembled in extraordinary ways that challenge and innovate how you experience a theme park.

Available on all platforms including the premiere experience of a Virtual Reality (VR) headset, you and your family can thrill to world-class rides and shows where creativity is boundless, and without the expense and hassles of real-world parks. We build environments and attractions the real world can not afford, unlocking fully realized experiences as far as the mind's eye can see. Visit us on the Panopolis and Panopolis City websites today!

The Panopolis universe is an entertainment revolution in the making. Follow this indiegogo account as well as our social media so you’ll be hip to all the books, comics, attractions, animated experiences and collectible merchandise we have coming based on our endless stable of stories and characters. Every purchase you make goes right back into the projects, so please support us by purchasing multiple copies for friends and family. We appreciate and love every one of you. Thank you for helping this dream come true!

story:
Summary

 

Hello, readers! My name is Olena Yacoboski.

I am a Ukrainian writer and poet. I hope you adore New Year’s and Christmas as much as I do. These magical winter holidays inspired me to write this book. Those transformations taking place as each season changes are real miracles. The Fairies of the Four Seasons work very hard to make you see the wonders of nature all around us.

This book, "Fairies of the Four Seasons" is the first of four Children's books I will publish. I write my books in Ukrainian and then have them translated to English. Both languages are in this book.

My goal is to inspire children with love and a deep appreciation of nature. In this book, there are four long poems about each season. All my poems have the central theme of how the beauty of the Earth encompasses all things.  

I worked closely with my illustrator Svetlana Navrotska for two years to prepare all the original, hand-painted illustrations for this gift edition book. The illustrations are essential to my poems. They elaborate through color and detail, and carefully integrate images with my poetry to amplify emotions. 

The superb translations to English are by Steve Komarnyckyj. His literary translations and poems have appeared in Index on Censorship, Modern Poetry in Translation and many other journals. He is the holder of two PEN awards and is also a highly regarded English language poet. 

I seek to educate, entertain, and capture the imagination of my young readers– to encourage a lifetime of reading enrichment and enjoyment. My dream is to be a writer and publisher of exquisite literature for children. I hope I can attain that more quickly with your generous help.

The book measures 30 cm (11.8 inches) by 30 cm (11.8 inches) and is 80 pages long. Now it is ready to be printed and published. I have displayed some of its pages below including the first verses of each poem.

Crystalline Fairies in the Kingdom of Winter

Fairies of Rosy Splendour

  Fairies of Summer Sunbeams

 Fairies of the Golden Time

What We Need & What You Get

This hardcover, gift edition book will be of the highest quality possible. It will be a wonderful gift for avid fairy lovers or a keepsake for your children to cherish as they grow older. I’m asking for your support to help fund the printing, publication, and distribution of the book. By doing so, you will be helping me to realize my dream of inspiring children with literature about the love of nature.

I’m targeting raising $10,000 for this project.

The costs are distributed across four main categories:

Printing and shipping costs for 500 books: $4,500

Marketing budget for the book post-publishing: $2,500

Money for creating my online book store: $2,500

Indiegogo's platform fee: 5%

We have included 5 perks of the hardcover books and 13 perks of posters of some of the book's illustrations.

Children will love "Fairies of the Four Seasons" when you read to them at night while they gaze at the beautiful  posters adorning their bedroom walls.

There is a Special Perk for six contributors of $500 to our campaign.

The Fairies have painted every poster for your children.

 

PERK NINETEEN- ACKNOWLEDGEMENT FOREVER 

FOR SIX CONTRIBUTORS OF $500.  

Be a big part of my journey. Your name will appear in my Acknowledgements with a big Thank You! for the as long as the book is in print. 

Our Splendid Moose represents this perk.

 

Even if the fundraising goal is not met with this project, I will still put the funds towards  printing at least 300 copies- all eligible backers will receive a copy and have their book perks fulfilled. All the poster perks will be 100% fulfilled. We will start shipping the posters during our campaign.

Stretch Goal- 

If I raise at least $20,000, I will, as quickly as possible, complete my next children's book called "The Golden Bird" which is a fairy-tale telling the myth of a bird with golden wings. It is about deep family love in nature.

This beautiful tale is set in the times of an ancient continent and concerns a Golden Bird who is held, along with other gold birds, captive in a mythical kingdom ruled by an evil Queen. One day the bird strays beyond the Sequoia marking the edge of where they may fly into the magic forest. The creatures there are eventually moved to rescue the Golden Bird and the other captives, because one of their number, a peacock was also held prisoner by the evil Queen and cast out when he had lost too many feathers to be beautiful in her eyes. They rescue the birds at a point when the enchantment over the evil magic kingdom is weak because the moon is eclipsed by the earth.

The book will be printed entirely in English. The text has already been completed and the incredible illustrations for the book are now being worked on. Any backers of the "Fairies of the Four Seasons" campaign will be be added to my mailing list and I will inform them directly when my new book is finished. They will also receive a substantial discount on "The Golden Bird" and have the opportunity to obtain signed and dedicated copies. 

The Impact

There is so much suffering in our world these days. We have COVID 19 , seemingly endless wars, societal conflicts, and perilous times for nature and our environment. I hope my book can, in some small way, help children understand what the love of nature is in relationship to the nature of love. I do recognize these vital truths. When you love, everything will come right. Love has its own action. Love, and you will know the blessings of it. Love, and there will be understanding.  

Risks & Challenges

The book is now ready to print so the creative risks do not exist.

I have already found the right printer in Ukraine. I've looked at samples they have printed and I'm confident that they will do very good work.

Please visit their website below.

  PE "SKAT Company"

http://skat.kh.ua/en/ 

Shipping Logistics and Timing

Depending on how much money is raised, it may impact the shipping logistics of the book and I will have to manage that wisely as I am planning on shipping all over the world.  

Due to the pandemic, the global supply chain may be experiencing delays across production industries. As I have selected a printer in Ukraine this could cause delays.  However I do not anticipate that these delays would be substantial.

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you for reading this, and thank you for contributing whatever you are able to. 

If you aren’t able to contribute any money to this project,  don't feel bad about it. I hope you will share my campaign with others and spread the word about it. If you can, please share my book with 5 friends, family members or co-workers whom you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or direct message on social media. The more people the campaign reaches, the more people who will be able to experience the fruits of my endeavors.

Summary

 

Hello, readers! My name is Olena Yacoboski.
I am a Ukrainian writer and poet. I hope you adore New Year’s and Christmas as much as I do. These magical winter holidays inspired me to write this book. Those transformations taking place as each season changes are real miracles. The Fairies of the Four Seasons work very hard to make you see the wonders of nature all around us.
This book, "Fairies of the Four Seasons" is the first of four Children's books I will publish. I write my books in Ukrainian and then have them translated to English. Both languages are in this book.
My goal is to inspire children with love and a deep appreciation of nature. In this book, there are four long poems about each season. All my poems have the central theme of how the beauty of the Earth encompasses all things.  
I worked closely with my illustrator Svetlana Navrotska for two years to prepare all the original, hand-painted illustrations for this gift edition book. The illustrations are essential to my poems. They elaborate through color and detail, and carefully integrate images with my poetry to amplify emotions. 
The superb translations to English are by Steve Komarnyckyj. His literary translations and poems have appeared in Index on Censorship, Modern Poetry in Translation and many other journals. He is the holder of two PEN awards and is also a highly regarded English language poet. 
I seek to educate, entertain, and capture the imagination of my young readers– to encourage a lifetime of reading enrichment and enjoyment. My dream is to be a writer and publisher of exquisite literature for children. I hope I can attain that more quickly with your generous help.
The book measures 30 cm (11.8 inches) by 30 cm (11.8 inches) and is 80 pages long. Now it is ready to be printed and published. I have displayed some of its pages below including the first verses of each poem.

Crystalline Fairies in the Kingdom of Winter
Fairies of Rosy Splendour

  Fairies of Summer Sunbeams

 Fairies of the Golden Time

What We Need & What You Get
This hardcover, gift edition book will be of the highest quality possible. It will be a wonderful gift for avid fairy lovers or a keepsake for your children to cherish as they grow older. I’m asking for your support to help fund the printing, publication, and distribution of the book. By doing so, you will be helping me to realize my dream of inspiring children with literature about the love of nature.
I’m targeting raising $10,000 for this project. 
The costs are distributed across four main categories:
Printing and shipping costs for 500 books: $4,500
Marketing budget for the book post-publishing: $2,500
Money for creating my online book store: $2,500
Indiegogo's platform fee: 5%
We have included 5 perks of the hardcover books and 13 perks of posters of some of the book's illustrations. 
Children will love "Fairies of the Four Seasons" when you read to them at night while they gaze at the beautiful  posters adorning their bedroom walls.
There is a Special Perk for six contributors of $500 to our campaign.

All the poster perks will be 100% fulfilled. We will start shipping the posters during our campaign.
Stretch Goal- 
If I raise at least $20,000, I will, as quickly as possible, complete my next children's book called "The Golden Bird" which is a fairy-tale telling the myth of a bird with golden wings. It is about deep family love in nature.
This beautiful tale is set in the times of an ancient continent and concerns a Golden Bird who is held, along with other gold birds, captive in a mythical kingdom ruled by an evil Queen. One day the bird strays beyond the Sequoia marking the edge of where they may fly into the magic forest. The creatures there are eventually moved to rescue the Golden Bird and the other captives, because one of their number, a peacock was also held prisoner by the evil Queen and cast out when he had lost too many feathers to be beautiful in her eyes. They rescue the birds at a point when the enchantment over the evil magic kingdom is weak because the moon is eclipsed by the earth.
The book will be printed entirely in English. The text has already been completed and the incredible illustrations for the book are now being worked on. Any backers of the "Fairies of the Four Seasons" campaign will be be added to my mailing list and I will inform them directly when my new book is finished. They will also receive a substantial discount on "The Golden Bird" and have the opportunity to obtain signed and dedicated copies. 
The Impact

There is so much suffering in our world these days. We have COVID 19 , seemingly endless wars, societal conflicts, and perilous times for nature and our environment. I hope my book can, in some small way, help children understand what the love of nature is in relationship to the nature of love. I do recognize these vital truths. When you love, everything will come right. Love has its own action. Love, and you will know the blessings of it. Love, and there will be understanding.  
Risks & Challenges

The book is now ready to print so the creative risks do not exist.
I have already found the right printer in Ukraine. I've looked at samples they have printed and I'm confident that they will do very good work.
Please visit their website below.

  PE "SKAT Company"

http://skat.kh.ua/en/ 
Shipping Logistics and Timing
Depending on how much money is raised, it may impact the shipping logistics of the book and I will have to manage that wisely as I am planning on shipping all over the world.  
Due to the pandemic, the global supply chain may be experiencing delays across production industries. As I have selected a printer in Ukraine this could cause delays.  However I do not anticipate that these delays would be substantial.

Other Ways You Can Help
Thank you for reading this, and thank you for contributing whatever you are able to. 
If you aren’t able to contribute any money to this project,  don't feel bad about it. I hope you will share my campaign with others and spread the word about it. If you can, please share my book with 5 friends, family members or co-workers whom you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or direct message on social media. The more people the campaign reaches, the more people who will be able to experience the fruits of my endeavors.

story:
We're proud to offer you The Transformational Travel Journal. This unique journal was thoughtfully written, based on the rigorous multi-disciplinary study of the Transformational Travel Council. Based on ancient wisdom, mythology, and contemporary science, it is more than a journal, it is an insightful guide to exploring the world, and your own backyard, more mindfully.

During these COVID times, we invite you to begin dreaming and designing for your next journey today, from the inside out, learn to Travel with HEART, and Follow the PATH. Whether it is for you or an intrepid friend, this wise investment in travel will not only be life-affirming for the traveler but life-enhancing for others, and our civilization.

This journal guides into a deeper connection with yourself, with others, and the world around you. It also encourages time and space to reflect and make meaning of the experiences you have, and thereby, fostering a more intentional, virtuous, and heart-centric life while contributing to a more ethical, empathetic, equitable, and ecological world.

Transformational Travel is inherently about leaving our comfort zone and returning with new perspectives. It is a catalyst for growth, change, and positive impact. 

 

A LOOK INSIDE

  • 220-page softcover journal
  • Interactive activities, prompts, and challenges
  • Insightful, inspiring quotes and stories
  • Background and philosophical understanding of Transformational Travel

The journal is a guide to discovering the full potential of a traveler’s journey by helping them harness the power of travel to create personal growth and make a positive impact in the world. The guide is presented as a journal, a travel companion in which to capture thoughts, ideas, and memories, and to create your story.

As expressed by acclaimed author, Phil Cousineau, “If we prepare our imagination as carefully as we pack our bags, then we will experience, learn, remember far more.”

If you're inspired by our work and would like to help us get this journal into travelers around the planet, please consider supporting us and the future of tourism with a ‘Bonus Pledge’ in an amount that feels right.

 

About the Author

Eric Rupp is a founding partner at the TTC and runs Evergreen Escapes, an insightful naturalist driven guiding company. He is a traveler, a storyteller, an engineer, a carpenter, a designer, and a woodsman. Over the course of his multi-year wanderings about the planet, he’s spent time building traditional Spanish stone homes in Andalucia, Spain, and running a small university in Santa Cruz, Bolivia. He currently splits his time on and off-grid around Seattle, WA with his wife, two young children, and a trusty dog. He is kind of digging this author thing.

 

About the Transformational Travel Council

We are a collective of global tourism stakeholders who refuse to skirt the challenging issues. Instead, we throw our boundless enthusiasm and well-researched knowledge and wisdom at them, determined to find a resolution. We stand for the betterment of lives and livelihoods through transformational travel and regenerative tourism

We’re aimed at changing the way we travel, but also how we live, and behave with each other and the planet. We are bringing ancient wisdom with science-based knowledge into practical intelligence and sensibilities that guide personal and planetary transformation. We believe that meaningful change starts from the inside out. By identifying patterns and creating the conditions for transformation in a regenerative system, the TTC is uniquely positioned to accelerate radical change.

If you're inspired by our work and would like to help us get this journal into travelers around the globe, please go beyond your purchase and support us and the future of tourism with a Bonus Pledge in an amount that you can feel really good about.

 

The Transformational Travel Council is Washington State Social Purpose Corporation and would like to express gratitude to our Partners in revisioning and unleashing the power of travel ... Center for Responsible Tourism, The Long Run, Quiet Parks International, 1% for the Planet, Grayl, GLP Films, and the For Good Movement: B Tourism - driven by Equity, Diversity, and Inclusion.

 

Reviews + Endorsements

"This book is alive with the possibility for change, for the traveler, and for our deeply troubled world. Thought-provoking and imagination stirring, it calls forth your inner compass, challenges you to fully engage, embrace the trials, relish the revelations, and revitalize your life and the lives of others. It's more than a journal, it is a travel companion unlocking not just who you are, but who you want to be. In this COVID era, this is the best money you can spend on making every journey that lies ahead, more meaningful, if not transformational." 

- CHIP CONLEY, Hospitality Entrepreneur and Founder of the Modern Elder Academy

“A good travel journal invites us to draw out our best self both at home and abroad, and The Transformational Travel Journal does just that. Alive with beautiful prompts and spaces to reflect, this is a journal that extends our journeys well beyond the actual trip.” 

- Dr. ANU TARANATH, professor, racial equity consultant, and author of Beyond Guilt Trips: Mindful Travel in an Unequal World

“Way too many people wander into their time off without a second thought - and all too often that leads to highly processed, low satisfaction vacations. In this inspiring guide, Eric Rupp provides practical questions to help all of us avoid the vacation version of junk food, and much more likely to enjoy meaningful, memorable, and - yes! - transformational travel instead. Get your copy today, reap the rewards for the rest of your life.” 

- JAMES WALLMAN, author, Time And How To Spend It, and creator of the STORIES method

“A masterfully crafted guide to - travel and live, deeply. The Transformational Travel Journal invites you on an outer and inner adventure. Step onto the path and you will expand your heart, feel richly alive, and nourish authentic relationships with the people and natural environments you encounter. This is a brilliant and accessible roadmap to transform ourselves and our world.” 

- LLYN ROBERTS MA, award-winning author of Speaking with Nature coauthored with Sandra Ingerman, and Shapeshifting into Higher Consciousness; founder of Olympic Mountain EarthWisdom Circle; sacred travel guide since 1997. 

“How many of us—thoughtful travelers—pack a blank journal only to have it go untouched? We don’t know where to begin, we fear a blank page. (As a writer, this fear is a familiar one.) The Transformational Travel Journal includes within its inviting pages that gentle guide that prompts us to answer those elusive whys and other big questions to find meaning in life. Author Eric Rupp takes inspiration from mythologist Joseph Campbell’s work on the human experience to give today’s traveler a journal worthy of the journey.” 

—NORIE QUINTOS, travel journalist and editor

story:
The Skinny / Quick Math...

    Imaginatively illustrated children's book
+ 16-inch bend/pose plush elf (house guest)
   Quick, cheerful toy-cleaning magic for kids

In a nutcracker - I mean nutshell - The Naughty Elf is a book and plush elf pairing that creatively encourages children to put away their toys.  Say goodbye to stepping on toy after toy, and say hello to seeing your floors once again!  It's best suited to children ages 3-7...old enough to take on the responsibility of cleaning up after themselves and still young enough to embrace the more imaginative elements of childhood :)

WARNING: Don't let the elf's holiday spirit fool you!  Things may not have worked out in Santa's workshop, but this elf is now perfectly suited to help out all year long in other homes as well as he did in ours!  Unlike some stories that only appear briefly around the holidays, this duo actually does its magic and encourages great behavior throughout the entire year...12x nicer for parents than children focusing on the "nice" list for just one month each year.
 

How the magic began...

Our son, like many children, consistently struggled to keep his toys picked up around the home.  Our pleas often went either unnoticed, ignored, or put off until "later" as he'd like to say.  That is until I created the concept of The Naughty Elf...an elf that was booted from the North Pole and who now eagerly looks for toys that children leave out for too long.  Don't worry, the elf can still make his way back home with your child's help!

The mere mention - or even worse, sighting - of the elf had our son cleaning up his toys like never before from the moment the story first began last February :)  Had our daily dance played out in a text exchange, the origin story would have looked something like this:



The rest is history!  Best yet, we quickly became toy-cleaning allies in his mind by simply helping him keep an eye out for the elf.  We got amazing behavior all year long, and even had a great learning experience the single time he didn't pick them up.  After a few toys were unfortunately "lost" one night, he showed remarkable maturity in understanding his role in why it happened and vowed to not let it happen again #takingresponsibility (Parents: 1, Children: 1)
 

What you'll receive...

The 4 levels of perks offer options for yourself, others, or both!  They range from just $25-55 and all nicely include free shipping within the U.S.  Considering how frequent and frustrating a problem this solved in our home, I wanted to keep the cost as affordable as possible so more families can join in the magic!
 

Why now & giving back...

I oddly enough took a storytelling class in 7th grade and have loved telling stories ever since!  So why choose to actually write one now you might ask.  The 1st reason is simple – it works!  We haven't argued about putting away toys in our home for 10 months and I'm excited to now help other families struggling with the same common issue.  Beyond helping give the gift of a cleaner home, I'm also happy to share what I've learned along the way with any other aspiring children's book authors - just direct message me and we can arrange a time to connect.

The 2nd reason is more heartwarming.  I grew up in a military family and have great memories of the Toys for Tots program...first the joy of receiving a toy and later witnessing the spark in kids' eyes when I began helping with handing them out.  I’ve been seeking a way to give back in my community and a very personal path to do so struck me one day…host a toy drive for underprivileged youth in Oakland!  I'm committing $1/book (and $10 from the top perk level) towards a toy drive next holiday season, and I'll then personally match this total amount 100% so that even more children can leave with a smile.  Sure, this book may be about helping children pick up their toys, though too many kids' imaginations suffer from the opposite problem...not having many toys in the first place.  With your support, we can both do our small part to help :)
 

What the future holds...

While this first edition has been a hit in our home - and hopefully yours - I have a few ideas in mind to enhance the experience even further in the future :)  All backers will be the first to hear about updates as they unfold, so stay tuned and thanks for your support!

P.S. Makes for a great gift too!
